CuzBiQPW_KaEQSmqIMsLow.text: Being completely honest, I'm usually not a fan of "special events," guest chefs, or the dumbed-down truncated experience of "Restaurant Week" but at $26 (after a deep discount from the quoted $100) with friends already planning on attending Chef Akira Back's "Chef's Tasting" at Yellowtail I tossed caution to the wind...only to reconfirm all the aforementioned prejudices to a whole new degree, leaving the event after 2 hours hungry, a touch intoxicated, and $26 poorer albeit richer in friendships.  "Spend the afternoon with us at YellowTail inside the Bellagio Las Vegas overlooking the spectacular fountains. Enjoy extraordinary culinary selections from Chef Akira Back and libations provided by Wirtz Beverage.  Chef Akira Back has chosen to feature the Big Eye Tuna Pizza, Crispy Kalbi roll and his famous Baked Crab Hand Roll among other items.  Gulf Oyster Industry Counsel's amazing Oyster bar. Salty coastal waters produce the world's best oysters for the world's best chefs and restaurants, harvested today as they have been for generations.  Chef's menu will be paired with specialty reserved Sakes, Wines & Spirits provided by Wirtz Beverage and custom cocktails created by the mixologists from Hendrick's Gin and Tito's Vodka" as described on the website, the actual format of the event was a standing circus of confusion where "reserved" tables were fed full trays of food while the rest attempted to hunt down one of four circulating servers that were frequently mobbed and stripped clean at the doors where 'diners' gathered like a group of kids playing World of Warcraft sitting on a spawn spot.  With booze of decent quality and the modicum of food equally competent a total of six mouthfuls of food plus three oysters were accrued by myself (one literally FROM a reserved table) during the course of the afternoon, probably justifying the $26 though certainly not $100 or the overall aggravation.  With no Akira in site and 'live music' that fell through for unknown reasons I can only assume that this 'event' was a money-grab intended to draw high rollers to The Bellagio or an attention-seeker for an outdated property hoping to generate new fans; both goals a miserable failure as we walked out in search of sustenance down the strip at Aria.

YWEvro3bWulPGr2vi8r0Bg.text: It's in bellagio, the staff is pretty pretentious, and will absolutely judge you on how you look, and not how much money you have.   That being said, the food here is amazing.  I think everyone who goes to vegas should stop by here and have the Popping spicy crab.  It may sound so peculiar and almost disgusting but the pop rocks actually create a really interesting mouth feel that almost forces you to smile.  Plus the sweetness balances so well with the saltiness.   For some reason the krispy kalbi isnt served with wasabi (need to cut the creamyness of the coleslaw that tops the roll) but they quickly fixed that. Everything is extremely fresh and beautifully plated.  Well worth a stop.

_TWBePM059lDK32NjRfLVw.text: My first ever Yelp review!  Why Yellowtail?  Because this was the best meal I've ever had.  Period.  I was lucky enough to have The Light Group as a client and was given total VIP treatment:  not only a comped dinner, but the best seats in the house on their balcony overlooking the Bellagio fountains  (other diners actually asked my friend and I if we were celebrities - extra points!)  We were greeted personally by Chef Akira Back who offered to bring us all of his personal favorites on the menu and we were so glad he did.  Everything was mouthwateringly delicious but there are 3 must haves:   Tuna pizza - don't ask just eat, it has truffle oil!   Baked crab roll - melts in your mouth better than chocolate Tempura crab - why wouldn't you order that?!  Extra tip - have the sommelier help you with sake pairings; she'll even tell you which ones are good for your skin!  Cannot WAIT to come back here!

DHxcud_19vhEi6F2hc6JUA.text: lucky us. we got a spot on the patio overlooking the bellagio fountains. the unobstructed view was definitely the best part about the restaurant.  besides the awesome view the food is solid but pricey (keep in mind you are in the bellagio). the tuna pizza is a MUST. it's crispy and has truffles.   we also had the edamame with two flavors (the spicy one is pretty spicy) and three sushi rolls which were good but not amazing.   not much to offer for dessert.

0VzOUfprQK5LrMh5PUrI_g.text: The dining room was loud; difficult to carry a conversation. We had two specialty rolls (popping spicy crab & angry salmon) and a spicy tuna roll. All three were under-whelming. The crab, salmon and tuna were mushy and lacked flavor. Way over-priced for the quality of the food we received. I will not go back. This is not quality; it's over-priced tourist food.

jQL5TPGjPLwFFZ6OociJkw.text: Holy Moly!  Delicious!!!  We LOVED everything we ordered, but my favorites were definitely the mile high roll and the yellowtail with jalapeno.  Hubby also loved the ahi tuna pizza (I like it, too, but not as much as the other two).  We ordered a few other rolls and appetizers to share and all were delicious, but those are the True standouts. Seriously... eat here!  You won't be sorry!!!

F5JGrqKMe3nRiHNz_fShww.text: Whenever we go to Vegas, there's two places that we have to make a pit stop at. Yellowtail is one of them, not because it has the best food or its the reasonably priced, but its just a comfortable place to go to for decent food with a great view! The other one can't be mentioned, because of some rule about what happens in vegas stays there?  If its not too cold, opt to sit outside. You'll have an unbeatable view of the Bellagio fountains!  The dishes I would recommend:  1) Big Eye Tuna Pizza 2) Seaweed Salad 3) Kobe Short Ribs  The poppy crab roll is a novelty and if you haven't had it, its worth a try. The rib eye is also a decent slab of meat, topped with crushed wasabi root I believe.   To be honest, its not the greatest food here, but there's something that just works for us. Kind of like your local diner, except 5X more expensive, haha.

tk9xa1WB7tdwhKwkOD6-hw.text: The food was okay, pricy for what it was. We would actually come back just for the bartender Luciano, so full of life and experience, more bartenders need to be like him.

k_Dm4zZM_9R3X0B1gUg6wQ.text: Had the pleasure/mispleasure of eating here a few weeks ago.  The good: The rib eye - sous vide prepared, excellent but  pricey at $49 The view - the fountain show is spectacular  The not so good: The service:  For the pricing of the food, the service is meh at best.  I expect better, this ain't a coffee shop, we shouldn't have to ask for  refills of soda or water.  The appitizers....not served at the same time - spread out over 10 minutes, and althogh the King Crab tempura was tasty, they drown it in sauce so if not eaten immediately, it becomes a soggy dough piece of crab.  The Kobe beef - BEWARE - they told us that they had Kobe beef as a special that night, in two, five or ten ounce portions.  They don't mention the prices and beware it's in the $35-40 range per ounce.  It's heavenly but way too expensive.  They have a Kobe-like flat iron steak for $42 on their everyday menu so it gives the impression the special Kobe will be prices in the same range - NOT.    Lastly, check the bill carefully.  They will offer to room charge it, but be sure to take a look - in error on our bill was three orders of some lobster roll that no on ordered - plus the surprise of the outrageous Kobe - even the waitress and the manager did not know agree on the price per ounce ($35-$42).    Beware!

DZq21tMKE_PuTbCdlW-KIA.text: The Big Eye Tuna Pizza alone is worth a visit. I'm not kidding. I took my friend to Yellowtail for the first time, and he couldn't stop talking about the Big Eye Tuna Pizza.  But it's not just the Tuna Pizza. The sushi at Yellowtail is also amazing. They chef truly finds some of the best fish. They just melt in your mouth and they taste so fresh.  I love their simple rolls too. But the only thing I don't love here are the fancy rolls. Other than the fancy rolls, I love this place.

l-Hhycq3zbt8RkxjIziw-g.text: I love love loved this place. It was amazing. The food was really good but the view was wow!! Perfect romantic dinner to go to. Sitting in the patio and having the Bellagio fountains go on every 15 min or so with beautiful music was just so nice. The ink reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is because of the hosts in the front. When I made reservations and requested outside they never mentioned that it's not a guaranteed seating so when I got there they made it a big deal. In any case we waited a little and they did find us a table to sit in the patio and I had a great time. O and it's pretty pricy but usually you get for what you pay!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice drink and a view

evoa1aS1aWo_4WoTWekr0g.text: The 4 star review is solely on their food. I got miso soup and the California roll because I just can't do the texture of raw meats. A friend got the pop rocks roll which creeped me out at first but after I tried it, it was the greatest thing I have ever tasted! The tempura crab (I can't remember if it was crab or lobster) was also amazing. Scallops were amazing too. So tender, Like eating butter! I got some sort of fruity mixed saki drink which was also to die for!! I can't remember what else we got but it was all amazing.  Our waiter however was terrible. I don't know if it was because we were all younger or what but he just didn't seem to care about us at all. We ended up timing him based on the Bellagio fountain "shows". We got seated in the middle of one show, and it took him until the start of the next show to even ask what we wanted to drink. The service got worse from there. He was really nice every time he talked to us but we seemed to burden him. I say this because he was really attentive to literally every other table he had, except us. Was it because we didn't order bottled water?

Bg5rP_L2PjSn3zO7oqiSYA.text: My hater-ass first reaction to this place was, "Oh Gawd, here we go..." Dim lighting, loungey club music, chi-chi decor and hostesses in slutty stripper-style Mandarin-collared minidresses (because Chinese, Japanese...whatever). Light Group runs this place, and the atmo reeks of pretentious Vegas douche.  But once the food started coming, the truth is...it turned out to be FUCKING AMAZING!! I'm not a sushi snob; I'll eat grocery store California rolls and be happy as a pig in shit. But even my undistinguished palate could tell that this was truly exceptional food. (Someone else paid...if I'd had to pay, I probably would cut off a star or two for it being overpriced and pretentious...as I am wont to do :-)  My friend and I shared lobster carpaccio, the tuna pizza (!!!!!!!FABULOUS!!!), Japanese snapper (!!!!YUM!!!), octopus sashimi, duck prosciutto (shockingly AMAZING, and I hate duck!!), tuna tataki, some kind of crispy pork roll, and another sushi roll that had pop rocks mixed into the rice (sounds weird, but was AMAZING!!). Every single thing was exceptional, but the ones I marked with exclamation points were pretty much orgasmically good. We had some good desserts, too.  It didn't hurt that everything was washed down with a sake flight featuring 6 different types of sake...plus a shot of some cucumber vodka cocktail they feature that was incredible.   I'm giving this 4 stars instead of 5 just because I can't in good conscience give a place this full of itself 5 stars. But srsly... I will MOST DEFINITELY come here again in a HOT MINUTE...as soon as I find someone else to pay for it!! Until then, I'll see you in the sushi aisle at Trader Joe's :-)

4jrH4LW8Mh_a0-KEKaqUeA.text: First off let me start by saying the food TASTES AMAZING. But that's about it, everyone knows Vegas food is extremely over priced unless you go off the strip. BUT this place goes out of its way to give you the smallest portions known to man for the price of a full course meal for four. I got the chicken and Scottish salmon for me and my girl friend. Each one I could fit into the palm of my hand.... No sides either. For 32.00 each this is ridiculous. I've ate at some of the best restaurants in America and this one was a disappointment. Like I said the food tastes great but you will leave hungry. If you want to blow some money on a entree that's more of a snack then come to this place.

0PkQCHYYLMpFlRluyf95LQ.text: Was happy that my buddies and I could get a table without much waiting on a busy Saturday night . The entrance to the restaurant is rather narrow with bar setup, but once you walk past the bar, the place opens up to a nice and spacious dining area.  One of my buddies was quite intoxicated when we were seated, and he started asking so many questions about how the food is prepared and what goes into each dish on the menu to our server.  My other friend and I were amused, so we didn't interrupt and we really appreciated our server's patience and also his professionalism.   About half way through our meal, another server started serving our table. When this talkative friend asked her to surprise him with a good glass of wine, she brought him one of the most expensive wines (as the rest of us suspected!) on their menu (~$30), but this wine tasted merely ok, not great.   I had sushi rolls and it was very mediocre tasting. Presentation also was OK. I expected more and better food for fine-dining for the money I was paying.   If you really don't care much about food or price, this place offers modern and well polished environment with good cocktails. But alas, you are in Vegas, the place full of many great fine dining places that could offer the same level of ambience and cocktails.   Although I realize if you are in Vegas to party the hard way, the food might not be your main concern... in which case, what are you doing, wasting your time reading this review!

MgbirMbFcqNhjYUUq6gyPw.text: Went here the other night. I'm not a big seafood fan...but I must say I loved the tempura shrimp rolls. Even tried the ahi tuna pizza, that was amazing as well. The cucumber salad was a nice addition to the meal. It's a little pricy for the amount of food you get, but then again it's Vegas, everything is overpriced. Our waiter was wonderful.

-_jjVdzGZDR7uxfAUwf_HA.text: Worth a trip for the crab tempura! I love the Bellagio and I really think this is the best restaurant inside the hotel. It is very loud but you feel like you are in the center of everything. If you are lucky to get a table out front, the people watching doesn't get better. We must have had a lot of sake because that is all I remember...

c2NjEK9Ib5JXoU0aEqXbSA.text: When I come in this place, the bartender knows me and what I like to eat.  If you can get seated outside, the view is fantastic!

zbfn19fg3Zz7Q-z-nAGa5A.text: This is one of our favorite restaurants.  My husband, who comes to Vegas more frequently than I do, comes here every time he does, and I am super jealous when he tells me about it!  The big eye tuna pizza is phenomenal.  Not only is the presentation beautiful, but everything is so fresh, and you can taste it in the flavors.  The rock shrimp, which is smothered in a delicious chili aioli is also amazing.    CANNOT wait to go back.

HKwfCHk1qtvdu938lULb1A.text: I'm not the biggest sushi fan in the world, but this place was great. Everything was fresh and come out pretty quickly. The group I was with ordered a good amount of everything and we ate family style (although I could have ordered a few things just for myself and been just fine). Our waiter was really nice and helpful with questions we had about the food and the menu.   So there were four "must-have's" on this menu. 4. Big eye tuna pizza. 3. Tempura Alaskan king crab. 2. Lobster carpaccio. And coming in at numero UNO, the rock shrimp tempura.   I'd definitely go back if given the opportunity.

Aryr3x7UpJkfTfiO-7ewQQ.text: Delicious, fresh sushi with amazing service. Our waiter was very attentive and helpful-- definitely recommend eating here!

ATFilkTBfRVRgfPePYgclA.text: Horiable service. Had a 8pm reservation did not get seated until after 9. Waitress was slow and not helpful at all. Waited another hour for our food. Sushi had no flavor. Extremely over priced for the food and the service. This is the second time this has happened to me so I am all done going here. In a town built on service this place is a major fail

FAzvti1Q2qnzKU_j-H4irg.text: Very nice servers, atmosphere and food.  Very pricey, but it's the Bellagio in Vegas.  Nice views of fountain.

-qyy24IskIbiMbtY4N6p_Q.text: We were really looking forward to eating at Yellowfish prior to Circque du Soleil during our Vegas trip and though good, it wasn't GREAT (perhaps our expectations were too high).   The atomsphere was visually subtle yet interesting, the tables comfortably spaced. The view was awesome d/t the view of the Bellagio Fountains just outside the large windows. However, the music was heavy, mod. loud, and more suited for the casino or nightclubs than the soft Japanese atmosphere.  Food wise, for the money, Yellowtail was a (big) disappointment. I can't really go into detail because it was that forgettable.

rgSoTReIXS7hvMFOeoEEBg.text: The food was excellent , the quality and portion size were great . I have had sushi all over the states and this was most definitely in the top two, I have yet to find decent sushi where I live sadly ,nothing that compares to what I have found in multiple trips to vegas, We started with the Bigeye tuna pizza and just ordered each additional plate as we were done ,next was  Kobe Beef Tataki,Hirame Ikejime ,Duck Prosciutto,Seafood "Dynamite", Seared Foie Gras,Japanese Yellowtail  . This food was very good!!  I'm looking forward to going back..  we stayed at Bellagio and I actually went down the following night for one of the Big eye pizza's ..I couldn't get enough!!

vCd6Q85nEgaxJznN1KCOQQ.text: We came here for dinner on Wednesday night before our 10:00 "O" show at the Bellagio. We enjoyed several drinks at the bar where I was introduced to a really tasty - and strong - lychee drink. After a couple rounds, we relocated to the dining area and started off with some San Francisco oysters (which, by the way, were so good we ended up with 4 orders....we have no shame) and sake. Our server, Roberto, did a spectacular job - I have never had such amazing service ever. He also made some excellent recommendations such as with the sake selection "Wandering Poet" - a fine balance between dry and sweet at a fair price. Our entree was an usual order of spicy tuna roll, bluefin tuna sashimi style, and some whitefish. The ribs came highly recommended so we decided to give it a go as well. I'm not going to lie but I was pretty disappointed and felt like I just got ripped off for a mere handful of meat chunks. Like, seriously? 4 pieces of beef for ~$30?! Of course, this IS Vegas and the quality you get is definitely noticeable, no complaints there. For dessert we moved to the balcony with a perfect timing - the water show! The view was awesome and we enjoyed the green tea mousse which came with a shot of coffee  on the side. Really superb combo. Definitely give Yellowtail a try when you're in the area! PS keep in mind this meal may take a chunk out of your wallet.

GUsOgK1Wzitt1wAvmkCK1w.text: This place is expensive. But you get what you pay for. It was delicious with great service and very tasty food. The tuna pizza was fantastic!

S2vE1NoYEUCkMFUjhcbqyQ.text: My wife and I enjoyed our time at yellowtail on 9/29/2014. The environment is amazing. Highly recommend  dinner for two reserved and seated outside to have the view of Bellagio water show. We had sushi and steak. The sushi was fresh, but the Kobe steak was not really hot and it felt like was placed under the cold lamp instead of hot lamp. The rib eye was tasty I would recommend that over Kobe. My wife ended up eating half of my rib eye and I did not mind switching with her. Over all good experience and if you first timer to see the water show that is a good dinning.

vy9GMqTD-IM_nxN0qugrCw.text: Went after a poker tournament at Bellagio, been hesitant because I knew Yellow tail was a very expensive sushi restaurant. well Sushi is not sushi and definitely was impress by the quality of sushi. just the chopped sticks was real Japanese chopped sticks like it use to be. the quality of fish was great, the protein Roll ($30) was impressive. even the ginger taste like reel Ginger. So if you like quality food,and not really stop by the price.. this is a good place to go.

F9UDypLqyKX_El8g_GBRVQ.text: A complete rip off!!!  Overpriced and undercut sushi/sashimi.  This restaurant is a complete joke.  Doesn't matter how much food you ordered, you just can't get full.  Dude...sushi is either fresh or not fresh.  Your sushi ain't made of gold.  So give up this almighty attitude that you are located in Bellagio and cut the damn sushi/sashimi the size for an adult and not some 3 year old kid.  Nothing cute about the size of your sushi/sashimi.  This restaurant tried too hard to be high end which will lead it to total failure.

Service wAs lacking but that doesn't even matter because once again, Yellowtail over delivers in taste!  The spicy edamame is awesome as well! r-qLB7h0RKDy12oS7o2Aog.text: beef dishes were good.  i had the short rib and the beef flat iron.  I also had some fish, the halibut was dry and meh.  the salmon sushi was good, the spicy tuna was ok.  overall id go here if you want a japanese steak.  if you want seafood there is better. A shame since its called yellow tail

y_rkWD8fRyyMwdEpl08NTA.text: Chose to try the ribeye again with wasabi butter sauce and wasn't as good this time...almost like they didn't get a great cut...or maybe my first time it was amazing. Dunno.

-Lzrl1WPmYCJz4hHkIKf4w.text: Not a big sushi fan but the food was actually pretty good.  The service was top notch though.  A business partner and I both received very watered down drinks.  When we let the server know he brought us each another one and it was bigger and better than what we had ordered.  Felt very taken care of here.  Could have been the specific server but we were well taken care of.

a4LToikFHIGEEYW_wcSCZA.text: Great sushi and service. best Sushi restauramt in Vegas. Thhank You chef!

5jCSuF0iOH63MHty36dalg.text: We walked from Vdara to eat at Bellogio. We thought that we will go to eat at Olive (in Bellogio also) but I am Asian. I decided to go for Japanese. The Tuna pizza was so disappointed only one is good was seaweed salad. Service is so slow compared to other restaurants in Vegas.

vVfwbKpqC-oyJYmrvOkFYw.text: We came for my friend's birthday, had a great meal and enjoyed our evening.  I will say that the meal was very good and the service was excellent.  I base my reviews on comparable restaurants, hotels, etc.  First off, you know you're going to spend a ton of money because you're in Las Vegas and in The Bellagio.  If that is a factor for you then just don't go.  That being said, I feel like the food was very good.  The kimchi Brussel sprouts were excellent and the highlight of our meal.  However, the sushi was just very good.  It wasn't amazing and the presentation wasn't amazing; it was just good.  We enjoyed it and enjoyed our cocktails.  Again, the service was exceptional and fun.   I will say that the decor was beautiful and we were able to look out and watch the fountains of Bellagio which was lovely.  Given all the sushi restaurants in Las Vegas, would I go again? I probably would, but only to take first timers to Las Vegas.  There are other places that my husband and I enjoy more.  A solid four to four and a half stars.

3uEBCDcIInWjUVFIBg-OtQ.text: It pains me to give this place a 2, but I can't rate it any higher and have a clear Yelp conscience. I'll start with the good stuff.... The food was delicious, our waitress was friendly (and apologetic for the terrible experience) and the manager did treat us to a round of shots to help lessen the blow of the dining experience. Onto the not so good.... We went for a birthday celebration. We had a huge party, but we were at 3 different tables to make it manageable. No big deal there, except we weren't all in the same general area. The real problem was getting our food. For a table of 7, half of us didn't get our rolls until the majority of our group of 21 had finished eating and paid their bills. We asked for an update multiple times and even had to remind/correct the staff on what exactly we had ordered and still hadn't received. Sushi is obviously an experience and I never expect my roll to be in front of me within a few minutes, but nearly 2 hours is unacceptable. Worst part... the birthday girl was one of those waiting. Her guests were paying and leaving before she was even able to fully enjoy her dinner. Not a great experience.

Xl7U7UgNdMxT64lgfpUeYg.text: Had a reservation but NOT Honored they kept saying our table was in the works but after 45 minutes three hungry walked out in disgust!!!! Not nice

pTGSr2sBZdf9G5ziXD6wVg.text: This review is for the sushi only.   I understand people not wanting to pay the price of high quality sushi - it's expensive, I get it. But it's truly a culinary experience. When you get good fish, cut with artistry and finesse, served well in a beautiful setting, then it's a price worth paying.   I absolutely love sushi. I've had good and bad experiences all over the globe. This, while not in my #1 slot, it does make the top 5. The cuts are perfect. Thick,  uniform, and precisely sized. The fish itself melts in your mouth, as it should. The edamame was crisp, and well seasoned (I didn't care for the chili seasoning, but my husband did). The seaweed salad was perfectly prepared.   Drinks: I started with an infusion. A pineapple sake cocktail. Probably one of the most dangerous drinks on the planet. So good! The sake selection is extensive and will take another visit to explore more throughly, but impressive nonetheless.   Service: Our waiter was triple sat with us (party of 2), a party of 7, and a party of 10. Come on guys, that's just not fair. But in our servers defense, he handled it expertly. He asked for help from other staff when he was overwhelmed and the support staff always stopped to refill our glasses or clear the plates. To someone who doesn't notice those sorts of things, it would have been seamless. To me it was server perfection. Well done!   Atmosphere: This is a nice get away from the bustle of the casino. You can't hear the commotion from the dining area and the views of the fountains are spectacular! It's a beautiful setting and quite conducive to an enjoyable evening. The music is quiet, yet enjoyable and the decor is hip and trendy, yet elegant and well executed.   In conclusion, I'm sad that yellowtail doesn't get better reviews. While I only enjoyed the sushi on this visit, I would be willing to try more. Including the chefs choice menu with 7 courses and a sake pairing!   Well done over all, Yellowtail. A specific thank you to Chef Akira Back and your team!

vKt_OhU5863228y1OcrkbQ.text: I'll be dreaming of the tuna pizza until I return to Las Vegas! We loved sitting on the balcony overlooking the Bellagio fountains!

ZmULXlr42eSwnsAJxppSgg.text: Wasted my calories and time here.  Ordered wine and Mile high roll that took 40 minutes to come out.  The roll was mediocre and usually when I'm really hungry I think things taste extra delicious.    Bar Server was sweet though.    I was still hungry and took my $$ elsewhere for better food.

DU42o4mHjFqzh8hP1mPGXQ.text: I was here couple months ago, but I had to come back and write a review about this place because I still love it so much. Yes, you could say it is overpriced and not so good and whatmore. Some of the items on the menu could just be considered mediocre, yet their signature dish were definitely worth calling them 'signature.'  My friend and I took all the recommendations of our kind server and had an overwhelming dinner. Their Big Eye Tuna was served first. It was to die for. I personally love truffle oil, and its scent and flavor all went well with the crispy tortilla and thinly sliced tuna. This is a must-try on their menu, and probably one of the best I had the night. Second, we got the Yellowtail jalapeno. There was nothing that really stood out or made it different to other japanese restaurants, so you could skip this. Then, we got the rock shrimp as a finale to our appetizers. This got us FULL. Their portion for rock shrimp which is simply popcorn shrimp marinaded in somewhat like a spicy mayo sauce was huge, but the overall taste got sick after few pieces.   Yes we thought we were full but we still managed to move onto our entrees, the rolls! Our server asked us couple questions and brought us out the Popping spicy crab roll and Happa roll. The happa was a little spicy but it was delicious. THEIR POPPING SPICY CRAB ROLL WAS THE BEST. it was probably one of the best rolls in my whole entire life. You may think pop rocks in sushi roll is weird, but trust me and get this roll. It is worth every buck that you pay for it.   The service was great as well. Just make sure that you have plenty of time if you were to dine here since they do take awhile to bring out your food. Our dinner was done after their signature dessert-chocolate in a cup, which was amazing-- in total we were there for about 2-3 hours. Long dinner but everything was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate in a cup- yummm
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happa roll!
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. POPPING SPICY CRAB- my favorite!

Uk-z7TGmwiD9LpFyApdyUw.text: For sushi 3X times LA prices you would think service was better. SUCKS. Worst 300 I ever spent. Couldn't even fill my moms tea back up. Disgrace to bellagio. A joke Boyfriend had also called beforehand to surprise us with paying for dinner. I ended up coming earlier than reservation and they didn't bother with his request.

RR59Um6O1ah0iCOW6q3Q3Q.text: I've wanted to come here every time I've been in Vegas for the last couple years. Finally I came and it totally let me down. The waiter was meh. Nearly everything he recommend was meh. It wasn't bad by any means. But it wasn't great either. I've had better sushi at Whole Foods.

24UvTch7mfSphNZz0901jg.text: Nope.  A higher end hotel like the Bellagio needs a fine dining Japanese restaurant. Not a strip mall quality loungey fusion spot. Sure you're trying to get a fun party vibe going, but when the food is mediocre to low, it doesn't work.  it's time to upgrade to a premium high quality sushi location.

MM2y2hmWYrD38R6xQ7kbjQ.text: Really nice location inside the Bellagio.  The Big Eye Pizza was lights out and our other favorite was the temperature the sashimi was served at, just spot on.  Presentation is nice as well and staff was very generous.

jXFgFJ7z8wMjZXkAtopkMw.text: Can I say I am a fan.  However it will set you back a few dollars.  But than again, what do you expect from Vegas.  The sashmi are Japanese style.  What do I mean by that?  Well expect what portions should be vs. the Americanized sushi joints which can give you sashmi the size of a small truck.  Think of these pieces as a small Fiat size compared to a truck.  The crispy kalbi roll is simply amazing.  Def one of the better places at this casino.  By the way if you sit near the Casino floor you will um...see some interesting ladies of the night walk on by giving you the eye and it ain't for the amazing sushi.

_TmM0i4wI-j8MfDQfpdmpw.text: The food did not live up to our expectations. The salmon sashimi was frozen. The rice in the nigiri was not very good. The food eas served in the wrong order. Rolls before the staters. The attention was excellent

i_d7I07izNamrsT_HV27vQ.text: The food has been very very good on the omakase menu but the long delays between service is horrible.  The overall rating should probably be three stars because the service timing is so dreadful.

Bn0dUSN5aZ5t6C4X0OpJTw.text: They have my favorite dish which is warm foie gras, but they cook it in an Asian way. Fried banana under the foie gras provides the sweet taste. This is just like the chocolate sauce in the French style Foie gras dishes.  Kobe beef is also a recommended dish. The price for the dishes are high, but the waitresses' nice(shape&size) boobs  complement it.

namA2DWbvOqMI86tlCAwsg.text: I came here for dinner for two and waited about 15 minutes. We were seated at the bar and I let my friend do all the ordering. We got the rock shrimp, seafood ceviche, and braised kobe beef short ribs. The shrimp was a tempura-battered pieces of shrimp drizzled with aioli sauce. The seafood ceviche came with only five pieces of wonton chips to serve with the raw seafood mixture. To be frank, the portions are incredibly small, but I guess that's how fancy restaurants are. The flavor was good, but nothing extraordinary to me. I do have to admit that the short ribs were cooked amazingly well as the meat just slid off your chopsticks. Otherwise, nothing too special. Maybe I should've tried the authenticity of the sushi, but oh wells. Good thing I wasn't too hungry either because the food fit in the palm of my hands.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Ceviche.
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised Kobe Beef Short Ribs.

_GP7tW2WbqQ6g-AtAeWsBw.text: Get yourself the black cod !!!!!! So I came here with a group of friends before heading out to the clubs, as it was some close fitness we don't see often I wanted to make sure we tried something good. We got a lot of share plates we had the sea bass AWESOME , black cod INCREDIBLE, scollops very good, Kobe beef the mushroom were awesome and the beer just fell apart in all the right ways and king crab spring soy roll which was AMAZING.  The location is facing the bellagio fountains so the view is incredible with a Asian wood style restaurant which will wow a date and make you look like a hero.  Overall very pleasant experience and those that like their fine wines will also like this location. The black cod alone is worth checking out this place.

GvYx4BG76Hif7Lr_iez4BA.text: I can't rave enough about this restaurant! I am not a fan of raw fish and/or sushi but I seriously ate everything my table ordered! It was so fresh, delicious, and paired well. We had the lobster carpaccio that was my favorite as well as one of their rolls which has pop rocks in it so it gives a unique experience! The short rib roll with Cole slaw piled on top was fantastic! Def a must to stop by!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vJKNBa_be8Kn1QK-EhvRqg.text: Starting my evening off at the Bellagio's Baccarat Bar with some business friends seemed like a good idea. Other then the very loud pianist it was. Then the subject of dinner came up and I was all for relocating to another venue due to the amount of people we had and the certainty of me having to pay the bill. A quick trip to the men's room and the subject of dinner will be decided. When I got back it was unanimously decided (without my vote) - YELLOWTAIL JAPANESE RESTAURANT & LOUNGE.  Ouch, this was going to be expensive!   The fact is, this is really good Japanese cuisine. The best ingredients, great preparation, beautifully done and very delicious. The menu offered so many variations of what I'm used to on my Ventura Blvd. niche environs that each dish as a pleasant surprise. This was, flat out, a wonderful dinner with fantastic service. Everyone including myself enjoyed the hell out of it, and I will definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone wanting this cuisine.  Was it very expensive - a resounding YES! It's not a hole-in-the-wall place with hole-in-the-wall prices. It's a "Real Deal" place with "Real Deal" prices. Was I shocked when I got the bill - No. Did I feel I got my money's worth - Yes. So why the four stars and why am I crying; It was one months car payment and I still have to write the car payment check.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BUmHHytDobNvEGRTzVIakw.text: Celebrated New Years here with my hubby. The patio seating with water show views are breathtaking. Truly a romantic setting. Service was very good. Food was good but location was better. Definitely try the tuna truffle pizza. It's a must. Overall I'm giving it a 5 start for the restaurants atmosphere and location.

cw4oUxJVvflyd1x9rZMKDA.text: Went to Yellowtail a few nights ago with some colleagues. It was absolutely amazing. I cannot say more about our server, Guy. He was so attentive and unbelievably helpful. He recommended a few dishes and each one was exquisite - my favorite was a dish that was kind of like a fish pizza. The crab tempura was also on top of my list. I will most definitely be back and will be asking for Guy as my server. He made the experience that much better!

QuczwWVBIQFQDeDIvT91wg.text: Seafood here was definitely fresh. Toro was so very good. Rolls were not as unique as I had imagined it to be for a sushi restaurant on the strip. Server was pleasant but we didn't get visited as often which is understandable since it was very busy that day.

z5fsoeoehb8jGiW8HLS54A.text: One of the best restaurant experiences in Vegas. Great food, location and views overlooking the fountain and the strip. Also the staff are very helpful!  The cold and warm dishes are great here!  Will definitely come again!

d_ks-2x3Su6h0mEqxAo5Bg.text: Way overpriced for the quality. I ordered a Toro Scallion roll, my wife ordered the Tempura Shrimp roll. Mine was 6 small pieces, my wife's was 8. Both were so poorly wrapped they fell apart picking up the first piece. We sent them back and had them remade. Both dishes tasted good, but could be outclassed in both price and taste by most supermarket sushi. The miso soup was better than most though.   The only reason for the second star is because we were comped for the Toro Scallion. Some redemption, but I shouldn't have to send anything back for such an obvious defect.

LGRpk-tA3bSYehhPS8hZUg.text: I would have adopted our waiter Guy, and made him family. We were pretty trashed- and we got a gorgeous setting, he took our pictures on the balcony in front of the fountains, such amazing service!!! I paid roughly 100.00 plus a person for 3 appetizers and three drinks. This place is great if you have thousands to spend on getting a satisfyingly full dinner.
