UXNJFr9gkDc3OKW9e7Xdxw.text: Delicious Kobe short rib!!! Soft and tender! Rib-eye was a bit dry....rock shrimp roll was perfect!! Only 4 stars because each dish took forever

KFQQCemWccHn9io3yLcNmg.text: I came to Yellowtail, trying to continue the legacy of great sushi meals I have had in Vegas. I managed to do so, but I will say that we ended up ordering more "non-sushi" items than we had intended here, and that was fine.  From their hot and cold plates menu, we ended up with four things. Our Bigeye Tuna pizza came recommended, and was quite good. The tasty thin sliced tuna was "glued" to flat bread with something - creamy, and neutral, maybe a creamy cheese? That particular ingredient wasn't listed on the menu. The whole thing was topped with drizzled truffle oil, which I frankly could have done without. The more I am exposed to truffle, the more I think the smell is offensive. It's too powerfully earthy, almost a rotting smell, to me at least, and while the taste is not as strong as the smell, it tends to overwhelm my nose, and thus my sense of taste. But this was still good, my anti-truffle campaign aside. The sliced octopus in jalapeno vinaigrette was...fine, but unremarkable. The octopus was tasty, but the vinaigrette needed some more punch. I didn't find much jalapeno in it.  From the hot side of the menu, our tempura king crab was awesome - light batter, flavorful tender crab meat, tossed in a sweet/hot sauce. So delicious, and probably the highlight of the prepared plates. The seafood dynamite was also good, served in a cast pan with corn and mushrooms. Kind of an interesting take, with plenty of chunked seafood. Also worth ordering.  For sushi, we ended up with their popping spicy crab roll - how can you resist a sushi roll with pop rocks? This is gimmicky, but also very good. I liked the crunch of the pop rocks (and the pop) along with the soft crab and crisp cucumber. Their spicy tuna roll was good - heavy on tuna, not just spicy mayo like I've had at some places. And the toro scallion roll had some of the best toro I've had to date. Super tender and flavorful. The scallions did not overpower like I thought they might.  I also had my standard seaweed salad, which here is a mix of fresh and pickled seaweed, for a nice change of pace. Really enjoyable.  Service was good, prices are...well, I'd say normal, but not absurd for Vegas. The restaurant looks out over the Bellagio fountain, so if you get a good table, you've got a great view. Even from the middle of the room, we found ourselves stopping conversation to watch the thing go off. Cliched though it may be, it's still really cool, every time I see it.  Here's to another successful sushi meal in Vegas - 3 for 3. Of note, dress code here is "casual" for sure. One of us saw a man enter the bar wearing a bear costume (which included fake abs and a furry hat with bear ears) underneath a suit. So yeah. Wear those sneakers without fear.

MRVj9O4pXOjtEK7JgI0plw.text: I'd have to thank Food Network for this visit to Yellowtail. If it wasn't for Beau MacMillan's convincing testimonial of their Alaskan King Crab Tempura from Best Things I Ever Ate, I probably would never have considered coming here. It looked so good on the show, I had to make the effort to try it out. I came by on a Sunday night without a reservation so the pretty hostess asked if I want to sit at table inside the lounge or outside on their front patio. So no view of the Fountains of Bellagio which wasn't such a bad thing. I chose to dine at the front patio as it was a nice way to people watch while I would wait for my food. As a side note, the hostess and all the waitresses here are really HAUTE!! Never had Crab Tempura before, but after having it at Yellowtail, I'm gonna look for it at any Japanese Restaurant. The Alaskan King Crab Tempura was amazing!!! Not only was it delicious, it was very photogenic as well (bit.ly/2wg2LWg). The Crab was tasty and the Ponzu sauce totally enhanced the flavor of the Tempura. For me, it was a foodgasm with each bite. At $23, it is quite a splurge considering it's from their Small Hot Plate menu, but they give you plenty of pieces and a side order of Rice went great with it. Plus, it's not very often that you would find Crab Tempura on a menu at your conventional Japanese Restaurant. So consider it a different experience when you're ordering it. My waitress was great and very friendly, and as I mentioned earlier, very HAUTE!! One minor hiccup about my service was that the person who served me my food forgot to include the Ponzu sauce which was a very important ingredient. It took a while for my waitress to get the sauce for me which cooled down my food a little bit. But once she brought me the sauce, the awesomeness of the Tempura totally made up for it. 4.5 stars rounding up! Yellowtail has definitely earned a spot as one of my To-Go Vegas dining spots.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan King Crab Tempura ($23).  YUM!!!!

xIrC31Q7MIXVOlEcZvnvEA.text: The food is okay, considering that it's almost always  a packed house. I felt as though it was microwaved?  It was almost cold the moment the food arrived at the table. The reason why I gave this a 3 Star is because the food took almost an hour to arrive.

usZFA8AjDMRxsTnXXMtRSQ.text: 4.5 stars, rounded up-- mostly for the fact that their service has been the cream of the crop in Vegas every.single.time. Along with this, the restaurant is very hip and trendy yet maintains a beautiful and almost addicting ambiance.   I've now visited Yellowtail on 4 separate occasions, all very impressive. As aforementioned, their service is truly top-notch; At times I felt that there were anywhere between 3-5 wait staff members assigned to our table; on one occasion, we had 7 different members visit our table. However, none of this was overbearing to the point where our party felt uncomfortable or "too" helped, if that makes sense. Perfect balance. Also, I'm a water snob, and my water glass was never less than half-full. Wheeee.  Some patrons have docked stars because Yellowtail is so expensive. Well, I can't blame them, as I almost docked a star because of its price tag. I try to reason that "it's Vegas, and everything is overpriced, and blahblahblah *insert the voice of the teacher over the intercom in Charlie Brown / Peanuts.*" Anything to assuage the bill's amount....riiiight?   A few of our favorite items include:   --Big Eye Tuna Pizza ($26): Quite the delectable item, but make sure that you don't mind truffle oil! The oil is strong but brings out some additional nice qualities of the tuna sashimi. All served on a crisp "pizza" crust, this appetizer is best split between 2-3 people.   --Tempura Alaskan King Crab ($23): My mouth waters just thinking of this...nom nom nom. Tender pieces of fresh king crab with just the right amount of tempura battering. Served with some shaved serrano (think like bitter jalapenos) and a delicious sweet ponzu, we make sure to get this each time. A great starter for 2-4.   --Cucumber Salad ($8): Probably their most basic menu item besides the miso soup, but the bountiful, thin shavings of cucumber mixed with the delicious sweet/vinegary liquid makes this something we always crave.   --******Baked Crab (or Rock Shrimp) Hand Roll ($10): This is probably my family's favorite little dish at Yellowtail. My mom always cracks me up when she says that "we need to order the little burrito things!" May seem a bit funny, but these really do resemble mini burritos. We love both variations of the hand roll-- I personally prefer the crab-- and we once got carried away and didn't realize that our party of 8 had ordered 10 of them until the bill came out. Sorry we're not sorry..? I'm sure our waitress loved us that night.   --Popping Spicy Crab ($17): If nothing else, this is worth a try. Very unique with the pop rocks embedded in the roll.   --Shrimp Tempura ($14): Extremely basic, but tasty nonetheless.  TIP: Their specialty cocktails are good, but for $20, I'd rather stick that into a video poker machine, test my luck, and tip the cocktail waitress for 2-3 premium drinks.   Overall: Yellowtail keeps us coming back with its impeccable service, unique ambiance, and fantastic flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi tuna pizza...definitely not to be missed, so delicious with the white truffle oil on it!

OUbu3zuH1p1SD4MAhshhqA.text: My husband came to vegas 5 years ago and literally has not stopped talking about the pop rocks sushi, so when we came this past June for our 2nd wedding anniversary, it was the first place on our list. We ate here before seeing O and waited for about 20 minutes for it to open. We didn't make reservations so I'm a bit confused about how that part works because they wouldn't let us sit inside, they sat us at the "lounge" area facing the casino (which was honestly a view in itself, best people watching of my life!) but it didn't deter us. We tried the seaweed salad, which had kale and for the first time in my life I didn't spit the kale out. The cocktails were too expensive for me to try ($20 PER DRINK!) but my husband got a blood orange Grey Goose drink off the cocktail menu that was okay but not worth the price. I digress, for dinner my husband got two sushi rolls (pop rocks was one of them, obviously) and yes it was phenomenal...but the show stealer was my beef short rib. Holy expletive. On the down side, I will never again in my life be able to eat short rib because nothing else will come close to this. Upside? I ATE A MEAT CLOUD! I literally cut it with my effing chopsticks, that's how perfectly cooked it was. I have a video to prove it. It was the best tasting thing I might have ever had in my life and that is not an overstatement for once. It was so beautiful I might cry just reliving the experience while I write this. MEAT CLOUD! CHOPSTICKS! GO NOW!

wXI5hhNQZhGiQssoSdEGgw.text: Dined in at yellowtail a few days ago and we had the most amazing time. Our server Tammy was so helpful and knowledgeable about the menu. She directed us into ordering the tuna pizza which is the most delicious thing i have ever eaten. We also had the lobster carpaccio and filet toban. We also had the divine droplet sake and it was amazing! Make sure to eat at yellowtail if you are in vegas and ask for Tammy! You will definitely enjoy your experience! Very Nice view too!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best view ever!!! Excellent service btw

yPYQm-9g_ZKZW2mScukfQQ.text: Well I think this restaurant is growing long in the tooth as is the hotel in which it resides.  The food isn't bad, just not the "knock your socks off" taste as it once was.  It seems the prices go up and the quality is starting to go down.   I will say the waiter/waitress staff are the best.

KR5O1OMV1qf2QizSmyzzGQ.text: Only the best for me, met the Chef, he was very friendly. Loved the food, this is the way food should be expected.

A-fGjq9SAPQx7DGc2zvr5A.text: Ive debated even reviewing this restaurant (as I only had a glass of wine, and two apps of edamame), but decided I should.   My friend had some sort of sushi, and really enjoyed it. And my edamame apps (I believe I had one with sea salt, and one with a chili sauce) were very good (how can you go wrong with edamame??). But wow this place is expensive. Very very very expensive. For two glasses of their cheapest wine, two edamame apps, and a sushi plate, our bill with tip was about $100.   Sorry that this isn't the most informative review about the service and atmosphere (see other reviews for that), but I can't justify spending the amount of money this place requests... even in Vegas.

fgdCMWiC6a0ppyItBRXplA.text: Super pricey. But the sushi is pretty damn good. Staff is a little on the "higher end" and if you're not dressed up and dolled up they might just give you a funny look. Luckily I didn't have that problem and was seated right away. Fun friendly server. Again don't come here expecting to be full off $100. I'd recommend it time and time again. 4 stars only because of the greeters

Dbv2oAgz_rcDXzWFrbN77w.text: This place offers all of the delectable items one comes to expect from a good Japanese restaurant. We were 6 for dinner and opted to share a bunch of different plates. The food is very good. The portions are small and the prices are...well...PRICEY! We all agreed that though we were enjoying the meal, we all felt that a late-night burger or hot dog would be in our near futures. This is the type of place that delightfully empties your wallet, while not quite filling your belly. But hey, it's a restaurant in The Bellagio. If you want value, hit a buffet at a lesser resort.

nqD2dPe4yZ9FcpiaayIe7A.text: Good vibe restaurant. The big eye tuna pizza is really delicious, generally all the food I had was really good!

i0GVgAZKA83pR9MI4J_b3g.text: If I could give no stars I would. We were staying at the hotel and wanted to grab some sushi.  The lady who greeted us spoke so disdainfully to us I was horrified!  We had a sleeping infant, and were informed we couldn't bring her in, in her stroller. She was asleep and we were told to take her out and put her on a chair if needed! Yeah right! Needless to say, we walked out and ate at sensi across the other side of the hotel! Which was amazing!

OZdkrIIasmI41Z36Xov53w.text: Though my first experience at yellowtail was a fairly pleasant one, my second one was not. In all fairness, I ordered takeout versus dining in the second time. I ordered the red dragon roll and the seaweed salad based on some positive reviews. I was quite disappointed with the entire experience -- the customer service was poor, consisting of a handful of confused or unwilling servers/hostesses running around trying to ring me up. I paid nearly $50 for an 8 piece roll and a seaweed salad. The quality of the roll was not worth the price -- the rice was hard/not fresh. I felt like I was eating grocery store sushi. The seaweed salad was good, but not extraordinary.  The three stars reflect my previous experience in 2013 together with this one. I will likely not return here for sushi as I've had better quality fish and service elsewhere in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red dragon roll and seaweed salad

uk-IFzHOIBSbPl48LBIJcQ.text: WOW! WOW! WOW!  Dinner at Yellowtail was a highlight of my latest Vegas business trip. We decided to eat whatever the Chef's preferred to make us, without even looking at the food menu, and we were not disappointed.  The tuna pizza - Awesome! Yellowtail Serano - Awesome! Tempura Alaskan King Crab - Awesome!  Seafood Dynamite - DYNAMITE! Baked Rock Shrimp Handroll - Awesome! Angry Salmon - AWESOME! Sushi  was fresh, the rolls were fun and mouthwatering.   Everything was so tasty I wanted to order another, and then the next thing came up and took the "Favorite" spot.  Of course we drank - champagne, wine, coffee and finished dinner with the Lemincello (first for me), and thanks to the sommelier recommendations, everything was excellent.  The best part, and I didn't know this was an option, one of my dinner guests told the waiter he wanted to time dinner service with the Belagio fountain show - every 15 minutes.  Every 15 minutes we walked out of the restaurant to the balcony (it was a cold night so the patio wasn't open for dinner) and watched the fountain show, came back to the table with a new set of dishes, glasses re-filled, everything clean, napkins refolded or replaced.  The service from the waiters, sommelier, food runners, was excellent. We felt pampered without interruption, all night long.    I can't wait to return!

nLlV7j6sNo5oGjGuOVuquQ.text: AMAZING! Possibly the best sushi restaurant that I've ever been to! Be sure to try the Protein roll. It's $30 but when you taste it you'll be blown away. We started with edamame like we always do and were so pleasantly surprised to discover a new twist on edamame: they do a version that is a sugar chili paste. Sounds weird but it's soooo good! we had many dishes and everything was absolutely perfect. This is how fine dining should be.

su3vjbaC4aWQ-vtdhH5BFA.text: Everyone should experience YELLOW TAIL at least once in their life!!  This is not a joke about "being" with an Asian woman.  I'm Asian, so watch it!  Seriously, remember the name AND GO!  I've been 3 times and the next time I go to Vegas I will be there again!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas!

zZ2Qtk5wRRvFWiuZIkLk2Q.text: Don't go. Save your money and get 2 dinners. The food quality was good, but not great. I've had much better more times than I can remember. For the price I paid, I expected life altering sushi.   Service was so-so. Hostess forgot to seat us and asked us what we were waiting for. This was 3 minutes after she already said they were preparing our table.   Don't have the heart to give it a 1 Star because the food didn't suck, but I would advise no one to go to this restaurant.

ylJg0mc-17t_doxZCoc8BQ.text: I love everything at Yellowtail!   The ahi pizza, protein roll, king crab tempura awesome! Ask for Roberto he is the finest waiter at Yellowtail.

OX_6hYNBDKtXbd9AvsUsBw.text: still my #1 Japanese favorite... Service is outstanding - view I the bellagio waters how is pretty awesome. Highly recommended.

zzTddgutHf5w-weYkjapfQ.text: The only tail worth noting here were the busty waitresses. This place is horrible value for money. Tiny portions that are absolutely overpriced. "Specialty Rolls" (e.g. Spicy Tuna Roll), start at $14 and are half the size of any other place I have ever been to. $12 Gin and Tonics may be  priced only slightly above average, but it was tough to detect any gin at all.  Pass this one. There's much better value (and food) to be found in Vegas.

i9iY2uOJRQkYBETjW6cD3A.text: Well, when you're walking around Bellagio waiting for O to start and you want dinner, there aren't many options.  They're all pricey, we know that.  Service was very kind, but the drinks are really overpriced and the rolls are perhaps the smallest I have ever seen.  We left there hungry for sure and still spent a ton.  They have a creme brulee dessert, but geez, who ever thought to put ginger on it?  It was still good though even though I'm not a big ginger fan.  I had the tempura roll and it was good, but I could have used about 3 or 4 of them.  Also had a little crab something roll but it was even smaller.

6ya3BAvOXY8ZrXSw4dpxhw.text: Great sushi, excellent service and breathtaking view. One of the best restaurant in town.

PH4YXPc3b9lb2Vj2nRDf-w.text: The seared tuna pizza w/ truffle oil  is amazing.. A little $$ but so worth it.. Wish I could find something that even came close back home..

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Almost the best thing ever
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5pvssSmxKPFLjhUb-GbKDg.text: I love Japanese food and this restaurant does not disappoint. Low lighting and a beautiful view of the fountains which give the room a great ambience. The waiters are wonderful, attentive and encouraged some great menu choices. The food is a modern take on Japanese cuisine with some unusual combinations that work so well. The stand out dishes for me and my personal favorites are the tuna pizza and the pop rock roll.  Overall Yellowtail is fantastic, the location in unbeatable, the food is phenomenal and the service completely blows you away. I will absolutely dine here again, and highly recommend to anyone who comes to vegas this is a must!

FgNOVrRGTkZCYP53LiyovQ.text: Fabulous food. However, the service needs improvement only from the standpoint of efficiency. I read reviews that service was an issue. When we first arrived, it appeared we had a great waiter. Started off with a bang & then he disappeared. Our dinner took 3 hours!!!!!!! Portions are very small & very pricey. We were a party of eight & after a thousand dollars worth of food we were still hungry. The portions are ridiculously small & ridiculously expensive but very good. Wish they could improve the service.

pZ4Uph3dbA1J835vaeZxhA.text: Couldn't pick a place to have an anniversary dinner so we decided on Yellowtail before coming to Vegas.   Major plus - my bf's cousin is the sue chef and some old homies work there. So, they definitely took care and we had a delicious anniversary dinner!  Fun atmosphere. Dim, romantic ambiance, but it's kinda loud. Definitely a 'must-go again'

nq_B9xGwICHAwZVTzNZN1g.text: Had a reservation with another couple.   Waited 40 minutes.  After receiving no updates from the rude, disinterested hostesses we finally left.   Considering they are located in the bellagio I was shocked by how they could careless about their customers.   Not up to the bellagio standard - they should refrain the staff there - every other dealing with bellagio stores and restaurants was perfect.    Try Lagos across the way  in bellagio - wow they are amazing!!!!!

SjMjXbOElSnBNKsmXpUVVQ.text: At first glance, this place seems really affordable for great sushi in the Bellagio, but beware! The food portions are extremely small, nearly 1/3 the amount of what you would normally get at a regular sushi restaurant, resulting in having to pay 3x the cost! While the food was ok, the service was mediocre and prices sucked for the quantity you got.

iKCCf3LRYbBN6y_rqf57kQ.text: Yummy Spicy Miso soup! Big Eye Tuna pizza is a MUST when coming here!   Tempura Alaskan  king crab was appetizing and the sauce poured on it was pleasing. The spicy salmon roll were small, but very fresh. Jidori Chicken tasted alright. Braised Kobe Beef Short Ribs was deliciouso!!! Nice atmosphere,knowledgable staff, great tasting food.  Cons Condescending staff(wait, bus) small portions(tapas style) Extremely pricey  Overall feeling after: food was not filling and we were already discussing where we should eat after! missing the "treated right" feeling.  You don't pay 4x more to be treated worse :(

N9pU-TkdIYUzmX0UhGv2oQ.text: I went during the WCC tourney in March, so a bit late on my review. Not a huge sushi fan, so was a bit hesitant to join my friends for dinner. They told me the place was high standard. I will freely admit I am not well versed on sushi and dont even use chopsticks well, ha. I will say that what we ordered was amazing, I cant even remember all the things. I know we had the battered crab, which was really good and I even liked all the fresh sushi. The waitress as nice and was patient with us. I had a beer to drink so cant comment on the drinks. My only knock was the prices. I get it, its Vegas, the Bellagio, etc but your prices are simply too high. Overall food was good.

LCYvTth4l17X4YPSCKZqiw.text: Food and service were excellent, but the techno music blasting in an endless loop made it almost impossible to have a conversation and forced us to rush through dinner, leaving with headaches. Maybe just not our scene, but won't be back.

pzAcxCeq2eGHzyHF59Gw6A.text: My husband and I sat at the bar for dinner before we had to catch a flight. The food was overall good, but didn't justify the prices. I could eat at Kabuto for what we paid to eat there and still left hungry. We paid close to $300 for 2 people and I didn't even order a drink.  The rock shrimp was really good, so we ordered another one which then came out soggy and also took awhile because the kitchen was backed up. Everything else was pretty standard with regards to the sushi we ordered. Overall, the food was ok but I don't think I'll return when there are so many other options in the city off the strip.

p1VV3cHoDush3LflDBMKMw.text: Creative fois gras dishes and fresh yellow tail tuna sushi pieces are delectable. Fantastic sake list. Excellent service from the friendly bartenders. Great place to eat dinner solo at the bar while reading and people watching. I'm not a fan of Vegas but when I'm here for work, this is easily my favorite place to eat and chill.

QSX7NMp6wl3WyeZF9g2UtQ.text: In Las Vegas for a Convention. What a dissapointment. The Food was cold, service was bad (to the point that the waitress was bringing out a plate and her hair was in the plate). We were a party of 7 and 6 of us eat and 1 never got their foid. We asked why. They replied we are busy.  Too bad because the food it self was not bad. This us not cheap and we don't mind paying for goid food bit service is probably more important that food. This is "The Frugal Critic" and I cannot recommend this Rest.

R4L27lhKCTqIUf7v6CcOVw.text: This is my favorite sushi spot in Vegas. The vibe is awesome and the food is fresh and amazing. Sitting by the windows will give you a fantastic view of the Bellagio fountains to enjoy during dinner. If you like sushi and are in Vegas this is a must.

0JxJ06PhrkptdZYxQBJgsA.text: The food was good but very overpriced for what you get. For example, the difference between new style sashimi and regular sashimi is new sashimi is razor thin with good tasting sauce. Yes the sauce was good. The thinly sliced fish and octopus was also very good. However I don't think it was worth $28. I'm starving after spending 150 on sushi and sashimi with drinks and am on the hunt for a burger to satiate my hunger

4L3ZhrGtCrJW9yw_FVnlCw.text: The yellowtail jalapeno in blood orange sauce is to die for.  I could've eaten about 5-6 plates.  The big eye tuna pizza was ok.  I think I'd skip that dish.  Their cocktails and sake are fabulous.  Service was beyond stellar.  I love the ambiance and decor here.  Definitely coming back for yellowtail jalapeno, sake, and going to try their octopus in jalapeno sauce.

W3Q69wiRCwF4qemR3-xqfQ.text: Best food in Las Vegas by far. Yes, expensive but worth it!!! Great bartender great food and great vibe.

qllxrqnNRFEs8TnwwKfNRg.text: My favorite sushi spot on the strip! Fancy and super classy dark lit decor. I love the Bellagio lake view and their espresso martini is my favorite. I recommend it for a nice dinner out and even a casual meet up. You won't regret it!

BlAv471pZI2JA7yytrT1Yw.text: Made a reservation on a whim for a 6:30pm dinner on Tuesday for 4 adults and my 9 year old. We were lucky enough to snag a table on the balcony and am so glad we did. The view of the fountains and Vegas strip is amazing. As many times as I have been to Vegas, I have never seen the Bellagio fountain show from this vantage point and am so happy we were able to have our friend and our daughter see this as it was their first time in Las Vegas.   I cannot recall our waiter's name but his service was impeccable as was his team. The adults decided on the 7 course omakase dinner and we definitely made the right choice. Unlike nyc omakase, these plates were larger than what we were used to (in nyc, it's usually 1 or 2 pieces of sushi per course) and included a couple cooked items. Each course masterfully done and timed perfectly in between so we never felt rushed to finish a plate. Absolutely delicious. Truly enjoyed the sushi pizza, yellowtail in Thai sauce, and the scallop just to make a few. Be sure to give yourself at least 1.5-2 hours if you do the omakase though but you won't regret it especially if you have the water to entertain you. We were able to see the sunset and the show lit up at night. My daughter had the California roll and, at first, didn't think she'd like the king crab but she loved it. We also ordered the oysters, yellowtail carpaccio, and wagyu. All terrific! Best wagyu I've ever tasted. So tender. My daughter asked for more but she'll have to bring her own birthday money next time. Haha! Best cocktail for me was the cucumber essence as recommended by our waiter. Not too sweet, but light, and refreshing. Whoever serviced our balcony table of 5 on 6/25, please tell him that we truly enjoyed everything about our dinner including his professionalism, patience, and banter. We will definitely be back again and hope to have you again as our server.  P.S. thank you for accommodating my daughter's nut allergy for the dessert. She loved the tiramisu! Cheers!

yfn5geWh0pB7MgGkKTa1gg.text: Best Big eye Tuna pizza I hAve ever had ! They also have a lobster carpaccio that is delicious .

GdPP6MFH5a0ySql3eQWA0Q.text: Idk why this place doesn't have 5 stars ? The Tuna Pizza is out of this world delicious... and I don't even like fish!! Which is why I also go for the crispy kalbi roll with the cole slaw on top. Service is always amazing and timely.  If you're there don't even ask for a dessert menu. Just order the chocolate in a cup, you won't regret it... unless you have a nut allergy :) this is a must if you're looking for a fine restaurant in Vegas with incredible views of the Bellagio water fountains. There's also bar and lounge seating for the more casual guests.

pI-VIrPqRMs4PrHr0GCcbQ.text: Beautiful restaurant with views of the fountains at Bellagio. It's really a nice experience and beautiful ambiance at this restaurant & the food was delicious. All fish very fresh.

WUPkr84ljIOtIYTpH2GKZA.text: The best part of the restaurant is the view. We sat at the patio and saw the water show every 30 mins during dinner. Though it's warm out, but not as bad during dinner hour, especially night to the water in the shade. So I will give it a 5-star to the view. Now talk about the food, there is nothing extraordinary about the quality and uniqueness of their food. Their service is extremely slow. Our reservation is at 5, by the time we finish is almost 7. Just gave us enough time to rush to the 7pm show.  We rushed our server many times for the desert, it took them a good 30 mins to prepare for just the desert!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TpZzcTyUw432dQc1XJh78w.text: Sushi here is always on point. If you enjoy fusion cuisine this is restaurant will not disappoint. Great variety on the menu and the tuna pizza is probably one of my kids' top 10 dishes of all-time! They have been devouring it since they were 7 years old and have grown from sharing one to ordering at least one each and then another for dessert. It literally melts in your mouth. Pop-rocks sushi roll is also fun for mixing things up. The ambience is fantastic and Yellowtail offers a wonderfully eclectic variety of dishes!

jPwQ-b-n_Pxq6O68e75DWA.text: Came in with 90 min before our show. Our server put a meal together for us that was top notch.  I believe her name was Jae. But the view, service, and food was all the best I've had in Vegas

yuXkl5Nmwyw_KDD9x_QD-Q.text: was excited to try Yellowtail but EXTREMELY disappointed by...well all of it honestly. service was very sucky as our waiter was very dismissive & rude, food came all out of order (like our soup came after of entree & that's after it took 25 minutes for anything to come out at all), sushi roll was the most disgusting item i've ever eaten, and the experience was NOT AT ALL worth the price or time. only good thing i can say is that the edamame was delicious- but it's kinda hard to screw that up. just completely let down in just about every way.  Update: to respond to the comment from the owners- the opportunity to prove yourself will never be givin. this was completely & utterly unacceptable for a restaurant that's supposed to be amazing at the least. (you don't just get a restaurant in this location for being "okay" or "shabby". & honestly Yellowtail didn't even live up to that standard.) it's proven that by your reviews and rating this is obviously not "uncharacteristic" of this establishment. i only wish i would have seen it before hand. so to anyone & everyone reading this review- save yourself the $200+ and go to a restaurant that's actually worth your time, your money, and serves quality food. i mean, you might as well- you're paying for it.

O6XbTD1NW5ap8aNvsaPrOQ.text: Too many misses here. I really expected 5 stars here but sadly Yellowtail did not deliver. We were seated fairly fast but never received menus from the host. The wait staff was slow and we sat for about 10 minutes before a waiter came to us with a menus. We were never told about the restaurant week special menu. I started with a martini and it had to be sent back because it came dirty not dry with a twist as I ordered. The positives about the food were the salads. They were outstanding and so uniquely made. After the first course I was excited to have the sushi rolls. The four rolls we ordered arrived and they looked the same rather blah not very unique or pretty. I thought the spicy tuna was very good by far the best roll. The California roll was disappointing not having much flavor and the cucumber wasn't pealed so it was bitter. The yellow tail roll was highly disappointing the tuna was fishy and did not appear very fresh. The presentation was sad the roll was loose. The service did improve as the meal went on and our drinks were refreshed.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber salad very refreshing
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Variety of rolls for the most part disappointing
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A unique spinach salad a highlight of the meal

NMf0h5p8cWDQazK7nDqk8w.text: Loved the ambiance.  Went with 4 other folks and walked out with a $600 bill plus tip.  Each had about two drinks and shared a bunch of sushi.  Rolls are average at best.  Fish was good, especially the Uni.  From a value perspective this seems a bit too high.  If we had spent $300, I'd give this place the fourth star, but I expected much better quality given the price, especially for the rolls.

PCnO9kQSKtp1kGlN3dta5A.text: Fabulous restaurant overlooking the Bellagio Fountain. We followed the recommendations: Big eye tuna pizza topped with micro greens, so yummy! Braised beef and Kobe flank steak were also very good. A star less for the lukewarm miso soup. Do not miss an opportunity to try something new: Black and White Matcha Cake and Banzai Bunny Blueberry Sake. Kampai!

eRYCdLIH5fU2L7zVu_OEbw.text: We got the scallops, rib eye and yellowtail sushi. Everything was divine. I would say that the scallops were a bit underdone for my liking; but that is no reflection of the chef. I just like my fish welldone and my red meat rare. Ribeye was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WN5rz5K4k76f0sIJ-_mJUg.text: Great service, food across the board is delicious. My only two criticism, pricy and extremely loud. We ordered scallops, seaweed salad, duck prosciutto, toro caviar, Kagoshima wagyu, Kobe short ribs, chocolate mousse cake and yuzu citrus. Duck prosciutto was a little on the salty side. Kobe short ribs a little too sweet. Otherwise everything else was delightful. For the Kagoshima wagyu I recommend teppanyaki style. If price is not a concern then this place is worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Mousse Cake (with tiramisu ice cream)
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yuzu citrus
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kagoshima wagyu

iYtnOx-cxb__kvpEFaMRVg.text: Honestly was not my favorite restaurant reason being is because the food was just all very similar and a little on the blander side. However it was very elegant and the deserts were the best part. The food was very well displayed but not my favorite tasting. I was not a fan of the tuna pizza that everyone raves about.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h2xhDRtkMz_uVKtmKA_voQ.text: My experience at Yellow Tail was as good as it gets. From the delectable, melt in your mouth sashimi, to the perfectly mixed cocktails, I couldn't have asked for a finer dining experience. One of the managers, Jamie, went out of his way to make sure that our experience was above and beyond our expectations, and I am so appreciative. I was so impressed! The service matched the quality of the food, and that is a beautiful thing. We can't wait to go back to sit on the balcony and watch the Bellagio fountain show!

UdYaUQnSn7PDdZYvto5-NA.text: What can I say .. This may be my new FAVORITE sushi in Las Vegas.   Pricey but totally worth it !  Everything we ordered was absolutely amazing! Great ambience, great service, great food, great saki selection... What more could you ask for ?!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_wZ8d8wrsQZtlY-3z4Coaw.text: Food was so so. Veey unimpressed. We had 7 people in our party and three plates came out first, then three more came out 15-20 minutes later. The 7th plate came out anoth 15 minutes later. The salmon was done very well but the Kobe Flat iron steaks where chewy and cold when delivered.   Bottom line, not worth the money.

NHHrFCrlFUchdjFV9kjuKA.text: Last week, I wanted to end my trip at Vegas happy, but I was met with udder disappointment. Me and my girlfriend was served by Team 1.   They had highly disorganized team. We wanted a few minutes to look over the menu and the server never came back to us. Instead another server came and took our order. We only ordered 3 items since we only had about 2 hrs before meeting up with friends.  After our order was taken, the previous server came back and asked if we ordered. We told her we did and waited another 15 minute before we were served with Braised Kobe beef short ribs.   Honestly, it tasted like something my dad could make for 1/3 of the cost. Wasn't impressed, but the next item that came did taste amazing. The Seared Diver Sea Scallops tasted Amazing! It was cooked perfectly and practically melted in your mouth.  Here is where I have trouble understanding your service. I had to wait 30 minutes for the Big Eye Tuna Pizza. A cold dish. There was 3 servers that came over and asked me if I wanted to order more. Did it look like I was happy sitting there with no food on the table? I asked one server to check on it and she never came back. The second one actually checked on it and told me it's almost ready. The third one obviously wasn't told that people were working on it already.   It then took another 10 minutes to get the check. Is it because we came in late around 9:30? Is everyone rushing to get off work, so we end up getting a few minutes per server?  So the main reason I'm giving this place a 2 star rating is because of the horrible service.

7PMoiNAlIUaJnM74dpFT9w.text: I made Saturday night reservations weeks ago as it was my birthday. We had 7:45 reservations arrived 15 minutes early and were greeted with a happy birthday. However I was told the table wasn't ready which was understandable. There are tables directly in front of the host and we sat there. 25 minutes later I had to go back to the host to inquire about my status. I was told the patrons were taking a long time to finish their meal. We were not seated until a half hour after our reservation time. And while it is not required, a nice touch would have been an offer of a drink. We were not offered that drink so I was forced to get one at the bar.   When we were finally seated it was at an unremarkable table and in light of the multitude of two tops, it is extremely unlikely in my mind a table didn't become available sooner.   A server whose name escapes me was very good. However our appetizer came at the same time as our rolls and I felt like my birthday meal was being rushed. No explanation was offered on the timing of the dishes.   The  sushi is very, very good. We had the octopus appetizer, the California roll (True Alaskan crab), the unagi roll and the tuna roll. I recommend them all.   Besides the Happy Birthday greeting, no mention was made again.    The price of the meal (110$) was reasonable for an upscale sushi establishment. It just didn't feel like an upscale sushi restaurant.    Sushi lunch or last minute dinner? Fine. A remarkable dinner or special occasion? You are better off elsewhere.

VpbsP5a1aHZFXR8B-4x3tQ.text: Amazing way to end my stay at Vegas. Food quality was outstanding; the Toro literally melt in my mouth. The waiter was very friendly and attentive.   I highly recommend the Big eye tuna pizza, the lobster carpaccio, and the Happa roll. I also tried the spicy crab pop roll which was interesting but I wouldn't get it again.   Flavors of all the food was great and the only complaint I would have is it is quite pricy for such small portions. Other than that great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happa roll
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster carpaccio
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big eye tuna pizza

BoePEjhHow5HKVizWrgTmg.text: I was just at Sugarfish. That's what I kept telling myself as we walked out slightly disappointed by our lackluster meal. It wasn't bad, but it also wasn't great.   And it was free (which usually makes everything that much tastier, glazed with the sweet ambrosia of victory) since we were using our Vegas winnings, but that still didn't help the cause :/  We tried a little bit of everything -- a few specialty rolls, toro scallion, a couple orders of sushi, yellowtail jalapeno. Along with a bottle of Kirin and some sake. Overall, pretty underwhelmed. The sushi seemed bland, nothing that really stood out, sadness. Especially since we were looking forward to checking this place out!  Hope it was just an off day :/ But they do have a great view of the Bellagio water show! Try to grab the balcony seats if you can. Wooo silver lining

jq1EpPZ5NQchSkCBHTlbGw.text: This is a place I do not skip on any Vegas trip. They have a great atmosphere and their food and drinks are amazing. I personally always get a cucumber martini which is very fresh tasting. And then I always make sure to order the filet mignon toban as well as the mile high roll being my new favorite roll there. Also don't be afraid to try the pop rocks roll. It's really good and even though it sounds wild I've never had anyone say they didn't like it. Usually we order a round of seconds

JNqJpKNayzJENyel1tFKfA.text: $$$ at 7 pm decibels rating of almost 90!  Food good but if you're expecting to "hear" others at your table - good luck . EXTREMELY LOUD

0vNCmtLcfjZ4eAI7yns-bg.text: Seriously fantastic food. The kind that hits every hpt button.  Awesome view,  too. I would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8tppB4Y9MvT0rLZqBRfJHg.text: So good - we told the waiter how much we wanted to spend for the night and to bring the best dishes and he did not disappoint.  The tuna pizza, crab roll, yellowtail jalapeno and the mile high roll were my faves but the rock shrimp tempura, kalbi roll did not disappoint either!

YDtyhJulEz-TVDMv9lH4mw.text: It is a beautiful restaurant. The food was good; the only item we didn't like was tuna pizza. Comparing to competition, Nobu has higher energy and food is better. However, Nobu is also more expensive. It is a great Japanese place for groups. We had 10 people but it was easy to pick items to share. Salmon in clay pot was amazing!

v-CUohmt-j8zu9_t9XyEng.text: Located inside the Bellagio, makes it super convenient to grab some sushi here while playing poker at the Bellagio. I love their menu and the ambience of their restaurant. Its an upscale sushi restaurant so the prices are bit high especially since its located in the casino. They offer some delicious cocktails as well. I come here about once every visit.

aJPyoY_61WgJkP_e1aX-fA.text: Wonderful sushi restaurant! If the weather is nice, do yourself a favor and sit outside.. best view of the Bellagio fountains I have seen! Cocktails were lovely, sashimi was tasty, crispy tofu was divine, service was perfect, scenery was stunning. Highly recommended!

ZZpcUwhxmAABncD7aI3-eQ.text: Food had a great presentation and short ribs were super yummy. Service was excellent! Some things were a bit messy- dirty knife, pouring wine that had been open for a while  for $28/glass.   Dinner was very pricey- if dinner for one was under $100 maybe review would have been a bit better but for these prices, I think I expected food to be at a slightly higher level.  Dinner for one - with one cocktail one one glass of wine was closer to $200.

8T72KeuZyH1LiKI0VDr4pQ.text: Great ambiance and amazing sushi! I always come here when I'm in Vegas the bartenders are also very knowledgeable and can whip up whatever your tastebuds desire.

ysKopdEn_k8ssg9h0BKJ2Q.text: Ok, I have read all of the reviews and I was a little concerned about going for my birthday but my husband had already made the reservations and was pretty excited about it.  I'm a sort of a foodie and I love Japanese food so here goes. When we entered we had a great table and were able to have front row seats to the water show. Roberto was our waiter and he was great. I told him what I read and asked his suggestions. We had the lychee martini which was great and sockeye pizza, amazing. We also had a yellowtail Serrano dish which I get regularly at my favourite San Diego Japanese restaurant. I always love this dish but at yellowtail the freshness and/or quality of the yellowtail took it to a whole new level. Definitely orgasmic! Size of portions were perfect, but more importantly, the quality may possibly have ruined me for my local place.  Can't wait to come back.

jjd-dcoQ2AP_AAJlep1WUA.text: Try this place in the Bellagio hotel. Elizabeth at the bar is a gem. She makes the best pear martinis. I had 2 it was so good. The manager Keith was so friendly and welcoming. We were dining with family and had a very interesting selection of sushi and other dishes that go beyond the regular sushi selection. A must try place while you are in LV.

mia6dSvECUGuGOf9-If1wg.text: Pricey of course - it is in Bellagio, and thus this goes with the territory.  That being said, everything was fantasic.  Service, atmosphere, and especially the food.   We had 6-7 things we shared, sushi varieties, big eye tuna pizza, etc.   All were out of this world.  We will most certainly return.

qpRcVxf898sPTpVPxbdasw.text: Everything from start to finish was IN-CRED-I-BLE!!! And Guy (our server) was the absolute BEST - every recommendation was on point! We'll definitely come again during our next visit to Vegas.

LBarQ7C1JgtekHSor-z1bQ.text: Slightly soapy tea, and mediocre agadashi tofu made for an ill-received midnight snack amongst friends.  Nevertheless, it didn't turn the stomach, so it was acceptable.  The attire of the waitstaff was vintage pseudo-asian, but again... not-unexpected.  With the amount of fine dining available to any person frequenting Las Vegas, however, I fear I do not ever intend to return.

ZNQp6SymBOaXJGRvEa4q8w.text: The "big eye tuna pizza" is incredible, as is everything on the menu. This is not only my favorite sushi restaurant, but my favorite restaurant anywhere in the world, period. And I've been to hundreds of restaurants everywhere from Dubai to Mexico to Melbourne.

qm763Jf4aI_w4Euvqhu2Ew.text: Big Eye Tuna Pizza...best ever. Put bring your $$$...

SfBx6xzLvAf2RZRsvB8LRw.text: Situated inside the Bellagio, Yellowtail is a Japanese Sushi joint with flair, flair, flair.  It looks more like a small lounge than anything else, but they do serve food - and expensive food, at that.  I don't recall how much the sushi costs, as I don't eat seafood, but the Jidori Chicken that I had was around $25.  When the waitress first brought it out, all I could splutter was, "THAT'S IT?!"  I mean, it LOOKED tiny.  But I was so hungry, I decided to just shut up and eat - and good thing I did!  Turns out, it was really friggin moist, well seasoned, and actually a pretty hefty portion!  No complaints from me!  However, the dish wasn't anything sensational.  The reason Yellowtail gets 5 stars is because..  I was star-struck.  Not by any celebrity sightings... but by waitress sightings.  HOLY COW.  EVER SINGLE WAITRESS THERE WAS HOT HOT HOT!  I'm not just talking "pretty,"  I'm talking "HOT"!!!!  With MANY MANY exclamation points.  Hotness must be a requirement to work here!  That's not to say that every waitress was a cookie-cutter Barbie.  Nope!  Brunettes, blonds, redheads, White, Black, Hispanic, Asian, tall, short, voluptuous, model-skinny, girly, tough, bitchy, friendly... The variety was endless - but in an oh-so-gorgeous kind of way.  Every single one of them.  I'm not a lesbian, but even I got a little giggly around these girls.  For sheer eye-candy alone... I have to give Yellowtail five stars!!!

Gt30UYak-biPTNa0q-oxjQ.text: Mmm... I can't stop thinking about the delicious food at Yellowtail.  I can't wait to return to Vegas just to eat at Yellowtail again!  During my last trip to Vegas, my friends and I checked out Yellowtail and tried the following menu items:  -Big eye tuna pizza: WOW... this was so good.  I loved the contrast between the soft tuna and crunchy pizza crust. -Kumamoto oysters: super fresh and perfectly scrumptious.  -Kobe beef tataki: melted in my mouth.  -Yellowtail tataki -King crab tempura  -Popping spicy crab roll: yummy and the popping candy was definitely a nice surprise! -Unagi roll  Yellowtail's menu is definitely one of the most creative and innovative ones I've seen.  I love how everything on the menu was so unique... I wish I could've tried it all.  Plus, the ambiance is fun and trendy and the service was great.    I can't wait to go back!

awkml9yiaHZ349pBcxLkZA.text: I was a little disappointed in this restaurant.  The portions were unbelievably small (we ordered 4 sushi rolls for 2 people and were definitely still hungry - I mean not even a tad bit full).  I figured that could somewhat be the case, but I seriously think these were the "skinniest" rolls (not sure how to describe it!) I've ever seen.  Not very thick at all.  Like mini rolls.  They tasted ok.  But, I will say - our table was near the patio, so we were able to walk out and take photos with the water show, so that a definitely a plus.  The restaurant is also nicely decorated and I like the huge gold fish tail on the wall outside of it.

eesI32u9O_uNUHW1Tx-aFg.text: Three and a half stars, actually.  The extra half star is for the relaxed and friendly environment.  So friendly, in fact, that a random stranger joined us at our table for a cocktail and conversation.  He was built like a brick shit-house, so we let him stay at our table while his friends looked on and shook their heads at his bold behaviour.  I didn't mind at all, as he was perfectly ok with my wandering hands appreciating his biceps.  Wait?!  What was this review about?  Sushi.  Oh, yeah.  It was good, not great.

4cysrSb2tqwXflDUGEE9lQ.text: On a weekender to Vegas, my gf and I were hungering for sushi one night and the concierge of our hotel (Monte Carlo) suggested going to Yellowtail, the newest restaurant at the Bellagio.  Only open a week,  one might expect some hiccups along the way, but the food was top notch and the service was even more so.  The outside entrance signals the restaurant's presence with a beautifully decorated, massive glass tile mosaic of a yellowtail fish.  Indoors, posh, elegant, with clean yet comfortable lines in a contemporary style.   Seated at the bar (since we had no reservation), the service didn't slack one bit as our bar waitress was more than knowledgeable, explaining the vast menu choices and offering helpful suggestions on what to order.   Despite the busy atmosphere of having to juggle bar mixology and restaurant patrons, she checked up on us often and made us feel comfortable.    Food wise, my best description for this dining experience would be - sushi fusion.  Combining East and West sensibilities into sushi produced some unique flavor combinations that I've never tasted before.  I'm not talking about your typical California roll here.  Think banana flavored sake, strawberry topped rolls in place of unagi, Big Eye Tuna Pizza with shiso, Toro Sashimi with caviar and microgreens.  The crab dynamite was delicious with generous chunks of crab meat, and a hint of spiciness.   One of their signature selections is the Grand Omikase, a six course tasting menu based on the chef's* fancy that day.  I would highly recommend this, as it's the most bang for the buck, and you get to taste a vast array of flavors.  Kobe beef fans will be satisfied as this includes  Washu beef (a domestic breed of Kobe) offered in a tenderloin cut; a texture that just melted in my mouth.  Some might think sushi fusion is a bastardization against tradition, but I think it's fun.  Why not try something new?  Your palate might thank you for it.  *(Head chef, Akira Back, has worked with industry greats such as chefs Nobu and Morimoto.)

ZOiBJTSsqkbdL7rYdNyggQ.text: Love love love the big eye tuna pizza....I don't remember anything else. Service was awful...I don't like when you ask if I'm sure I want to really pay 5 bucks for fresh wasabi n look like your surprised...I'm ordering it so bring it.rude. our server came around once in a while, never asked if we were ok or needed anything else...maybe i wanted to order more...oh well...ill do take out next time

98CRQyJIX7vnLN4uzb37Vg.text: The combination of delectable japanese fare and perfect service, gives this spot 5 stars!!  The order:  Maguro Pizza (amazing) Poppy Crab Roll (interesting and well executed) Yellowtail, Toro, and Salmon sushi (supremely fresh and delicious)  Kurosawa Sake (always has been a fave of mine....dry and refreshing with a bitey, but short finish)  The Bill was like $400, because of the sake, but it was worth every penny.  Seriously, our server, Michael was an absolute dream. So, good that I asked to give him my compliments to the GM.  I will definitely be back!!  YUMMMMY!  I am gonna try to make that big-eye tuna pizza at home!  xo- andrea

ez6Gsh6rkbTZlLNUWzb8lg.text: Great place for dinner! The sushi was great! A must try is the "popping spicy crab"! Very unique and extremely good.  We had a large party and ordered most things off the menu to share. Everything was "stunning" and service was excellent! Atmosphere is perfect for a date night.  Definitely will visit again when in Las Vegas!

fR2O78LAGuPeAaG9vxpSMQ.text: First off, we came here in an elaborate scheme for my cousin to propose to his girlfriend.  We're friends with some staff thus they opened up the patio (which was closed that night) for us during the water show so that he could propose.  It was quite a picturesque scene.  The staff was very friendly and accomodating and got us comped into the bank nightclub afterwards.  Awesome.  The food - we were all still pretty full from the paris champagne brunch so we ordered light.  I got their signature banana unagi roll and strawberry roll (it has pop rocks on top!)  The banana roll was impressive as the banana flavor was evident but not overwhelming.  And no whack filler like cream cheese!  My friend ordered salmon sashimi, but it was smaller than my pinkie finger.  I felt bad for him, but otherwise, a great night and venue.

3OzAOSXkmVDm5YHmUqucfw.text: While the service was outstanding, the prices and portions are a joke.  $36 for a few paper thin slices of yellowtail -- maybe $0.50 worth of fish -- and some ponzi sauce.  Really?  $19 for the tiniest sushi roll I've ever been served.  I'm all for small quantities of great food, but this was just a rip-off.

GIeUpGFmx99KeEB8_QImsQ.text: I've had the pleasure and opportunity to dine at Yellowtail four times now, and I can confidently say it is probably in my top three favorite high-end Japanese restaurants in the country.  First and foremost: the big eye tuna pizza with white truffle oil.  Just get it.  That's all I'm going to say.  Secondly, ask for the patio.  It lays directly over the Bellagio fountains and provides an amazing special occasion experience, especially for newcomers to impress.  Otherwise, the inside area has a more bustling, active ambiance.  In addition to the pizza and the patio, I'd also recommend ordering the miso glazed cod which is not on the menu for some reason.  Although it is not as good as the original (Nobu), it's definitely up there, albeit a too-small portion.  My only gripe would be the less-than-sweet (I'm being nice here) hostesses, which is why I'm only giving four stars.  Yea, less attitude would be appreciated.  The servers are awesome, however.    I'll be back.

zk0VmNFBluSLqWxloSa5dg.text: Fantastic sushi!  Definitely deserves 5 stars.  Came for my sister's bachelorette party and we were taken very good care of.    Our waiter was rude to us, so we complained to a manager and they brought us out a round of shots!    We ordered the Big Eye Tuna pizza as an appetizer and it was seriously so good.  We also ordered the Seared Albacore which came with crispy mushrooms and onions.  I didn't care too much for it, but everyone else in my group liked it.  We ordered a ton of sushi rolls and sashimi.  One of my favorites was the Popping Crab, it has PopRocks in it!  A  nice surprise.  The salmon sashimi was also melt-in-your-mouth-like-butter good.  The potato puree and baked corn sides were so good, we ended up ordering more.    The chocolate mochi dessert was very good.  So was the lava cake with foam and vanilla with chocolate on top.    Despite our waiter being rude, overall our experience was good.

wUfFu7yDySxSAt65zQxPFA.text: Like many of the 'big' restaurants in the 'big' casinos the restaurants was a little longer and decor and image than its cuisine. Food was ok, but not great. Sorry.

kgj6lmMoNHS--5_-bmO6OQ.text: Great service and food. Share the plate sand you can try many different things and no leave overly full. Try the edemoni as they have some in a chilie sauce that was just great. I enjoyed our meal. Be water the drink bill can be higher than you food bill..

y0F3K8Rt0THzvcVfKcPbKg.text: Good but overpriced!!! $45 for a sashimi dish. But I guess it's vegas

x0UfNoL29ArvOvKqFiHNjw.text: There were pop rocks in my "popping spicy crab roll" it literally popped in my mouth.  POP ROCKS really! Sushi chefs everywhere are embarassed.   'Nuff said.

55HDOngttjM7YWYDB9GghQ.text: Wonderful! That's the world to describe our experience at this restaurant. It is very pricey, but the quality of the food and service is just wonderful!

OfVW4tpgxn99NCTo7L8h5w.text: A total mess. waited too long for the food and seated other "special" better party at the terrace although we arrived earlier...

GEqzRwir-jmuPr9PG1KtUA.text: The best food ever!!!!!! Amazing place and service. Thanks Brad for the thank you card. First time in my life that a restaurant sent me a thank you card!!!!!!

5dwkVJY_WbdPVwWxpUMMfA.text: Decent food but poor, poor service from start to finish.   We went with a group of 8, and they  started the meal by telling us that there was another party coming in two hours and we needed to make sure we were done by then... what the?!@?!   Then, the server said he "recommended dining family style" and when we told him we'd like to each order separately, he responded by saying he "wasn't allowed to write seat numbers next to the orders" so they'd all have to be delivered to the center and we'd have to sort it out... what the?!@#$#?  Then, the completely forgot to fill one persons order, so he sat patiently while we all *finished* our meals, and then he was served. To Yellowtail's credit they comped his meal, but it still ruined it.  There are so many options on the strip, that a restaurant that makes so many mistakes just isn't worth it.

ii6knAGE07ZNJ98nh8llOQ.text: This restaurant is ridiculous. It was so expensive and the whole experience is totally not worth it. First, the music was sooooo loud and it almost feels like I was in a club. Second, the food is soooo average and the price is so ridiculous. Third, I was so mad at the server because he doesn't know what he is doing and he is totally not helpful at all. I was waiting here for half an hour without anything after my dinner, without dessert menu, without check, without anything!!

dLmdACRhBuVi3AoQTTCp5A.text: I had the best time at Yellowtail.  I came here with my cousin during July 4th weekend.  It had a good vibe and great energy.  We sat at the bar and although I was not too hungry, here's how my food went down:   Seaweed Salad:  It was a heafty size, tasty and fresh Green Tea Ice Cream:  How can you go wrong with GT ice cream.  Well, ice cream in general.    This place had a great vibe and was pretty busy. I highly recommend reservations, but I also recommend sitting at the bar... for people watching and hanging out.

9FtzSaT7JGJG88FQ0p-QCw.text: The entryway of Yellowtail is golden glitter and a dark wooden bar with beautiful white and red accenting tables. It's very dark, as you start to walk around the room you just think this place is breathtaking. My experience at Yellowtail was early this Spring just as the Vegas weather was beginning to change. You have the option to dine out on the patio with a view of the Bellagio Fountains. SIT ON THE PATIO, IT WILL MAKE THIS PLACE MAGICAL. I swear you could fall in love on that patio! I couldn't even imagine this, there are many great views in Las Vegas but how many can you see people on the strip, hear the water spraying from the fountains, and be surround by beautiful lights in the center of everything.  I'm not even a huge Sushi fan, however my boyfriend is and we just we're floored on how fresh and delicious everything was.    Started out with, The Tofu Miso Soup, Lobster Carpaccio, and Kobe Beef Tataki. Oh my does the Tataki own! Loved it, the amazing blend of garlic and sea salt. Next came out the Cucumber salad. Everything was so yummy, I must say.   For our entrees we got the Jidori Chicken with veggies, and I got the Kobe Flat Iron with veggies. The chicken was really good, juicy and well flavored but def not a dish you would eat with chopsticks in my opinion. I'm a Flat Iron-oholic and this was no disappointment! The only thing I think Yellowtail is lacking on is a solid selection of dessert. I have a serious sweet tooth. :) All in all, Glitz and Glamour. I'm enamored.

xG0gb1Y9bcfQHGxr-d_hqA.text: the best place to watch the bellagio fountain show?  at one of bellagios fountainside restaurants.  we made a reservation at yellowtail the day of dining and had no problem.  they gave us a table outside and while eating we saw three fountain shows as the sunset.  definitely the best views of the strip ever.  yellowtail serves sushi for a very high price.  and as the food came we joked that we had to go to mcdonalds afterwards.  we ordered the big eyed tuna pizza which the server said was the most popular.  it had truffle oil and was pretty good.  bascially tuna on crackers.  i had seaweed salad - nothing spectacular here except the price.  and also a clear soup - again nothing spectacular.  thei lobster carpaccio is not raw.  the lobster has been poached.  they have this really high energy sommelier/sake specialist (?)    for dessert mochi and tempura ice cream.  a bigger ball of ice cream would given us more ice cream after frying.  we got a lot of melted vanilla ice cream on our plate.  i never order mochi because its not like they make it.  they just buy it and put it on a plate and charge us much more.  and for the record we did have to eat after this.

7cTEgE82H-vCSv4WKL2QPw.text: The food here was okay, not the best not the worst. Smaller portions than expected. The drinks and ambiance were great being able to sit right in the action at Bellagio. Great for a light meal before a night out. Our server was Mithkah and she was fabulous!!!!! Personable and sweet, very knowledgeable. She was the best part of the dining experience.

5QieWXN-q3fHZ6rjRy4Hfg.text: This place was awesome!! We ended up coming here not knowing that this was a brand new restaurant, and once we got here we had the impression that they had been around for a while based upon their service, quality, and professionalism.   Their rolls are amazing! In fact I liked them better than Nobu.  Try their Yellowtail and scallops roll, soft shell crab roll, and definitely try their crab roll with pop rocks!  Their Mochi is also quite good.  Oh and FYI - the chef is from Nobu.   I really, really, really liked their service. Everyone was extremely friendly.  The manager even came over to chat and even gave us passes to The Bank!

wif3Do6U8Qy8okmNDidw4A.text: Meh-yep, I've had better. I think Tao was a lot better than this place.   Cons: The sushi didn't taste too fresh-it was really just ehhhhhhhh'. The yellowtail/scallion roll just tasted like kimbap.  You know..the fish just was ehhhhh.  Pros:  Great service. Very polite and wasn't pushy about ordering their most expensive thing on the menu like some places in vegas. Waiters were cute :D  Right now I can't think because I'm still recuperating from my trip. Will edit later.

68zClKcyjLVg-s4jVayoXQ.text: If you are looking for real Japanese food, yellowtail is not the right place. Food definitely not made by some one who knows Japanese food. I was there for the food not for the view, so it only worth 1 star. Very pricy for what they sell. E.g. California roll cost $17. Very limited selection. I bid the owner is not a Japanese.

KF2V_NMBKfWyRiMH66nvUg.text: First let me say, I have eaten here before, and have been here when it's super busy.  We were seated within 5 minutes which was a good start but it went downhill from there.  It took the server quite awhile to bring out our drinks.  Then we waited over 20 minutes for our edamame.  After 30 minutes of waiting for 2 sushi rolls (we were just getting a snack), I finally was able to get our server over to our table and ask what was going on.  Her response was that they were really busy; which was not the case.  Let me also say, once we had our drinks, she NEVER came back to our table.  Our food was brought to us by runners, and our server never even came back to see if we wanted another cocktail.  I have to say the food was excellent, as usual, and also very overpriced but I knew that going in.  I give the food a 4, the price a 2 and the service a 1.  Overall for me, terrible experience.

LwBMHpNcP8wWRUl6BhPxhw.text: Make sure you request a table outside on the balcony. It's here that you get a fist class view of the Bellagio fountains.   Yellowtail has an amazing selection of Sakes, and a great twist on Japanese cuisine. My favorite dish of the night had to be the Big Eye Tuna Pizza with micro shiso and truffle oil. Our table ordered two plates of it at the end of the night it was so good!! The sushi was good as well, but not incredibly outstanding. Overall I would recommend Yellowtail and DEFINITELY recommend a table outside.

-w0-tf8nLUo0JHaE24swMA.text: We decided to eat at Yellowtail after a long stroll up and down the strip..me and my girls were craving sushi so we stopped in (and the line for The Buffet @ Bellagio was loonnnnggg). The restaurant wasnt too crowded and our waitress was super cute. First, we ordered the Spicy Miso Soup....if you like spicy food-order it and thank me later. That soup brought tears to my eyes but did it stop me...Hell no! There was also bits of shrimp and seaweed and the soup but honestly I expected more soup for $8.00.  Next, we ordered spicy tuna sushi and it was pretty good-the tuna, rice and seaweed was pretty fresh. No complaints there but nothing spectacular either. Last but not least, I ordered the Edamame and it comes 2 ways...Salted and with a Sweet coating...pretty appetizing...very different. Finally, we washed it all down with our $4.50 glass of Coca Cola....(hey its Vegas...whats a $4.50 soda).   We had a pretty good experience here at Yellowtail....I actually had better sushi at a strip mall in VA but, hey...its Vegas :)

Og6SBV63HsicVXQzgOfFSA.text: Although good food, everything else is terrible. I was willing to put up with bad service until I was denied service at all... TWICE! ok, Yellowtail is off my list! Good luck, hit it right and it's great, hit it wrong and you'll never come back...

yloilBW1SUDmlt-9eoU7BA.text: Loved it! We went here whilst in town for a convention.  This place is amazing.  The portions are small but left my taste buds wanting more.  We ordered the rock shrimp and Gyoza appetizers and were convinced to order the lobster carpaccio.  My eyes were opened, the lobster was so good.  The crab roll with the pop rocks in it was amazing as was the angry salmon roll.  Fantastic!!

8AJz2QZ6UjY7Zy7wscoWWQ.text: First Visit : 09/2012 Great drinks. A bit pricey tho =\  Second Visit : 04/2015 Great BarTender.  Poured some very good drinks. Strong yet tasty.  Still pricey. =P

pKHxn2ZJBznvYCWGXUjnXw.text: This sushi restaurant/lounge located inside the Bellagio is exactly what people have come to expect from not only Vegas but the Bellagio as well.  The decor is modern with an Asian flair. The food was amazing the employees were not rough on the eyes either.   I defiantly fell in love with this place!  My group sat in the lounge part on a Saturday night. We enjoyed an awesome bottle of sake and really amazing sushi.  The Big Eyed Tuna Pizza is an absolute must order!  My group ordered two! :) We also tried the Popping Crab Roll!  I loved the new twist this restaurant puts on the same old sushi dishes.  The service was a little slow at times but not awful.  If you love sushi and are in the area, this is a must stop!  I know I will be back next Vegas trip!

DmzfT7FBM38NNOeuxsIggw.text: Decent sushi restaurant overall. I had the rock shrimp and protein speciality role. Kumi to me is still be the best kushi joint on the strip by far but yellowtail is decent as well. I like the ambiance and the service is good.

A0HEXVQlyzuClkpLMR5Chg.text: Formerly Shintaro at Bellagio, Yellowtail is the Bellagio's attempt to cater to the younger hip crowd. The decor and ambiance are nice. The bar setup is cool. A few more specific comments  - on a busy night they do not give beepers or have any way of tracking you when your table is ready. So keep a watchful eye or they could skip you! - drinks at the bar are about $14 for cocktails (the kiwi one is tasty), to $12 for large Asahi. Reasonable for Vegas, but still on the high end. - Sushi rolls are pretty tasty, but be forewarned that they are SMALL. They roll them tight with not much rice. Not too much inside either. So while you may think a roll for $9 isn't that bad, you only get a small portion. So you must end up ordering more than you thought just to not be hungry an hour later. - Bill for my wife and I. We each ordered 2 rolls, plus some sashimi. 2 cocktails and one large beer, with tip came to $150. Luckily we charged it to our MGM room which has a 30% off promotion via Mastercard until January 31, 2009 - otherwise it was a complete rip.  Food good Ambiance good Service acceptable Price excessive  Simply for better and larger sushi (and cheaper), I suggest the sushi bar inside Caesar's Palace (next to Cleopatra's Barge).

Q1C7agfHNeEgc4I8LLn3Pg.text: This was very first time at this restaurant and I thought the food was pricey, but the food was delicious with a nice atmosphere. There is nice view of water front in front as your enjoying your food. And the service was excellent.

J0TUlin-2Qj1vbAiQ6oyRg.text: Small portions for the price, but worth it. I would not go to this place starving. But its a nice light meal before the show at the bellagio.

40Eb8O9gOx_k9RjLFb3_5g.text: My wife and I decided to try Yellowtail instead of Nobu on Friday night 3/4/16 and it was a really pleasant experience.  We sat on the patio around 5pm and enjoyed one of the better rolls we have had in awhile which was the Protein Roll.  It was fresh and we enjoyed it enough that we ordered a second roll.    My wife tried the Kumamoto Oysters and while they were a bit on the small side, she said they were very good.  She also ordered the Baked Crab Hand Roll and said it was fantastic.  The Japanese Yellowtail Roll Sushi was average and I would not order that again.  I have had better at Hole-In-The-Wall places for half the price.  They did have a solid wine list by the glass and my wife tried one of their signature drinks as well.  It's a bit on the pricier side.  Our bill with drinks and tip was roughly $200.  The scenery and atmosphere on the patio were also fantastic and made the mood.  Our server was also attentive and even helped us get a great angle for a picture.  We will return for sure.

7EriYkMBC72vUbw7-f4XzA.text: A totally awesome place that was not only romantic but had great service. My date got us a table right next to the water where we could watch a lighted water fountain show during our meal. It was beautiful and totally enhanced the experience. Food presentation was excellent as well as the quality. Highly recommend!

y28KDqTvJl1ews9HnpmeVg.text: Hands down without question this was the best sushi I've ever had. If you're here you have to try the lobster carpaccio, big eye tuna pizza, and the yellowtail in the citrus sauce. Amazing food, unbeatable views of the bellagio fountains, and great service. It was truly a unique Vegas dining experience.

F5nOsvswSfOJ5rCJ3P_8uQ.text: The type of place that makes one wonder "how does this place stays open?"  Overpriced small portions, no flavor. Shady server  tried rip us off.  Or maybe he was just incompetent. Hard to tell.

nQuRZRbS5HeM2At0y3wp9g.text: I was here with my clients and the dishes taste perfectly yum. We order all kinds of sashimi on the menu, chef choice beef udon, the famous pizza on the menu, the tempura king crab, and a lot others. Foods are great and server was helpful in gratifying us a 6 ppl party. It is a little pricy, but, it's Vegas and Bellagio.
