LlCR1tddbLv8TY7HhemPzQ.text: By far the bestest place I have ever eaten. Considering I've been to over half this country. Late review, but my fiance took me here on 12/28/14. Our waiter,  Brandon, was the bomb! Great customer service and very creative with helping my now fiance to propose to me outside next to the Bellagio fountain. The menu is very pricey bc it is a 5 star restaurant.  But none the less, I will make time to eat here every time I come to Vegas. The food was so delicious, that I crave for it today!  I will forever remember this place. In addition, this place is great for kids. They have fancy high chairs with cushion for thr kids. Not the basic wooden high chairs. Oh, and the chef, right under the Top chef is my brother in laws best friend who cooked our awesome meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brandon was our main waiter.  The rest of the staff, including manager were very nice to us &amp; congratulated us on our engagement
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our chef of the night! The bestest ever!

tw_3Hhn5h3q1AoKRT_kfvw.text: This meal pleasantly surprised me with how fresh, flavorful, and delicate the food was. I got the YELLOWTAIL jalapeno appetizer, korean braised short ribs, and Mile High Roll. I respect the chef at this place.  I am very picky and I loved everything here. They also offer TO GO.

a8oGxZfYWxe-XZotTzaUlg.text: Food was good, but...we ended up asking for the bill before we were even done with our order.  So slow, it took more than 1.5 hrs to get our main course.  Even still they didn't knock much off the tab.  Didn't even get half of our order.

TJYylf44LII_HjhPe0FDww.text: Yellowtail is amazing! Delicious food. I've hosted a few events there and the staff/management were incredible. I do want to say that I'm a Vegas local. The reviews complaining about price on this wonderful spot seem more geared towards their own financial situations rather than the atmosphere, staff, service, and food. If you rate Yellowtail as a 2-Star because your edamame was too expensive.. A) Read the prices before you order, B) Visit Paruhmp or China Town  PS - One of the BEST views in LV!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious AYCE Oysters at a Private Event.

dzgwEmDevtcldfuF7yZxWg.text: I have never been so insulted in my entire life. My 8 months old was hungry and started crying. I didn't want to disturb other guests so I took my baby out and sat at another area in the restaurant. I finally calmed down my baby and got him to nurse with my NURSING COVER ON. A waitress approached me and said this is their bar area and I couldn't sit here to nurse my baby. I looked around and there were about 15 tables and had only 2 tables that were being used. I was very upset and asked where can I nurse my baby then. She said we have a RESTROOM. You don't eat in the bathroom then why should by baby eat in the bathroom?! What is wrong with you guys?!!!! You guys ruined my baby's meal time and my family's dinner.

iT_0Tr6yzG8lwC-uFsp2Pg.text: Service is slow. Sushi is ok. Not impressed really. I've had much better experiences at strip mall sushi joints. If you want the high end sushi experience and spend the cash walk over to Nobu.

pL0BHC-MFf_YK8Id3vRNWA.text: This restaurant is so good in so many ways!  I always make it a must dine in, every time I visit Vegas.  There are excellent dishes to have, each with it's own taste and style.  The service is also top of this world, you really get top notch service, excellent food, at a very reasonable price (for a high end restaurant).  The wait staff is smart, they anticipate your needs and take good care of you throughout the meal.  The dishes come out quickly and everyone is very nice and pleasant.  Some of my favorite dishes are:  Tuna Pizza Rock Shrimp White fish in Spicy Thai Oil King Crab Tempura Kalbi Roll Short Rib Yellowtail w/jalepeno  Trust me, you can't go wrong...definitely pay Yellowtail a visit.

ME4Is9qhPNV2DiE--MEB-w.text: This place is so expensive but also so good! Probably one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. I always leave this place satisfied and wanting more and with a hole in my wallet lol. Well, technically I'm not the one paying but you know what I mean. Last time we came with the party of 8 and the tab came out to be around $1,600 including tax and tip.   Let's talk about the setting of the restaurant. It's located in the casino of Bellagio. It's next to the fountain. If you get seat by balcony like we did, you get to experience the fountain show from inside the hotel. It's a completely different feeling than experiencing it on the Strip. It's much closer that way and you can enjoy it without being in a huge crowd of people. As you'd expect from a high end restaurant, the setting inside is fancy. It's dim a little giving sense of romanticness, so it's a perfect place to take your date.   The food. There large selection of food and honestly they're all great. Though these are my personal favorites: tuna pizza, yellowtail, flat iron steak, ribeye, and Scottish salmon.   -The tuna pizza is a thinly sliced pizza served with raw tuna on top. I thought it was an interesting combination at first. I mean, raw tuna on pizza? Does that even go together? Oh man, let me tell you, it does. And it does great. It has the soft and juiciness of the tuna and the crunchiness of the pizza. This was our party's favorite and we just kept ordering these. They come at $29 a plate though.  -The yellowtail has got to the best yellowtail I've eaten. My go to food at most Japanese restaurants is grilled yellowtail cheek, so I've tasted plenty of yellowtails, but this is honestly the best one I've tasted. Well I mean you'd expect it to be good, afterall it's the name of the restaurant. The fish is juicy and soft and just melt in your mouth. It's not dry like some places.  -I'm going to review the ribeye and flat iron together. They were both great. The quality of beef is excellent and it's super soft. However my only complaint was that they were a little burnt. Maybe the chef was a little off today, but the outside of the beef were a tad bit burnt. This wasn't the case with my previous visits. Aside from that it tastes heavenly.  -The Scottish salmon also tastes great. Not much to say about it. Just your average salmon, but they just somehow seasoned it and made it taste so good. Maybe the chef used his secret sauce or something? ;) lol jk but seriously it's good.

IInEOIFlhuAKWmuxaDXuUw.text: 1: Overly priced  2: Small portions  3: They don't split checks  4: Worst California roll I've ever had The star can count for atmosphere because it's beautiful.  Would never return. Complete waist of time.

2Drdh4lMFRMrzE6HITp5zQ.text: Been to Yellowtail numerous times and I can honestly say it is expensive, but life changing sushi. Yes I said life changing. You won't leave the restaurant full because everything is small portioned, but you are there to taste little, tiny pieces of heaven sent fish. Also, make sure you order a blueberry sake shot, you won't regret it...actually you might because it is so addicting and good, you'll end up ordering so many that you'll leave with a great buzz.  Note: try making a reservation to sit by the balcony so you can catch the Bellagio water show. also, the doors open up and you can take beautiful pictures on the balcony.

pNfjU7VC4ftmIaVW9ZEdTg.text: It's not good sushi at all. It's not bad sushi either. It's absolutely terrible sushi for the price. The ambiance and decor is amazing, one of the coolest looking restaurants and sexy hostesses.   Seaweed salad was tasty.

WVKF2DNDDzoK3eA-mSRw7g.text: So.....I can't figure out why this place only has 3 stars. My experience was a solid 4.5! Our party included  30 people and the service was excellent. My favorite dish was the tempura king crab, but everything was delicious. I consider this a sushi fusion spot...so maybe the hardcore sushi purists can't relate. The filet mignon was worth honorable mention and the sushi pizza was divine. Next time in Vegas, I'll be sure to make a beeline here!

X-W40UFcNxIlLsOvuF8VTQ.text: Just very sad experience here.  Cold short ribs, late order, hair in the food our by the server delivering food, bad remarks by guys delivering food and half of our party not getting food still an hour after we ate. Ahem a on you yellowtail

z_CHhHG3HR-pKMiVASmNtQ.text: First of all, I don't want to come across as some expert in food and sushi.  I know what I like, and I usually play it safe (boring) when it comes to sushi. I'm in Vegas quite a bit and I always make a point to go to Yellowtail. In fact, I might even make a trip to Vegas JUST for Yellowtail if I had the means!!  That being said, the reason for my devotion to this place is the Big Eye Tuna Pizza and Pop Rock Crab!! I have the pizza as an appetizer (obligatory table sharing) then I order it again as my main course (no sharing!) along with the pop rock crab. No other sushi place has these gems to my knowledge, and the chef should trademark them if he hasn't already.   Service is usually pretty good, I'm in heaven with my meal that I actually don't care how long it might take to get it nor do I care if the waiter is rude....I wouldn't even notice if the waiter is rude since I'm in my ultimate happy place. (I'm not saying I've had rude waiters or slow service, to make that clear)  All of this costs WAY more than I'd usually pay for sushi but hey...it's Vegas, it's Bellagio and it's WORTH IT!!

qC7--1J0d3CqhZ86wYjKwQ.text: My fiance and I were pleasantly surprised by the quality fish at Yellowtail.  We were skeptical since Vegas is in the middle of the desert, but the toro sashimi and the fish for the maki rolls were very high quality. They also  had kumamoto oysters which were great for a starter. The service was on point throughout our whole meal. Be sure to ask to sit on the balcony, which as a perfect unobstructed view of the Bellagio fountains.

w601w6lCsmKU8ZwlYd-Mag.text: Came in for a couple pre show appetizers and drinks. Took 20 minutes to get our drinks (3 beers mind you not cocktails) and we had our appetizers well before the drinks. The rock shrimp was just not good and everything was insanely overpriced for the quality of average food. Then finally, for our bill, our cocktail server forgot a pen and we were in a bit of a rush so we went and asked the hostess for a pen. You'd think we had asked for her new born when she asked why with the nastiest tone. We explained and she said to ask our server, we tried to explain we were in a rush and the server was running around helping so many others. Bellagio needs to hire someone who isn't going to act like a petulant child for interrupting whatever doodle she was making on some napkin to provide someone with something as basic as a pen sitting right next to her.

fKsM_q0iV1IB7gVpE_375g.text: Let's start with the view - WOW Their balcony is facing the bellagio fountains, also some of the inside tables that are next to the windows can clearly see the strip and fountains. I'll start with the negative, for some reason each person at the table got the food in a different timing. I got my main course before other got their appetizers. When they got their mains I was 30 Min after the food. The salmon entree with some creamy cucumber dressing is 5 stars and highly recommended. Tuna pizza appetizer is highly recommended, 5+ stars. We shared few different sushi  rolls and I would say skip it, try something else...

sQk18OL-QxOGuwGzP0325g.text: This place was horrible! The hostess was not welcoming at all and the service and food were horrible! They didn't serve us all at once so some of us got our food 15mins before anyone else and some of us were legit done eating when others were still waiting for food! Not only were we waiting but servers would just jump over your shoulder to grab the plates off the table without saying excuse me or anything. I had a server bump me and not off the sushi from my chop sticks.... I've had better sushi from smart n final to be honest and it didn't get us sick after also. I would never come back here

4kdOaJELFkyRjXHyyEF5TQ.text: This was probably one of the best dining experiences i've ever had especially here in Vegas. We were celebrating 8 people post 10k and they gave us a wonderful table off to the side in front of the doors where we perfectly viewed the fountain and the paris across the way.   Every dish was nothing short of incredible, even their delicacies of the Tuna Pizza and Pop Rock Roll were phenomenal. I would HIGHLY recommend working this into your next vegas trip.

6xXS_B8a5F1V_f3radD_Nw.text: Honestly, if I could give this more than 5 stars I would.   We celebrated an event with a group of about 8 people and had the best view of the fountain. It was a gorgeous setting that started our experience off on the right foot.   We all ordered various drinks and loved each one. The food is on another level of amazing. We ordered too many things to list, but EVERY DISH was delicious. The tuna pizza frequented our table throughout the night. I cannot remember the name, but the sushi roll with pop rocks changed our lives.   The service we received was exemplary. 100% would recommend and will definitely be making another trip to Vegas for this restaurant.

zJlup2gKFeESpBjB5auzxA.text: The BEST dinner experience in Vegas! The GM Jamie pours his passion into this establishment and has an amazing team backed with knowledge and 5 star stellar service. The menu has a plethora of options and the flavors cover a full spectrum that surpassed my expectations. We were greeted with a warm welcome and were sat immediately, amazing ambiance and design paired with the epic fountain show display in the background. Mithkah was our elite server, taking all of our orders all by memory and describing every dish as if she crafted it herself. Mithkah provided amazing recommendations and delivered on her promise. I celebrated my birthday and was greeted by a cheerful assistant general manager hailing from New Zealand, David really ended the experience with a grand finale that my friends and family will never forget. Just like the fountains of Bellagio, Yellowtail blew this trip out of the water, legendary! We will be returning for many years to come. Kudos to the kitchen staff and chef for creating countless amazing dishes that I'll dream of back home. This spot is a MUST in Las Vegas! Bravo.

_nNSr_GI2Er3wGe3t5IeWA.text: Exceptional service and fantastic food. View of the water show. You must eat here if you like sushi!

aogXpY8aUyGm38LWvRXrWg.text: We absolutely love this place! Mickle is hands down the best server in Las Vegas. We're regulars and request him every single time. The food is fantastic and just a great vibe

scjVVU214gjLUtYHVN_vmg.text: Wow. I heard that Yellowtail was the best sushi on the strip but I had no idea just how life changing it actually was. Casey behind the bar suggested the Protein roll. It was SO good I went back the next day for another, where he also suggested the Yellowtail Jalapeno dish. He further suggested I dip my Protein roll in the sauce the Yellowtail comes in. Absolutely, eye closing, amazing food moment. The only bad thing I can say is that I won't be able to experience this as often as I'd like. Wow.

fg0fNIXTTl2z4ZcpOfqJfQ.text: Fantastic!  Filet w/mushrooms. New sashimi: octopus. Several sushi for me, matching sashimi for him.  The food was devine. I loved the perfectly salted, soft flavor notes designed to showcase the main event: the meats and fish. Vegetables were gorgeous and fresh. The proteins: the best. Top quality.  It was packed, packed, packed on Saturday night and we didn't have reservations. The girls at the desk had us wait a few minutes for a table in the bar. It was lovely.   They waitstaff was attentive, but not intrusive. Service was smooth, and best of all, we loved every delectable bite.   Japanese art in the gallery. Japanese food in our bellies. We were fully nourished, body and soul.

-8Pf4zy5UH0-xJr9uY2iXw.text: After visiting the Bellagio's 'under-construction' Greek looking conservatory, I headed to Yellowtail.  What a fantastic bar, bartender KC, & wine/sake list.    Three favs that are an absolute MUST in this order:  Protein Roll * Similar to a Rainbow, except instead of rice, it's real crab wrapped in soy paper, topped w/ Tuna, Salmon, Hamachi, Shiso, asparagus.  Wow!  ($32)  Big Eye Tuna Pizza * thinly sliced tuna w/ a cream sauce on top of a cracker thin crust & topped w/ micro shiso & Truffle Oil.  The best way to eat this is to scoop one half of the tuna onto the other half of the pizza & enjoy a larger amount of tuna on each slice mmm! ($27)  Strawberry Roll they used to have it so maybe it's a seasonal Roll that I love topped w/ sweet strawberries, thinly sliced.    Overall, wonderful environment & view, on top of the food   & wonderful bartenders, I highly recommend Yellowtail!

DYXcLTcbj_cGbvuX6RizVA.text: Delicious, original and super fresh!! You think it's a tiny restaurant but just go around the corner and it's a nice big fancy sushi restaurant we had an awesome time!!!!

BGFz8_C_qcMTJynnFjgJKA.text: Yellowtail. (3.83 stars).  "Hamachi: the Japanese name for Pacific yellowtail, especially when used in sushi and sashimi." - Google  I first heard of Chef Song Ook "Akira" Back when Chef Back was on Iron Chef & he battled Chef Bobby Flay. I was secretly rooting for my fellow Korean (after all I am half Korean). Sadly, Chef Back lost, but he gained an instant fan!!  I think the Iron Chef battle was sometime in 2008 because I ended up at Yellowtail in the Bellagio for their grand opening in 2008.  I have been to Yellowtail at least 10 times since their grand opening, & I have to say, it's still a nice place to relax & unwind!!  I enjoy the vibe & being able to have a lighter meal & cocktails in the evening.  ---  Ahhh yes, that glorious meaty fatty melt-in-your-mouth fish that is known the world over as HAMACHI!!!  Yes please!  Ironically, my favorites at Yellowtail aren't made with Hamachi...  Yellowtail is a an upscale sushi bar & lounge where Chef "Akira" Back hones his love of Japanese food with a twist.  I have tried many of the items on the menu so I'll review 1 item I would pass on & 2 I usually order when I'm here:  Big Eye Tuna Pizza. (3 stars).  Chef Back's most popular dish is his signature Big Eye Tuna Pizza.  While the Tuna is sliced deli thin & delicious, I feel the truffle oil overpowers this dish.  I do love truffles & I do love truffle oil, but I find myself smelling truffles HOURS after I have eaten this pizza.  That tells me, there is too much truffle oil for my liking.  The micro shiso greens do give a nice crunchy texture but much like the tuna, they are overpowered by the truffle oil.  The "crust" is a thin crispy shell which does add a crunchy & enjoyable texture but this is one of those dishes that u will either love or despise.  U won't really know until u try it.  If u get this pizza to share, one slice is more than enough to taste the flavors & move on to another dish.  The BF said the truffle oil is too potent for him so I was forced to dump 3/4 of my pizza. Boo!!  Tuna Tataki. (4 stars).  Every time I visit Yellowtail, I always order this. I think it's because it's so simple but luxurious in quality & taste.  Plus, I get to see each individual slice & inspect its quality while admiring its beauty...  I am from Hawaii where Ahi is KING!  But I have to say this tuna tataki is light, subtle, & silky in texture. A nice firm fish that melts on contact with my tongue. Surprisingly great quality tuna for a restaurant in the middle of the dessert!!  While Chef Back's sushi rolls are fun to try, I come here to enjoy a semi-naked fish basking in all its glory... in a pool of spicy mustard sauce.  Delicious to the last bite!  I order this when I have wicked bad cravings for ahi & I'm not in Hawaii.  This tuna tataki has got me "hook, line, & sinker".  Duck Prosciutto. (4.5 stars).  Perhaps I love this dish because I rarely find it on any menu?!  Of the few places I have had duck prosciutto, Yellowtail is my favorite place to have it!  The fatty salty curing that these duck breasts go through make them all the more delectable.   Yellowtail's version isn't gamey at all. Just a deli-thin slice of duck which is so delicious with an ice cold beer!!  The saltiness is addicting & the micro beets give the duck a lightly floral flavor while adding a nice crunchiness.  I love rolling the greens into each individual slice of duck and eating it like a roll.  This dish is really what entices me back to Yellowtail after all these years. Maybe not the best in the world, but the best I have had thus far!  Ahhh... the perfect quack... oops I meant bite!  ---  Service is always friendly.  If u have a small party, I highly recommend sitting at the bar!! The bartenders are extremely knowledgeable & friendly. The cocktails at Yellowtail are innovative & delicious.  I'm an "old-fashioned" kinda girl... *Angelic smile*  Yellowtail is located closest to the North Entrance near Prime & the tram.  MLife comps can be used here.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail by Sung Ook &#34;Akira&#34; Back.

XBREhk6yORy0cImSt6ZbhA.text: Not sure why this place is 3.5 stars. We went last night and had a fabulous experience!! We were seated out on the patio on a lovely evening. Our waiter was very attentive but not overbearing. Just right! When the fountains started the servers stepped outside and took pictures, if requested. The food we had was fresh and delicious!! We ordered edamame and the pickles to start. My ONLY negative was that I didn't care got the pickled veggies. I love LOVE pickles but these didn't hit the mark. The dirty martini was sooo smooth and well balanced! Went down nicely!! ;)  For dinner we had the Flat Iron steak, spicy tuna roll, rock shrimp roll cut and the mile high roll. ALL of these were fabulous! The mile high had a nice kick to it! The spicy tuna roll lived up to its name but is better with a few sliced jalapenos on it. My favorite was the Rock Shrimp roll!! It as so different from most rolls I've had. It had some shrimp tempura and was covered in soy paper. It had a crisp crunch inside was creamy and delicious! Almost yeasty and addicting like a fresh buttered roll!! So good I ordered another one!! We have enjoyed Kumi for years but this was our first time here. It is my new favorite! Give it a try, I'm sure you'll love it too.

sNkpkBBQGNBtV1qI8CYxxQ.text: Came in for a late night snack.  The tuna pizza is awesome! Crust is super thin and crunchy, the tuna on the top is wonderfully flavored and outstanding in taste  Rick shrimp tastes ok but not superb, and is on the oily side.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XpR61t_Gmy5q2CaN_IH4BA.text: We went here on a birthday splurge, per my moms raving recommendation of the food here. We sat in the back and were immediately greeted with steller service and recommendations.   Appetizers: --  Seaweed salad: came with two types, one with an overwhelming oceanic taste and the other a salty and sweet clear green thin type found in most restaurants. I liked this one but the fresh seaweed was almost too powerful to handle.  --  Cucumber salad: light and refreshing, they use some great white vinegar to enhance the flavor. Makes a great refresher in between complex dishes. --  Miso soup: the best I have ever had. --  Grilled Eggplant Skewers: one of my favorite dishes, this eggplant is cooked PERFECTLY, and has the best sauce I have ever tasted. It is like a caramelized miso reduction and if you like eggplant you need to try this. I think it was around $12 so for being the cheapest app on the menu it was by far the most memorable! --  Big eye tuna pizza: We tried this one because it won "best appetizer in LV" (according to our waiter). It was good but not spectacular. I will say that you will definitely taste the truffle oil. Also, the salmon was fresh. Not worth 26 though. -- Scottish Salmon Carpaccio - Another winner, fresh fresh fresh! The sauce (Yuzu Soy I think) was delicious  Entrees and rolls: -- baked crab hand roll : SO GOOD. THIS IS SO GOOD. I MEAN GOOOOOOOOD. If you like your sushi with a little oomph and cream sauces then get this. for 10 bucks it is well worth it! -- rock shrimp hand roll : I liked the flavors a lot, but the roll is a bit more of a dry one in comparison to the baked crab. **The paper that wraps these two rolls is unlike any other I have experienced, I would go back just to have this style hand roll again.  -- california roll : tasty and standard, again aim for the more unique dishes here  -- spicy tuna : not much more than tuna and rice. I liked that they were very spicy  -- oysters - creamy and very good  Drinks:  -- Lychee - This one was good but for $20 it wasn't great. There was a strange flavor to it that was not sweet, empty and unsatisfying. (It was too unusual to compare to something else though). I will give them points for strength, the cocktails most assuredly hit the spot.  -- Essence - cranberry cucumber flavors, extremely refreshing and mild.  Overall go here for appetizers and drinks, do not waste your money on an entire meal. We spent around $500 for 4 people in total.  I will give it 4 stars because for as much as we spent, I was expecting each dish amaze me in some way or another.

zxPTm2JQbQtk8ZEANN1gUg.text: Great spot with a hip scene. Has windows looking out to the water show which adds a little something nice. Food is inventive and fresh making it great for a date or a bigger group. Love the big eye tuna pizza and how can you pass up the sushi rolls with pop rocks. The cocktail menu is great flavor and fun. Have to say my fav is the essence. If you are dining alone the bar scene is fun looking out on to the rest of the casino a killer spot for people watching. Love coming here. Easily my favorite restaurant at Bellagio.

hHHp1Oy6eOadPfi2DYAJsg.text: The ambiance is quite trendy. The food is quite good and the sushi is fresh and tasteful. However the menu is quite expensive and the portions are very small. The service could see room for improvement.

nhlgFSKjPvWaNiubZLFiog.text: I will give this place a 3 1/2 stars...  We came here for a friend's dirty- thirty bday dinner with a group of 13. So getting the reservation or a large party was a little bit difficult especially on fight weekend. They accommodated us with a phone call about three days before.  Service - pretty decent. Very responsive with a large party but thats because tip is guaranteed. But they did fill our waters and had decent suggestions. Also they were very responsive and helpful.  Food - Each group of 4 people ordered their set of dishes. In my group we had a hardcore sushi person, two experienced sushi eaters and one non sushi eater.   We ordered the tuna pizza, which was pretty good, the non sushi eater liked it. Along with tha we ordered 4 rolls, a unagi type roll, a soft shell crab roll, a tempura roll of some sort and a tuna roll. We also ordered a Wagyu beef dish that was probably the highlight of the meal. We also had a snapper dish which definitely one I would come back for. I am not much of a roll person, so I can't say they were that good nor that bad.  The non sushi eater was pretty good at taking down the rolls, so in that sense the fish was pretty decent. The tuna pizza is more of a novelty, sorry toro, or hamachi are number one on my sushi wants.  Decor - It was a very modern setting and the view we had was outstanding, it was a great view of the water show at the bellagio, it can get pretty noisy in here so don't look here for a romantic dinner unless you like raising your voice to the person across from you.  I'll admit it wasn't my first choice (Comme Ca was) but it proved to be good for a not too filling meal, which is what we aimed for.

rJYRLUpQ3C0tcrWmVBly2w.text: Great atmosphere for a Thursday night date or mid-week bachelor party for a half dozen guys to get down on some sushi! The dancing waterfall outside the Bellagio provides subtle entertainment, the sweet chili edamame is delicious and the smoothest sake nigiri I have had in a long time! Get an 8:30 reservation and ask for Michael to be your server, he's a pro!

6jnnz7FCMg1szwtywRDIUg.text: It's been over a year since I have been here and I STILL think about the Protein Roll. I have never had a better sushi roll and can not for the life of me find one that is comparable even here in the DC area!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail&#39;s Protein Roll....over a year later and I still think about it haha! So good!

cIQsPW58PBDmpbpG7NtbtA.text: Pricey, but fresh.  I had just about everything here and my favorite dish are Kobe Beef Tataki, Big Eye Tuna Pizza, Sashimi Platter, Shikoku Octopus with Cucumber and Jalapeno, and baked crab.  Great service and fountain view.

ILuHffM-nZpYfOMUiBfGUw.text: Dinner here before "O" and they happily recognize you're on a schedule.  Pulsing music makes casual conversation a bit strained.  Food was exquisitely prepared and very tasty.  Sake / wine / beverage sommelier was really over the top and an aggressive up-seller, not appreciated.  Service was sporadic and they forgot our edamame order.  Portions could be larger, but every bite is delicious. The quality of the food helped counterbalance the negatives.  If you can dine out by the fountains, be prepared for some misting... but an exceptional view!

esvDs7cqTwLDHyai7CQGpA.text: So my date and I came here to just get a couple drinks before we headed off to more lounging, cake eating and other shenanigans.  We got a table in front of a couple (elderly white guy and young asian girl with really short skirt).  It was definitely a cosy seating area and we were able to do some people watching since we were literally next to the walking area and people were passing us by.  We ordered two drinks, normal cocktail type prices.  A bit loud around us, but we definitely made the most of it since we were in our own little happy bubble.  We spotted some "whoo" girls near the entrance (you'll need to watch How I Met Your Mother to understand that reference).  Can't believe they do exist though... Good place to just lounge and enjoy time with someone special =)

UI9xWD8xi9D4QP7fvUR3RQ.text: 3.5 stars. Service- Friendly & attentive, a must for any fine dining restaurant. Price- Not so friendly as most dishes are in small portions but $$$  Here's what's memorable and what's not- Great-Big eye tuna pizza (everyone's favorite),lobster carpaccio, yellowtail serrano (fresh yellowtail never tasted this good), tempura alaskan king crab (a must order), uni. Okay- Kobe flat iron (a bit tough), Ankimo (good but I could get this easily at local sushi joints), shikoku octopus (might be better without pickled cucumber). Not so memorable- Kumamoto oysters (either not fresh or not in season), Holy mackerel roll(small roll & nothing special).

Mq4I1jl-BYt4nQ5ozaDN-g.text: Japanese Fusion Place. It was noisy, actually really noisy as we were sitting by some loud chatterboxes...  Alaskian Tempura: $23; this was pretty good. Small portion but good.  Seafood Hot Plate: Yuck...too oily and creamy.   Tako: cut off bumps, chewier  Halibut Sashami: 2 small pieces and they were okay  Baked Crab Roll: TONS of mayo...nothing special and it felt like I was eating a California Roll but with MORE, MORE mayo.   The only thing that was really good was the tempura. Other than was average.

xZf4GfdAH-k9a02tvfrO4Q.text: First of all this place is pricey. LOTS. But then again, that's Vegas for ya. The hubs and I had dinner here on Friday and it was delicious. He had a Happa Roll and a couple of pieces of sashimi. I had the Jadori chicken and their roasted corn as a side. The hubby loved his food and so did I. So many sushi places just serve plane chicken but this was so delicious. I will try to post pics later. The roasted corn was SO yummy. It was definitely a small portion for the price (10) but delicious in deed.   I had 2 cocktails, a pineapple and a strawberry. The drinks are pricey, $20, but they are strong so I could have easily had one. But hey I was on vacation.   The staff was SO nice and courteous. There was no snootiness here like at some of the restaurants in the strip.   And lastly, we sat outside and were able to enjoy the fountains. Just perfect, other than the price tag ;)

jhCgGI0eNHop8MVHCuRO0Q.text: After seeing this place featured on "The Best Thing I've Ever Eaten," I was ecstatic when my friend decided to treat me out to dinner here.  Unfortunately, Yellowtail fell quite short of my high expectations...  ATMOSPHERE Located in the Bellagio, Yellowtail definitely has some swag (I mean, that giant, bright, metallic, golden fish hanging out on the wall definitely screams "Vegas"). It was a pretty swanky place so I had some high hopes.  The server was really nice, but she accidentally gave us someone else's bill on top of ours...   FOOD 1) Tempura fried king crab appetizer 2) Red snapper sushi 3) Shrimp tempura roll 4) Salmon sashimi 5) Angry salmon roll 6) Toro scallion roll  The TEMPURA FRIED KING CRAB was fantastic. I wish we just ordered a few of those instead of the sushi and sashimi. The crab itself was juicy and the tempura was perfectly crisp and crunchy. The dish tasted so good with the ponzu sauce! The scallions were a great finishing touch because they added that final subtle zing to the dish.  The SUSHI and SASHIMI were both mediocre at best. The rolls were small and they weren't that creative. The only good thing about the sashimi was that it was presented in the shape of a rose, but it wasn't the best sashimi I've ever had.  Overall, Yellowtail is overrated and overpriced. I feel like I had better sushi at Ichiban in the basement of Bally's for 1/10th of the price.

I-Bkt2EVF8kBXsNzCVcLaw.text: Totally tasty with a great fountain view. Kobe beef tartar served in slices- who knew? Everything was tasty, even the roll of angry salmon- Recommend the pacific style sake- so smooth it's slammin'!

kf7kn--E9L1fp96uvOdHbQ.text: Stopped in for a last minute dinner while killing time waiting for a red eye flight. I wanted to get a light dinner and see the dancing water show. Yellowtail delivered on both. I had a table by the window and ordered edamame, vegetable rolls, and an amazing eggplant skewer.  Sushi was great.  It was way over priced, but not surprised given the location.

7flcGeNv99xv7A7DU8yL_Q.text: Great food and atmosphere, but abysmally bad service. It took over 45 minutes to get drinks (which arrived well after starters) and food arrived in an extremely staggered fashion so that a couple people in our party waited over 20 minutes for their food after the first plates arrived. Further, one member of our party never even got his order. Delicious food, embarrassingly terrible service.

3CtRq9538yUTx9Cv0_1U5Q.text: Sorry folks, this place is overhyped. Small rolls, high prices, very boring, un-imaginative rolls. We always try new sushi places wherever we go, and don't mind throwing down some cash for quality. But this place didn't fit the bill. Go to Social House instead.

0qT_TbF9-tlmxMnBGmQHtw.text: Surely a place you plan on wine-in and dine-in!  I sure did!  Pricey rolls.  I did enjoy the roll that had "POP rocks" candy in it. I really wish there was more. Honestly what ever the waiter said was good and appeared on Food Network I ordered!    I had the "better fortune sake" bottle and one more.  I surely can't remember since we were many sake shots deep!    can't wait to go again. It's always great with great company

8gptrqz4I8A2Y5M-xxc2Zg.text: My fav restaurant in Vegas. The marinated eggplant that they have here is definitely the best i've ever had. Delicious cocktails. Impeccable service.

tgsNrX5H9qhgQ8FXRj1f8g.text: The sushi here is amazing! I came here for my friends bday party and let me tell you, drinks and sushi all night. Can't beat that!

ioBWSEujjG-qKy_uEcsuXg.text: Holy wow. We had the mile high as an appetizer. Holy so amazing. We also had the crispy calby. The spicy aioli was out of this world. There is a drink called damn I forget the name. Sweet pineapple and some other stuff. Yummy yummy

Q3I_GlV_Z2uTO5oLO2K1rQ.text: ****************************** REVIEW 864 *******************************            Chef Arika Back knows what he's doing here, a former professional snowboarder and worked under many great chefs (Morimoto, Nobu). Chef Arika Back brings much more to Yellowtail, offers classic Japanese cuisine, which features innovative dishes that utilize fresh ingredients.             We frequent here for snack with the casino host; this time we had a quick bites with Julie K., but the food here is always consistent and yummy. Service is quick and we love sitting at the bar, to try all the sake cocktails.  - Shikoku octopus with cucumber and jalapeno vinaigrette - Hamachi Serrano - Kobe beef sashimi in ponzu sauce - Big eye tuna pizza, reminds me of Morimoto Waikiki - Oyster shooters with citrus sake.         If you are the type of Yelpers complain about the small portion, this is way out of your league, remember even a bowl of PHO is $15 here at a 5 diamonds resort and casino. You get what you pay for, this Yellowtail considers reasonable compare to other sushi spots on this strip! P.S. try the cucumber and ginger cocktails when you get a chance!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YoVRiVC798Nt8nlo8TdtgA.text: This was an amazing experience. We went as a group of 8 to Las Vegas and this was our special dinner night. The servers are attentive and the restaurant is beautiful. The food is incredible The big eye tuna pizza is a must for everyone! For the warm plates, we had the seared diver scallops, perfectly cooked; as well as the sea bass. Everything we had was really good, and we will definitely make this a regular dinner when we are in Vegas.

XhHYF5U_IUUdnK9m3XUtcg.text: Used to love this place. Love the people here and the food. But the sushi cuts are way too thin. Sushi is suppose to have thick cut of fish and small rice. Not the other way around. Sorry.

-JashkeK2GmIBclOFv3Arg.text: Credibility: I have an AOS from the Culinary Institute of America and am a hospitality major at Unlv.  First off, what a great location- no doubt a reason for the prices. Yes the drinks are expensive. Get over it, you're in the Bellagio  The menu is excellent, something for everyone and even adhering to the "meat heads" that Las Vegas attracts. Everything has a great deal of different flavors and textures going on all at once.   My server was Guy B, absolutely amazing. Very smooth and attentive to our every need and expectation! He gave us great recommendations and wasn't pushy! I highly recommend him to anyone who wants great service!   We were a table of two and ordered Tuna pizza, Lobster carpaccio, Alaskan King Crab Tempura, Rock shrimp hand roll, protein roll, and cup of chocolate, and Oolong tea!!  The lobster carpaccio was great! Nice and light! The king crab tempura was outstanding- nothing like i have had before in terms of SUBSTANTIAL King Crab. Rock shrimp roll was good, I would most likely try something different next time. The protein roll is a must!  Cup of chocolate was a great twist on a classic! Banana foam is a nice touch!  All is all, amazing meal, amazing service! So why the four stars instead of five? Well I was looking around and it seems that We got lucky with our waiter! Next to us, i was watching a waiter pour beer into a class(not tilted) and it completely over flowed on the table. The waiter seemed to just walk away before he could watch the inevitable happen. Also, it seems theres a lot of confusion with tables, many of the food runners were making mistakes around us involving table numbers. Either a lot of the runners don't know the table numbers or theres a lack of communication.  Last words: sushi rice was warm- GREAT hard to find warm sushi rice anywhere! They are good with allergies such as Celiac!

bDZX-iBmOEDrAGcmcmbqSQ.text: I truly enjoyed my Yellowtail experience! Beautiful atmosphere and lovely staff. We decided to sit at the bar to enjoy unique cocktails and several delicious dishes. The service was excellent and genuine. I enjoyed the friendly demeanor and exotic flavors. I can't wait to come back to this sexy establishment.

DllRnoW0DAcPUUr_q-_hOA.text: Average food. Horrible service. It is difficult to say which employee at the restaurant was more rude : It was either the rude hostess with an attitude or the manager who interrupted our business conversation and told us to finish our dinner ASAP because he had other reservations. Go to Prime, Picasso, or Nobu and avoid the unprofessional staff at this restaurant

Psw3BsQlIYFqwqRWki6H6A.text: We went for our anniversary dinner last week and it was quite pleasant. We both loved the food and service. We sat on the patio and got to watch the fountains about five times. The heat lamps kept us warm enough without jackets. If you want to sit on the patio, make reservations and go just before they open - it fills up fast.  Our favorite dishes were the rock shrimp, duo of edamame, and most of the cold fish dishes. The sushi roll wasn't the best we'd had. I would highly recommend this place for a fancy night out.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers to us!

1vCBI2XKZJG2YYqHCl4Wog.text: The best sushi restaurant in the states! Guys with sushi you get what you pay for... it's not your typical AYCE place. The attention for details is unheard off nowadays. The food level is consistent. The Sunomono(cucumber salad) here was the one who made me fall in love with the dish years ago and till today every slice is perfectly crispy, the Toro just melt in your mouth! I just wish it was more affordable but again you get what you pay for...

4Nf_CbS6E9HVC5TR1QCCsQ.text: This restaurant was just not good. We split two rolls, tempura king crab and a side of corn. The rice was beyond sticky on the roll and had turned into a paste. I've had better at chain restaurants. The corn was way overpriced for what it is about a half cup of corn.

LiQFBcySUw5fRj28s6ERCA.text: Food was amazing and the waiter (Theo) and most of the staff was great! The star is being knocked because of the hostesses who were rude and came across as pompous...  We had a reservation for 6pm but seemed that we could have been seated just as fast without it! The food is some of the best sushi you will find, expect to pay $$$ since you are on the strip in Las Vegas AND at the Bellagio but that doesn't knock a star, just the rude hostesses!!   One of the best dishes is the Big Eye Tuna Pizza!! The Happa roll was great and all the fish in everything was fresh! The braised short rib also was fantastic!

qiAw6lBv_6PbZjrVq58oEw.text: $$$$$$$$$$$$$ Need i say more?  I ordered a chicken breast dish. It was a half a breast and wouldn't fill a child. And they had the nerve to charge me $28 for that! Amazing. I don't care where I am, if i pay for a meal, it should be a meal. I am a grown man, 6'3' and 215lbs. I don't expect a buffet, but this place is a joke.  Forgot my beer.  Terrible sushi.  I will upload the photos so you can see this joke in real time.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $18 for this? So lame. Seattles worst sushi place is better
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $30 for this? What a disappointment.

bvgQH6jXOLqf1GyBmagLBw.text: This place is worth a solid 3 stars for the location alone. It sits right over the water's of the bellagio fountain which happens to be my favorite thing to see on the strip. Other restaurants have seating next to windows, but I think this one (maybe also olives) are the only one that allow you outside to see it all.   We called and made a reservation for a Tuesday night. While the restaurant really wasn't that busy, the patio is small so it's worth calling.   The service as most yelp reviews have said, was ok. Weird buser who kept making loud dramatic comments about how much water I was drinking. The server was a calm individual who never listened to what we would answer to his questions. Example, so" you guys are here visiting Las Vegas?" "No we're local, we're just celebrating our anniversary" "do you know what you would like to drink?"   The food: 1. The tuna pizza, pretty good. Bread to tuna was sad. But hey, it shows the chef knife skills to cut the fish that thin! 2. King crab tempera chopped and deep fried. Small portion but good flavor. 3. Salmon roll. Same as any roll at a sushi place. But they double the price.   Would I come again? Maybe for dessert and capachinos and sit on the patio. If your on the patio...it ain't worth spending your money here.

bITnweLBF_p5b1gyPIX3Kg.text: I've been here several times & have never been disappointed. The food is always amazing & service is usually pretty good. The popping crab roll is a must try. Filled with pop rock candy that doesn't change the flavor of the roll much just adds to the sweetness of the crab & creates a unique popping sensation. The seafood dynamite is also wonderful. I could have licked the plate! Pretty much can't go wrong with whatever you order.

3kv979n_xquLth_CgIVsVQ.text: Okay, stopped in again last night (I know, I know, just can't get enough).  Have three additional dish recommendations in addition to those in the first review.  - Crispy Kalbi. This dish has a center of Korean short ribs and uses slaw, rather than rice, as the outer layer.  Yep, you read that right.  No need to grab your Grandmother's glasses; I said slaw.  Trust me (famous last words.)  ;-)  But really, trust me.  - Broiled Atlantic Black Cod.  OMG, and I mean OMG! Any attempt to describe the taste of this menu item will fall short.  The fish is firm, yet pulls apart easily and I would ask that this be the last item to be served during the meal.  A perfect punctuation mark to an experience that has been building in taste and texture.  The chopsticks were clicking as we attacked the dish like a school of Amazonian piranas.  I would replace the Filet Mignon Toban with one of the above.  - Rock Shrimp Hand Roll.  I would order this rather than the Baked Crab Hand Roll.  Both are good, but the Rock Shrimp Hand Roll takes it over the top.  Happy eating!

eILpDSV0H7h4i1q0wJ9kEA.text: We have a reservation for this restaurant. Very cool looking bar and the table by the windows allows you to see the Bellagio fountains.  Service was very slow to start.  The featured cocktails were extremely watered down. We had to get a extra shot of vodka(Tito's)for $13 to actually make it taste like a alcoholic drink. Shishito peppers and the rock shrimp tempura very mild. Typically they're supposed to have a little spice to it but this wasn't the case. The food was mediocre at best. Featured specialty drinks were horrible.

QPGUmiPdsqY01iFYu1A_HA.text: Enjoyed two dinners in a week at Yellowtail.   Just amazing.  The Toro Caviar is sublime.  Every piece of sushi we had was perfect.  The service is fantastic and the yellowtail jalapeno dish is kind of amazing.   This chef is so great, he's just killing it right now.   GO!  EAT! You'll be so happy you did.

S674S3ETbZIWaZxI6ybNlQ.text: Mediocre at best. Service was slow. Place was rammed, loud. Sushi was nothing special at all.

THjzHS8N0h-A1Ag-TP8AvA.text: Such an awesome place to Eat. After taking the Tram from Mandalay Bay to Excalibur, Getting lost inside New York, New York for 15 Minutes and walking all the way back from there to our Hotel (Planet Hollywood). I decided to come here for a Late Night Bite, located deep inside the Bellagio lies Yellowtail: a Japanese Restaurant that serves killer Food, with waitresses dressed in Miniskirts (but mainly this is about the Food).  When I made the reservation I asked if I could have a Table overlooking the Bellagio fountains outside, but they said they were all taken (that was only negative thing about my Experience here, Other than that everything else was Spot-On) they were at least kind to put me close to the window (Close Enough).  The reason why I wanted to come here was because of one Dish: Tempura Alaskan King Crab recommended by Beau MacMillan (1st Season Co-Host of the Food Network show: Worst Cooks in America and 1 of 15 Challengers to defeat Bobby Flay on Iron Chef America) on The Best Thing I Ever Ate episode (With Chopsticks).   It came out and it was like layered like a Cake and When I went to take a Bite it was Awesome (The rich juicy Crab meat, the Crunch of the Tempura, you get Heat from the Serrano Chilies, Mildness from the Red onions, Smokiness from the Micro Cilantro, Earthiness from the Beets, some Crispness from the Shredded Nori and you get sweetness from the Ponzu sauce that they pour over just when its about to be served).To take the world's biggest and most expensive Crustacean and turn it into this is just Mind Blowing. I had that along with a bowl of Spicy Miso Soup and a tall glass of Blueberry-Infused Bonzai Bunny Sparkling Sake (Refreshing). Everything was Phenomenal The food, service, the people, I'll be sure to have another meal the next time that I'm in Vegas (Count on It)

TaOHQPImeI1WB-KzK8e0wQ.text: I came here twice in 3 days... And I must say I wish I had gone even more times!!!  The decor and presentation are impeccable and I love how big the space gets... I wouldn't mind spending a few hours there.  Once they seat you, there is not a moment where you are not taken care of- their service is on point.  Now for the food... We had their tuna truffle pizza (worth it to come just for that), then their popcorn roll which is an experience all to itself (pop rocks are mixed into the roll and send your mouth on an exciting culinary adventure), the yellowtail jalapeno (melt in your mouth), oysters (I wish they had mignonette sauce but I loved them regardless), cooked jalapeno halibut (also un delice!!!).  Sushi is one of my favorite foods and when the flavor are so present as they are in the chefs dishes... It makes a world of difference :)

fezGMjfR-bANkRz1A5QttA.text: I really wanted to like Yellowtail, but it was such a disappointment.  My co-worker and I arrived to our party's reservation (of about ~12 people) late and ordered our entrees late, but that should mean that everyone else's entree orders should arrive on time, right?!?!  Wrong.  We had the Big Eye Tuna Pizza, Yellowtail Jalapeno, and Tempura Alaskan King Crab (which is supposedly highly praised by the Food Network).  I liked the tuna pizza, but mostly because I liked the truffle oil.  The yellowtail tasted odd to me but that could be that I'm not a fan of orange flavored things and it's sitting in a blood orange sauce.  Meh, I think it was just not for me.  I had high hopes for the crab tempura given our waiter's high praise for it, but it was lackluster and did not wow me at all.  Tasted exactly like what it sounds like.   :/  What's up with that Food Network?  I thought this was supposed to be good!  Given our lackluster appetizers, I was hoping our entrees would make up for it.  I had a taste of the High Steak Roll, Crispy Kalbi Roll, and Jidori Chicken and again... lackluster.  :c  I could only taste the A-1 sauce in my steak roll and mostly only mayo from the coleslaw on my kalbi roll.  The rolls were overly sauced making it hard to even taste anything else!  Luckily the chicken was not so bad, and actually quite tasty and tender.  Thank goodness. But despite the chicken, it didn't save this place from the mediocre food and long wait times!    Throughout dinner, everyone's food came out at various times so one or two people would get their food, while the other ten would sit there waiting.  And then another person gets their food 15 minutes later, while the other nine sit there waiting.  And then another one or two people would get their food 15 minutes later, while the other seven or eight people would sit there waiting... you get the idea.  By the time everyone's food came out and decided to order dessert, it took another half hour before it was brought out!  To the point, where we almost wanted to just call it quits and pay just to leave.  After having the dessert, it wasn't even worth the time we spent waiting... sigh.  It made the wait that much more terrible.  :c  This resulted in an 3.5+ hour, $$$$ mediocre dinner.  :c  Lots of thumbs down.  Waste of time and money if you ask me.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Sesame and green tea dessert
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. High Steak Roll
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jidori Chicken

BrkHVXUz6s-VCngEakHSdQ.text: Subpar sushi rolls. The best thing on the menu is the sashimi pizza (can't remember the actual name).

iB0kkWQyHO0MGTuyvU-5wA.text: Let me first mention that I understand that this restaurant is a high grade Japanese restaurant on the strip, Chef Akira Back is a Michelin chef and lots of celebrities have dined at Yellowtail. Let me also add that I've been to many other high quality Japanese restaurants in Hawaii, Seattle, California (both NorCal & SoCal), England and of course Japan: Tokyo, Kyoto, Hakkone, etc., as well as lived in Japan for 3.5 years. My Dad and I had a really bad dining experience. (My family returns back to Las Vegas a few times each year b/c we own a home here and we also have relatives -- so we've been to a lot of the restaurants on the strip over the course of 15 years.) It was apparent that our waiter did not like us ()-- in fact she ended up leaving us and had someone else wait our table -- and our food took a long time to reach our table. (The time it took really annoyed my Dad.) Naturally, even the best restaurants have their off nights which leaves room for some error. What made the experience even worse was that when we spoke with the manager, it was quite evident to us that he didn't care: his arms were crossed and face looking down to avoid eye-contact, as he slowly edged us out of the restaurant -- very passive aggressive () -- to ensure that other customers would not hear us. In all my years of eating at upscale Japanese restaurants, I've never experienced this sort of treatment. Chef Akira is Japanese; however, the customer service is not --  Even outside of this cultural point, I think most people want to be heard if they feel like they're not getting what they paid for. At the restaurant's price point, this sort of treatment is not acceptable :-( Even if the manager didn't agree with us, there's a different way to handle such situations --

bB9CYFkbr9elXZEXPFVYzg.text: I had made reservations for my wife and me as I read about the opportunity to have fine Asian fare overlooking the Bellagio fountain.  We were shown to an ideal little patio table overlooking the fountain.  The evening weather was perfect., and were both in high spirits.  What could go wrong?  How about all the food and all the drink....  We started the evening with one of their $20 cocktails.  I'll let you decide whether or not that would be considered "overpriced".  Mine was OK, but my wife's choice had vodka, spicy pepper, and strawberry puree.  It was so sour, we had to call over the waiter, and ask if it was supposed to be so.  He said no, that the sweetness of the strawberry puree was supposed to compliment the spicy pepper flavor.  He returned it to the bartender who then made a better tasting one.  Well, it was a minor slip-up on a $20 drink, but stuff happens, right?  We had ordered a chef's tasting menu paired with various sake tastings.  Before we could even take two sips of our pre-dinner cocktails, the food runners from the kitchen started dropping plates of food in front of us like it was a race to get us through our dinner.  We ignored the food while we enjoyed the cocktails looking over the fountain and Las Vegas Boulevard.  We asked our waiter to slow it down.  Ultimately, we begged him to just stop completely.    The chef's tasting menu was supposed to be six courses and a dessert.  We made it through three of the courses before we told the waiter to just stop.  The chef was embarrassing himself.  Each course was worse than the last.  The first course was kind of a sashimi pizza.  It consisted of four minuscule, paper-thin pieces of fish on a communion wafer with truffle oil drizzled on top.  The waiter said it was their signature dish.  My wife tasted it, and said the communion wafer was burnt.  By, Jove, she was right.  They apparently over-toasted them, and all you could taste was oil on a burnt cracker.  Oh, OK, the drink was bad, and the first course was disappointing, but we had a great view.  It would certainly get better, right?  Wrong.  The second course was three paper-thin pieces of fish with some melted chocolate sauce and a splooge of sriracha right from the plastic bottle.  It tasted as awful as that sounds.  There was no flavor of fresh fish.  None.  Chocolate and sriracha  Blech.  The waiter was growing tired of hearing our concerns, and just then, another food runner showed up with Course #3: again, three paper thin pieces of fish covered in mustard and salt. What little taste was exactly like one of those German pretzels with mustard on it.  It was at this point, we had to flag him down and demand they stop the service.  Each course contained tinier and thinner pieces of fish than the last (if that could be possible).  There was no celebration of fresh fish, but a naked attempt to serve the smallest portions possible slathered with overpowering sauces dreamed up in some hellhole kitchen about to be eviscerated by Gordon Ramsay.    I have never, ever, in my life asked for the food to stop coming.  We felt horrible.  We had never had such a difficult restaurant experience.  My wife was nearly in tears.  The waiter said the manager removed all the food from our bill, and we were still served a bill north of $250 just for the drinks.  I tipped the waiter appropriately as he wasn't the chef, and I had to write off the experience as a very expensive seat to enjoy a couple drinks overlooking Bellagio's beautiful fountain.  The manager refused to visit our table.    Now before you or the restaurant manager simply write us off as East Coast rustics who wouldn't know fresh fish if it was a piranha that bit us on the cheek, let me provide a little context.  I am retired military and work internationally.  My wife is also a highly accomplished professional who travels globally for her work.  We have had the world's best sushi/sashimi at the Tokyo fish market.  I have eaten fugu in Japan (the potentially deadly blowfish).  We have sampled the raw fish in cities like Hong Kong, Seoul, Beijing, Macau, Luoyang,  San Francisco, Hawaii, and dozens more places.  Sushi is supposed to be all about the delicate flavor of the fresh fish.  The ridiculously transparent slices of fish and the nasty sauces made this the single most disgusting sushi meal we have ever eaten.    The.  Worst.  This was supposed to the the chef's tasting menu!  I would have preferred gas station sushi from a quicky-mart on a desert highway outside of Pahrump, NV.  The fish slicer at Yellowtail should be paraded in sackcloth and ashes down Las Vegas Boulevard on his way out of town for good.  I guess you could say we wouldn't recommend you waste your money here.

kg6kBk92SSOuzh1J2LXgOw.text: We were treated like hillbillies at a country fair. They wanted to seat us in a dark area of the restaurant when we wanted to sit outside! This place was the definition of DIVE from start to finish!

Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CAngNjMZksD_-OF29LdXXA.text: Great view, elegant decor, great food and impeccable service. One of the best meals we had in Vegas. We happened to be in Bellagio  that day and after having desserts at Jean Phillipe Patisserie, we decided to come here for dinner. Kind of a last minute thing since we were looking for a sushi restaurant in Bellagio so we stumbled upon this place. We requested a table with a view and were taken to a table next to the window with the view of the Bellagio Fountain outside. Amazing!!!   Our server was wonderful. We didn't know much about sushi so he gave us some recommendations, all of which were great. We had a few rolls and a halibut sushi. Everything was delicious. Even the presentation of the food was beautiful.   Now this place is one of our fav places to go to for sushi in Vegas. Hopefully we will have a chance to return here again on our next trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail Scallion
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soft shell crab roll
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut sushi

oCKd7oE-cRnMVusAPfOeqQ.text: Horrible customer service.  I came to the restaurant as a walk in. Rude lady in the front stated there is a half an hour wait. I saw close to 20 empty tables. I waited withmy husband at the bar and saw several people without reservations getting a table. I believe we were told to wait because we weren't white enough for this restaurant.  Food is horrible as well. If you like to eat over priced sushi with no flavor then this is the restaurant for you

bwsrThB5PfchEB1q8NPJHw.text: This was the last restaurant in the Bellagio that I had not been to and I decided to give it a go before seeing 'O' again.  I had a reservation for 5 PM to assure plenty of time to eat and relax before the 7 PM show.  I was taken to a two top at the window overlooking the Bellagio fountains.  I looked at the menu and my server came and asked about water/other beverages and I ordered my standard iced tea which was quickly brought to the table.  I looked over the menu some more and the server gave me some recommendations.  I decided to order one cold shared plate and one warm shared plate as the server (and some reviews) point out that the shared plates aren't that large.  I got the Big eye tuna pizza and the tempura Alaskan king crab.  These were two recommendations from the server and he pointed out that the tempura crab had been on the Best Thing I Ever Ate Food Network show.  The tuna pizza was very good.  It had a very, very thin crust with just enough substance to pick up the pieces and eat it truly like a pizza.  The flavors were great even the truffle oil because it was used sparingly.  The tempura crab was a bit of a disappointment.  It was OK but the tempura was a bit heavy and took away from the crab. I couldn't help but think it was a waste of good crab making it tempura style.  It wouldn't go on my list of best thing I ever ate.  For dessert, I ordered the Chocolate in a cup.  It consisted of Nutella, banana foam, and vanilla bean ice cream.  The Nutella is in the cup and there's a ring on top of the foam that breaks and dissolves into the foam and ice cream.  It was a great dessert.  Service was impeccable.  The view of the fountains is always good.  During dinner, there were three fountain shows.  Prices are Strip prices but I knew this going in so it doesn't affect my rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate in a  cup.
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura Alaska king crab.
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big eye tuna pizza with micro shiso.

N0-o3o1wUnPl6pvNLD5uPQ.text: Yellowtail delivered the goods for our party of 10 the other night.  Excellent service, beautifully prepared plates of delicious food in a nice setting.  $2400.  Ouch!  Yup, $2400 for 10 people!  Thankfully, our group thoroughly enjoyed the visit to Yellowtail.  4 solid stars (that's $600 a star!)

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail in The Bellagio.
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful...simply beautiful.

156A_zFvw7d-CrWcbEgz9A.text: We originally had reservations at another restaurant at the Bellagio but their outdoor seating was occupied by a private event that they didn't mention at the time of booking. We wanted a dinner with a view of the fountains and that's just what we got when we came to Yellowtail! We had our dinner on the balcony/terrace where there were heating lamps to keep us warm and a perfect view of the fountain show. We ordered the chef's choice option and each course was delightful! The staff was very professional and hospitable. We mentioned we had tickets for a show and they made sure the courses were being brought out in a timely manner.

fh01zqiic1oKy56hjHtJ3g.text: It is a very good restaurant if you like artistic presentation of fine food. The other 3 members of my party liked the meal very much. I thought it was too expensive for too small portions.

tmdqf-rv48KiLl7bBVZ4VA.text: Lousy all around. Most of the food is below average. There are a few nice dishes but overall it's below supermarket quality sushi at 10x the price. Not enough wait staff. Feel unattended to especially for the price. Very disappointed  Their deserts are actually very good. And the manager is a very nice guy. That's what brought the review up from a 1 to 2 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lousy presentation
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bad knife skills. Anyone could have cut this better. Anyone.
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Horrible.

JbQguwXci6HT2zZ2o65tlg.text: We had dinner here after watching the fountain show at the Hyde. Let me be honest. I only came here because of the popping spicy crab roll with the pop rocks in it. The roll definitely creates a unique sensation when you bite in to it and it just bursts with flavor. The pop rocks do not take away from the flavor of the roll at all. They enhance it. We also had the shrimp tempura and angry salmon rolls. I also really enjoyed the rock shrimp appetizer.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popping spicy crab, angry salmon, and shrimp tempura rolls
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rock Shrimp

JambioTn_Jf6qwKfPHatTQ.text: Was in town a few weeks back and decided to drop in and try this place out, I was very happy with this choice! Me and my girlfriend had dinner here on a week night and both of us enjoyed it greatly. We had a few pieces of nigiri and a few servings of sashimi as well as one of their rolls. All of it was excellent and tasted quite fresh, which being from LA we are spoiled with. Also their desert selection is delicious!

hv61q6otiE-L7C1WhRtjWw.text: Had the omakase here, everything was absolutely delicious. It's definitely a foodies omakase, small portions and not one that will make you feel full after it's over - go to a buffet if that's what you're looking for. It's seven courses, we enjoyed every dish. They could go a little more risky with the dishes, some felt pretty standard. Definitely on the pricey side, but worth the sushi and the view.   I'm so sad they closed the Sunset location in Los Angeles...they should re-open a smaller location in LA so we can go back to enjoying their tuna truffle pizza...

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mdHd7HlcxQbzcaD9CGcvRg.text: This is a great place to go to with a group! We were headed off to Hyde and The Bank (also in Bellagio) that night, so this was a good spot for dinner. The five of us (4 girls, 1 guy) got seated at a round table and were blown away by having a view of the fountains behind us. It was around 8:30pm on a Saturday and though the restaurant wasn't empty, it wasn't packed either.   We ordered a bunch of food to share as the plates were smaller and were happy with how everything tasted. We got the Duck Prosciutto, Gyoza (some of the best pot stickers I've had!), Uni Truffle Pasta with sea urchin, Seaweed Salad, and four rolls (Mile High was totally worth it!). Bill came out to be ~$50/each which was expected and worth it for a nice Vegas meal before going out. It was enough to fill us up and overall delicious too. Highly recommended for ambiance, fanciness, and quality of food!

RH7vqTxKtpdVCi5cgLCCYg.text: Was able to make a reservation via OpenTable the same day for a Saturday night. They open for dinner at 5pm. We made a reservation for 5 (we're parents and tired, so dinner is early) and we were seated right away, with a table with an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains. The ambiance is really nice and the music was really good.  Our server was fantastic although I don't remember his name. He clearly enjoys his job and was very helpful throughout experience. We were told to try their "Greatest Hits", in which our server ordered for us and guided us through our meal choices. We ended up getting the big eye tuna pizza, yellowtail jalapeno, the rock shrimp, and my husband got a roll with beef in it (crispy kalbi?) and I got a roll with tuna in it. Everything was delicious but the standout was the tuna pizza. It was on a thin, crispy flatbread and had some kind of spicy mayo on it and: truffle oil.   I definitely recommend Yellowtail, just be warned that it is quite expensive.

ig33g8kX4mHupuXQagzM-w.text: Excellent Food, Great Atmosphere, Amazing Views of The Bellagio Fountain. Sitting outside is a $345 minimum purchase per people, however, getting an inside window seat is an optional with no minimum. The only reason I didn't rate this place a 5 is because of our waitress. She (Chastain I think her name was or some combo name) didn't ask how the food was, refill the wine and worst of all it was my wife's birthday and not one small desert or candle. She knew and failed to make her feel special. Overall great food.

uOQZ2E7niEuf3Xl9gdQXSw.text: Over rated, over priced. Smallest sashimi slices I've ever had in any sushi restaurant in my life.

g1650s0ugq-mobdzGvnlxA.text: I wasn't really impressed. The food was just okay. The waiter only came by to take our orders and never again. It was my birthday and I was looking forward to this place for a while. Wish I had chosen somewhere else for my dinner. You're really paying for the ambiance.

pU7gyh55kjX8CSLmlQAJXA.text: Ok, I went back this weekend to try ONE MORE TIME.  It was great. The food quality is stellar, service was good. We brought 2 mid western friends who had never had sushi, and were kind of resistant to it, well they ate more than we did. Needless to say.. its really good.  I recommend everything. Its all good :D

WoDOwZ_ZsRKMXhKXe0qbLg.text: A- MA- ZING!!  We got there on Friday around 5:30 and able to get a table outside. the bellagio fountain show was right in front of us it was such a beautiful day and the view was amazing. Our server I believe his name was Seth he was incredible, very knowledgeable on all of the wines and dishes he is awesome! This was my first experience with Sashimi, I love sushi rolls and never thought I would care for sashimi. I believe we had the halibut I could be wrong on this. We also had the yellowtail jalapeno, oysters all of these were amazingly good! We also got the big eye tuna pizza so delish! A real treat was the tempura king crab the sauce with it really complimented the crab. We also got the filet mignon that came out sizzling and it is finished on the table with a peppery sauce it. Last but not least we figured we needed a little carbs ;) so why not get a roll my Sister opted to get the protein roll and to our surprise it did not have rice it was filled with crab, and it was amazing! We kept debating on whether or not to get another because we were running short on time to make it to, "O". We came to a decision that we would go with another. Our server knew we were going to the show and we got our second serving fast.  The service was incredible not just Seth but everyone there! The food was amazing! By the way did I mention how amazing this restaurant is lol!

wOkKY0PsMCQubzi_GcdbbA.text: Traveling alone to Vegas for a convention, I dropped in to Yellowtail for an early dinner. A good place to share ordered items with your party, my waiter, Roberto, helped me craft a meal for one. The well sake was so smooth. I started with a plate of yellowtail in a ponzu, the tuna pizza, which was surprisingly good, but would make a better shared item. The toro scallion roll was underwhelming. I finished with the braised short rib entree which I would definitely order again. The service was perfect and the decor was quite nice. Pricy meal but worth it.

lQle_ZQNHgKD-9rf3OlsWw.text: Sushi was good but this place is really pricey! I know, I know, its in the Bellagio, what can you expect? Came here with some coworkers last week and we shared several appetizers and rolls. Couldn't believe they had one roll for $36. Of course we had to order it! It was good but I'd have a hard time justifying the price of a meal here if I were paying for it myself.

bcxBRFJE3NFCfcHNeR4FKQ.text: The chef was good, but the service was horrible. I guess that's better than the other way around. It was empty inside so we had a great view of the Bellagio water show. So if you do come here, make sure you reserve your table outside or near the window to enjoy the ambiance.

o41DxZeo0NzA2RXheME9-w.text: Excellent Japanese food and atmosphere at the Bellagio!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna pizza w/ truffle oil

VdYsHPJ6rMSftgS3A2Vm9A.text: We came in last minute on a busy Sunday at prime dinner time and the hostess that evening was able to accommodate us and sat us on the patio within ten minutes without reservation. We were able to enjoy the fountain show throughout our dinner. Our waiter, Mr Mykkhul, provided us with excellent customer service and the food was scrumptious! I highly recommend the ceviche and of course the yellowtail with jalepeno. Thank you for an wonderful night!

VV1DFAY2xb6TRHERpLeq1w.text: We were greeted by the promoter who promised he could deliver lawyers and a private jet if we needed it. After that arrogance passed, we proceeded to wait for an hour for 5 very basic sushi rolls. My friend (me) was so hungry that he literally ate a chopstick.

_yMW0GcP073gbEZAt-vv2A.text: The food here is in one word average,  and that ruined it for me.   The sushi was so normal and one specialty roll costs $35 and was mediocre.  The service was amazing though,  and ambiance was perfect.

odgEwQueoGWMojzgq9Qm2A.text: Don't know were to start.  First I have to say for the amount of food they give you, this is one of the most overpriced sushi places I have ever been to.  I ordered the salmon sashimi for starters and they brought me a bucket of ice with 3 slices of sashimi on it that was carved with a slicer as thin as paper...come on..give me a break, this is not my first time in a high class sushi place....then I ordered the california roll and salmon avocado roll...nothing out of the ordinary but way too expensive....I still could not get passed the sashimi and how little it was, although the bucket of ice was Bigggg...never ever going to that resturant again....Avoid at all costs...sleep hungry but don't go to this rip off place....

P5WuaL-txyQPWvRh8by4nQ.text: Delicious, Pricey and Fancy.  All that is Vegas. We were one of the first to arrive since they open for dinner only, and we got great service because of it!   We ordered the Kobe beef tacos which were just awesome.  The meat was so savory and a little sweet - so good - and the little chips turned taco shells just came out of the fryer and still warm.   We also order Cali Rolls, which were also good.  And a cucumber salad - a nice addition. The hubby ordered 10 pcs of sushi - Unagi, Salmon, Squid (super chewy) and Tuna.  He was all about it, I took a pass.  I had my fill of apps and was satisfied. I love Sapporo so I stuck with that, but Joe had the Cucumber Essence - which is made up of cucumber infused vodka and other light yummy mix ins that made for one deliciously refreshing drink.   It's expensive.  But we were ready for that - we were at the Bellagio, after all.  I would go back just for the tacos! This one faces the fountains with some outdoor seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jlVJVTjDAhGGh72iLvUcog.text: First time dining at YellowTail. We ordered the miso soup and red dragon roll. Both were quite good. They were lite and delicious. The only complaint was the price. With drinks, we spent $80. Not thrilled, but enjoyable experience. We will mostly stop by next time we are in Vegas.

E1m7UI9PpksZh-efr_UWKg.text: Moderate food and service. Highly over-priced.

yeA8IzsUmBWSfJ69KprpHw.text: We got a 7 course tasting menu. First dish big eye tuna pizza (really great), second course was halibut sashimi with sauce (decent not my favorite), next was tuna with mustard sauce (pretty good). Next course hot grilled wallow with shiitake mushroom (awesomeness), Kobe beef with carrot and potato and see weed (awesome), sushi chefs selection was ok. And dessert was decent. Overall I would t recommend the tasting menu order off the menu. The sake flight was great

Y6LrgsRl5e_5YlYYtdXJ0g.text: Huminahuminahuminayummmmmmmm. I had a wonderful meal here!  yellowtail serrano- so sadly I can't remember, but instead of the yellowtail, we got a different type of yellowtail that was butterier than regular yellowtail. Can a sushi expert help me out here??? Anyway, it was sitting in a blood orange sauce with little serrano peppers and micro cilantro. The presentation was beautiful and the dressings were subtle, not cutting into the glorious stand-alone flavor of the fish itself.  foie gras torchon - two slices of foie gras with a nicely sized scallop, and an oyster. break it down! - I would have liked to see the foie gras seared, but that's ok, that's ok, it was still a decadent heap of fatty goodness that dissolved on my tongue bite after bite. The oyster was perfectly cooked, which is to say, nearly not cooked on the inside. It was fresh and delicious, but I could lose the weird crunchy balls that had been sprinkled no the top. Nearly ruined it for me. And lastly the japanese oyster sitting in the middle off the plate was to die for. Meaty, fresh and not fish. It didn't taste horrendously like the sea. It was covered in watery, salty juices. It was just a clean, fat, oyster.  Toro and scallion roll - there's not much to say. They make this everywhere because it's a classic and it works. The fish was good, the rice was good, it was a solid roll, But not if you're looking for something special.  Uni sushi- Since this is synonymous with awesome, there is nothing more I can say.  And the Bellagio is such a beautiful and romantic place. You really can't ask for more for a lovely, romantic, dining experience.
