r6tLqMQL3ZzoVnFhv6bNfA.text: This place was tight like my bung when its cold outside in the snow snow. The waitresses think they are real sexy and mysterious but in reality they are only semi sexi and looking like Mysterio from Spiderman. Food was tasty, but with this price tag, the food better make me blast off to outer space with the Los Locos way!!! Sushi was decent, but the winner was the tuna pizza with truffle oil. So that speaks on its own. The best item on the entire menu.... was a pizza.

cA86xclFY41BSO0Wx-8p0Q.text: I've since been contacted via email by the GM of Yellowtail. His acknowledgement of my experience coupled with what I read as very genuine concern and dismay over the incident and the way things were handled have removed any lingering bitterness I've been feeling. I'll be back.

0SNtxoBeZXZNLGylTtMurg.text: Didn't have a reservation so ended up waiting at least 30 minutes for a table Saturday night which meant eating around 10PM. Sat in front of the fish tail and loved taking pictures of it and people watching.  Here's what we ordered: -seaweed salad ($8): good, but too bad it was such a tiny plate! -strawberry roll (spicy tuna, avocado & tempura flake): awesome with the fresh strawberries...who knew fruit and sushi could mix well?! -yellowtail scallion (hamachi & green onion): average -unagi (cucumbers, sesame seeds, eel sauce): average unagi roll  Our bill wasn't too bad for 3 people (about $24/person) and that's not with alcoholic drinks. Service was average. I just enjoyed the people watching from my dinner seat.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2ix72xxuHaIRp8W5MGId4g.text: Like others who have reviewed this restaurant, the service is pretty off. One sushi roll, when the restaurant was barely half full, took forever to come out. I know creating sushi takes time, but it was as if the chefs forgot to make enough rice and had to cook it first.  The cocktails are pretty good so probably the best option is to get some drinks and sit on the patio and watch the fountains. Avoid the food unless you have $ to blow and are too lazy to go to Sushi Samba.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tIQvUKM6fCnT_xpNmqsavQ.text: Very unique sushi restaurant! We really enjoyed the entire experience and will return on our next visit to Vegas.

Rp4XswBNHg8sV2m2mVM-lA.text: My amazing boyfriend took me here as a surprise 3 years ago for my birthday.  Since then, we have made it a tradition to dine here every May for my birthday. Everything about this restaurant is beautiful especially the food. Patio seating is the way to go as this is the only place I've sat while dining here.   The food is amazing. I've had the omakase twice and on our last visit, our awesome waiter Emmanuel recommended the Greatest Hits menu. Definitely was not a disappointment. I love the tuna pizza the best!! It's a definite a must-try!!!    I love Yellowtail and the food is amazing! If you don't want to pay $$$$, then go to spring mountain and find an AYCE sushi restaurant.

LPETu1oq1g91SJSSmF2E4A.text: Yellowtail never disappoints! One of my favorite sushi restaurants on the strip. Everything from the Big Eye Tuna Pizza, Rock Shrimp, Miso Black Cod to my ultimate favorite sushi roll ever, Mile High Roll! It is out of this world!!! Also celebrating a private event coming up for my birthday and coordinating with the Restaurant Group Sales Coordinator couldn't have been easier. Julia was so helpful and accommodating. Definitely go to Yellowtail next time you're in town and craving sushi!

q0pcnYHU_4aGXPRWJ9CN7Q.text: My trips to this Japanese Restaurant have all been excellent. From the ambience, great servers, to the food and the beautiful view of the Bellagio fountain, it has never gone wrong.   My friends and I ate dinner here before going into Hyde Nightclub. Since we came with a large group we all ordered a bunch of shared plates which was fun because most of us were able to try a variety of the chef's choices. My favorite plates were the Yellowtail Serrano, Big Eye Tuna Pizza, Kobe Beef Tataki, and the Lobster Carpaccio.   Downside: It is quite pricey.

hrs0oYJpRbi6Der-yxkCvw.text: Hip, swanky sushi and Japanese bar & restaurants...  We order the house special dishes and they were all good.  Didn't care for the rolls that much.   Overall a bit pricy but it's VEGAS!!!  Will come back for the special apps and cocktails

WvdvPuqW116gbStnsFRhkw.text: Good sushi is hard to find.    I am certainly no sushi expert. I know the basics and that's about it, but, I do appreciate sushi that is fresh and prepared correctly.  I hate rolls that fall apart when they hit the chopsticks. That's not the case here... every thing is fresh and tightly wrapped.  I also love that this restaurant isn't afraid to to take chances. You can go to hundreds of Japanese restaurants and see the same exact menu... but to see things like sushi made with pop rocks or big eye tuna pizza- that jumps off the page. I love the originality!  The pop rock sushi was fun. The taste of sushi was fresh and delicious and then the aftertaste of the pop rocks fizzing in your mouth made it even more enjoyable. The tuna was delectable as well. Fresh and plenty of flavor and surprisingly easy to chew. I had other sushi rolls like spicy tuna and eel and avocado but those two items were the most memorable.  Also worth noting is the view. If you are fortunate enough to get a view of the fountain it doesn't get any better than that.  As many have already mentioned, the only complaint are the prices. The portions aren't large so you have to order a lot and then you are stuck with a huge bill.

wHxuPXae8k0fTAoheIWhvA.text: Absolutely the best meal I've ever had in Vegas.  A bit about the restaurant- perfectly located next to the water, you can sneak a peak of the fountains if you're lucky during dinner. The service was impeccable. The ambiance was elegant and trendy. The noise level was not too loud.  The menu is fresh, creative, and intriguing. My personal fav was the pop rocks sushi roll (sweet and savory were well-balanced here) and the Big Eye Tuna Pizza (what in the world is on here and how was it SO amazing?!). Other notable awesome dishes were Rock Shrimp and Tempura Alaskan King Crab.  Yellowtail will be my first stop when I return to the strip!

dzzoUdB5k6dFH5xU0ePOFQ.text: I would NOT eat here again.  The food way way too expensive for what we got.  We ordered a bottle of wine and I felt we got regular casino everyday glassware.   I would expect a nice expensive restaurant to have decent glasses not a glass you would receive while gambling or something.      The tuna pizza was good but presentation rather boring.  We also ordered Kumamoto oysters which was about $32 for 6 and it was not anywhere near Asian inspired I felt like it was something I would have got at an Italian place.   Oysters and cocktail sauce is basically what we got.   We ordered the filet toban as well which smelled awesome but was nothing special.   The crispy kalbi roll was delicious but presentation was lacking!!!!    Now I don't mind spending money on my meal if the food and presentation and service was great but I wasn't really happy when I left.  The service was rushed and she didn't really listen to us, plus she kept telling us that was probably enough food in which was not and felt that she didn't have time for us.   Maybe she just wanted us to leave.  We were helped by another man who was dressed in a chef coat who was not the chef but was helping out he said and he was very personable and helpful more than our server was.  She kinda disappear towards the end.  I Have high expectations for a restaurant in Bellagio and was highly disappointed.  Food was ok...service lacking....and food presentation pretty plain.  Prices should be much lower for the quality of everything.    Even a sushi roll was between 20 and 30 which is fine is it's exceptional.  If you're looking for delicious Asian food Andreas at Wynn or chada Thai near China town is great and you get what you pay for!

A3h_BX06f3QMkMEKBZFaiA.text: Horrible hostess's! My son who is autistic has been coming here for 6 years on his bday..... they dissed him even tho we had a reservation for the balcony. Staff felt horrible and encouraged us to speak with the manager... he was reluctant, but finally sat us.. and the table they were "reserving " remained empty the entire time we were there.... next year we will go somewhere else....

dwbicdF4AGnIGj2iTMWBVw.text: So it is bound to happen. I finally have had the best bite of my life. It happened tonight. Yellowtail. Bellagio. No more to be said other than thank you Chef Akita Back for the experience of what sushi should be. Thank you for the shots. You are a rock star!

sK3wA7xumSQ8KXNpwH3ddg.text: Shared the big eye tuna pizza, happa roll, tempura Alaskan king crab, and seaweed salad. I enjoyed it all. My favorite was the pizza because I love truffle anything, but the tempura crab and happa roll were excellent as well. My husband wasn't a fan of the pizza, but he loved the other 2 items, and he's not a big sushi guy. The happa roll had a little kick in the sauce provided. The seaweed salad was mediocre, just like any other seaweed salad at any other sushi joint, save yourself $9 on that. We stuck to water, so can't comment on the beverages. Waitstaff was courteous, on point with checking on us and refilling our water, and helpful with the menu items as we were newbies. Over all a great experience, and I'd say worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seaweed salad
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big eye tuna pizza
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura Alaskan king crab and happa roll

EaEHpu3lgmb68yJA4qw6Xg.text: I came to Yellowtail for dinner after my conference ended at Caesar's.  We were looking for a place to accommodate 5 people with varying levels of hunger.  Overall the food was actually pretty good (shared edamame, we all got different types of sushi, and my client also got gyoza).  They made a decent Old Fashioned.  The sushi rolls were SMALL--way smaller than anything I've gotten here in Boston, but the sushi quality was surprisingly good.  Overall service was pretty slow, but that's kind of what you get in Vegas.  A decent place for dinner, but I probably wouldn't go back (seeing as there are many other places to try that might be better).

6Xux-KSw9ZiMtdZcqqD_bw.text: Just left Yellowtail. I asked my wife to drive so I could write this review. Just couldn't wait. I love the service, the atmosphere, and best of all, the food.   The lobster carpaccio changed my life. Our waiter was very attentive. Sake selection is amazing. Demon Slayer Junmai Ginjo was amazing.  Thank you guys for a wonderful time will be back soon.

-HQJ_-Riajo0s58mXQbxXw.text: I have gone to Vegas many times and have been to Yellowtail on a few of those trips. It is a very pretty restaurant located in the Bellagio Shops not far from the Casino entrance. There is a long bar in front and the dining in the back which also includes out door dining that overlooks the Bellagio Fountains and the show they put on. The environment is chic, comfortable and the staff is very good.  The bar is very petty and they make a great drink something many sushi places don't do well. Here the drinks are strong, it could be because it's Vegas. The staff is knowledgeable.  The food is fantastic. Plates tend to be small but that works well as it lets you order many different things. Some stand outs from the shared plates for me are the Lobster Carpaccio and the Yellowtail Serrano amazingly light and citrusy but both with some spice to them. Both of these are cold plates and i could not get enough. We reordered these multiple times. The warm shared plates i enjoyed were the Black Code and Seafood Dynamite. Both were wonderfully balanced with many layers of flavor.  We ordered quite a bit of sushi and i am not sure now what all of it was. I had my standard Dragon Roll, Tempura Shrimp and then some of their specialty rolls. Fish was very fresh and the rolls were made well. All of it was good. I am not a dessert eater but the Chocolate in a Cup was excellent. Their Lava Cake is also good.

UENpHP8id7GM1OZw40it1A.text: Absolutely incredible!! Chef Akira is absolutely a genius. The flavor profiles are amazing. The portions may be small but that's because each dish is handcrafted and loaded with flavor. Hands down amazing!!!!!!! This is a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r-iizW2f3oSRYLbm-BZ8UA.text: It was one of The Worst Japanese restaurant we ever went to.  Sushi was cut paper thin and charging $15 for 2 pieces...they should be embarrassed to even call them self as a Japanese restaurant.

omfNn_xrEqZcYXd30Ke6Sg.text: Very yummie sushi restaurant on the strip. The food was excellent and presentation was amazing! I love it when dining out, I can tell others about an amazing dish that I had that I just had to rave about! In this case, Yellowtail offers a really neat sushi roll called "the popping spicy crab" that has pop rocks candy embedded inside!!! It totally rocked my taste buds! I felt like I was playing with my food. It was soo cool. Also, the "big eye tuna pizza" is a must order as well! Lychee martini was puree perfectly and it wasn't too strong.   I WOULD have given this place an extra star but I felt that the service was a tad lazy that night. I even ended up walking up to the hostess desk to ask for my bill and WATER! I usually ward people away from place that has poor service but the food here is so divine!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big eye tuna pizza!! Bomb assssss

2rIeQqIKTVoIGevnJ97e6A.text: Everything in Vegas is pricey...Get over it, you are in VEGAS.  The scallops were OUTSTANDING, the duck warm app was fantastic and the roll was fresh and flavorful..  The food was great but what made the night was our server Thio. He was awesome!!! Gave great suggestions as to what to order and conversed with us for most of the evening. For sure a place that we would return next time.

LK_vv6JEGU2pCrc13upbZQ.text: Great food and service. Way better then our Morimoto experience. Excellent sake and wine menu. Will definitely be coming back.

D6mcyCtatnHMfmPOLHPUIA.text: Made a BIRTHDAY reservation and got charged for my birthday dessert........ Managers just pacing around and not asking how the $200.00 worth of sushi was.. will never return and do not recommend. For Vegas, this is sad. I'll go drop my money at a Nobu restaurant. At least they'll probably comp my dessert for my BIRTHDAY!

1Kv4wdsQ92IDxsasrWEYtg.text: Yelps 365 Review Challenge - Los Angeles #17 - #365  Overall, Yellowtail was, mehh...  My Dad was craving some Japanese in Bellagio and Yellowtail was the only one that came to mind, plus the wait wasn't that long. I was craving sushi as well and I LOVE SUSHI! I really though this sushi place was worth the high price tag like in many strip hotels.   The food was mediocre and had no WOW factor!   We ordered:  Big Eye Tuna Pizza* Micro Shiso, Truffle Oil * 26  -Meh.. Nothing special  Ankimo Monkfish Liver Pate, Citrus Soy * 10  -You can find the same quality in almost any other city Japanese restaurant  *Edamame Maldon Sea Salt * 8  -Just lovely  Spicy Miso Crab, Negi, Wakame * 8  -Delish  Shrimp Tempura Cucumber, Aioli, Sesame Seeds 15  -Was very rich and tasty, yet overpriced  Japanese Yellowtail - Hamachi 14 -Yummy ummy!  Overall, I wouldn't eat here unless I'm not paying.

NV3OOaB9-HzAr74u_P3jlA.text: Don't go here expecting the best sushi you'll ever eat, but go here and sit on the patio if you want a great view the fountains (you'll be so close you'll get hit by the spray at the end of each performance, but it's not bad at all).  The sushi is just okay, a little pricey for what it is, but beer & wine selection was pretty good.

f8_0zOtSPxXIdb8BNsA-ow.text: wtf hype.  The waiter makes the food sound a lot more interesting then it really is.  The portions are SMALL as heck for the amount of money you pay.  Ok, this is really a case of quality over quantity but the quality was barely there to justify the cost.  If you get seating here on a night try to request to sit outside.  You'll be able to see the Paris's Eiffel tower from across the way and there is a water show.  You mostly come here for the view but don't come starving!!  Yellowtail Japanese Restaurant & Lounge's Score - 77 Points

JulGH4WcZh7FdQ87pDRJgA.text: This beautiful, modern, Japanese restaurant situated inside of the Bellagio hotel offers a wide variety of cold and cooked dishes on the menu, all of which are geared towards sharing.  The soft shell crab was delicious and so was the yellowtail roll.         For a refreshing cocktail, try the Sunset.  It is made with grey goose, blood orange pure and yuzu.  For something sweet and bubbly, the sparkling infused blueberry sake is amazing.  This restaurant is just as good for large groups as it is for a small intimate dinner.  But if you would like to take advantage of its location overlooking the famous fountains on the eight acre lake, make sure to request a table by the window or even outside on the patio.

djeoXMJHfXa1cyDfCYh46g.text: Very rude waiter.... I couldn't believe it. My husband and I came there to celebrate him returning from a deployment and the waiter didn't even care to really mention anything. Also, the sushi was very delicious but wayyy overpriced.   I would say I'm pleased I came here once to try out the food and that main fact that we had an amazing view of the fountain show at the bellagio-- but otherwise we will not be coming back here again.

uHMnPYDEKMgFrJYyjz51-w.text: Try to seat outside. Can't go wrong with sushi and the fountain show.  Food is average to be honest.

7YWC789SxqS9rZ3pjHK7jQ.text: I love this place! The view of the Bellagio Fountains is real nice and I love the dimly lit atmosphere. The food is amazing. You must try the spicy popping crab, I think that is what it is called. It's spicy tuna roll with pop rocks in it. Very interesting, but delicious and fun. The chicken entree is delicious and the kobe beef flat iron is amazing and a must try. Their spicy edamame is real tasty. The place is a little pricey, but the service is excellent.

kmiO__qsKFCsTcf6iQtenw.text: 4 words: Big. eye. tuna. pizza.  Holy cow, this is a fabulous dish.  It is listed under the "Shared Plates" part of the menu but I can guarantee that on my next visit, I am getting one of those suckers all to myself.  Maybe two.  It is that delicious.  My husband had tried it before and was raving about it ever since, so I tried to manage my expectations, but he wasn't exaggerating, it is that good.  I am not even going to bother describing it, because no description would do it justice.  It is just a flavor explosion in your mouth.  Period.    I am quite serious about ordering two for myself next time.  One to start and one to finish my meal.  In between I will order the Uni Sushi again, and the addition of the quail egg, really put these 2 pieces of sea urchin sushi over the top.  The baked crab roll is also fabulous.  My husband and I shared it, and I may just have to get an order for myself next time because the crispy onions, spicy aioli, in the soy paper was fabulous.  I was literally "mmmmm"-ing after every bite.    We also ordered the Popping Spicy Crab just because it is such a unique dish that we had to try it at least once.  Not only was this meal a pleasure for the senses of taste, smell, and sight...it was quite an experience for the ears too.  When the dish was placed on our table, you could hear the pop rocks popping away.  It was actually quite tasty.  Who knew that the sweet and crunchy pop rocks would be a great compliment to the spicy crab? Chef Akira, obviously.    My husband's favorite seafood is scallops and so we had to order the Seared Diver Sea Scallops, and it was seared perfectly and accompanied by a mustard potato puree.  It wasn't my favorite, but my husband loved it.  Fine with me, because that just meant more room for another order of uni.  From start to finish, I had a smile on my face.  With a fantastic view of the Bellagio fountain show and a tall glass of Asahi Black, I was in heaven.    The service was impeccable.  I highly recommend that you ask to be seated in Roberto's section if you want amazing service.  I was quite pleasantly surprised with this meal.  For years, I have walked past this restaurant in the Bellagio, not giving it a second look.  But, from now on, I will be salivating every time as I imagine the big eye tuna pizza.  If they were open for lunch, I would be there right now.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni sushi. Must add the quail egg!
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popping spicy crab roll. You can almost hear it.
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big eye tuna pizza. Possibly the greatest thing I have ever eaten.

0R_STj1qeU8GIm-vIGdjaA.text: We've eaten here many times and it doesn't disappoint.  Favs: Tuna Pizza (OMG), Rock Shrimp, popping crab roll, Edamame in the chili sauce, basically any special of the night.  The cocktail with cucumber was AWESOME!    3 complaints: Sake menu is pretty unfamiliar for most people, and the very nice girl who helped us by making recommendations only pointed out extremely expensive bottles, like $250+... ummmm... no.  So we felt like douches because despite everything she suggested, we chose an $80 bottle because that's more reasonable for us... to us, it's sake.  It's not Opus One.  Some people might disagree, but I just wish her suggestions were a bit more varied.   Secondly, the seating is too close together.  The tables where we were seated are all situated along a bench, and you sit THISCLOSE to strangers right next to you.  It makes for an uncomfortable dinner, because I didn't feel like I could talk to my husband freely without feeling like everyone was listening in to our conversation.  Lastly, when you order lots of small plates, I expect the server to stagger them so that you receive one or two, and then you get a break between.  This is the way our meals have always been at Yellowtail in the past.  This time, our table was suddenly loaded down with all 4 of our choices within maybe 10 minutes time (or likely less).  We felt very rushed and not relaxed at all.  That part sucked.  If the service had been a bit better and we hadn't been jammed in with strangers, this rating would be much higher.  The food itself and the atmosphere is amazing.

Yov2YF5hZyrvGpvsog0fRA.text: Everything was amazing and I enjoyed my birthday meal very much the place is so beautiful I would definitely come back again

0q-5s63Qqq6Vj7lNTkIC4w.text: The wait staff was very friendly and helpful. They knew what they were talking about and presented every dish to us with a description. I got the chefs tasting menu, which was amazing, the last few dishes weren't up to the price. But the first four were worth the entire bill. The atmosphere it absolutely beautiful. The tuna tartar pizza is a must have. If you can afford it and enjoy sushi or Japanese cuisine do not pass it up

0gDYoKax1vS3cG4m2HLn6Q.text: Ask to sit on the balcony, you'll get front row seats to the Bellagio water show. The sushi was good but not the best for the price they charge. Service is attentive and very nice. Overall good experience

lpj3VUaoypLWMRv0g7hccw.text: Our experience at this restaurant is the impetus  for writing my first review on yelp. My wife and I read the mixed reviews and decided to try it since we love sushi and unique dining experiences. I'd  have to say, this was one of the only vegas "higher end" meals that had left us disappointed, and sorry we didn't heed the warnings of those who had been disappointed  before us. We eat a LOT of sushi,  probably 6x or more a month. We tried two rolls (for a total of OVER $50) and were  completely  underwhelmed.  I've paid the same for similar sized rolls at sushi roku in Ceasars and didn't regret the price for a second because it was that good. Yellowtail? Meh.. ok flavor, pretty small size. Then we ordered  salmon sushi. My wife and I both laughed out loud when the order came. Others have scoffed at the size of the sushi pieces and we should have listened. I honestly can't even describe how small they were. I guess the best I could day is, take a standard "pink eraser" from when you were a kid in school, cut it in half, and that's the size of the order.  For $12. And, it was just ok.   Then we get to the service. We were in vegas on a Sunday night. It was dead. Walked right into this place and could have had a seat on the terrace on the fountains had we asked. That's how dead it was. The waiter was running around like he had never been busier, checked on us maybe once and in the midst of his "rush" failed to bring a BOWL OF RICE that we ordered for my son. We had two rolls and a salmon sushi delivered approximately 20+ minutes after we had ordered, ate them and then sat around waiting for him to come back. He looked shocked when he asked if we wanted anything  else and I asked if we could get the food we ordered in the first place before we moved on to anything else.   My wife and I eat out A LOT. It's a passion to try new things and explore new places. This place fell dead flat. Extremely disappointed  and thus, doubtful  we would ever return. Too many other great options out there. Not to mention much cheaper. It's unfortunate.  Great location and concept and beautiful decor.

VuDBGiynJy4mpghthEV-Nw.text: I agree with the others, this place is overpriced! My eyeballs had the $$ in them as I scan the menu.   My mister and I had our dinner here on our very last night in Vegas. I choose this place because I saw the chef on the Bellagio info tv channel making the popular big eye tuna pizza dish. Just to clarify, this is not your cheese and tomato pie, but slices of tuna on a crisp tortilla bread and sliced onions with truffle oil sprinkled on top. That was $26! Yes, that was our appetizer and it was really delish and one of the most creative dishes that I've had in a long time. I ordered a Lychee martini - $20, for that drink.   The mister decided that we should go with the chef's seven course tasting menu. The last time we ate a chef's tasting menu anywhere was ages ago, so why not, the mister was treating the Mrs. Here is the breakdown of the chef Akira Back menu:   1. Seafood Pate with a tiny, delish sugary treat (I didn't like this)  2. Sliced Yellowtail with jalapenos  3. Salad with greens, tomato, & onions  4. Salmon with miso sauce and foam  5. Kobe short ribs with a quail egg and star shaped veggies  6. 5 pieces of sushi (sushi was average)  7. Green tea mousse cake with a shot of milk.   Portions are small so this tasting menu made our stomach at that beginning feeling at full. Believe me, there will be no leftovers to wrap up and I made sure that I drank very sip of my lychee martini. Overall, I loved my experience at Yellowtail. The waiter was awesome as he made sure we done on time as we had to leave for our show. The ambiance is beautiful, so chic, and very romantic. This restaurant has a beautiful view of the fountain show. I would come back just for the tuna pizza and ambiance. As for the prices, you will be spending part of the jackpot you've won OR considered what you've paid to eat here as a part of your gambling losses.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail view of fountains
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lychee martini - delish!
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green mousse cake with milk

qQFqo6eKacsVrMyl3WwQZw.text: Lets begin with the amazing view from the balcony. Loved it!! We saw four water ballet shows. I had the crispy short rib sushi. OMG the flavor, it was one of my favorite food items in Vegas. I was terrible sadden to leave. I've been looking for something similar here in the DC area and have yet to find it. The hubby had the Japanese eel, was so good he asked for seconds. Try the sparkling Sake too. GREAT FOOD, GREAT SERVICE, GREAT VIEW!

W3jVvFlw1eFfcJ1wXUZwTA.text: Sushi has been ruined for me forever after eating here. Nowhere in California will ever match the quality, creativity and taste of what Chef Akira Back has created.  Do not leave here without trying the Big Eye Tuna pizza. In fact, even if you are not planning on eating dinner here, have a cocktail and this as an appetizer, you will not regret it.  You might want to shy away from sushi with, wait for it...pop rocks in the "popping spicy crab" roll, but don't be scared! It comes out popping loud enough for you to hear. The flavor it brings to the roll is unmatchable.   The service is stellar.  I recommend having a pre-dinner cocktail upstairs at Hyde. Enjoy the view before you enjoy an unforgettable meal.

zieFOpUe7goU88MHrCorWg.text: Worst place ever! Ordered food, waited over an hour. Asked when it would come and we were forgotten after we have were told five times,  "your food is coming" I will never come back here!

8sQ41oLPIf6rssvPFdxK9A.text: What kind of sushi place doesn't have normal soy sauce your food it way to expensive and frankly not worth it at all

nV1ZSmmDwxvZaVPaltE6Tg.text: I can honestly say that eating here was one of my favorite experiences of my most recent Vegas trip.    If you're gonna eat here, do it right.  Get a table outside on the Terrace.  There is no better view in Vegas of those Bellagio fountains and the strip in general.  It's relaxing, it's beautiful, it's romantic, just great.    The service is as friendly as you can find.  Our waiter was constantly checking on us and making recommendations.    We started with the garden salad which was good but the dressing was a little saltier than I expected, I think I was just prepared for something sweeter based on the smell.  I love that they bring you two different types of edamame.  The original style with salt, and a spicy/sweet marinated type.  Both were great.  The sushi was very fresh... I only wish i would have had room to try their amazing sounding current specials.. I assumed I wouldn't get full so fast!  The drinks are soo tasty... and at $20 a piece, they better be! The essence is by far the best.  If you're outside in that vegas heat, the essence is the perfect drink to cool you down.

ZEmSmbSQ2D30_Ou0QQsFOw.text: Yellowtail has it all, amazing view of the Bellagio fountains, outstanding service and unique one of a kind food. Expect to try something completely out of the ordinary here - this is sushi with a twist.  After being seated promptly by a lovely hostess (we were a little late but it didn't matter to them) we were shown our table right by the window which overlooked the Bellagio fountains. I'd heard about Yellowtail's sparkling blueberry sake before hand and it was gorgeous, a definate must try.  For starters we ordered the Tuna pizza which is pretty much what it says on the tin. It was good, unusual, tasty. We then went for Akira's "Shooter" which was an oyster, blueberry sake and wasabi served in a shotg glass. This was too cool, not for the brave, but we like a culinary adventure and so we ordered seconds!!  After quite a few appetizers we had a small selection of sushi including the strawberry roll which was amazing - totally unique and beautiful.  The setting and tone for this restaurant are amazing, that complemented by it's fabulous food and great service make for a beautiful meal. Expect to pay a little more but for us it was well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Pizza and Oyster Shooters - seriously yum!

VSAttYjZh1gyeQcnbUnNFg.text: Some of the best sushi I've had in Las Vegas. To counter some of the subpar reviews, especially on account of the price, I have to say:welcome to Las Vegas. Yellowtail is in the Bellagio. The Bellagio is known for it's exceptional dining scene. This will cost you. I don't think this fact should affect Yellowtail's rating. The quality of the food, dedication of the service, and ambiance make this a very solid 4 star choice.

7OWQGlNq04iL0bSOJUaeoA.text: I love this place. Great for a quick drink and some great sushi. The ambiance and service is great! We definitely will be back.

gd7tlGMrWjSjDT0GEwIefg.text: I ate at this restaurant and had the best service and food. Tried their salmon which was the best I ever ate. Desserts were too notch too. I will go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scottish Salmon, mango sorbet, Black &amp; White Sesame Matcha Cake

XoQhfOxeeZXUqBHeElYFjA.text: Having eaten four meals here to date, it is a great place to go; a favorite of mine for Las Vegas. I recommend the sushi roll with the pop rocks in it.  The only problem here is the hostess stand. They do not effectively manage arrivals. Reservations get seated simultaneously to walk-ins. In the time it takes to look up your reservation, two other parties are taken outside for the fountain view. Given the highly limited amount of seating outside, this can be frustrating.  Overall, if you're a sushi person, I highly recommend the experience; get there early for a good seat, the balcony is full within half an hour of opening.

oQ1qOlIyB14LuP-u87sTWA.text: One of the best places to munch, if you're staying at the Bellagio. I've ordered several dishes as a snack, not necessarily as my dinner. They were fulfilling as my afternoon snack, and they also tasted good. It was a win win!  I had the hamachi jalapeno, which is one of my favorites. Their sashimi meat wasn't as thick as others, but the jalapeno (obviously) was spicy enough. I might've enjoyed better with a side of sushi rice, but since I wasn't hungry, I had it just as is. I also had a few other of their amazing meals. 1 was their popular ahi tuna pizza. I may not have been a big fan, but my dining mate loved the dish.   My favorite was popping spicy crab roll. There was a surprise hint of Pop Rocks, which I did not expect. It was very refreshing but also a good surprise to the dish. I'm surprised this place only has 3.5 stars! Beware, it is pricey, but if you're at Bellagio, what else do you expect? If you walk in knowing that it's not going to be a cheap bite, you'll have much of a better experience. I had a great time. Plus, free Shogun Shot with Yelp check in! Go get their yummy drinks & food!

ijROQZs1znh3Ixkx3BL2aQ.text: Wow very expensive for what you get and the portions are tiiiiny. Ordered a few rolls. My favorite would be the protein roll. The spicy miso has a great kick to it. We also ordered the short ribs and at 42 dollars it was definitely over priced. I could eat a whole Korean barbecue dinner for one at the price. Even AYCE in La. The quality is good though,  but I probably won't be back due to the outrageous prices.

1msSAm0rQSLDIQMsgIzEVQ.text: Absolutely delicious. I went with some friends and got a few plates. I can't remember the chicken plate but it melted in my mouth. Staff is friendly as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My date always on his phone

HtHc6TAQPBtF-37l31dc1g.text: Terrible service!  Before I continue talking about the horrible service, I want to give my compliments to the chef.  The food was delicious and it would have been an even better experience if we received the A5 wagyu that we had ordered.  More on that later.  Now I want to focus on the horrible service my family and I received starting from the beginning when we arrived.  Negative #1:  Immediately the hostess tells us that we have to place our child's stroller in the manager's office because they have no place for it at our table.  Ummm...we were seated at a table that had a spot big enough for me to lie down and stretch out.  So there was more than enough room for our stroller.  What really upset me is when I saw someone leaving the dining area WITH THEIR CHILD'S STROLLER!  IF YOU ARE GOING TO APPLY A POLICY...APPLY TO ALL!    Negative #2:  Our waitress was the worst!  It took her almost 10 minutes from the time she said Hello to us to the time she took our order.    Negative #3:  We had to flag our waitress numerous times to ask her where our appetizers and dinner items were.  I get that it was a busy time at 630pm.  So, you would think she would at least keep us updated from time to time instead of us having to ask often.  There were literally dead times (several times) between the delivery of our different dinner items as long as 10 minutes each!    Negative #4:  At the beginning when we placed our order, we asked for miso soup, but we never got it until we inquired about it which was at least 1 hour after we arrived!    Negative #5:  WE NEVER GOT THE A5 WAGYU THAT WE WERE LOOKING FORWARD FOR OUR PARENTS TO HAVE EVEN THOUGH WE KEPT ASKING WHEN IT WOULD ARRIVE.  THAT WAS THE MAIN POINT OF US GOING OVER TO THIS RESTAURANT.    Negative #6: THE MANAGER CAME OVER TO ME AND TOLD ME THAT A RUNNER HAD DELIVERED THE WAGYU.   I SAID, "NO, WE NEVER RECEIVED IT".  HE KEPT INSISTING IT WAS DELIVERED AND THEN HAD THE AUDACITY TO ASK IF WE REMEMBER IF WE RECEIVED IT.  HELLO!!!  I SAID WE NEVER RECEIVED IT!  WHO CAN FORGET ABOUT EATING 8 OZ. OF WAGYU THAT WOULD HAVE COSTED $400!!!  HOW DARE HE ASK ME THIS...INSULTING MY MEMORY!  Suggestion to this restaurant...DO NOT QUESTION THE CUSTOMER ESPECIALLY IF THEY ALREADY SAID THEY DIDN'T RECEIVE IT AND  ESPECIALLY IF THEY HAVE BEEN ASKING TO RECEIVE THE ITEM NUMEROUS TIMES!  QUESTION YOUR EMPLOYEES AND THEIR POOR SERVICE!  MAYBE THEY ATE IT?  WE SURE DIDN'T!    Negative #7:  When I made our reservation, I mentioned that it was our parents' 51st anniversary.  At every restaurant that I have been too, when they knew we were celebrating an occasion, they would have some type of dessert.  You would think being at a high end restaurant at the Bellagio, you would receive the same treatment if not more...especially since our bill was $700 without the wagyu.  All my parents received at the end was someone greeting them "Happy Anniversary".  Wow...that's it?    Negative #8:  We had to flag someone for our check because once again our waitress was nowhere in sight.  When we received our bill, we paid for it and didn't give a tip to her due to her horrible service and due to the manager questioning us.  Instead, we tipped the guy $100 who paid attention to us over 15 times giving us water and clearing our plates because he did what we expected him to do at this high end establishment...he did his job!    Negative #9:  This one takes the cake... the  waitress who gave us horrible slow service finally ran so quickly to us outside the restaurant...not to finally give us good service...but to ask for her tip saying that they DIDN'T charge us the tip. I said, "I know.  We gave our tip to the guy who gave us excellent service, but we didn't give you a tip because you were so slow to service us and we had to keep flagging you down".    WORD OF ADVICE TO ALL THE WAITERS AND WAITRESSES OUT THERE:  A TIP IS EXTRA MONEY ASIDE FROM YOUR WAGE WHICH IS BASED ON SERVICE.  IF YOU WANT A TIP, THEN GIVE AT LEAST GOOD SERVICE, IF U WANT A BETTER TIP, THEN GIVE EXCELLENT SERVICE, IF YOU WANT AN AWESOME TIP, THEN GIVE OUTSTANDING SERVICE.

tHijk5e_KRJEf7xp9lfSfA.text: I love this place and do my best to go whenever I visit Vegas. The view of the water is lovely if you're fortunate enough to have a seat near the window. My favorite things to order here are the truffle pizza and the pop rock sushi roll. I appreciate that the website has recipes for some of the chefs dishes so you can try to remake them at home.

rL2B9j9lldb5TBeG-V2xog.text: Can I give this place 10 stars??? Amazing service and food EVERY time I'm there. I've been to many Michelin Star restaurants that don't measure up to how great this place is. Things I love from the menu: omakase menu, pop rocks roll, short ribs, black cod, any of their sashimi,  tuna pizza, Yellowtail jalapeno, gyoza, and Mile high roll. Okay that's like half their menu. Also Jamie (whom I believe is one of the managers?) is AMAZING!!!

eEfVL9n9wEOW408J0VEf9g.text: Hands down best sushi spot in Las Vegas. One of our favorite go to places! The staff is the sweetest and are always helping you have the best experience there.   The food, amazing. Need I say more? Our favorite plates here are the sushi pizza which is what they are known for! Their yellowtail jalapeno which is another popular dish here! They also have amazing sushi (albacore, salmon, and tuna). And if you're in the mood for cooked food they have miso glazed black cod which I think is better than Nobu's black cod.  This place honestly gets better and better every time. Never disappointed when we go and will always feel that way towards this amazing restaurant! Can't wait to go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi Big Eye Tuna Pizza

CVLSb3VbfOMk3yqbUS4CwA.text: I came here for dinner with some work colleagues a few weeks ago and had a very pleasant meal. The staff was very attentive and friendly throughout the meal. All the dishes were solid, but what stood out to me was the tuna pizza. Someone ordered it and I said to myself "that sounds a bit odd but I'll give it a try." I ended up being the person who devoured most of the pizza by myself. It was insanely good!

Sj8A5CbzTob6Waev5AqxEA.text: I love this place! We have spent many anniversaries and birthdays here and have never had a bad experience.   I adore their cocktails who are on the lighter side when it comes to flavors, which fits perfectly with the food. This last time i asked for something with cucumber flavor, our waitress said she had something perfect for me and she was right. I got one amazing drink!  I have never had any trouble with the time of serving, almost on the other hand sometimes the food come out so fast you have to wait in between ordering your dishes. We try to venture out testing new things every time, at this last visit we had the Big Eye Tuna Pizza which I will tell you... I will have to order at every visit I will make as long as it's on the menu. So delicious! We did not get the rock shrimp this time and when i walked out and saw it on someone else table I did kinda miss that dish, it is so very good. Other than that we had really good roles The baked Crab Hand roll was my favorite.  I have tried many times to get one of the tables by the window but only succeeded once. By the windows you have a truly beautiful view of the water fountains and their dancing spectacle.   I will be back soon for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Such pretty view
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Eye Tuna Pizza was the best starter ever!
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cyo1wSP1rvucNYeqmGLl9Q.text: Such a delicious restaurant.   When we arrived. There was no wait on a table, so we were seated right away. It was cold outside so the patio was closed. But we were seated near the window.   The food was delicious. The drink was very strong and the waiter Roberto was very friendly.   I should have taken pics of the food, but didn't remember until we were almost done.   As far as the food goes they have their version of a better spicy tuna roll. We also got another roll that was a tempura something. And seaweed salad. ( sorry for my lack of details).   But.... just go to the restaurant. You won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1lFaweVXx-INxHgB-N3-2g.text: This restaurant is very nice and chic.  They have a wonderful staff and the food is great.  Highly recommend this restaurant

hyB0gHRKEbHZmLx3jpL0XA.text: We love the crunchy kalbi roll so much that we got one for each of us. Crispy beef inside a sushi roll topped with creamy coleslaw is awesome.  I like the Buddha cocktail. My wife likes the Sunset.  The gyoza were also good. This was enough for us even though we were both pretty hungry.

vQPcSnaAW9Yi21LkYqO71Q.text: Inventive and exciting food! Pop Rocks in sushi? It works! The tuna pizza was my favorite. Everything with the exception of the eggplant skewers (undercooked and overpriced) was really great.

qbyexV0DsZv6ObwyCCHLJg.text: My fiance and I were looking to try a new place. We usually dine at MGM properties so we can get our points. We were walking toward the Bellaggio and found Yellowtail. We were also looking for a place to watch the World Series. This all worked out perfectly for us. We got there without a reservation and were able to snag a seat right by the TV so we could eat and watch the World Series at the same time. We had a lovely server who was very attentive the whole time. Our hostess was so sweet as well. While we waited for them to clean the table we were about to sit at, she recommended her favorites and the most popular items on the menu. She said you need to get the tuna pizza. We did and it was delicious. If you choose to dine here you must start off with that as an appetizer. We got a seaweed salad, a few rolls, and rock shrimp. Everything was delicious and it came out super fast. We also enjoyed a cocktail while we watched the World Series. It's a fine environment with great service. Of course it's pricey because it's fine dining in Las Vegas. Overall, I would come back here. We both had stomach aches later that night, we think it might've been because of the heavy sauce used on the rock shrimp. If you are a victim of having a weak stomach, I wouldn't recommend ordering that. Otherwise, this place is great and I would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seaweed Salad
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Pizza

0GEsi2KhiWsqx_ysgLwc2w.text: This place was very good,yet a bit pricey. The rock shrimp was pretty good, similar to bang bang shrimp. The fried tofu was excellent (bartender recommended) it was light and crispy in a sweet and spicy sauce. The real standouts were the protein roll and the crispy kalbi roll. The protein was a roll with no rice and several pieces of fish rolled around crabmeat. Really good! The kalbi roll was insane though. Crispy Korean short ribs rolled in rice and a sweet Korean BBQ sauce,topped with coleslaw! Yes really coleslaw! See my picture... This is a must try.  The foie Gras was good not stellar but it's hard to have bad foie Gras! Thought it was overpriced at 43 dollars for a small piece.   I know it's Vegas but 16 dollar beer (hitachino white) and 43 dollar foie Gras was a bit excessive, that's why I took off 1 star. Service was good, bartender made several suggestions and was very nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front is the Crisply Kalbi roll topped with coleslaw! Back is the Protein Sushi Roll (no rice, just crabmeat) both excellent!

I_pRbs7hVaYL5QJw31AMGA.text: Great service! I recommend getting the tuna pizza and mile high roll.... everything we ordered was pretty good, and the sashimi's are fresh.... we didn't have rsvp but they got us seated right away What we ordered: Tuna pizza Mile high roll Scallop sashimi Yellowtail jalapeno Rib eye

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail Jalapeno
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Eye Tuna Pizza... a must!
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mile High*.... so good!

ZUpq9cbXNfwM-i8igBre0Q.text: Best sushi in Las Vegas! Maybe the country! The fish was beyond fresh. I think they caught it in the pond at the Belagio which we were able to sit outside and watch the fountain show as we ate. Jamie was fantastic! He made our whole experience great. I give this 6 thumbs up on the yummy scale and ambience!

4Ujm2TvhKBS8IrlgxlR5Ag.text: Excellent service from Chanez & Yukiko.  I recommend the Eggplant Skewers and the Uni Truffle Pasta. Can't speak to the raw fish as I didn't order sushi or sashimi. Good sake selection.   Get a window seat so you can watch the fountain show.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Mousse Mousse Cake w/ Tiramisu Ice Cream

d6fUvmwmW8Dgu9N6L7z8IQ.text: Looking for a last minute sushi restaurant, we called Yellowfish to make a reservation.  The only availability was at 9pm, which was fine since we were gambling and shopping.  We actually finished early and arrived at 8:30pm.  When we checked in, the hostess was able to seat us. Score!  Our server was super nice and knowledgeable.  He recommended dishes and answered every question we had about the dishes. He also took his time- so even though the restaurant was busy, he didn't rush us.  What we ordered: - Big Eye Tuna Pizza - this is one that the server recommended and oh-mah-gawd.  It was SO good.  The whole dish was light but filling.  The truffle and shiso complemented the tuna and crispy rice thing on the bottom.  YUM. - Salmon sushi - fresh and delicious.  I got several orders of this.  LOL - Ikura - my favorite ikura is from SugarFISH so I always compare ikura to theirs.  This was pretty close.  =) - Yellowtail Scallion Roll - I figured since I was at Yellowtail, I should order something with Yellowtail.  The roll was good- nothing special.  We just drank soda since we were buzzed playing at the tables. Total came out to $120 after tax and tip!  Not bad!  After our dinner, our server told us we should go out to the balcony to watch the Bellagio water show.  It was nice to see the show from a different point of view (usually it's from the street), but I felt weird standing in the corner amongst the other patrons enjoying their dinner.  LOL.  I definitely would come back (at least for that tuna pizza thing).

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute matches at Yellowfish!
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the balcony at Yellowfish. You can watch the Bellagio water show from here...so romantic
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Lava cake with Nutella center. So chocolately and delicious

8GH078xTcUrN56lSV-V40Q.text: Had what seemed to be a nice meal with decent, not spectacular sushi. Quite expensive. Then 2 in our party got food poisoning. After alerting the restaurant as a courtesy, they proceeded to ask us questions as if we were in a legal investigation. Very unprofessional and totally lacking in customer service. Lots of options in Vegas, will be sure to avoid this one in the future.

SIN7935ynaWPuBh3i2I32Q.text: Such a great location - Bellagio. But service is so much to be desired. Service industry workers, yet, act as if they are doing us a favor by having to take our orders and bring food.  The sushi is definitely one of the worst for this type of establishment. I get Vegas prices - we've eaten at a number of upscale sushi restaurant on the strip. But the prices Yellowtail charges for its mediocre sushi nigiri and sushi rolls is downright rip off. Nothing special when it comes to food options and sushi rolls. Plain. Boring. Need major overhaul on food and service to meet the expectations of Bellagio guests who wish to eat at the same hotel they are staying at.

V7z9SKCZyRBHnVxjGWQWbg.text: I've been here two times. The first was the best experience. The waiter was personable and just great. They went out of their way to provide an amazing experience. The second time, the waitress was ok but no where as accommodating as the first. Still both times, the food was excellent. And watching the fountain show while having dinner was awesome

Yz8C36kjbKzxeVQ5GEPi0w.text: Recently just ate here. Restaurant is located inside Bellagio Hotel and Casino with views of the lake and watershow. We had a table near the window but it was too windy for the watershow that day. We arrived a bit early for our reservation so we waited in the bar until our table was ready. Soon after we ordered our drinks, the hostess came by to seat us.  I was happy to see that they had a selection of Japanese beers, which you don't see much around. I ordered the Hitachino White Ale. Great beer, very clean and refreshing.  We ordered a bunch of appetizers to share with the table. We started off dinner with a their signature dish, Big Eye Tuna Pizza. This is thinly sliced tuna on top of a very thin crunchy piece of flatbread (similar to a wonton chip). Next we had the Lobster Carpaccio. This was probably the best dish of the night. Thinly sliced pieces of lobster in a ponzu sauce. This is a must order. A good hot appetizer was the Tempura Alaskan King Crab. Bite sized pieces of Alaskan King crab deep fried in a tempura batter. We then ordered various pieces of nigri sushi for the table. The fish was definitely fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nigiri
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura Alaskan king crab
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso soup

6cDJPZ0PSVr6YmelEhC3Tw.text: I had the pleasure of having dinner at Yellowtail last Wednesday evening. I have to say that hands down, this was one of the most phenomenal dining experiences I have ever had. Keith, the manager, made sure we were well taken care of and Sara was simply the best. The food was delicious and the presentation of each dish was gorgeous. You would be missing out if you didn't make it a point to visit this amazing restaurant with the most generous staff!! Thank you Keith and staff for such an amazing experience.

Usc8Sb0RK1VdI_RzjpnDeg.text: A solid 4.5, only reason it wasn't a 5 star is the cost.  Food quality is excellent, waiter and serving staff were friendly and efficient.  We were seated promptly and once ordered, the dishes came out at a good pace.  Signature dish is the tuna pizza, but every dish was decadent and flavourful.  Be prepared for steep prices but as they say - you get what you pay for!

MlwWGrF4J6qEI5if6_MyXg.text: Love this place. We come here every time we are in Vegas. Love the famous yellow tail pizza and the beef tataki. We tried the crab tempura and were disappointed. All the great reviews, I was excited to try it. Not much flavor. We will stick to the raw fish next time. Great view and nice service.

7pLhBT6D9m3dtuDaUzHxMw.text: I'm not 100% sure what we ate for $160 for two lol but it was all good King crab tempura I asked the waiter for a soft shell crab and got it not on the menu and perfect Some sort of sea clam but it was perfect as well And two other rolls I didn't even try Great staff and overlooking the fountains Awesome

keEXDbOu47jvxfJdq9frag.text: We hit Yellowtail every year we go out to Vegas.  It's right there in our home base (Bellagio) and never disappoints.  The sushi is great...but the thing we get every year is the tuna (raw) pizza.  It doesn't sound good, but it is incredible.  I'm really not doing it justice by describing it like this...just try it!  I promise you won't be disappointed.  The sake is also really tasty.  And if you want to eat with a view of the fountains...that is available too.  Plus, we eat here every year without a reservation.  This place is a hidden gem right in the open.  The only downside is the price.  It is expensive, but that is the case for all nice restaurants in the better Vegas hotels.  No matter where we stay, we'll make a trip back to Yellowtail.

Mz4loRP2i_a-Ll5Iuae_0w.text: Great food with a beautiful view on the patio. We had a perfect family dinner on New Year's Day.

XKaYp1G8s-F4wglOEVhqzg.text: Ate here twice again this year on two trips to Vegas.   The dinner was phenomenal again.  The baked crab rolls were the hit of the table again.  In fact, everyone just orders their own plate now, and we share everything else!    For those complaining about prices, you should make sure you sit on the patio facing the fountains.  Its an amazing experience to be so close while having dinner.  That's what you are paying for as well.    Dear Management - wish you guys were open later.  There is nothing in the Bellagio open after 11pm.  Maybe keep the bar area open till 1am or something on a late night menu.  You guys close way too early!

jI3tPt3ja8FmdEhFnWPSWg.text: It's at the Bellagio, and obviously it was going to be kinda expensive. The food was GREAT but the service was so bad that the whole thing was painful. You could see that they hired the servers for their looks only. She was pretty but didn't have much of anything going on inside her head. It was NOT busy at all and she took 15 minutes to refill waters after we asked, and we had to ask for our bill twice and then get up and ask at the hostess stand for it. Ridiculous.  I got the tuna pizza based on her recommendation since she said it's what they were known for. It was delicious. My bf's chicken meal was crazy good too and he loved it. It's too bad that our meal was tainted by her horrible service. Also, they don't give free refills, so she ended up charging us almost $10 for his 3 sodas. Really?

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken something. Delicious
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big eye tuna pizza was amazing

_ShmITTHs9uQ5U3rmocuCg.text: My second time there and I still love it! The manager was very nice and the waitress took care of the ordering for us! We loved everything that came out.. can't wait to go back again! Also the best sake I've had!!

DDto7MPx75C0e4WChzB1Sg.text: This is my new favorite place to eat Sushi,  the food is amazing. The best sushi I have ever had. From the Rock Shrimp to the Salmon, to the yellow tail everything on the menu that I ate was perfect. I recommend anyone in Las Vegas or if you fly into town to go eat there. The wait staff and the Manager is amazing and 5 star service all the way around.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You can sit and watch the Belagio Fountains
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon was amazing, the best I have ever had of Sashimi
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops and Rock Shrimp delicious!

vf8fgAOhkM3ODjwG4hduoA.text: Nice location and environment.  Less than average sushi, not what I would expect for the location and prices.  Not bad but not great.

YTQJ4SOw1cJc6rTBI4_Kyg.text: Sexy place with stunning fountain views!  Walking into this place everything is just sexy. The hostesses, the furniture, the lighting, the tulip on your table and then the stunning Bellagio fountains!   Let's begin with the food items which are the whimsical sushi rolls. We ordered a baked crab roll which was very delicate yet filling and the popping spicy crab roll which happened to be the highlight of the evening. This roll had actual pop rocks in it and was so much fun to eat! Note to all sushi places, start using pop rocks! I loved the sweetness from it and it all came together so well.  Next we had the Kobe beef flat iron which came with baby root vegetables & potato puree. On the side you receive warm teriyaki glaze and it was smooth & sweet. This dish was good but nothing special. Ordered a side of mushrooms that were great!   We also had a few cocktails, one was the sunset that contained grey goose l'orange, blood orange puree and yuzu (nothing special) and then the Infusion which contained pineapple & vanilla infused "early bloom" sake and Bacardi light rum (loved this one) the drink presentations were beautiful with very feminine touches like an orchid and an orange twist.  Everything here looks really good and service was on it. When we arrived the place was empty and as we left it was packed.   Grab a seat near the windows for the views of the fountains! This part is the cherry on top of this experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushrooms :)
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe flat iron
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popping spicy crab roll and baked crab cut roll

zt8KShSxT_S_4TuGA7XOkA.text: Wasn't a huge fan of this restaurant. Love Japanese, but this fell short of most of our favorites including Nobu, Masa etc. We started with the tuna pizza (which was the best dish by far), rock shrimp, oysters, yellowtail, salad, tempura and all of specialty rolls plus sashimi/sushi platter. We also got the miso cod and the steak. We all thought it was so-so after sampling a good amount on the menu.

tODpX9YKVoMMQ_cAQPCJ5A.text: The fountain view is breathe taking it sure was worth the wait for an hour on a Saturday night for dinner. Everything went well other than the fact that it took them over 45 min to bring out the salmon plate. When we notified our waiter he was kind of rude about it so then we just asked to cancel the order. But other than that the pop rock California was something I've never had before. Candy and sushi together was a very cool combo. We also had the rock shrimp which was delicious. Other than the fact of us canceling the salmon dish everything went well definitely will go back here for the amazing fountain view and delicious sushi hopefully with better service.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pop rock California roll
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ovn_zYUajcdAcXc8H-x0IA.text: The only thing I really remember about this restaurant is how much I paid and how hungry I was when I left! There are two things that I enjoyed about this restaurant...hence the two stars. 1. The tuna pizza with truffle oil YUM!  and 2. The view of the Bellagio water show from the restaurant.

QaDs29j1A_UmQpSIQ6S7Xw.text: Nigiri was about as good as I expected, didn't blow me away. rolls were OK. They have this one roll though that is in itself worth going to.... pork shoulder  roll. OH MY GOD. You must order this roll. There's some tempura goodness rolled into a maki where when you put the thing in your mouth and bite into it you get this incredible sensation of texture... seaweed, then rice, then crunchy tempura, then this amazing pork fatty goodness. super yum. Just order that. You don't need to get anything else there.  Ambiance... I have a thing for restaurants that embellish the space with dark wood and dark drapery. Also, the plating was fabulous. I loved the nice long bar.  Ok... this is maybe going to push them up to four stars. Their mixed drinks on the menu were incredible. .

sr8R5Kx7Qg7JoVdpEkPoow.text: "Home of the three dollar tip."  If I'm paying Vegas prices, I want there to be "no limit" to the hours something is served. So, if I want sushi in a restaurant that is located in the lobby of the Bellagio, it should be served all night, not until eleven PM. 11 PM?! Really? Because I'm not a Vegas local I'm most likely just getting out of a show then, or maybe 1/4 of the way into my night. Serve sushi all night...it's a good business model.  However, if you do serve sushi, don't put white onion in it. It's totally gross. Maybe the chef was playing a joke on us.  Dinner for two: $80 including a horrible plate of mushrooms and "sauce" that tasted like something from my high school cafeteria; that weird "onion roll," and something tempura'd, which can never go wrong.   Also, the server insisted on reaching our table by maneuvering through a tiny gap between my left shoulder and the wall. It was like someone was sneaking up on my, only they were bringing me my chopsticks.   I'm sure this is a fun place to have a drink (we weren't given a drink menu) but our vodka tonics were watered down.   Eh, you get what you get when you go for convenience in Vegas.

QSEAjVyeDtOgrDzQUS0LGg.text: My husband and I had a great night at Yellowtail. It is a fun, hip kind of place to be, and it was a treat to sit outside and see the Bellagio fountain show over and over again. (They gave us a great table, and we are not in the NBA).  When I say the place was hip, I mean it might be a little too hip. The team of waiters (young, cool, and attractive) were always passing by and were perhaps a bit too present if you know what I mean. Certainly nice, certainly attentive, but also often interrupting us to ask us what we needed. This might just be a function of the place being new (and I admit that it's certainly better than being ignored!) but it was noticeable.  Some of the food we had was incredible: the Kobe beef carpaccio and the lobster carpaccio get five stars. The sushi, on the other hand, while good, was nothing to write home about. I felt like it was about the same as the good sushi I can get here at home, and it didn't compare to the sushi I had at Shibuya in MGM Grand.  That said, Yellowtail is a solid 4 stars, and I would go here again if I wanted to see and be seen while enjoying the good food.

RCF2bWr-o9f0kldgwPX7aQ.text: The price is outrageous. Understandable why the place is 1/2 empty. We eat sushi out 3x a month. We order house saki. It was $48. The sushi is just ok. Not aweful not great. I barely ate anything .2 adults and 2kids the bill was $308. Im disgusted.considering the small portion and I am hungry . Sushi at hard rock or Venetian is way better and more price reasonable. I still can't believe my 2 house saki cost $98.will never return

M8u-xZLj9K06qpUcem2riA.text: Most of the food here was average at best, expect for two items; the edamame was good, but they earned five stars for one reason....their "Popping Spicy Crab." They literally put watermelon pop rocks in this roll. I lived in Japan for several years and have had more sushi than I ever thought one person should eat, but I have never had anything like this. I was very reluctant to order the Popping Spicy Crab as I am a traditionalist, but the waiter told me that the chef's mom had added Pop Rocks to his sushi when he was a boy to encourage him to eat it. I was curious. It paid off.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Popping Spicy Crab Roll. The red garnish is actually POP ROCKS

Kvfrxv48ZHfCgzrqZu5PlA.text: I've been meaning to write about this place for a while. When you hear sushi restaurant inside the Bellagio, you expect top notch sushi with excellent service right? but NOT here!   It took forever just to ask us what we wanted to drink and probably 20 minutes before we were asked what we wanted to order. A pet peeve of mine.....bringing out a dish for one person at the table, but not the other, and even worse, bringing out that 2nd dish 15 minutes later. Really?   To top it off, the food was just okay, not much flavor and kinda bland. Come on Bellagio, you can do better than this!!  Everything was a wait and it felt like pulling teeth to get good service. I hate when that happens. I won't even bother trying again. It was that bad.

l5hXd3OqWrDy64BqBYHb6w.text: For an upscale "Sushi" place, I was beyond disappointed.  I think getting sushi off the  floor would have been better.   For a $10 roll, you get something quarter sized.  I would highly suggest finding somewhere else to go.  The tuna pizza was so so for what they called a delicacy.  I can't believe Bellagio allows this place to stay.  They also charged me $2 extra to get avocado instead of  cucumber.  The piece of avocado in each roll was smaller than a pencil eraser.  Absolutely pathetic.  Go get some chicken fingers from the cafe, and you'll be much happier.

v-q-MyxzQ2QEwCfYX-5-Eg.text: Oooooh, what a great meal.  Chef obviously has had some fancy food training. Our order (tuna pizza, cod-not on menu, dynamite crab, soup, salad, tuna roll, chicken, etc?) was inspired and delicious. Don't overlook dessert - it's just a few bites and it arrives looking like art.   Additionally, I was served the best cocktail of my life - and now have a somewhat strong compulsion to buy Square One Organic Cucumber Vodka.    Service was excellent, the room dark and lovely, yet open to the throngs passing through the casino if you are into people watching. Skip the patio if you are after a quiet meal. The view is great but those Bellagio fountains are thunderous at times.

5LXKqNQ8yy0XF5wpNKQ75A.text: The restaurant was attractive, but the tall tables were somewhat awkward and uncomfortable. The waitstaff from the hostess to the waitress was very snooty, and provided poor service. The sushi was overpriced, uninspired and not particularly memorable. I've had much better sushi for less money elsewhere.

ijDV6J9Q2xNzmaujcLyd9A.text: This restaurant was fantastic: the service was impeccable, the food almost as good, and the setting couldn't have been better.  We were a little late for our reservation outside, so we waited for a bit at the bar before they were able to seat us on the patio overlooking the fountain at the Bellagio: totally worth it.  The sushi was solid: fresh and creatively prepared, and we had some really good kobe beef (although the ladyfriend says the beef would have been better without the sauce and she cautions you to stay away from the banana roll).  One thing: the wine list was an absolute embarrassment.  We saw a bottle of Yellowtail (the name of the restaurant but also the crappy Australian wine you can buy at our corner Ghetto Mart for $7) for $48!  Using that as our baseline, and knowing next to nothing about wine, we ordered a bottle of $70 wine thinking it would be at least decent, and it wasn't.    The terrible wine almost ruined an otherwise great dinner.

AH_4R9A88__C3AjkX1X0_A.text: We just happened upon this place, just about the only luck I had in Vegas.  The soft shell crab roll was my favorite ever and the sashimi was so fresh it just about melted in your mouth.  I am a sushi snob and I have to say that this place did not disappoint!  My boyfriend is not a sushi person and there were definitely other tasty options on the menu so it's fair for all.  He had the Kobe beef and it was delicious.  The service was great also, they were knowledgeable and attentive.  If you love sushi, don't miss this place!!

k_EKNtjiPUFi8slpv6ZD_A.text: Arguably one of the best restaurants I have ever been to! I would recommend the tuna pizza and your variety of sushi

BdHHibWvwN8mKyl5C31QHA.text: The sushi at yellowtail was fabulous when I went there, but I just couldn't get down with the ambiance.  I know its supposed to be...whatever...fancy/vegas whatever.  But it was too...something.  Pretentious maybe?  It irritated me.  (not giving much information here!)  But the food was great.  We ordered this tuna pizza thing and a crab dish to share as appetizers, which were fantastic.  Especially the tuna pizza.  For my entree i had some sort of "angry salmon" roll -- really good.  I just hated the ambiance for some reason -- just over the top.  Also, we had probably the worst table in the house, and twice a waiter brought us food that didn't belong to us.

Fq-vs4h29UYAA3l5zznVWg.text: What a BEAUTIFUL restaurant! High Class Place.  Sushi was Fresh and very Delicious. i tried the Tuna pizza Appitizer and WOW the Flavors were incredible! Great view for the water show also highly recommend

lGr7skMeV0Q6yV3WeA66Yg.text: Stunning.  Flavor selections were amazing,  and service was exemplar.  Our waitress Tami engaged us in a sharp conversation about our experiences with flavor, shared some of her own, and made some spot-on recommendations.  We stayed with sashimi and were very pleased.   The very romantic patio seating made the whole experience perfect for our Vegas getaway.  Go here.  Ask for Tami.  Enjoy this blessing.

DddQ9RVw8OBxjJ4-CoSNJw.text: When dining at the Bellagio, I'm aiming for a 4 or 5 star experience.  This was way below expectations! The service was extremely spotty.   We had a large party, and I do understand if certain mistakes are made during busy hours.  However, they weren't super crowded.  Took a while for everything to come out.  What I really disliked the most was the waiter dropping off everything at certain spots of the table.  If you're a fancy sushi restaurant, wouldn't you at least know or remember who ordered which food and where it went? Also, there was clearly timing issues, and dishes came out one or two at a time.  For a large party, some people had to watch others eat.  It just amazed me how they dropped off the food, and since we were a large party, it took a while to determine who had ordered it.... And the waiter was pretty clueless also! The food itself was pricy, yet it was decent. The edamame was good, as it was well seasoned.  Besides that, definitely not worth it.  I would only go here again if I was forced to... If not, definitely visit other sushi places on the strip!!

18ZGbznN6nASyZQ0yKm_ew.text: Horrible service!!!! Very rude and pushy waitress. I will never go back.......we were told that she would only take an order from one person!!! She could not be bothered with speaking to the 7 of us. Overpriced and not worth it

95EFp1qVpn3yRjCZnBQoKg.text: Top quality sushi, but certainly for a price! I guess that's what happens in Vegas.

fWd0wCYsPunkUnlwzdg2iA.text: Seriously one of my favorite places for sushi!!! But they don't just have sushi which I love :) it's in the Bellagio so of course you're going to spend money. So don't be such a cheap bastard and enjoy yourself!! Great service and the view outside is gorgeous!

SmOgss161wQYEVnzZvVVcA.text: Should have searched yelp before eating here. Agree with 'YellowFail.' Overly pretentious, shared plates should be shared portions. Single scallop is not quite a sharing portion. Sushi quality fair. Shushi lovers, please avoid. Price is one thing, but quality should match. Lobster cappaccio was best of the worst. Salt drowns out most of fish flavor in dishes. As in other reviews, also received wrong order.

gRmmQzh5sq4u4syCvVwwjw.text: absolutely the best, creative and delicious sushi ever!! i wish it wasn't so pricey...but what else can i expect in vegas.  i love this place so much, we drove 8 hours from california just to eat the big eye tuna pizza and the spicy popping crab.  all the food is yummy here &the drinks are good too....try the infusion.=yummmmm!

OcIp16xtHdU4cv7Iczb_ZQ.text: This is the place that gave me the motivation to write a first review.  This place has a nice view of the bellagio water show.  You are paying 100+ dollars for the view.   I couldnt tell if the fish was any good or not because there was barely any in the rolls.  The nigiri was average.  The price is about 3 times more than normal but the quality is at or below average.  The special cocktails are $20 and barely have alcohol in them.  im willing to pay good money for a good quality meal but this place was just money down the drain

2x-VScy6DS4wNWhsqYOBiA.text: I can sum up Yellowtail in a word, "Whatever."  After eating sushi all over the world from New York to Tokyo to Honolulu, Yellowtail is just really "whatever."  Vegas really Americanizes sushi and Japanese food, so therefore, it's "whatever."

ojKLCWBCY-IVTlmG0M9EXg.text: Let me just say I think I am being more than generous by giving it one star. This was the WORST, absolute WORST, and for those of you who are just skimming and may have missed it... THE WORST PLACE EVER! Overpriced Garbage!  I made reservations at Yellowtail for my husband's birthday. He loves sushi and could eat it for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Even though we had reservations, we still had to wait 20 minutes to be seated and the place was not that busy. No big deal there...it happens...sometimes you have to wait.  Then there was the food. Becca F. was right in her review..."sushi chefs everywhere are embarrassed". We order the 7 course chef's tasting menu. After each course I was hoping and praying it would get better. I kept thinking...How could it get any worse? I was wrong every single time. Then we finally got to the dessert and it was bad! How do you screw up dessert?  Even the service left lots to be desired. Since we had 7 courses we often watched our next courses take a couple laps around the restaurant before it made it to our table. A few waiters that didn't know their table numbers I suppose. No big deal, until the ice cream was practically completely melted on the dessert by the time it came to our table.  The ONLY thing that was good about this meal was the Sapporo and we all know Yellowtail had nothing to do with that. I have been reading a lot of the other reviews on this sight and I wish I would have read them before I went.  Here's the kicker for those of you that are still reading...After dropping almost $400 on this crappy birthday dinner we went directly from the restaurant to Taco Bell. My husband didn't eat any Taco Bell because he was full from eating my meal and his meal at the restaurant because he didn't want to waste it at those prices. Now the next morning, as I type this review, my husband is having a hard time trying to decide which end to put on the toilet first because he has FOOD POISONING!!!

0WC7STRarorzXyuA2hQrXQ.text: Overpriced for the Sushi it delivers.  Saki list?  $33 and most bottles were over $70.  I started wondering if the Saki just might be worth it, I was ready to blow some dough on a good meal and hot saki, when I looked at their "premium wine" selling for $41 a bottle, knowing of course that it sold for $5.99 at the local grocery store.    The sushi list was little to be desired (and high priced) rolls were simplistic and not well thought out, Sashimi (at $11) was less then very small 3 slices, not even enough as an appetizer.  This place was so dissapointing I had to apoligize to my friends several times for picking it.   We filled up on popcorn at the 'O' show, instead of having the nice Sushi dinner we thought we would have.  I looked around at the restaurant, nobody had a caraff of Saki, or bottle of wine, or table filled with food...because...you go here, for the ambience not the food.  I was highly disappointed!  We ate at SUSHI MON off the strip the night before and it was well worth the price (if under priced) and DELISH!  Yellowtail?  Come on get a life!  I wish Hells Kitchn guy would visit you and give you a talking to.  I am embarrased that I didn't walk out!  Of course, this is fish in Las Vegas,,,I bet you feel entitled to your little dishes and ridiculous prices.    I'll stay in Santa Cruz and eat the best Sushi...and watch your business fail from afar.  YES that IS how pissed off that I wasted time in your establishment!
