I think that there are sushi chef's in smaller places that outperform the renowned.  Perfect example is Crazy Sushi in St. Peters, MO.  One of the best IMO.  Why do they not have a Crazy Sushi in a Vegas casino?  Thus going into YT I was skeptical, and preparing for the same roll I could get somewhere not Vegas for a lot less $$$.  Yellow tail was a great experience, and I understand why Akira has his own place at the Bellagio.  This isn't Dragon, Philly, or Vegas rolls, and if that's what you want go elsewhere because you are going to overpay for very basic sushi.  Sushi is a very tiny piece of YT.  Notice this says Yellowtail Japanese Restaurant, and not Yellowtail Sushi Bar.  There you have it... I have still avoided going to a Vegas sushi bar.  Like I said, we were treated to a much different experience than someone who waltzed in on any given night.  Akira is not always in, and I doubt I will ever visit a restaurant again where the chef is being filmed while making my dinner.  FYI Akira Back was on Iron Chef North America...     We did a hybrid Omakase  which is the 7 course sampler.  I think we received over 7 courses, and I think this was due to Akira, and the camera guy.  Again, stars aligned...  Also we agreed with the server to let him make whatever he wants for us which probably didn't hurt either.  From the first dish which was his pizza, I started realizing why YT is different, and not a sushi bar.  I really like truffle oil when it's applied to the right dish.  You wouldn't think raw fish would mesh well with the pungent truffle oil, but it goes great with the other flavors of the pizza.    The kobe beef tataki was awesome, as was the protein roll.    The pop rock roll was just odd to say the least, but was freaking amazing.  Pop rocks in sushi WTF?  Only in Vegas.  There was also a roll brought out, and I want to say it had strawberries and tuna in it.    There was agrilled walu which was outstanding...    The kobe short rib dish he made for us was awesome as well.  I think we asked for another round of the ribs, and walu.    I could have done without the rock shrimp.  Shrimp is just meh for me. I don't get excited over it because well... its just shrimp.  Shrimp should be the chicken of the sea, not canned tuna.  With that being said, the table loved it, and if you are a shrimp lover you'll go nuts over it.  Anyhow, those were some of the dishes that really stood out for me at YT.     I'm pretty sure we had something chicken and sashimi as well.  They were good, but drowned out by the quality of the courses I mentioned.  Appearance, flavor, and quality were top notch.  Akira Back should be very proud of his ability to be extremely creative with food, and a pallet that knows what goes.  Would I have enjoyed the restaurant as much on any other night? I don't know.  I  wouldn't have been as daring and would have just ordered some rolls, and the pizza.  I probably wouldn't have went to YT because I would have thought it was just another sushi joint.  Things happen for a reason right?  I can share my experiences so you can either walk-in, or walk-by.    I think this place is well worth the money.  Sure it's expensive, but seriously folks... if you're worried about price why the hell are you considering eating at the Bellagio to begin with?  Hey I look for the 5.00 tables, but that's only because I am a shitty gambler.  For dinner I go all in...

3k_tHG6dAGsh-v6fBYQ_hg.text: Really great spicy miso soup and a great location, but the sushi was just not very good.  With the exception of the albacore, the rest was average at best.  I've honestly had better in my hometown of...what for it...Dayton, Ohio!  Too bad really, because I really expected a lot more of a town that has so much great food.  Oh, I almost forgot.  Someone at our table had the ribeye and it was quite good.  It would seem that this "sushi" restaurant has a bit of an identity crisis.

_dpsSorj66jqzWphOrSp1Q.text: If there was a negative 100 star button I would click that! THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER! We specifically requested NO shellfish and they brought  the shellfish out in our roll and we had a horrible experience and swelling of the face and more side effects! It's a shame how customers are treated these days! They only took 1 dessert off after spending over 350+ dollars there. And now need medical attention for the mistake the waitress made

50nWrtAPZjLC7u-k08wPSA.text: I forgot this place is in bellagio or caesars cause these two places are connected. I got dizzy walking here and there, especially had drinks after. I got a compliment from friend that said this place is in Bellagio, not in Caesars, well, the only thing I can be sure is the restaurant's name, yellowtail, sushi bar. Sorry for misunderstanding.

Ky1vOYLSO20IOBdZnvz_pw.text: This place was way over-priced for average sushi. It didn't have much flavor/taste. It's family style which is cool but it was probably one of the worse sushi places I've ever been to. What hurt the most was the prices.  Lol. You'd think if you're paying that much the food would be superb. We had a party of 6...and we definitely did not leave in awe. Will not ever go back there...side note very friendly staff but that doesn't make up for disappointing food.

YxtT6TnySSh7OHh9nP67Xw.text: Lets walk through from the beginning. We had a reservation for 9:30 pm. We showed up precisely at 9:30 and checked in, were asked to give them a minute and please go to the bar if we wished. We waited a couple minutes for a place at the bar to open up and then ordered a drink. We sat and watched as walk ups were seated before us, including a couple of girls who walked up and hugged the hostess and were seated immediately. While I am not too stupid to understand that some people "deserve" to be seated immediately, it was disheartening seeing walk-ups get seated before us. I guess I wouldnt have a problem if they said they dont accept reservations, but they do, so I didnt understand the point of having one if it took 20-25 minutes to get seated.  So with that negative, lets say a positive. Our servers was perhaps the best server Ive had at any restaurant, high end or otherwise. I believe his name was Nick. Just wanted to give a shout-out because he was that good. We never ask to speak with management, but made sure we did this time to put in a good word for our server.  So, the food. It was good, and some of it great. Pricey, but then again, we knew that going in.  The yellowtail Serrano appetizer was outstanding. It practicably melted in my mouth. The Gyoza app was good, but nothing special.  The edamame was good too, I mean, its edamame, how could you mess it up? I wasnt a fan of the sweet chile flavor, but the gf loved it. The japanese pickles salad was awesome!  One of their signature rolls is the Popping Spicy Crab...it was ok. Seemed a little gimmicky, but wasnt bad. The yellowtail scallion roll was very tasty, as was the spicy tuna roll. I also had some scallop sashimi...it was very tender and had good flavor.  Overall impression, it was good, but slightly over-priced. You pay for the atmosphere and to be at the "cool" place to be. Dont get me wrong, the food was good, and I wouldnt hesitate to go back again, but just be warned you arent going to be absolutely blown away with some new type of sushi. You are going for good sushi (better than 90% of places), and for the atmosphere with outstanding service (once you get seated).

7KsoHxTEOpcwciI4NSkZBg.text: Fantastic dinner!  The jidori chicken is to die for!  Definitely the best I've had.  Also tried the seared scallops and was not disappointed.  Always find a sumptuous wine on their extensive wine list, you won't be disappointed.

THVbSNCIOhozjSnQJrrG_g.text: Beautiful decor, amazing ambience overlooking Bellagio fountains. The staff was excellent! I emailed manager Yoshi about food allergy and he was responsive and accommodating! Our sushi was made separately by the chef so as to not cross contaminate with gluten items in the kitchen.  The sushi was well presented and tasty with the gluten free soy sauce and wasabi.  Server was attentive and friendly. Will definitely return!

ks1ywReJ8ii4jy1V8sjepQ.text: Food was decent but we paid 145 for fried rice. Are you kidding me?!? We didn't even agree to it. What a joke won't be back again. Management didn't even care that their services completely misled us.

H_8RawYSA7rBcRcDbEoq4w.text: WHERE: Inside the Bellagio Hotel/Casino.  WHEN: Dinner only! Monday-Thursday, 5pm-10pm. Friday-Sunday, 5pm-11pm. It is also recommended to make reservations during the weekend just incase it gets a little busy.  WHY: The dishes are worth the while (or at least the ones that I got the pleasure to try tonight! =D)  WHAT: So... first thing's first. I actually got home not too long ago from eating here.  Right after my amazing experience in this great atmosphere, the only thing I could think of was "I'm so going home and writing a review!" So here I am, and here I go...  One of my good friends has been talking about how great everything was for the past year. So after a year, we finally got together to make it happen! Prior to getting to the restaurant, I was extremely giddy and excited!!  When we got to the restaurant, checked in, and got seated, we automatically were asked what we wanted to drink. Tangent! Before I forget, customer service was at its best! Anyways, back to my experience. We weren't as hungry, so we all decided to get an appetizer each and share. =) That's what friends are for.  FOOD: Keep in mind, the portions are small, but so worth your taste buds!  We started off with Edamame.  There were 2 bowls, one with cold, salted edamame beans, and the other with a warm and cooked-in-some-good sauce (sweet chili) edamame beans. Always such a great starter!  Eggplant Skewers:  One thing, I am not an eggplant fan, but I am not afraid to try it. My friend recommended I try this, and thank goodness she made that recommendation! It did not taste like eggplant at all. It tasted like bbq on a stick brushed with sweet miso and sesame sauce goodness. KUDOS!  Big Eye Tuna Pizza:  Definitely not like your ordinary pizza! One of greatest things I have ever eaten! To simplify such a magnificent dish, it was smoked tuna on some type of cracker/bread (which made it a pizza). Everyone must try this! KUDOS!  Popping Spicy Crab: Why come to a sushi joint and not order at least one roll?! We made the right choice. If like uniqueness in taste, be sure to taste this roll! Who would have thought that pop rocks (candy) can enhance a simple sushi roll?! It was magical! KUDOS!  Lava Cake: For dessert (I always have my heart, mouth, and tummy ready for dessert), I was given the duty of choosing. I chose correct! To explain this lava cake, it was a small, dark chocolate-filled cake, topped with banana foam, and lychee ice cream on the side! Perfect amount, perfect taste, just pure perfection!  To sum it all up, I had a wonderful time with my friends, the staff, and most definitely the food. We also got to say hello and converse with Chef Akira Back! He is very down-to-earth and such a great chef!  I leave you with this. KUDOS, KUDOS, KUDOS!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lava Cake. Enough said.
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popping Spicy Crab. It is literally poppin&#39;!
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Eye Tuna Pizza. It is definitely a must try!

c2xJGJ1lPq9xkHPFNY2n-A.text: Big eye tuna pizza! Sooooo good. It's one of the best sushi dishes I have ever had.  The rock shrimp and the roll with the pop rocks in it are also a must.   This is one of our favorite restaurants for not only the food, but the view. If it is not the dead of summer, request to sit on the patio. At night, the fountain goes off every 15 minutes and there is not better seat than the balcony at yellowtail.

KTCeOmG3LEES1zvKAO7jHg.text: Please do not let any first time sushi eaters eat here. This is by far the worst sushi restaurant I've ever been to. The sea eal was not prepared properly, the salmon was old, cucumber salad was just tossed on a plate. All would be enough but to add insult to injury they have the smallest servings at stupid prices. If you love sushi don't come here. I never will again.

B1deklcYTqpmHye6oxW2Og.text: I don't eat raw fish so this is opinion of my wife.  She loves this place.  She is small but still put away $100 worth of food by herself.  The food is great but expensive.

v6xwuQ86nMJgq8QFRgIzLw.text: It's trendy and a bit louder than I'd have liked, but conversation was possible. We had the seven-course Omakase, where you put yourself in the chef's hands, and he didn't fail us. Standouts were the tuna pizza with truffle oil and the teriyaki kobe beef shortribs, which were really tasty without being too rich.

X3ZBl4q9DYdhoMnrKcECXg.text: Sashimi and seaweed salad is the best here ! Very clean, the plating and setting is great. I come here rarely (since we only go to las vegas once a year). I love their rolls and how they have more choices compared to Sushi samba. I highly recommend, price is a little high, but it matches the great quality food.

Yod-2WfK1591m0tq6zORDA.text: Dined here for the 1st time. Was given a window table with view of Bellagio fountains show. Had the filet mignon roll, spicy crab with POP ROCKS, and red dragon roll. All real good! The roll with the pop rocks was interesting but very good!   We had the best service from our waiter, Taylor. Really energetic & friendly. The staff was very attentive, always refilling our drinks & checking on us.   We also had the blackberry cheesecake. That was good.

QNsmfdsCdThzD0Gvr7gtMw.text: i had dinner here a few nights ago to catch up with a few friends. we were asked if we would like a few dishes to be sent out and we said yes. everything was well balanced and you can tell it was all fresh quality ingredients. we ended up having them select all our dishes for us. our server roberto was very attentive without being intrusive. the general manager keith stopped by to check on us a few times throughout our meal. overall i would highly recommend this restaurant and i will definitely be going back soon.

Kx_eCdtPTPhS5358V1ijgA.text: Do you like $20 cocktails?  Then this is the place for you.  Fortunately my friend was putting our drinks on the ol' company expense account and I am not going to lie....The Sunset and The Lily were bomb diggity drinks.

AWzl-Z9-l1WnIMkdvQgG9Q.text: Kool bar in LV. Not crowded, good drinks. Our bartender was awesome at recommending drinks, in fact she had created some of them. The decor is calming.

xyQ7W5eG8ROxM9rgyoWz0Q.text: Yellowtail remains one of the top modern Japanese restaurants on the Strip.  The food here is inventive with bold flavors.  Stay adventerious when ordering; you will be rewarded.  The majority of the dishes are made to be shared (although the portions are not too large that those dining alone will not have a decent selection).    The tai (snapper) served sashimi style with EVOO and shiso is excellent.  The peppery edge of the oil enhances the sweetness of the fish.  The lobster carpaccio is amazing.  The sweetness of the lobster and the onion play off each other beautifully and offers the perfect textural contrast.  Finally, the kobe beef tataki is an absolute must try.  Roll up the paper thin slice around a sliver of garlic and spicy diakon pickle and pop it in your mouth.  It's amazing how the bold flavor of the garlic is washed away by the fat of the beef as it melt in your mouth.  For warm plates, top props to the "Seafood Dynamite".  Lightly broiled king crab and rock shrimp dressed in a spicy yet not cloying citrus aioli; delicious.  The nigiri sushi is all very high quality but boring when compared to the inventive speciality rolls.  The "Popping Spicy Crab" is a serious must try.  Crab, spicy aioli, cucumber, asparagus, and POP ROCKS!  Just try it.  Service is excellent.  The wine / sake list is very good with well chosen selections by the glass.  Prices are high (remember, you're at the Bellagio).  Highly Recommended.

KxMThanQZgH3riWjxFBUrg.text: We stopped in for a few appetizers and a glass of wine before a show. We sat at the bar. Excellent service, great view of casino floor for people watching, and the food was very tasty. (The back room has fountain views)   We had the big eye tuna pizza, rock shrimp, and yellowtail jalapeno. I would recommend them all, but my favorite was the big eye tuna pizza. Very light, and tasty.   I will return.

3B5zmgWFAZF_7-iMJ5iPwQ.text: Great place for drinks & ambiance but not if you are a sushi buff! Sushi way over priced for what you get. Sushi rolls were tiny & expensive! We spent $100 on 2 drinks & 2 pieces of sushi, a yellowtail roll & a small bowl of miso.  Left hungry! But service was great & drinks were good.

cm9fCPNtZS4ufl67q9VsZA.text: Big eye tuna pizza and crab roll with pop rocks are incredible! Had it 5 years ago and still dreaming about it. Went back last month and it was just as amazing!!!  Went back this month and meh.... Not as fresh but still very pricy. 5 star last time but 3 stars this time :(

7VNFJJBjfLidTg2P_OZ7Lg.text: Four stars for the fish. Let's hear it for the fish! That's all I've really got to say here, but I will probably write a lot more because as a lady friend of mine just recently said, I am long winded. What is that supposed to mean, exactly? I talk too much, I write too much, and I am awesome at underwater gameplay? Well, duh. To all three.  I ordered a usual array of rolls, nigiri, sashimi, and beverages. I suppose in a restaurant review you would imagine I would give you more details, but in response to that, I would say that you have quite the active imagination, as I am not going to give you any more details and you will have to just deal with that. Boom.  We sat at the bar and our first server aka bartender was so inattentive that the other bartender just stole us from him without even trying. He kind of looked like a mentally challenged version of a celebrity that I can't remember ... I think it was Rupert Everett. If you come across that guy, or a guy that remotely resembles him, or in fact, if you are ever served by someone who looks mentally challenged, well, maybe you can expect the same time of service.  The girl we got after he wandered into a corner and couldn't find his way back to the bar was very good. I stole a paper coaster. Father please forgive me for my trespasses.

TACP2apbnXA-J1itV7oPqg.text: The only downfall of coming here is that the lighting is so dim that your phone pictures of these beautiful creations look better than we can actually see when its  served.   Everything here was magical.  Get the truffle pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops on a mustard potato
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pop rocks in my sushi

Tif9-18t_Np0_X5PWF9d7w.text: Terrible food. They used to be good 5 years ago, but due to economic problems they switched out the chefs with cheaper incompetent ones.     It was obvious in the food that I tasted. I have enjoyed much better food in fast food places that here!     The menu and they prices stayed the same even tho the food was markedly inferior!      I will never go there again!

ywH09tjzhjTw4DTuiuDHMA.text: Great Service, 4shizzle...however for such a price the Food and the menu is lacking some imagination and wow factor. That's why I took away one star. For a group setting, very nice...as an individual eater and looking to load up on some top quality sushi find a better match.  We had a party of 7 and we dropped over $2K. That's with drinks, maybe one 2 many drinks)))

R3jbADqIdHK_iBs5oZ5TpA.text: The food is solid, but I really enjoy the atmosphere, especially for a late meal in one of the casino facing tables. Sushi is very fresh and they have a great drink menu.  The service is excellent.

GKBVFKAw7A46Q07FVVXdvQ.text: Excellent sushi spot and the service is really good.  Even my wife agrees the waitresses were nice and nice looking.  Try the cucumber salad it was excellent.

OFDH3WWu2FmlJxHO4mo7SQ.text: Yellowtail was amazing! The prices were not half bad either for being located in the Bellagio. We walked out for under 100 bucks and that was for Appetizer, Cali Roll, Unagi Sushi, Sweet Shrimp something er other, and Dessert.  The staff was incredible. We had atleast 4 different people serving us. From the warm towels, to topping off our drinks, to checking to see if we needed anything else, to offering information on their menu.  The menu is about the only negative. And that is mostly because I'm not uber sushi connoisseur. But the staff was friendly and answered all the questions I had.  Oh! And the view...we were lucky to get a seat inside, next to the window, looking right outside to the fountains.  If you like sushi, you gotta check it out!

zIOwAdvYyrGsgCWIQCeClQ.text: I am shocked that this place has a 4 star average. Absolutely floored.   In Vegas for the weekend, the wife and I want sushi. We decide to give Yellowtail a try. The hostess tells us she'll have a table for us in 20 minutes. Great, we go to the bar.  35 minutes later I go back to check in and a different hostess tells me it will probably be another 15 minutes. Meanwhile the place is at least 1/3 empty. They're probably trying to create that fake buzz that the restaurant is more popular than it actually is. Annoying, but I guess that's part of Vegas. At one point the bartender even asked us "You guys are STILL waiting for a table?" When we said yes, he actually went up to the hostess stand on our behalf. Not sure that it did much, but we were appreciative all the same.  After waiting for about 45 minutes in a 1/3 empty restaurant we finally get seated. The decor of this place is nice, I'll give it that. One of the few redeeming qualities of Yellowtail.  We're seated by the window facing the fountain show outside The Bellagio. Nice setting. Unfortunately things went down from there.  We ask to start with some edamame and the King Crab Dynamite starter. Then we order a couple different rolls and a few types of nigiri sushi. The starter arrives (the edamame never actually showed up) and within 2 minutes all the rolls and sushi were on the table. Shouldn't you have at least 5-10 minutes minimum to eat your starter before the rest of your meal is being hustled to the table? The restaurant at this point is probably 1/2 empty.  It wasn't like they had to turn over the table quickly for other waiting guests.  It's not even worth rehashing exactly what type of rolls and sushi we ordered because it was all pretty poor, as was the crab starter. The quality of the fish here is equal to what you get in those pre-packaged Safeway sushi trays. No lie, it's on that same level. Certainly not what I expected given the decor of the restaurant and the exorbitant prices. We were ready to drop some $$$ for a good meal. We certainly dropped the $$$, but Yellowtail didn't deliver on the good meal.  2 Large Sapporo's, 2 glasses of champagne ($30 total), King Crab Starter, 2 rolls, 6 total pieces of Nigiri cost $170!! $170 and I left hungry.  My advice for anyone thinking of going to Yellowtail... instead go to Safeway, buy a few of those pre-packaged sushi trays, a 6 pack of Sapporo and a bottle of champagne and take it back to your room. Same quality food and to complete the effect, you can even make yourself wait 45 minutes to eat it. And the best part is that you'll have an extra $120 in your pocket to spend in Vegas.

OARN5OpxxNifJlXp5bLSbQ.text: As I read from another reviewer, I had seen this restaurant mentioned among others on my hotel television promoting different attractions in Las Vegas.  I booked the reservation online, and was very satisfied.  My boyfriend and I were seated right away.  Our server was attentive and courteous for the duration of the meal.  Order three appetizers: the standard edamame and gyoza (particularly delicious) and Alaskan King Crab tempura (our server's recommendation).  Other than looking like tater-tots, the tempura was very good.  My rolls were amazing: the yellowtail scallion (made sense to order the namesake) and the Rock Shrimp handroll.  Boyfriend's special lobster/tuna concoction was not worth the price.  Spicy tuna was good.  As others have said, liquor prices are ridiculous.  While the prices for the rolls were generally reasonable (around $15), the cheapest carafe of sake was $35.  Stupid.

AQy-qkk7u1Y9Wn38D241iw.text: 5 stars! Absolutely perfect location! If you book online make a note to request a table on the balcony for a front row seat to the a bellagio water show. Reasonable Vegas prices for a nice restaurant but totally worth it for the quality of the food and surroundings. Staff were fantastic and provided 5 star service. Could not recommend this restaurant enough! A must do when in Vegas!

Ks-zG4ksjGyRvRP4yIxdjw.text: I have eaten at Yellowtail three times now... and this review will encompass all three trips: In my humble opinion, yellowtail should change its website to BOMB.COM!  Seriously, how they get such FRESH sushi in the middle of a desert baffles me, Vegas rules, man. I've had a Tuna pizza, delish... multiple rolls of their sushi... amazing... And the love of my pallet, their Kobe steak, it's like a meat explosion in your mouth... (um, wow, screw it, I'm leaving it just like that.)... It IS pricey... the Kobe alone will run you upwards of 40 green backs for a pretty small steak (I couls easily crush two of them).  But its worth it! Drinks are really well made here, order something different, you;ll be surprised. And if you want to eat here, call ahead, if the weather is nice, ask for fountain side outdoor seating, best ground level view of the Bellagio fountain show. Oh yeah, they have this sweet deal... if you buy Cirque De Soleil "O" show tickets, you can upgrade to a package deal for 13 more dollars, the package includes a free drink at a bellagio bar, your O show tix, and dinner at Yellowtail!!! Of course, its off of a limited menu, but still very tasty stuff.  Try it out, and off topic, O will blow your MIND!  Cheers-  dRe'

wAELD_XM-PnEGXbgkfx1cQ.text: Well as with all the Strip sushi joints the quality of food is awesome, service is awesome . I ate at the bar and the bartenders are great, but I just can't justify the portions and the prices can't give this more than a 3 star because of those reasons.

ibEGx_89GJIMynLz5--7Sw.text: Go anywhere else in the Bellagio if you want good service. We tried eating at the bar, waited over 40 minutes for 6 pieces of sushi to show up. The waitress forgot to bring our second round of drinks, we ended up cancelling the rest of our order... the food quality is overrated. The man sitting beside me left because he didn't want to suffer the same fate. Furthermore, the food service manager had nothing to say after we advised him of what had transpired. I find this unacceptable.  We travel extensively and dine frequently. I highly recommend hitting up Olives or Michael Mina if you want real food AND good service.

qtI8x6shcOeSTeywgLOTHg.text: Very fresh Sushi at a decent price (considering it's inside the Bellagio).  I heard that the Tuna pizza is the best thing they have and will definitely be back to give it a try.

ziT4rlT6SNRzhpuUc4nR2Q.text: My favorite dish here is the tuna pizza. It was recommended as the most popular dish here and they did not disappoint. I already am a fan of truffle oil, so I knew this dish had to be good. The kobe beef tataki just bursted with flavor in your mouth. I also tried the sushi with the pop rocks which the name in itself already caught my attention. I think it's a cool concept but I personally did not like the sweetness from the pop rocks mixed with the sushi. I do appreciate the chef's creativeness in this. Overall, very good experience here, not to mention the beautiful backdrop of the Bellagio water show in the background at night.

YxoRZwApN2GMw1Z65pNp9Q.text: Beautiful. Very Good Food. Superb Service.  Party of 4 on Sunday night.  We ordered the big eye tuna pizza, popping spicy crab roll, seafood "dynamite", some nigiri and a Maine lobster roll (a special that evening). Each dish was good, the tuna pizza was very delicious. The pop rocks in the spicy crab roll are amusing. It's a nice bit of sushi, the candy doesn't add all that much, but puts a smile on your face. The seafood dynamite was the least refined of the dishes, very stew-like but still good. We were offered a special roll that was made with Maine lobster, it had flavor reminiscent of the tuna pizza which we loved and the lobster was excellent. The unagi, maguro and shiro maguro were all very nice.  Our server, Teo (sp?), was attentive and made our experience a comfortable one. He was very knowledgeable about the dishes and his description of the lobster sold us on that fine dish.  Yellowtail's beautiful space just added to the overall positive experience. We will definitely return.  Total bill with tax/tip $240 (2 rounds of cocktails).

QK8j8CoiNPItOFglLBhtXg.text: Came here for a birthday dinner with a close friend. We didn't have to wait long (it was a weekend too) and the ambiance was pretty nice. It's off the casino floor but I didn't feel bombarded by slot machine sounds all night. The we had a couple starters, sushi rolls, and dessert. Everything was great and the only slight downside to the evening was arguing over who might have eaten the shrimp's eyeball (it had fallen out). We had a nice dinner. I wouldn't rate it five stars simply because while our experience was good, it wasn't spectacular or particularly memorable either. Would give it another shot though if I'm craving sushi on the Strip!

IlEYa_p5bzKHfIchrLjsBw.text: Let's see, it's extremely hard to order because it is so dark in there, you can barely read the menu (literally had to use my lighter, and I'm 31 with perfect vision). It is loud, and not in a good way; sounds like you are in the kitchen. I'm not stingy when it comes to fancy dining, especially Vegas; I know you pay a lot for a little in places like this, but this place is ridiculous! The portions are so small, its hard to share something with even two people (and we had 10), so if everyone wanted to try something, we had to place 5 orders for it!!$  The waiter came by every now and then, and had to yell over the ambient noise; AND forgot either a drink or menu item more than a couple times.   As for the food...eh. Although the fish/shellfish in the apps tasted extremely fresh, it seems as though everything was drenched in truffle oil to make it seem fancy [hire a new head chef]. The rolls were about the size of my index finger, so tasting the fish/ingredients over the rice they were rolled in was a task. This isn't the only sushi restaurant in Vegas, I recommend trying one of the others before you step foot in here.   *We ended up spending well over $100 per person, and had to grab a real dinner soon there after. Not one person in our party of 8 girls and 2 guys were full after that.  Sorry Yellowtail, you are going to have to kick it up a few notches.

A65Jnh582yDIfhKzYMoV9g.text: Yes I understand sushi is expensive but this was very expensive, like very.  The big eye tuna pizza was crazy good but the other sushi was average.

3EPImqYWpuGMXieC52I_dA.text: I have visited this restaurant  on many occasions. Probably one of my favorites in Las Vegas. The views are wonderful ( overlooks the water fountains), decor is nice and the food was top notch. The Big Eye Tuna Pizza is the talk of the town! However on my last visit I noticed the service and sushi quality has gone down a bit. I am not sure if everyone was having a bad day or if it was an off night but the our waiter was non-existent and messed up our order on top of it. There were major D staff just walking around and pretty much not talking to anyone or asking how things are going. The Sushi felt like it was unpackaged from a supermarket shelf and served to us. The Kobe Beef showed up cold. You get the picture :) I will not give up on this place just yet and will give it one more try in the future but keep and eye out for bad service and low quality sushi. For what you pay for this place the experience should be better.

XN2XjbFLJLcYTm7yU5vIQg.text: Sometime Japanese food can be not worth it even done well.  This restaurant is worth it. Excellent food, very attentive servers

7D6MRIZVtizE-iv3rh196A.text: The service here was pretty terrible - we had 5 different waiters in a span of 30 minutes. Why? We ordered only one dish for a pre-show snack, and the unagi roll (seaweed, rice, and unagi - THREE ingredients) took 20+ minutes to come out on a Sunday night when it didn't look very busy.   I did order a Sunrise cocktail though, and that is the only reason I'm rating this a 3 and not a 2. Grey Goose L'Orange vodka, blood orange puree, yuzu, and shiso leaf. Very very good. I was very impressed and wished it came in a 20oz margarita cup/pitcher/thing worthy of Vegas tackiness.

9ZtwstlxMfhzE2sGSBRTuA.text: Delicious food, trendy ambiance. We wandered in while waiting for some friends to get in on our first night in Vegas, and we were seated in the front section, out in the casino - honestly until now I had no idea you could get a view of the Bellagio fountains!! Will definitely push for that next time.   We ordered the edamame and two share plates - rock shrimp and tempura crab. The edamame was unique - came in two dishes, one with rock salt and the other with chili sauce. The rock shrimp was good but the sauce was too creamy for my taste. The crab was, hands down, the star of the show. Huge chunks of crab. Tasty (ponzu?) sauce. We also had the chocolate lava cake which was delicious, although not very lava-y by my standards .... I like my chocolate to ooze. Our drinks were amazing - I had the blood orange and my bf had the kiwi (this will make sense when you see the drink menu).   One gripe - I hear they have super nice bathrooms, but when I went they were shut down and I was (sternly) directed out of the restaurant. The food was definitely tasty - if I were in Vegas again I would go back to try some other things on the menu ...which could push my stars up to 4 (stay tuned).

-XbngrK3hEh8dy2Z-nQ-rw.text: Very good And interesting food. Not typical sushi. But great new types of food to try.

ZxW0jXUxNPJMbCwelDFV1w.text: The portions here are small (good for sharing between two people maybe), and the tempura veggies were really much better than I expected, but the sushi was sub-par. Not only were the flavor combinations (on my visit at least) strange and unappetizing - for example, mango lobster - the fish wasn't as fresh as it should have been for the $30 roll price. I would not recommend this restaurant. They did sell crazy milk, which is a plus.

dAmB_R1UuIFRTLlAG_Jblw.text: Amazing cocktails, exorbitant prices. I'm game! For $20 a pop you get one of a modest selection of amazing drinks. My friends and I each ordered one and the sucker who won the most at the tables paid for all our drinks haha. Tab came out to be around $80ish tip included, worth every penny of it. The friend who paid for the drink also made a comment on their selection of sake: "I'm blown away by just being in the presence of these expensive, rare bottles of sake." Good times. Will be back whenever I'm at the Bellagio!

K2N9BsIF6zhSdL6q2m0uPQ.text: This place is amazing! The sushi was the best I've ever had, no exasperating. Also the ambiance was very nice and intimate. I sat outside on the balcony which gave me the perfect view of the water show without the crowd. The sad was amazing and extra attentive. Over all I am very pleased with Yellowtail and I will be returning every chance I get.

aS6fNuJonDJeE66LC3rt2g.text: Best Sushi I have ever had. Waiter was wonderful, we  gave him an idea of our past sushi experiences and comfort level. He brought out multiple dishes that everyone loved. The flavors and freshness were amazing. Would definitely recommend to other, I personally will be back next time I'm in Vegas.

pxz-A5N7Nb5ASp6UrW_iHQ.text: I'm back at one of my favorites in Vegas. We decided to try the Mile High and Protein specialty rolls. We also tried the Big Eye Tuna Pizza which our server highly recommended. The "pizza" looked odd to me. But when I tasted it, I loved it. On the flip slide  the protein roll was a disappointment. It tasted good but the amount of fish was obscenely small!!! The mile high was better. The ambience is great and service was exceptional. I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mile High toll

f1qhOgGFmg_nsP0Oc9m2hQ.text: Great friendly service. Got there and it was not that crowded ,yet. Staff is great. Menu was simple. Not too complicated. Everything tastes great. Recommend at least once.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Pizza
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another view
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from patio table

KGNE_QbLRxwh8gOCODHX2A.text: My boyfriend and I were very excited to try Yellowtail last night for the first time, as we frequent the Bellagio but usually dine in other places.   We were seated in the back with a view of the fountains which was beautiful, and settled in with our menus. A waiter came by to bring water, and then the giant cluster that was this evening began.   After that waiter came, we were completely forgotten about. I don't even understand how this is possible, as we had a waiter come by in the first place. A table next to us was seated five minutes later and ordered their drinks and meals while we continued to sit. Finally, after 15 minutes of sitting there we flagged down a bus boy who said we would get our waiter. Another 5 minutes go by and a waiter comes to the table and proceeds to tell us that he is going to get YET ANOTHER WAITER?  After waiting another 5 minutes we walked out. I don't understand how this is even possible. The restaurant wasn't full, there were waitstaff all around, yet we could not get anyone to take our order.  Pretty sure we would still be sitting there waiting for service at this very moment if we hadn't left!

Be2yhxMw0WRWhWwRIYDiag.text: Really innovative and delicious sushi restaurant at the Bellagio. With a view right over the fountain show, Yellowtail amazes with beautifully presented sashimi, sushi, steak and lobster. We shared a large array of plates for our group ranging from Kobe beef to tuna crudo to some of the best uni I've ever had.  Try the big eye tuna pizza and the sushi with pop rocks!  Definitely on the pricey side but worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Montage of gorgeous food at Yellowtail!

K3egv2hNWV_j4zrFUwCccg.text: Wow!  Yellowtail jalapeno  Mile High roll Spicy tuna roll  Salmon sashimi  Highly recommend all of the dishes, we ended up getting two Mile High Rolls. Delicious. Service was phenomenal. I'd highly highly recommend sitting outside even if it's cold. We got to see the Bellagio fountain go off every 15 minutes during our meal. And they have heat lamps. Quite romantic. And quiet which is always nice in vegas and seldom occurs.

KVPoQYNPf8ntaQP1-AKb5A.text: The raves about new style sashimi couldn't be more spot on- so so good. We ordered the salmon new style sashimi because I love sashimi and then some rolls because my fiance loves sushi rolls. The quality of food was superb. The rolls were interesting and unique, we got a unagi, the pop rocks one, and a the tuna belly scallion roll.   The pop rocks roll is funky but good, it's almost like a dessert roll. The other two were tasty and fresh.   The menu is pricey but consider where you are and our view of the bellagio fountains was immaculate. I requested an intimate table and they delivered nothing short. My fiance was so impressed. We had great service from the host to the server to their readiness to pour water at any time ours was low.   Thank you, we will be back next time we are in town!!

6S_fcJHPaMEJhMQfSksBeQ.text: Enjoyed a wonderful dinner here a couple nights ago. Our server, Brandon, was attentive and had on the point suggestions throughout the evening. We started the evening with his personal recommendation of Gingo Shizuko "Divine Droplets" Sake, summed up, it was delicious!   Must trys: Big eye Tuna Pizza Lobster Carpacchio Seared Diver Scallops  To end the evening Cocunut Rice Cakes, Great!!!  Only downfall, the sommelier was a tad pushy. She didn't introduce herself as she approached our table and just jumped right into her "sales pitch". However, this was a minor detail to our overall evening, which was exceptional.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops

iRyi5I_zNqHRRp8bxmswKw.text: Don't know why this restaurant have 3.5 stars?!? Food was to the finest and great service.

bAz_Y6vR2zhJ2u0dbUyQSw.text: I went to this restaurant with with bridal party during my bachelorette weekend and it was AMAZING. The staff was so attentive and friendly. We were given a table on the waterfront and got to watch the fountains go off. It was the most perfect evening. The tuna pizza is a must as well as the protein roll and mile high roll. My girls and I just absolutely loved this place. There were a couple girls who aren't sushi fans and they still found some great food to enjoy. This restaurant is a must if you are in town!!!

cPp2sAxSF-4vfQqex5If5g.text: I've always loved yellowtail... Just not yellowtail prices. I'll admit that this visit was the most expensive bill I've had... But I was also covering for the birthday girl. 10 girls.... $959 (double damn)  With that being said.... Our server  Emmanuel was very attentive. He asked once, by name, if we were waiting on the birthday girl. After he knew who she was... He kept calling her by name all night. Even snuck the dessert menu over to us while she was on a bathroom break! He's good... Really good! I'm was stuck trying to figure out how he got her to go to the bathroom on queue. Lmao   Right away we ordered the edamame, in which we wanted both bowls to be sweet chili instead of sea salt (the best way to order them).   There were a few things on the table... Let's see if I can remember them all.     My favorite roll is the high steaks! It's a shrimp tempura roll topped with filet mignon and A1 sauce. It's a interesting combination... But a good one.   Mushroom as a side.... Soooo much flavor!!!!   Rock shrimp- a little dry. Not as good as Nobu  Chilean Sea bass- great tasting... Small serving.   Nope, can barely remember anything else (I had a lot to drink) but I'll post the pictures!   Just make sure when you come here you bring both of your wallets, because it won't be a cheap night out. Also, if you're in a big group they don't split checks... Not even three ways!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple crumble
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ugni and oyster shooters
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. High steaks

iwtSGi1nqTIGb1xlYj-Cuw.text: The food was absolutely amazing when it finally came out over 2:30 hours after we were seated!  We had a 7:15 reservation for 6.  We were seated early and drinks were delivered quickly.  We ordered appetizers and all looked to be going well.  Then it turned into a miserable time.  The halibut was delivered first.  Then a shareable plate.  Then nothing for OVER 45 minutes.  We had show tickets at 9:30.  I alerted the server that we needed our food.  He said it would be just 3-5 minutes.  10 minutes later 4 of the 5 meals were served.  Mine not being one of them.  4 of us left for the show...me without food.  The 2 remaining finally got the bill 15 min later where they comped my meal.  They paid the bill after chatting for a few more minutes and the waiter finally brought my Sushi rolls... I wasn't there to enjoy them but...so needless to say if you have a relatively large group, are in a hurry, along with wanting your party's meals delivered at the same time this is not the place.

5q6k7FwqKNei-cmHfMoPKg.text: So good!!! Myyhkeh was our server. I think that's how you spell it? He was so good! Very knowledgeable and fun. My friend is not a fan of sushi, but there are many other options here. She had some kind of BBQ roll? It was amazing. I had the yellowtail roll and the salmon sashimi. The sashimi was good, but it was pricey for just three pieces of fish. The miso soup was good, but really just like other miso soups out there. The mixed drink I had was a cucumber martini and so refreshing. We also indulged in an apple dessert and my gosh, you guessed it, amazing! Ha. Definitely check this place out. It's pricey, but I feel like everything in Vegas is.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drinks!
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon sashimi.
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The yummy apple dessert.

VWJzsL6MhLqFzAOlYTxvKQ.text: This was the tiniest sushi I've ever seen.  I chose the "Mile High" premium roll at $32 and thought I'd be in for a treat.  It was small, bland and lacking in imagination.  I've had better in supermarket trays.  I've also had better service in supermarkets.

tPnEmCXi-d5G9mq7NPnNFA.text: Another gem on the strip. Was in a mood for sushi and stopped by and was immediately seated. Tried quite a few things and one after another it kept getting better. Started with Hamachi and Halibut sashimi, followed by Salmon Serrano and Lobster Carpaccio. Then switched to rolls. Happa ( spicy tuna ) and Crispy Kalbi ( warm Kali need rolled and topped with cold coleslaw. Refreshing surprise. Every morsel was cooked ( served raw )  to perfection making me want more. The rolls were the highlight , very creative bursting with flavor and served to please the eye. They say you eat with your eyes first and this places captures your attention with every dish. Akira Back has created a winner.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Serrano
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Carpacio
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi and Halibut Sashimi

OTLdapsB-fwlg8gQnJwLfg.text: Yellowtail sounds delicious! It is. With a very big but! This review is based on the class and price of this restaurant. The service was slow, and price was... Pricy (as to be expected in Vegas), but price should match service.   This place needs some work.  The food was delicious, but look at my picture of their salmon sushi, to know the portion size for the price.  If you're in Vegas find another place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smallest salmon ever!
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail

1EHDT3w0IEbDoVemykjhZw.text: I'll swim up to Yellowtail anytime!   Started out at the bar with Kat, she suggested a delicious drink for my friend called the 'Dragonfire' and I opted for the delicious Yamazaki. We hung out with her while we waited for our table outside. She was super friendly and my friend was enamored with her beauty. He probably creeped her out, but she handled his douchey-ness well.   We were seated outside, and while I've seen the Bellagio fountains a thousand times, my friend was awe struck by our table location and the fountains. Nick was our server, he was friendly and personable, and guided us in the right direction for menu choices. He suggested the tempura king crab and tuna pizza. Even if you don't have a full meal, stop in for those two items. Cash. Money. Hoes. We ordered a bunch of rolls, but our Pop Rock Crab roll was a party in my mouth. Sorry gentleman, this is a PG show, no gutter thoughts. Nick was super sweet, he must've overheard it was my friend's birthday because when we ordered the chocolate cup dessert, it had a little 'Happy Birthday' note. I didn't even say anything to the hostess when I made the reso, so it was a very nice touch for a server to take notice.

hP_VklXlgH57UdvdX7m-pA.text: Our experience at Yellowtail was fantastic!  Food was spectacular, service was amazing, and the fountain show view took it to a whole other level.  Not your traditional sushi experience, very unique offerings.  Big eye tuna pizza was one of our favorites.  Additionally we had the mile high roll (highly recommend), pop rocks roll, spicy tuna roll, sweet Chile edamame.  Everything was delicious.  Highly recommend, and we will definitely visit again.

RgyUedmygvr4Am-4oBz_Yg.text: Sushi was awesome, a bit pricey but nice atmosphere we came here for sushi and drinks and had a hefty bill staff nice drinks good .

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sakitini

rbAiXq6Fj5elbkVbkVK69g.text: This was by far my favorite meal of our recent trip to Vegas. Located in the Bellagio hotel with great views of the famed fountains, the restaurant is trendy and sophisticated without being too fancy or stuff. The service was fantastic. Every bite of food was incredibly fresh and delicious. I particularly loved the Salmon Triadito (this was one of the most fresh, clean, refreshing, and perfect raw dishes I have ever had) and the Seared Diver Sea Scallops.  The restaurant really went above and beyond though when dealing with an allergy of mine. I was intrigued by the idea of a sushi roll with pop rocks in it (when in Vegas!) but the one on the menu comes with Crab, which I cannot eat. Luckily the chef prepared a version of the roll for me with spicy tuna instead... and it was awesome! A rare delight of candy and savory food working together with such a fun, unique mouthfeel.  I would definitely return on my next trip to Vegas. They made me feel like a king!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Scallops
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pop Rocks + Sushi!
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rock Shrimp

9yflIrLPtMAvKykcSXXoAQ.text: Sorry, but I was not impressed. Basically overpriced sushi here. An underwhelming experience at best. would I recommend? Not really. There's better sushi places in this town.

HALn-A-VspoatO6rRdExpg.text: Very good and very fresh modern American style sushi restaurant. Which can be a great thing if you are in the mood for it. It is a little pricey, but hey... You are on the strip, and the patio seats have a great view of the Bellagio fountains. If you are looking for old school Japanese style sushi, this ain't the spot for you. But if you want fresh fish done in a newer Asian fusion style, it's amazing.   The big eye tuna pizza is very good, and the uni is very fresh and high grade. One of the things that stood out the most was the chefs special, which was tuna topped with caviar! Mmmmmmm.   Definitely a spot to go to on a special occasion, or a date if you are trying to seal the deal or something.

EIeU0chMROuKV0v59rYXdQ.text: I don't think we could ever asked for a better server than Sarah. She was phenomenal. The eggplant skewers, miso cod, toro caviar, foie gras and baked crab roll were my favorites. The food was delicious, the vibe was very relaxed and the service was beyond excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Crab Hand Roll, Soft Shell Crab, Salmon Skin

RRMGLk6O0kpPREA7Z2w_Lg.text: My second favorite sushi restaurant in Vegas. A lot of original blends of fish make this a must try sushi location. Prices tend to be on the high side and if you sit at the tables facing casino, it can be loud but fun people watching.  Service is great and location in the Bellagio is convenient enough if staying there or just popping in to shop the Bellagio stores and need a bite to eat. Make reservations on weekends as it gets packed.

oI_erfL2y50JCQBbbvSCWQ.text: Food was awesome but killed by the service. Half of our sushi didn't get ordered, my boyfriend's salad and my soup came out way after our sushi, and we got asked to see our ID by 4 different girls within 40 minutes. We're both 25. Very annoying. If they're that worried about it, ID at freaking the door instead of interrupting us 4 TIMES.

-hi2thiQQmyPRHzDQBKBKQ.text: We were looking forward to Yellowtail mainly because of the location in the Bellagio. The ambience was different right from the start. The restaurant was almost empty on a monday night and the lighting was so bright, I felt like we were in an upscale diner. The food was above average but nothing exceptional except for the tuna pizza. Yes, the tuna pizza appetizer was really good. The pricing was as you'd expect in Bellagio. Really high for what you get. I would probably go elsewhere when I come back to Vegas. We had (2) different servers because the first one clocked out. Why give us 2 different servers? Doesn't make any sense.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eh!
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eh!

40WKmxOsTwEb4CV7-LbUtw.text: This place is a secret little hidden gem in Vegas. I've never been here before, and I've been to Vegas so many times I've lost count. I actually chose this place because I called two previous restaurants at this hotel that were completely booked. But I'm so glad that the third time really was the charm. The Bellagio fountains went off during the start of our meal as we were getting our drinks. It was a stunning cheers moment.  The survive was so helpful and polite. We didn't have to wait very long for our food and the decor was so modern and beautiful. This is my new go to spot when I come to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view

n1fBgJ5f4BE1qw2JUU9t7Q.text: My compliments to the chef, actually to a Sous Chef Alec Mayfield along with my server, Chanez M.  Two combination made my Omakase dinner on August 28th as perfect as it can be.  Chanez informed me that Sous Chef Mayfield personally made my Omakase selection and made it himself.  Quality and the taste was to die for.  Wasn't expecting to see   Foie Gras as a part of Omakase.  However, I am so glad that he included them.  Foie Gras was one of the best I've tasted anywhere.  Not even the best restaurants from Paris could have made this Foie Gras better than Yellowtail.  What can I say about Chanez.... She was great.  She was attentive, professional and friendly.  She bend over backwards to make this Omakase dinner as perfect as possible.  I just can't wait for my next trip to repeat this experience.  Thank you Chanez and Chef Mayfield for making this into a perfect evening.

XX7JqphQopBtc2kvuqiCXA.text: Would give 5 starts but for the price. We got in late and found this place open with limited seating. Wait staff exotic, flashy and professional. We had edemame, miso soup (try the spicy miso !) and some sashimi. I tried a cucumber vodka drink. It was really refreshing.  The grilled halibut share plate was my favorite

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted edemame
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled halibut share plate. Enough for an entree
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy miso yummy!!!

kKeBUwA3-ThhWqXUQkrbiQ.text: The food here was amazing and the view, which was of the Bellagio fountains, was beautiful. This is a very classy Japanese restaurant. The black cod was delicious and the toro rolls were superb.

_bJxr-nb6NMKvWfvE-RD9w.text: Excellent food. They have TVs at the bar too. Here's the rub, get the protein roll! Yes, it's expensive but it's literally melt in your mouth. The view in the restaurant area is of the beautiful Belliago fountains. This place has lasting value. ..it's tough to be a restaurant in this hotel. You must be EXCELLENT and Yellowtail fits the bill.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soft shell crab roll. We also had the protein roll but I forgot to take a picture!

j7qsPvS45hNpOJKIOe6sIg.text: This place was absolutely delicious. Highly recommend the Crispy Kalbi and the seafood dynamite. The service was great too and the atmosphere/music was relaxing.

gIrZgK2LEjQ30tDJ2vjsLQ.text: I got SEVERE food poisoning right after this meal which ruined my whole weekend.Would have given 1 star, but 2 because the big eye tuna pizza was good. Our server spoke very highly of the protein roll, but the crab tasted funky. Very mayo-y as well. Felt like that roll is what caused my food poisoning.  We stayed at the Bellagio this past weekend April 12-14, and expected more from the quality of food at the hotel. Disappointed, especially for the cost.

3TOnlJ-T2E0ca5eZEfkLDQ.text: Popped in for a quick drink and bite before going to a show. So glad we did! We sat at the bar and enjoyed good conversation w the bar tender.  He made up the delicious dragon fire cocktail. For sushi we tries the crab and pop rocks roll. Yes, pop rocks in a sushi roll. It sounded so strange that we had to try it! Delicious.  Highly recommend!

c_52jZyTUTvpx2Nqv999Fw.text: We arrived to the restaurant with a reservation and they were not ready for us. The front area is very cramped and if you get more than five people it becomes a traffic jam. Good luck trying to get a drink at the bar in the meantime as that area is even more of a mess and instead of having someone getting drinks for people waiting on a seat they have several people at the hostess stand doing nothing.  As far as the food goes, everything I ordered was very delicious and very well prepared. It was surprisingly loud in the restaurant but that's to be expected in a packed restaurant. The staff was mediocre at best, I had to wait for very long periods to get a drink refill. The busers were more attentive than the wait staff.  Over all the staffing is their biggest issue but the food was outstanding. If you want great sushi but don't mind bland staff, hit this place up.

DoQLu7zzlva9p5Qemxep3w.text: Amazing service. Amazing food. If you like sushi, you can't go wrong with this upscale restaurant inside the Bellagio. Although it was raining tonight, if available, I would recommend the Veranda for outdoor seating. Not only is the view spectacular, you are also able to see the Bellagio water show up close.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from Veranda.
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pano view from Veranda.
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veranda at Yellowtail

p3go0HRymq6paD_XinJaMg.text: This place was good. I'm not the best person to review because I don't love sushi and I got dragged here for a work event however I can say this:  1) everybody I was with loved the food that they had.  2) The view from the patio alone was worth the price of admission.

MP87IJkssGyRG-dFv6qEdA.text: Good not great. Menu highly varied and interesting . Atmosphere nice. Service five star. Food was good but nobody in our party of seven was impressed or said "wow."

PiSLTPsRm0FbWix8330wKQ.text: Great service, great food, and great ambiance!  First of all- this place is a "small plates" kind of place. Since Chef Akira Back is a Michellin Star Chef,  the prices are steep. Be prepared for that! We, indeed, enjoyed our meal and really loved every bite! Our sushi we ordered was delicious, delicate, and delectable.  I didn't really like the dessert that we ordered- it was too fancy for me.  I recommend if you want a good view of the fountain and if you want some good sushi (and have the money for it)!!

ddFE0HOoKIPwXgLVo5flnw.text: They have some very tasty unique dishes here that are worth coming back.  The tuna sushi pizza is to die for.  I have eaten here four times and get it every time.  The yellowtail blood orange carpaccio is also very tasty.  Lastly, the king crab tempura with ponzu is also divine.

74_Y0xBCl1Jyhtf8wX17fw.text: First time in Vegas and this was my first meal here. Overall not a big sushi fan and this place, while good flavor and texture, all tasted the same to me. So if you are not a sushi buff, not worth the money.   On the other hand the beef short ribs were one of the most amazing things I've ever had. While there was only four small boneless pieces, the beef literally melted in your mouth. There were no teeth necesary to enjoy that dish and the flavor was a perfect mix of meat and gelatinous goodness.   The service was amazing and the staff really knew the menu really well and were great about refilling water and being available (expect for our later order that someone seemed to have forgotten to deliver for a half hour).

EQMUosoDrUZtXe7HlzDFbQ.text: Very nice place, sleek with a mix of tourists and locals.  Of course its over priced for what it is because of sheer location but your in Vegas.  Sushi is very good and so are the cocktails.  Service can be slow and the wait can be long.

CuDQ8jxFzDbD23TtsHIcYA.text: Mediocre at best! I went here in high hopes while in Vegas and walked into a packed restaurant which I thought meant the food will be delicious...WRONG. Everything on the menu is WAY overpriced for the food that you're getting. I had the Rock Shrimp (AKA Shrimp popcorn) very sugary and lacked any flavor outside of overly crusty sugary flavor. Duck prosciutto - even that was just super salty duck without much to bring out it's flavor. Any sushi roll is $15 or MORE for regular sushi. I've eaten at many many sushi places and don't mind spending money on GOOD food but if you're looking to spend money - i would much rather go to Nobu in Vegas. Their menu lacked uniqueness and intriguing dishes. Flavor palette was boring and lack luster.

OdskEnRCrwHFZBBBQsd3eg.text: Best sake and best seawood salad ever!  Service was superb.  We had tickets to the O show and the waitstaff was very attentive and watching our time for us.

CLzFYaow8L9VQsgTrrxU-Q.text: Pop rock sushi?! Say whaaaaaaaaaaaaaat. I just had to try it while I was visiting Las Vegas. It was basically a spicy tuna roll with pop rocks, really original and actually tasted pretty darn good. The other pleasant surprise of the evening was the Big Eye Tuna Pizza. It is topped with truffle oil, YUM! Ended up spending a pretty penny that night, but definitely had some delicious and originial food. I say it's worth a shot if your are looking for a nice date night in Vegas.

Z2QdG5VTJabGTxatVG-rSw.text: Came here for date night and they sat us right at the window by the fountains. The service was impeccable from entrance to end. Arnold and his staff is amazing! Create a wonderful experience for us. The tuna pizza I could eat everyday for the rest of my life. The food does not disappoint!

4hg2rsQa0AwIND2GRZq_ZQ.text: We only stayed for a drink here as it is extremely over priced - $20 for a cocktail, what a joke! There are much better options then this place - the two stars are for the service and the ambience.

BMmrbnFqDICMZTKZfRm8zg.text: The most amazing sushi meal of my life! Come here ready to splurge, but know that it will be worth it. First off - the view of the Bellagio fountains is spectacular! Second - the service is absolutely incredible and Third - the food and drinks can't be beat.  Definitely need to try the PopRocks Roll! We had several different small plates and they were all so tasty, but the winner was the roll that came with Korean BBQ Rib on top. They also have some craft Japanese Beers that were super delicious and the perfect ending to our meal.

txe8klWeELa0nDdmdnzLpQ.text: I didn't know this place was going to be so damn good.  I'm not a big raw fish eater or sashimi fan has to be great quality and it definitely is here.  The Tuna Pizza is WOW. we feasted and oh boy so good.

Rdc9yE2Yptd_PTGuYTD76A.text: Simply beautiful. This place is super sexy. Started at the bar and the bartenders are on it. I was waiting for my guests as I arrived early for my reservation. The music was upbeat and trendy the staff was really good looking but knowledgeable - one might assume they are hired for their looks but every one here knows their shit. My guests arrived and we were promptly seated. Tai snapper, Tuna Pizza, this Octopus Dish with a green sauce (amazing), and some nigiri, and these king crab hand rolls ( my favorite) as well. Ok so they have a sake girl the know what you've ordered and recommends sake for you... BEST THING EVER!! We got WASTED LOL, in a good way. Great view of the Belagio fountains too.        It was a memorable experience. The place is expensive, but I felt it was worth every penny and want to go back for my Birthday this year.   Great Job Yellowtail !!!

fzBuHM1DJUfBUFNO4HI99Q.text: The spicy tuna pizza is a must have. The rock shrimp is to die for. It's made with truffle oil and melts in your mouth. The service is quick and very efficient. The atmosphere is casual chic, the lighting is dark and sexy.

Dv2StIYj7Js5HnRAa3umCQ.text: Good sushi, not the best in town... with exorbitantly expensive dishes. This is great when others are paying. Ambiance ok.

blPYdiKYMqUu4vbr2NpCVQ.text: In three days, I ate Japanese A5 Kobe at three different restaurants, each prepared a different way.  While no particular one was better than the other, I was amazed at Yellowtail's preparation and dipping sauce.  When the plate hit the table, we looked like gremlins after midnight, devouring each piece like it was the last piece in existence.    Rewind to us waiting for our table and them trying to place us facing the smoky and noisy casino. No... $100 later and we're on the outdoor balcony facing the famous bellagio fountains.  That's more like it.    We ordered uni and we were presented with a small portion of nigiri.  After describing that we literally wanted a "pile of uni" on a plate, the waiter quickly returned with exactly that.  We scarved that down with smiles until more sushi came out.  I would say the fish was wonderful, fresh, and paced well.    It's not cheap, but it's great if you are in the mood to splurge or if you won some $ at the tables and have extra cash to throw around.  Enjoy!

NOL0VXVPYjSSDN1kmBY5SA.text: Another fine dining experience at the best sushi place in America.  The tuna pizza with truffle oil is to DIE for. We ate two. One for an appetizer and one for dessert.  Service is very good. The fountains outside the windows. Wow. Black cod amazing.  Sashimi with jalapeno melts in your mouth.  The cucumber martini best ever. I have been here ten times and have tried everything on the menu and haven't found anything that isn't great.  It's expensive but well worth it.  Enjoy

MBoYJPpx-Ox3CDLHLbWiPg.text: I really wanted to give yellowtail 5 stars. My husband and I enjoyed our dinner, the food was great. Our waitress seemed to be forgetful most of the night. Asked for extra ginger and sauces for our sushi. We waited a while, noticed it was taking so long so we started eating. Finally got the waitress's attention, and reminded her that she forgot. At that point we were nearly done with our food. It's too bad when the food is great and the service is horrible.

ZeGJfMKtlSp1voGokb3N9A.text: My goodness! The food here is outstanding. Try to come early and get a seat by the window for great view of the strip and the bellagio water show.   I ordered the tuna pizza. Best flavor combination you could ask for. The entire night at the bellagio I debated going back and getting a couple more of these pizzas.   Next I got the lobster carpaccio. Very delicious again but could have used a few more pieces of lobster. After all, $30 for 6 thinly slices of lobster? Let's try and be fair here.   Followed with the Kobe beef tataki. By this point I told my server it had all gone down hill. The sauce was over powering and you could barely taste the beef.   Next I had the ankimo. Fish liver was tasty. No complaints here.   Ended with a toro scallion roll. Needs more toro!  6 pieces od deliciousness but needed more sushi.   Service was good. I asked for a second glass of coke from one of the waiters and never go it.  Oh well.   I would only come back for the tuna pizza.

CB_KVHkSvXoag08sLatPhA.text: HONESTLY, THE BEST MEAL I'VE HAD IN VEGAS.  This restaurant is simply AMAZING.  I came here for my birthday dinner. I expected to pay a lot, but I didn't expect the food to be this good!  The decor was just in my taste, gold, warm colors, dimmed lights - just a romantic, pleasant atmosphere. Tables aren't too close together, so we had our privacy. LOVED IT!  THE FOOD IS EXQUISITE! I was extremely happy with EVERYTHING we ordered.  Big Eye Tuna Pizza - simply delicate and delicious. The truffle oil was an amazing addition. Baked Crab and Rock Shrimp Hand Rolls - delicious and tender Madlon Sea Salt and Sweet Chili Edamame is a MUST - a very nice twist to edamame! Sake was good as well!  The SERVICE WAS SUPERB! Our waiter was pleasant, cooperative, and attending without hesitation. He was very helpful with any unfamiliar items on the menu.  He truly deserved a big tip!  The bill was a bit pricier than what I usually pay for Japanese, however, it was worth it. Plus for the Bellagio, the prices were considerably cheap!  All in all, this is a must for a nice Vegas dining! You will not be disappointed. I'm definitely making another reservation soon!

ykwnYwC8hBG20kxpVZnTwg.text: Excellent service and excellent food! We highly recommend the  Tuna Pizza as it has a very surprising aftertaste that has you wanting more. We also had the spicy dragon roll and the protein roll- the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna pizza

CNSgDR8RCENNQEFBeQxLlg.text: Definitely on the pricier side, but the food was definitely interesting. Some of their rolls are more interesting than others. I remember there was a crackling crab roll and it literally pops in your mouth!

PlL8u-jSSxGQNQU1FxHU6w.text: Ruined my evening. I came in happy and ready to enjoy some fine dining, and I left hungry and about $75 poorer. This is very far from authentic Japenese. I knew that coming in. But I at least expected to get some food for my money.

6zu7aelGka5jfY_bSZFE5Q.text: We always have a great time here. This time around, we had the Big Eye Tuna pizza, which was our favorite. Who knew tuna and truffle oil went so well together??? Also had the Rock Shrimp hand roll, Seaweed Salad, and a few other cut rolls. Everything was delicious, and service on point, as usual. Also, check out their amazing view of the strip from their balcony- watched the water show after dinner. A great way to end the night.

bv73Ocp0yxL1qEJ6CAt54g.text: Good cocktails, above average sushi and a seductive elegant atmosphere will all be found at this location. Pricey, but what do you expect you're at the Bellagio!

Zs_sGC62iEYe11SgpVN95w.text: I went here over the weekend. Definitely the SMALLEST pieces of sushi I've ever had. It was delicious and the roll that has the pop rocks in it is a must. It was delicious and fun.  The rock shrimp appetizer was great, although tiny. The staff was snooty and the girls were bimbos for sure. The food is almost worth it. Glad to say I tried it but probably wouldn't go back. Not the best bang for buck. $130 later, still hungry.

sSGIMg0mxFb9Cmqfn8Nbjg.text: Had dinner here 2 nights ago on a whim.  Was our last night in town and we had a group of 8-decided to take a chance without really researching it bc it was in our hotel.  The food was dissappointingly mediocre, with one exception (the miso black cod which was quite good).  I sort of expected that.  What I didn't expect was the horrible service.  The waitress kept leaving the table after taking one persons order without allowing the rest of the party to order their dinner.  We had to keep stopping her and telling her to come back for the rest of the order.  We had only ordered a few appetizers previously so I'm not sure what she was thinking.  We waited 30 minutes for one of our pre dinner drinks and 30 min for a hot tea I ordered after dinner.  She forgot one of our rolls.  And she never seemed the slightest apologetic or embarrassed.  All this at an extremely high price point, even for an upscale sushi restaurant.  It was more than our dinner at Andreas (at the Wynn) the night before.  Terrible experience.

PHIwatiMEALCTiJVw93XtA.text: By far, the best sushi bar I've ever been to. The service is superb, the location is beautiful and the food blew my mind with its freshness.

PLRKfo1Im0VkCnQWt-xkYg.text: YellowFAIL. Overpriced, Pretentious w/ no justification.  $28 for 1 scallop. That's right. One. Waiter was a snot, couldn't get a decent table for anniversary even w/advanced reservations & showing up early. Apparently we didn't know the right suit to fellate. It tries to come off chic but really just sucks. We spent over $100 on dinner (no drinks), & left hungry. Need I say more.

qIt1ZNfo7L0ozb1f8aR2AQ.text: Service is good... but the food is just average... nothing that really stands out as really good... but nothing that tastes bad either...

RucZs-P3-8BHH4a8lAjYog.text: Well, the cons were that we waited for awhile before we were seated and the waitress spilled lemonade on the table. Also appetizers were brought at the same time as the entree, but that could be a good thing, depending on the person. Portions were small and overpriced, but it is sushi in Las Vegas, so what do you expect? However, the overall service and food was good. Sashimi was small and only 3 pieces for 11 dollars. But the Saba was great, and the lemonade was the best I've ever had. Snapper, yellowtail and eel were all fresh and tender, and the miso was to die for. The soybeans came in 2 ways, salted and put in a sweet chili oil. They were good, and the Japanese pickles were OK. So, this place's food was great (better than the sushi in the buffet), but don't expect it to be filling...or cheap.

FXNTKx-4CU11MaRYbOOreg.text: I was disappointed after my recent visit to Yellowtail.  We ordered the scallops (which were AMAZING) as our appetizer and several rolls for our dinner.  When our drinks were brought mine was fine but my date had to ask the waiter for an extra shot of rum because his drink just tasted like soda (they brought it and didn't charge us, which was nice). The rolls came out very quickly but no scallops - the waiter said everything on the menu is an appetizer so they just bring out whatever comes up first.  That was weird to me.  The rolls (we ordered three different ones) were just blah, no decoration or sauce on the plate and we had to ask for soy sauce. The whole experience was just meh - our server seemed like he was losing his mind although it was a very slow night in the restaurant.  Someone who may have been the manager did check on us at least three times after the drink incident.  All in all, uninspiring rolls, weak drinks, way too expensive.

fVJ7NJ5PfWZqOBZ7nDiETg.text: I was really excited to try this place, but I thought it was just okay. The Kobe beef plate was $32 - and not a big deal.

wYb7mZQURIWeqbjZBH44aw.text: The service was terrible. I had to leave our table to retrieve menus at the hostess station. It took about 15 minutes for the waitress to take our order. The manager seemed really annoyed by the four of us. We got mixed messages from the hostess, manager, and waitress about the status of the restaurant--they were open for drinks only, last call on food, last call on drinks. No one knew what was going on; the staff were not communicating well, and the food and drinks are overpriced.

wyEGKeq7_Y7TnZbwS5iNXw.text: My friends and I loved this place so much we had to come back here again during our 3 day weekend Vegas trip.  The tuna pizza was one of our faves, and this was actually the first time I ever tried Uni (yum!!).  We also had some tasty drinks here, I wish I could be more helpful and remember the names of the drinks but they were tasty enough so you couldn't taste the alcohol, but not too sweet, and definitely refreshing.  I think it might have had something to do with melon??  Anyway, along with the food and drinks you can go outside to their balcony and get a fabulous view of the watershow at night.

ED3g3a5M--UYJgO_T1xmMg.text: WOW!  I was blown away!  It started when we walked in...the hostess was very sweet, the restaurant is beautiful (great first impression).  Our table was ready right away, but we wanted to enjoy a cocktail at the bar first.  The bartenders were very knowledgeable and extremely funny which made us feel comfortable immediately.  We had some awesome drinks....my wife had a cucumber essence and I had a honeydew something or other...tasty!!  We then sat at our table on the patio...OMG! Talk about a perfect setting.  We overlooked the water show of the Bellagio and ate some incredible food thanks to the recommendations from our server.  By the way, the service there is flawless and friendly...our server knew his stuff!  We ate a number of dishes and all were incredible.  I heard about the big eye tuna pizza earlier and was a bit skeptical, but it was only a pizza in the shape and cut of the dish.  The flavors were to die for...I'll be dreaming of that one for a while!!   On the way out, we thought we would ask to pay our compliments to the chef and low and behold out comes this young guy with a huge smile!  The exec. chef Akira Back is such a down to earth, friendly, yet talented, man.  It just topped off our evening the right way.    This was one of the best dining experiences I have had, not only in Las Vegas but anywhere in the world (I travel all over for work and eat in many GREAT restaurants)!  My wife and I will be back for sure!  5 stars is not enough!

gwRvt4RDZqRywE8_zcJjLQ.text: Found this place after seeing "O" show a couple nights ago.  Had the Kobe beef in ponzu here, it was good.  The sushi here wasn't as fresh as in California.

VkryHj2dXCwITdvXcOebGg.text: I love sushi. It's probably my favorite type of cuisine. I'd say I'm a sushi snob. Yellowtail is in my top 5 favorite sushi spots. I didn't try any menu items from the kitchen so I can't rate them on that but the nigiri and sashimi were extremely fresh and "buttery" (melts in your mouth). My husband and I celebrated our 2nd anniversary in vegas and we had dinner here at yellowtail before our cirque du soleil show.  They set up a private table on their small balcony (it could only fit a table for 2) overlooking the fountains.  It was dusk so the lighting was perfect.  The noise was minimal.
