We had most of the nigiri on the menu - from hamachi (yellowtail) to toro (tuna belly) to uni (sea urchin).  It's so hard to find fresh uni and yellowtail had the best!  I swear I could taste the ocean, it was so fresh!  The waiter said they had just been flown in from japan (not sure if he this was True but I didn't care b/c it was delicious).  I could have eaten a dozen!  Overall the service was great - we had an informative and attentive server.  I would definitely go back for the sushi!

Uw9vT_j3-1iPJ1wmHCDe4w.text: You'll get screwed on prices to food ratio. We ordered pot stickers that were the smallest I've ever had, for 10 dollars. A toro roll that couldn't have been larger diameter of my thumb, and 5/6 rice for 16 dollars, and a shrimp tempura roll for 12 that was almost as small as the toro roll. I left appalled and hungry. STAY AWAY.

VUeoX0xGST7TSnsYJ8ZuWw.text: I love sushi, and this place is not for the connoisseur.  I will admit the location out on the patio to view the fountain show can't be beat.  The Essence (cucumber martini) is superb even at 20.00.  The side order of mushrooms is also very good as well and the tuna pizza.  Other than that don't waste your money unless it's all comped.

l1WcRxBGKdB5OKu4t0-_VQ.text: great service. very good view of the bellagio fountain with show if sitting outside. the kobe short ribs are the best. very good flavor. the rolls are also very good. nice place to go eat for any occasion. i've been there many times and it never fails me.

huGHyazVO6sZsj3Go4S-jw.text: They made a believer out of me. Prior to going here, seafood was a no-no. My dude jokes that I'm a cheap date (so I make up for it by ordering multiple drinks...) but anything fishy seems gross to me. He LOVES sushi, so on our little trip to vegas we had to stop here (it was in our hotel) and didn't end up going to Nobu. ANYWAYS. I actually ate sushi and I LOVED IT. not just fish... RAW FISH!? The service was SUPERB, but then the service at the Bellagio was STELLAR, outrageously good. We had a great night and our server even gave us an honest breakdown of the strip joints we should try (we asked!). Everyone was cool, everyone was nice, the service was out of this world. I definitely recommend it, especially if you love sushi, but even more if you're on the fence about it.

9wEIHr7CjMXoHkjhYaHyag.text: Don't try Yellowtail unless you're a high roller with cash to waste. The night started off great, we were seated very quickly considering the size of our party.   My biggest complaint was the lack of attentiveness by servers shown towards our group. The restaurant was about 50% percent capacity but the service was very horrible. Our dishes took forever. It's sushi? how long can it really take? The food was not bad, but it was overshadowed by the horrible service. You would think 25 dollar sushi would come w/ immaculate service. Expensive doesn't equate to great service.   My friend came to the rescue, and made the situation a little better. She spoke w/ management regarding our experience, and the manager admitted, they were hosting high rollers at another table and couldn't properly serve his other guest. He discounted the bill and bought us a round of drinks, but it still didn't make up for the experience. Two stars for the good food and the management for attempting to redeem themselves. Dinner finally ended at 12, and luckily my friend had a table at Tao, so we didn't have to wait.

8LEPE9AeigM6mjEgbyfknA.text: I can't give it five stars simply because the price was fairly outrageous ($180 with tip for four small plates and a bottle of sake), but man it was the most consistently excellent food I had all week in Vegas!  The star of the show was the walu in tosazu sauce - the best-cooked whitefish I have ever had, in a vinegary and savory broth that I wanted to drink with a straw.  The lobster carpaccio was also a hit with my fiancee, a crustacean nut who gobbled it down happily.  The cilantro was used liberally, which didn't mind me but could be off-putting to those who think it can overpower dishes.  The only dish that I would not have ordered again was the eggplant skewers.  The eggplant itself was nice and meaty, with a good char, but the sweet miso sauce was just way too sticky and sweet for my taste - going with a less sweet, more spicy drizzle (and using less of the sauce) would've made a world of difference!  If you want to splurge with a date in Vegas, make a reservation and be clear you want to get a seat by the window (or outside if it is nice).  They have unparalleled views of the fountains at the Bellagio, and you can get one of the lightest, tastiest meals in Vegas.  Of course, your wallet will also come out lighter too, so perhaps best enjoyed after a lucky day at the slots/blackjack tables!

dPwOUv-qblElgDrVlfJVaA.text: My boyfriend and I were fortunate enough to get a table on the patio. That made for one of the most romantic dinner dates ever.  Add that the food was exceptional, and this was just a wonderful experience. We shared the tuna pizza and then ordered different kinds of sushi.  Each order came out looking prepared with care. The short ribs were succulent and full of flavor.  The service was on point. We floated out of there.

TC2cVyXz9ns24VIH_PLmEA.text: Decent sushi, OK food overall. But it is Expensive.   Vast overuse of a sweet miso sauce.   For the price, tho, skip it. There is way better food at the Bellagio.

TwKlv94Up0WAesxgG-w_9g.text: I really enjoyed eating at Yellowtail.  The menu provides many different options.  From raw sushi and rolls to hot dishes.  I ordered the popping spicy crab from the sushi side of the menu.  It was amazing!  They put pop rocks candy inside the roll!  From the hot side of the menu, I ordered the rock shrimp and the tempura Alaskan king crab.  Both were excellent.  Service was good.  The server was very knowledgeable about the menu and the food took no time to get to our table.  Another great bonus yellowtail offers is their outdoor patio.  The patio sits right on the water where the Bellagio fountains sit and every 15 minutes the fountains go on and display a spectacular water show.  Since I was with my wife, it made our time at Yellowtail very romantic and overall, I had an amazing experience!  I strongly recommend having dinner at Yellowtail if your ever in Las Vegas!

YFbk2Jt5HM096RY4Gl3Lig.text: Small portions, uninspiring food, and very overpriced for what you get. Service was fine, but the Social House was 1000x better.

1IViY0XMvFkD-GJexNwshA.text: We came here for m bachelorette party and all 15 of us girls thought it was the best restaurant and fish we had ever eaten! I highly recommend this place. Order the spicy tuna pizza! enjoy!

jDjorihTvPEVE479kka7Xg.text: Yellowtail is one of the coolest & most stylish restaurants that I've been in.  The fish tail mural in the front is eye catching.  The interior setting is modern and very posh.  I am a huge fan of sushi and sake.  I'm not a knowledgeable snob; I just know what I like.  * The Fishy Food: The presentation is modern and minimalistic. The Big Eye Tuna Pizza is tasty, but will leave your breath fishy. The sushi was horribly forgetful!  Major letdown.  I had the spicy tuna & some other roll (I forgot).  The ingredients were fresh & tasty, but I've seen conveyor belt sushi with more charm and heartiness. The sake was insanely priced.... however there is a huge selection of high grade sake! Yes, the price was ridiculous for everything ($5 beer = boo) but that's just how it is on the main strip in the big hotels.  * The Service: It took about 10 minutes before the staff prepared an empty lounge table. The waitress was charming, but she wasn't attentive at all. The service had a lot of room for improvement.  * The Setting: I really dig the style of Yellowtail. The outside lounge tables look over the casino floor, where you can be seen as the coolest dork under the Yellowtail sign (or I can at least). The interior is dimly lit, there are some Asian inspired artworks along the walls, and the lounge music sets a nice background.  If I were to return to the Bellagio, I would keep Yellowtail as an option for an expensive drink and a quick bite in a very cool lounge.  Don't go for more than a bite, or you might just end up unsatisfied and cursing the bill.

9WPiO4vttIotogI5t332xA.text: Dined there last week.  Food was good - but for a fine dining experience we were completely disappointed that ALL of our food came out at once within 15 minutes... for that much money, I would like to experience the food.  Not eat is so quickly you're left wondering what happened.  Maybe next time I'll ask the server to pace the food, but I don't think we should have to do this at the Bellagio.

emjQB4-4mCKqnwmKYKukCQ.text: A five star rating is well deserved! My experience from the moment of arrival was top notch. The staff was friendly and our waiter Theo V was attentive, helpful and super friendly. Sushi, cocktails and of course the view of the fountains was the best way to dine in Vegas.

jg5JfkHUj0Vu0hJ_zV4PQQ.text: Top notch service. We were seated next to windows overlooking Bellagio fountains. Server was super friendly and knowledgable, as well as attentive. Bussers were friendly and attentive as well. The lobster ceviche roll is the only thing I don't recommend, but high regards for Dirty Vegas roll and the vegi tempura. The restaurant was mellow, but the bar was packed. The noise level was surpringly low due to the separation between the bar and dining room. Good place for everybody. Large groups had ample accommodations and other couples seemed to be enjoying themselves as well. Impeccable service and great food. Kinda pricy though.

oMh27hnRDt9lPjKQuo5CZg.text: Great food, good attention to the quality of fish used. But, not the 'magical' experience I'd expect. The price wasn't bad, although it's definitely above what you'd pay at your local sushi restaurant - but it's Vegas, what do you expect?  All in all, an good place with GREAT service.

d7uZ22Wb9aLWMIs9xWT95Q.text: Wow service was attrocious! Waiters hardly gave you the time of day , restaurant was about 60% full. No suggestions . Miso soup was mediocre, sushi was tiny and and not all that fresh tasting,  Nothing all that special. The only interesting thing was the pop rocks crab roll but it was more of a novelty more than anything. Not worth the dining experience.   If you really want to try the novelty "pop rocks" roll I suggest sitting at the bar with a cocktail and just order it as an appetizer before going somewhere else .   Theres better ambiance and service by the truckloads in Vegas. This was not one worthy of a star rated dining experience.

vhrQyhyDaXGMUNtFcR6Fxg.text: My wife and I sat next to a window and watched the fountain show out front before watching Cirque du Soleil's O. Uni was as fresh as can be. Cannot emphasize that enough. Uni seems to be the most susceptible piece of sushi and anything more than a day old is garbage. They get it fresh daily here. Toro was tasty though not the best I've ever had. Service was excellent. The server pushed the tuna pizza hard and we ordered it. It was OK. I don't think tuna and truffle oil compliment each other. But between the fountain show, the service, and the uni, I would definitely return.

k6L0yPdUp9BrWFpEjzD7Lg.text: I never had a bad experience or dish I didn't like. Great view, atmosphere and service. One of my favorites

P16j9yNrG6XPtU58GMoSMQ.text: Great baked crab hand rolls - sparkling blueberry sake and views of the Bellagio fountain - great vibe.

8ETIAL9XHcary9ss9bY3BA.text: The tuna pizza with the truffle oil was really good! I also liked the eggplant skewers and the roll with the POPROCKs!   We sat near the patio and had a view of the watershow so that was kinda cool. Generally a good experience - the service was kinda weird (brought out our sake cups then 10 mins later brought out the sake) but we were just enjoying ourselves and having a good time in Vegas so it didn't matter to us. PLUS the head chef came out to chat with us for a bit and took pics with us. Would go back - def better than that sushi place that used to be at Treasure Island.

TVNRkXegwcdrFHoH7oeZYw.text: Ate dinner here and its very modern. Started eating on the patio which was very romantic, but it started to rain so they moved us inside. The chef recommends 3-4 dishes each but 2 was plenty for us. Had the lobster carpaccio and its to die for. The soft shell crab sushi was a fabulous dish. The place is very loud inside, so conversation was hard to have

AHjUaeFBWmyLf3K6GbZpWg.text: Get the rock shrimp and baked crab hand rolls and some Star Rabbit sparkling blueberry sake.  The other rolls are on the small side but you can't beat the view of the fountain!

zC9U2d5OwhW-W4VYBmJfpg.text: It was an impressive atmosphere-views of the fountain show every half hour and countless weddings to watch in the courtyard from the windows...i liked it here. DInners consisted of edamame (apps)kobe beef, lemon spinach salmon and grilled chix. the portions were elegantly distributed but i wondered if it ewould fill me. Vegetabvles on the side means 1 green bean, 1 miniature dwarf carrot and a grape white onion...uummm....  it was all delicious but it left me hungry. this is vegas living??

Ilr9irmpY_UpJdHZlgPBkA.text: Amazing view of the fountains and the strip. We made a reservation and requested seating on the patio. The hand roll sushi, tempura shrimp, and flat iron steak were delicious. Would 100% recommend this restaurant to others, especially if you can sit outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kxq2zaga0_2YP6Z7OYsV2A.text: Im giving this place 3 stars unfortunately. All of the food is fantastic.  Unfortunately this place is extremely pricey.  That would be fine except the portion size is also dismally small.  I ordered a miso soup for 8 bucks and it was the size of a large monopoly thimble.  I also ordered yellowtail sashimi for 16 bucks and it was maybe 1 oz of fish.  3.2/5 stars. My brother says try the yellowtail.

q7LKC0vmeSfkJCJ6cnGnZw.text: This is not a proper Japanese restaurant. It is a resort-style restaurant serving hundreds of people at a time. I cannot recommend it for anyone who really enjoys good Japanese food.  There is no sushi bar at all.  I was disappointed that even though we talked to a very knowledgeable sake somm, she apologized for the lack of high quality sakes on their menu.   The cooked food that we had was adequate, but I was very hesitant about ordering anything raw, and I suggest you do the same.

g-zoomPd4qmq4_MXW93_Mw.text: I loved this place so much we came twice during our stay!  The sushi was all on point so I recommend just ordering whatever it you you enjoy most, you will not be disappointed! The spicy miso soup was delicious and a great appetizer along with the rock shrimp. When making your reservation ask to either be seated close to the window or outside depending on the weather as it overlooks the famous Bellagio fountain. I can't wait to go back to Las Vegas simply to come here!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R8EGJXktlKplDj4xkMLFzA.text: This is by far the best place I have ever been! The sushi was phenomenal and we got a full view of the bellagio fountains. My Chardonnay was extraordinary and the wait staff was very helpful.

EoZLHdftM3QZVNUzLMajng.text: Sexy! Inside offers a view of the fountain lights at the Bellagio. The sushi is delicious! Sooooooo delicious! We started with a couple of dirty Martini's - perfectly dirty! Even the oyster sake shooters are sexy. The food is beautifully presented. The baked crab hand roll was amazing! The lady next to us had a bowl that lit up. We are so happy that we spent our post 'O' date night at this place. It was wonderful and we will definitely go back.

L0KpPYlQZ5fFTXLoCYYp3g.text: Lastnight we went for dinner. I'm not really impressed there food. We order two Grilled halibut it's little bit salty and there japanese yellow tail very plain. Most of there foods its a overpriced and very simple especially there's sushi roll. And, we wait our orders almost 45 minutes and we're super starving because take longer. However, their staff is very friendly.   Their dessert are good the Chocolate cup.The reason I gave only 2 star; no#1 food is ok, no#2 overpriced for a very simple food no#3 not impressed the presentation or garnished.

lqgsbcE4eo69mgwS6-HgLQ.text: Good place good food but the service is very slow  I went there 2 times one time for my bday we all waited at least for 2 hours for our food. We said why not give it a try again i went there with my gf same thing happened :/ waited for 2 hours her food arrives and she was already done and then my food arriver :/ for a high end restaurant like this this shouldn't happen at all :/ but the quality is good

atrNMulteSzwGvaIwJx75A.text: Short version: WAY overpriced, tiny portions, bland sushi.  Details: This came highly recommended by a Bellagio employee, who raved about the sushi rolls. I love me some sushi rolls. I eat them at least once a week from various Bay Area restaurants or even markets. I don't have super-high standards... I just want fresh, flavorful, well-crafted rolls that aren't chewy. Well, this place failed on all accounts. Add insult to injury with a hefty price tag (the roll I got was TRIPLE what everywhere else charges for a larger, better roll). Yikes, not happy! It was also supposed to be spicy. Umm, yeah it was after I put a pea-sized amount of their wasabi-like paste on it.  The wine list made no sense for a sushi/seafood restaurant, and again super overpriced.  So, why did I give it a generous TWO stars? The wakame salad was wonderful. Two types of seaweed, delicious sesame dressing, big portion, reasonable price. I should have just ordered that.

7r7Z7ceIdpHCxoo-v2Ki5Q.text: I love this spot. They have delicious creative rolls and small plates. My fav was probably the protein roll.

uJZ7Uw7K1yL8RMYvAUzo8Q.text: For a long time, I had lived in an area without proper sushi so I always make it a point to find a place wherever I travel. Yellowtail had a nice atmosphere with a good view of the fountains, at least from where I was sitting assuming some group of tourist wasn't crowding up the window near my table... sometimes I wonder about people :-) Despite the noisy tourist clamoring for pictures I was able to enjoy some delicious food.   While it might not be the ideal sushi place for a connoisseur it will definitely satisfy. I wasn't in the mood to be picky so I made a deal with the waiter to bring out plates based on my affinity for certain flavors, not to be confused with the Omakase I can't eat that much. Every dish was beautifully put together and delicious. One of my unexpected favorites was the tuna pizza (not sure if that's the actual name). The smokey flavor and slight crunch were perfectly paired, I only wish I wasn't sharing with someone. My only real gripe is that the sake selection is lacking. Otherwise, service is excellent and the atmosphere is nice though it can get a bit noisy.

35-PBwxLtP_acNTwK-veUg.text: This is a great place for seafood including sushi. It is located in the belagio.  The view of the fountain and the Vegas skyline is nice too.  Definitely a top restaurant when In Vegas if your budget permits..  it's easy to spend over 100 per person.

X5EmrDnDz_ULJtaFcmZCvQ.text: On our last day of our Vegas trip we decided to go to Yellowtail in the Bellagio Hotel. It was the best decision we made that weekend!   We sat at the bar where we were greeted with a smile by our beautiful bartender Kat. She made our experience all the more enjoyable. She made us some delicious cocktails and made suggestions on the menu. We were so glad we listened to her suggestions. Everything was so fresh and flavorful! The tuna pizza was so light and refreshing and the lobster carpaccio was AMAZING! I could eat that everyday!   It's rare that I take the time to write a review but I was so impressed by the food, the cocktails, the atmosphere, but I was especially impressed by the service and attentiveness of Kat. She turned  a four star rating into a FIVE!

imclSKHOk-qKMOk079b7Tw.text: I hosted a large group of clients on 2/13/17.  When I was initially searching for venues, I had a lot of difficulty finding a place that could accommodate my group of 18 for the time I needed.  Yellowtail stepped right in, accommodated my event, and did an incredible job of making a recommendation for a tasting menu that would satisfy all palates.  We went with the "Great Hits" menu.  Every item on the lineup was even more incredible than the last.  In addition, the service by far exceeded my expectations!  I cannot recommend Yellowtail enough.  This was my first visit, but I will be coming back every time I am in Vegas.

fPX-O12IrnwDbMkTYXcQHg.text: First I want to commend our waitress for excellent professional service. the restaurant was packed on the night of 1/13/18 when my date and I went, and all our dishes arrived promptly and I appreciated her knowledge of the menu and its ingredients. However, this is really not a sushi restaurant. their cooked food was underwhelming for the price tag (yes the tuna pizza was good) and their sashimi was so so. If you are eating rolls at a sushi restaurant, you dont like sushi either. Being from LA I am spoiled, and I also understand that there is no such thing as an inexpensive sushi meal. But for their prices, I should have been wowed. Atmosphere A, service A, food C-.

FJ44d1ipcdQlNsyqYkiAow.text: Had the seaweed salad to share it was ok...we had octopus it was good...as my main dish I had the chicken...tender but tasteless...waitress at the end was very slow, when i ordered a tea,, her helper never asked if we needed anything,  just walked away fast , but the beginning was good.. the fountain view was Beautiful...

wKaP1VT4s21GHiSlj7X_pw.text: My fourth Yellowtail visit and I continue to have amazing dishes and great service. Love!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful and tasty desserts
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi galore

mKc0cJKY_3rm9jms5gyt6w.text: No, No, No, No...and No...You've been warned.   Sadly, everything was wrong about this dinner. We made a reservation on Saturday morning for an evening dinner there. We like to do a ton of research and try new places, because well, it is Vegas and there's a jazillion restaurants to try. Frankly money doesn't matter to me (though it is nice to feel like you are getting what you pay for).  If the food, service, and ambience are great, then it is worth it.  I like to leave a place happy and satisfied.  But, on the other hand, if you drop ~$200 (for two mind you) to eat what amounts to nothing (and not remarkable either), then we've got issues.   We arrived for our 6:30pm reservation and were greeted by the hostess(es), who all wear the same tiny black dress with extreme amounts of cleavage baring cut-aways. Being a dude, I don't mind this much, though I will be respectful to my lady and not ogle or point.  I mention this because my girlfriend was appalled by a couple of the girls, and as she "pointed out" an Asian hostess seemed to have gotten the wrong size dress because her assets were on display. Not sure how cold it was in there all day, but it was beyond a tit bit nipply for this lady.   My gf was put aback by this at an upscale place.  Strike one for low class wandering exposed boobage.  (As for the decor, location, and the restaurant. It is a dimly lit, very woody feeling, and warm (dark) hues of browns and low orange light. I liked the ambience and decor. This is the one earned star.)   Next up we got seated. Sadly no fountain views were available though I had asked for it...not a big deal. Our server was all hopped up and excited, which can go either way...but she really, really, really was pushing the Big Eye Tuna Pizza appetizer...hard core...so we bit at it much to my dismay (I wanted the Toro) and it was a super thin cracker with way too much truffle aioli on it, and the thinnest slices of tuna ever fashioned. It was "6 pieces" but honestly I could have put back 3 or 4 orders of these things for the amount of food an "appetizer" should have been.  We were both not impressed.  We also ordered an Organic Field greens salad, a Rock Shrimp (warm plate), the Protein Roll, and the Toro Scallion roll. Also we ordered a two-person pot of hot green tea because it was effing cold in Vegas this past weekend (and even dusted some snow!??!). Quick reviews:  - The Big Eye Tuna Pizza was just a $29 waste...not even tasty (see above). - The field greens salad was acceptable...and simple salads should not be the highlight of one's dinner experience. - The Rock Shrimp were over fried, hard, and just smothered in chili oil. Our local sushi place in LA has a similar dish where the shrimps stay moist, meaty, and the fried batter is a doughy, spicy delight. Here it was like eating rocks. I am being serious...they were so overcooked, I couldn't tell that it was a shrimp dish.  ** Meanwhile our bubbly server is asking us every other minute what we want to order next, we got so frustrated with her constant up-selling, it detracted from "trying" to enjoy the food we ordered ** - The Protein roll was okay. I thought the flavors worked. But the portion and roll size were embarrassingly small. 7 disjointed pieces, not symmetrical in cut, super small in diameter...this would NOT have passed for an appetizer, let alone a $32 entree roll. - The Toro Scallion Roll was tasty, but again it was too small, and weak for the asking price.  - Two person serving of green tea is $16. Wow.  I do not ever mind spending my hard-earned money in Las Vegas. I like gambling it away, I like eating it away at nice restaurants, and I enjoy the shows, the comics, and the art work...but I could have rolled up two hundred dollar bills, dipped them in McDonald's ketchup and eaten them, and probably come out more satisfied than Yellowtail.   From hostesses with wandering nipples, to a giddy over-selling waitress, to tiny bites (ha ha small plates...not so much), to dishes that fall flat...save your money and go somewhere else...there's a dozen more sushi joints in town that will impress you.    I give Yellowtail a double Emoji big brown thumb's down!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. almost fountain view. but crowded tonight.

3A_922duTXazo6rufqgKlQ.text: I'm giving a 5 star because the ambiance is perfect! The water show at the Bellagio was Beautiful! Went on twice during dinner. We ordered the tuna pizza and a 2 crab hand roll with soy paper. The food is good but a little on the expensive side. Overall a good dining experience not just because of the food though !

AV5Ux3fR2v3QeeHJ5fU-9A.text: What a waste of time and money. Toro roll with scallion was not fresh. I asked waiter about the dynamite seafood which he said was sauteed scallop with fried  king crab and shrimp. He said nothing how it was covered in mayo or how it was 98 % CORN NIBBLETS AND MUSHROOM. in the whole dish I had 3 scallop chunks, 1 king crab chunk and 2 shrimp pcs. For $26.  This is a phony of a "Japanese restaurant." It sucked and Im pissed it cost me so much.

0G3LXoN3RBq8-h22S1CosQ.text: Food was good, service and atmosphere were wonderful.  If you can, sit near the windows to enjoy a view of the Bellagio fountains and Eiffel Tower.     The pork pot stickers were really good but on the smaller side. The sushi is delicious, standard fare. My husband had various sashimi and I had a tempura shrimp roll. The cocktails were standard but delicious.

kuQovYmOkUIw3KeqyQF6LQ.text: The rice of the rolls was very chewy. Had way better sushi before.  The service was great.  The view is amazing. Sit outside. It's worth the wait!

z_7E59AdpNkAf6s_D-zkcg.text: I absolutely loved this restaurant! A friend and I were looking for a nice restaurant to have dinner at prior to watching Cirque Du Soleil O at the Bellagio! The restaurant where we wanted to originally eat at had no available seating at our preferred time. Good thing we ended up here. Very satisfied.  Amazing food, nicely decorate, good ambiance, awesome service.  I honestly don't remember the names of the food, but you can definitely just show them the pictures I've provided.

S2f8LwtTLKEwkbnCCWS4hQ.text: This is by far my favorite sushi restaurant, I'm a little mad it doesn't exist in St. Louis so I could eat here often. We had a party of 10, ordered several different rolls, plus the Big Eye Tuna Pizza which was so delicious I could eat just that for dinner. The general consensus at the table for the top 3 rolls were the  Popping Spicy Crab, Baked Crab Hand Roll and Crispy Kalbi. My personal favorite was the Angry Salmon. If I am ever in Vegas again, this will definitely be on the list!

yc945QR0FA5YJyYcTl-n-A.text: This restaurant is amazing. The food is unique of its kind!! I'll definitely visit it again.

wLiYbQfl6phIfuyQsjin0A.text: Had I gone to this my first night in Vegas I may have rated it higher, but I went to Nobu first. Nobu was superior, so it may be unfair to rate Yellowtail.   The service was good. Moreover, we had a great seat - our table opened to a private patio on the Bellagio fountain. We would walk out with drinks and watch the fountain show very 30 mins  As for food, it was fine. Again, I'm comparing this to another sushi place within a couple nights. I do recall one dish recommended by the waiter - it was essentially bbq and coleslaw sushi. It sounds horrible, was better than it sounds, but this should simply not be a thing. This is bad fusion. All in all, it was fine and we had a good time.

NeqnAZd_WSJ_aVZ4BjdR9A.text: Never been here before, so we decided to come in for an early Valentines Day dinner. We made reservations and got the most perfect seats, right next to the window. We got to see the Bellagio water show every 15 minutes. Our server Berto & food runner Joel were amazing ! Very attentive and had the most wonderful personality.  Wish I could name everything we had, but there is no way. We order lot's of random things and got full very fast. But I will name some of my favorites. -Big Eye Tuna Pizza -Crispy Tofu -Salmon Tiradito -Toro Nigiri -Salmon Nigiri -Popping Spicy Crab roll had PopRocks inside, making it unique.   For dessert, you must get the "Chocolate in a cup", it was delicious.  Overall our experience was wonderful.

_0CHibXk8f-f4oyk1ij6Kw.text: Our service at the bar was great Katherine made suggestions for our drinks and was quick to make orders/check on us. She also kept our waters nice and full :) when we ordered sweet shrimp she suggested getting the fried shrimp heads with it which was something I didn't even know was an option so we were really happy about that. She also made a great lychee martini!   We eat a lot of sushi and we're excited to see quality fish on the menu, however the food wasn't very good. The scallop crudo is served with an overwhelming red sauce that totally covered the delicate sweet flavor of the scallop. The sushi was served on cold rice that tasted like it had been out for awhile. The highlight was definitely our botan Aba (sweet shrimp) with the fried heads. We were just in for about an hour before the show so I can't speak to the full sit down experience...it is cool to see the fountains!

U9xqEXI5UdNysEcNiWSYNw.text: Had dinner with a group of seven at Yellowtail. Great atmosphere, bar, setup. We shared a half dozen rolls and other plates. A very clear favorite, and a bite that may have been one of my most memorable in recent times, was of the sushi pizza. Think thin crust pizza, covered in a layer of thinly cut tuna, with truffle oil and a light salting. It was so delicious and unique that we ordered a second. Amazing.   I will look forward to returning on a future trip to Vegas!

v-AcBS6D3nyXYPql6A2P6A.text: I have eaten here twice now and both times the food was great! All the fish and sushi items have been super tasty and service is usually pretty quick. The California roll (usually something I don't order) has huge pieces of crab in it. Yum yum! If you order the tuna pizza, the first thing you will notice is the smell of the truffle oil. It's heavenly.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon dish on bottom. California Roll and Toro Scallion on top. All delicious!
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Broiled Atlantic Black Cod. Melts in your mouth!
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Eye Tuna Pizza. One of the best things about this is the smell! The light drizzle of truffle oil really makes it pop.

0TwmUepDLoQDJ03-BQe8QA.text: I do not think I can write a review that truly captures the great food this place has. We tried quite a few things on the menu which were all tasty however our favorite items were the Mile High role and the Seared Diver Sea Scallops. The scallops PERFECTLY cooked, just melted in your mouth, that sauce was amazing. We wish we had some bread so sop it all up. The service was informative and attentive to everyone's needs. The restaurant has a front row seat of the water show of Bellagio. I will definitely come back to this place, first stop YELLOWTAIL!

eDYGCMe2IjN9pWMfp2wJMQ.text: One of my favorite places to go on date night!  Everything I've tried here I really enjoy.  The Tuna Pizza and the Mile High roll are to die for!  They make a good cocktail too and the view of the famous Bellagio Fountains don't hurt either!

aMz6L1_Ul-oh7lP8nnhxHA.text: A relatively newer addition to Bellagio's dinning scene. Me and a group of friends walked here on a perfect Saturday afternoon. We were seated outside by the fountain. The view if you get to sit outside is five star and definitely the best part about dinner. The appetizers are underwhelming except the seafood dragon which was grilled seafood with great flavor and aroma. The sushi rolls were below average except the kalbi roll which was delicious. Overall not the most exciting menu. They did get a couple of things right but for that price definitely not something I will back for.   If you like the views and want to take a picture of your wine with the dinner as the fountains play in the background - this is your place. If you are craving some good food - maybe not.

RdNqKnZAlrCpafoQ0kldYQ.text: Yellowtail serves up very high quality appetizers and decent soosh in Vegas. Situated in the Bellagio it's a prime location within the hotel.  There are options to even sit on the patio/terrace and watch the fountain show (if you can take in the 105F summer heat). Vegas being Vegas and the fact that it's in a popular Casino means it's on the upper spectrum of the price range.   Here's what we ate for our meal of three people:  1)shisito peppers to start off. They were delicious as an appetizer. Some were mild and some were medium in heat level (this is from a guy who can handle some decent heat). $10  2) big eye tuna pizza- very delicate almost on a church wager type crust and served with truffle oil it was a delicate and delicious appetizer. $27  3) Yellowtail Jalapeno- this was my fave dish of the evening. The yellowtail was super fresh and the drizzle of sauce made plus presentation was artistic exquisite and damm yummy $28  4) various sashimi combo $28 and rolls probably $60- on the ordinary side. Seriously I've had much better.   4) Black Angus Ribeye- $55 very juicy. Sliced thin full flavour but nothing wow amazing. Decently good.   I had a nice Sapporo to wet the whistle and the cocktails I saw being carried around looked decent quality.   Considering dinner was near $300, some items were good but not blow your mind wow amazing. The Yellowtail Jalapeno excellent , big eye tuna pizza was very good. Peppers (hard to screw up) very good. Overall it's a 3.25/5.  I'd be inclined to come here and order some drinks and a bunch of appetizers. This may be a 4/5 kinda time.  Maybe there are other menu items that are more exceptional to what we ordered but expect to shell out a few hundred shekels for a dinner with drinks here.   Service was good. No issues here.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shishito peppers... great delicate flavour. Some medium heat some light and tasty 4/5
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black angus ribeye... good flavour but nothing wow special 3.5/5
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon skin roll. Dynamite roll.... 3/5.. meh lower side of decent

4I6QtAxXgrtsX1LEDYzzsQ.text: Yummmmmmmm!!!!!  This was recommended by a friend who frequents Vegas and I trust for good tips.  Our waiter Roberto was amazing - super friendly, attentive and pointed us to all the most amazing things on the menu:  some amazing crispy beef role, another one with crab tempura, halibut (amazing), rock shrimp, and more.  We ate them all and had a hard time picking favorites.  Cocktails were also great!    Would definitely return!

4jTYZBWPykwY1sDwESLnyA.text: Whatever "manager" thought it was a good idea to insult me in front of my fiance and several other guests on the patio for taking a seat at a spot some other waiter had already assigned to us... Chill out!  Miss Tempura Tantrum claims the seat was reserved, but apparently wasn't aware of her own company's policy that seats on the patio are first come first serve basis - and that we were actually appointed the seat.   Back off and let me try to enjoy my dinner, which obviously we did not.  To be insulted and made look like a fool in front of my fiance on her birthday... shame on your establishment for hiring such incompetent individuals.  Visitors beware and take your money elsewhere. Plenty of other lake view establishments or sushi restaurants in Las Vegas to consider.

N76eg9RyCuVA6lRvmpU9FA.text: Fantastic service. Small portions so it can be pricey. Sashimi was fresh and creamy. Rolls were awesome.   Miso soup was perfect.   Ambiance and views of the fountains were breathtaking.
