Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IodrH1kC6TfFf_1k7k2hLw.text: The atmosphere of the restaurant was breath taking. However, that was only thing good about the place. Our waiter seemed inconvenienced we  asked questions about the menu. He also walked away in the middle of us asking a question. Then he came back and asked if we were ready to order. The food comes out at random times. Therefore, if you practice any etiquette, your food is cold. At the end of the meal, they will not let you split check and our waiter said "we could work it out". So we had to do the math and divide the check and taxes ourselves. I will never go to this restaurant again and would discourage others from wasting their money.

aO-HqkIFTrJKkqCLPha9RQ.text: If I could give this place 6 stars, I would! Been here dozens of times and I've NEVER been disappointed. The key to Yellowtail is knowing what to order. If you want regular sushi rolls, don't waste your time.  Here are the highest recommendations we can offer (and get every SINGLE time): - BIG EYE TUNA PIZZA!!!!!!!!!!!! AMAZINGGG - Seared Albacore - especially if you like onions - Spicy edamame - like I've never had anywhere else  - Braised Kobe Short Ribs  - Happa Roll  - Rock Shrimp - Shrimp lovers delight - Miso Black Cod  The sashimi and many other dishes are outstanding as well, but the above are our HIGHEST recommendations  If you're still hungry, definitely order another tuna pizza!!!! We always do!  To finish it off, for dessert, you MUST have Chocolate in a Cup! Make sure to scoop all the way to the bottom of the cup on your first bite!  Hope this reviews helps you enjoy your visit to Yellowtail, it's my ABSOLUTE favorite!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate in a cup
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happa Roll
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe beef short ribs

-3lfMrpuYRl7JOCsUTzVOA.text: High end Decor? Check. "Signature" appetizer with more taco shell and mayonnaise (?!) than fish, and flavor dominated by truffle oil? Check. Other "signature" appetizer with four tiny little pieces of seared albacore hidden under a canopy of crisp onion? Yep. Downright stingy serving sizes? Take a guess.  I actually had a very enjoyable evening thanks to great company, and I was prepared to feel overcharged given that this restaurant is located inside the Bellagio Hotel. But, if you live in a city that has good sushi (L.A.) you can probably think of 3 sushi bars within 3 miles of your house, have a better meal at each and every one of them, and still have money left over in the end.  To me, sushi is supposed to be an experience in every bite. Yellowtail Japanese Restaurant & Lounge is too bland and too expensive (and the servings embarrassingly small), and will likely disappoint all but the most novice of sushi fans.

Ci8BhMdMIL0aW029CGuCPg.text: We went here because it was the only mid-range restaurant in Bellagio that we could get a table at without reservations.  The food was ok but WAY overpriced for what it was.  We had miso soup, seaweed salad, oyster shooter, 2 sushi rolls, and 2 cocktails.  The miso soup was fine.  The seaweed salad was weird.  Instead of loose seaweed, they came in tightly rolled balls.  They didn't have as much flavor as I'd liked and the consistency was just strange.  I didn't really like it.  The sushi rolls were rather bland.  And small.  I had a ginger cocktail, which I really liked and my husband had a cucumber martini, which he didn't like.  But at $20 a cocktail, they were rather steep.  I think the bill came out to $175, not including tip.  To me this wasn't a $200 meal.  I've had much better sushi for a third of that price.  I would not recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber cocktail and ginger cocktail

0x4ajf22Ol7YNW3aXHzB3g.text: Super slow service for mediocre food. My wife's halibut came out incredibly salty and was sent back. I finished eating my entre and her new dish had not arrived. We asked for the check and the waitress became very rude. We should heave know better when this was the only place with open tables on a Friday night.

sM9Clkval6LS1rd6Wod1Hg.text: I have to ding a star for service, but other than that we had a great time.  The Big Eye Tuna pizza is insane, and the yellowtail serrano sent my taste buds on a whirlwind.  MORE PLEASE.  Too bad it's so pricy, but what can you do?  It's quasi-fine dining at the Bellagio, it's going to hit you in the pocket.  We did get the fabulous table with a window viewing the fountains at night.  Breathtaking!  We couldn't hear the music, but that was the only downside.  The server was super sweet to me, and some of the people I was with, and straight-up ignored one of my best friends.  I hate to make assumptions, but my friend who was dressed the most plainly (no shiny colors, no glitter, no faux hawk, no bling) got zero attention.  Ordered a drink, never got it.  Had to actually call the waiter back to order food.  Inexcusable.

puBJK7I4cHhGJIMMUPf_zw.text: Yellowtail is by far one of my favorite restaurants on the strip. I agree that the price is definitely a lot higher than your average Japanese restaurant, but aside from paying for the incredible quality of fish, you're mostly paying for the real estate so it's a great place for a date! The ambiance is romantic and ideal for beginning your night out since they have a trendier atmosphere. They're in Bellagio Hotel which is centrally located on the Las Vegas Strip and sits by the lake overlooking the Bellagio fountains.  Also, trust me when I say this... Yellowtail has some of the best servers in the hospitality industry.  Every time I come here, the service is impeccable; personable, knowledgeable and top-notch, worthy of Bellagio.  Roll Call -   *Ahi Tuna Pizza - MY FAVORITE! Thinly sliced grade AAAAA ahi on a light, crisp tortilla with a magical onion and mayo blend, topped with micro greens and...TRUFFLE OIL! I've personally had friends tell me they don't like tuna OR onions OR mayo and then I introduced them to the tuna pizza and BAM! Life-changing.  *Baked Crab Hand Roll - What is up with soy paper? I love anything wrapped in soy paper! And this isn't your typical grossly baked, oozing with burnt mayo roll. The crab itself is baked, I believe. This roll will make you MOL (Moan Out Loud).   *Crispy Kalbi Roll - I don't know how this came to be but it definitely works! I love the texture of this roll - meaty, crunchy (from the slaw), and juicy! It also has complementing temperatures of hot and cold in your mouth!  *Grilled Walu - Of course it's amazing and buttery and just melts in your mouth. Just don't order too many or you may end up on the toilet the rest of the night since Walu is like a natural laxative. You're absolutely fine if you have a few bites and it's worth the small risk since it's fatty and delicious!  And then if you want a fun novelty roll, get the Popping Spicy Crab roll. I'm personally not big on it only because it's a pretty simple roll (crab, asparagus, cucumber) with pop rocks in it but I have to order it whenever I bring someone to Yellowtail for the first time and they always love it!   My 5 O'Clocktail is the Lychee Martini! It pairs wonderfully with everything on the menu & you don't have to love lychee to enjoy this beverage!  Stay classy Las Vegas and thanks for stopping by!

y24dX8-4u5IoumAUl69NNQ.text: The sorriest pieces of nigiri sushi I have ever seen in my life! I am not exaggerating at all. When the pieces came out I almost laughed because I thought it was a joke. Two very sorry looking pieces for $15?! Seriously? The slices were as thin as my finger and I wear a size 3.5 ring. I was actually embarrassed FOR them.   Also, the waitress didn't even know what nigiri was. Me: "2 pieces of the hamachi and sake nigiri please". Waitress: "uh nigiri?". Me: "yea the sushi on rice". Waitress: "ohhhhh sushi on rice."   Wow. Wow. Wow.  I haven't written a review on yelp in years, but had to dust off my login to specifically write this one.   To the owners: Please don't make us sushi lovers embarrassed FOR you by serving that kind of nigiri. You guys need to show some respect and slice up some legit pieces. Come on man... You know what you're doing is wrong.

TcMdjKyKTUObMn6-zH8a2Q.text: Overpriced sushi with mediocre service. Expected more from a sushi place at the Bellagio. Definitely go to a different place before trying anything here. Small portions for the excessive pricing.

_8-yIu2KKpZEDAX22IpvpA.text: OMG, sushi will NEVER be the same anymore after you've eaten here.    Everything is like GOLD.  My favorite is their Rock Shrimp Roll.  It's so bomb!  We always finish the night off with Chocolate In a Cup.  I swear, it just melts in my mouth.  Great -___- my mouth is watering just thinking about it.     Anyways, this is high quality, top-notch Japanese food.  It's a MUST have whenever I visit Sin City.

9Vaoz3NsFNmcCN1ZS8Mw5w.text: We had a nice light dinner here. I did have a spicy tuna roll because I wanted something basic and it was good and not THAT overpriced. I liked that I could substitute brown rice. We shared the king crab appetizer which was delicious and had these yummy little tiny jalapeno peppers. And, because I needed veggies, I had a side order of Brussels sprouts and I would highly recommend these. Very light and tasty. I had wine by the glass (sauvignon blanc) and the service was good. It was also easy to get a reservation.  My main complaints are that it was really loud and really dark. Maybe it's because I'm getting old but I could hardly read my menu and it bothered me. In any case, I'd come here again.

bHyaLNRbdbVjVN282264bg.text: Unique place. Really fresh sushi. The spicy crab roll has watermelon pop rocks in it which was wonderful. The outdoor patio is literally on top of the Bellagio fountains, which is a really cool/unique experience. If you're in Vegas and want to do something different I would suggest this place.

YVzqytx5FMGKCgEoxMCz2w.text: Overpriced, yes! But like other reviewers have said, it's Vegas, it's Bellagio, and OMG, what an incredible view if you're fortunate enough to sit by the windows facing the exquisite fountains or on the outside patio! Unfortunately, we weren't sitting there, but we had a huge booth, big enough for six, all to ourselves, just two of us!  Service was good, not over the top.  Our waiter was a great photographer, so he gets kudos for the most excellent picture he took!   The specialty drinks are stunning and creative in presentation, heavy on the alcohol by my standards, but expensive - $20 for one martini!  Loved the Lychee martini!  The food is fresh, inspired, and pretty!  We had the Big Eye Tuna Pizza.  I could have eaten two of them by myself.  It really isn't a pizza at all, but an artfully covered cracker with plenty of tuna accented by shiso and truffle oil. To get my daily dose of veggies, we ordered the grilled eggplant skewers which were covered in miso and sesame. It was sweet and good enough for dessert.  We had to try the Popping Spicy Crab Roll, the claim to fame being the addition of pop rocks (remember those?) amongst a more traditional crab, asparagus and cucumber roll.  We were expecting an explosion of sorts on our mouths but it was actually very subtle and sweet on the finish. It didn't wow us like we thought it would, but it was still a delicious roll.  Yellowtail is really all about the combination of atmosphere, service and food, and it was a great experience!  Next time, we might try sitting in the lounge area that faces the casino as you get a prime spot for people watching as the throngs of people come through Via Bellagio! That's entertainment!

6ekd3ZrCvpx2XSJ40vHu0g.text: Not close to authentic Japanese taste but it is one of the best spots to watch the Bellagio fountain over dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mwQZ0BfwcFcL1lnZNsfzxg.text: Second time coming to this place. Our first experience was great! Though the second time was a bit disappointing. After making reservations, we still had to wait for 45 min to be seated. The food was ok.. Nothing special. Ordered three of their speciality rolls, couldn't eat any of them.

w7PTCjUWGKMxTqns5Q6rOw.text: We went for my wife's 50th birthday celebration. We were a party of four. We were going to order the 7 course meal for all of us and our waiter suggested that they could do a better job of just bringing out food and for less money. Well they did not disappoint. We had the best meal of our lives and the staff was amazing.  I wish I could remember the names of the gentleman that took care of us as they were all fantastic.  Thank you so much for giving us the dining experience of a lifetime!!!!!!!!

1_Rz_T69zCruIDq467pRGw.text: Super small portions, for a lot of $$. We had two courses each and were still hungry afterwards. Shared plates aren't enough for a single person. I was very disappointed, on top of being tiny, it was absolutely nothing special about the food. Very average food, extremely small portions, a lot of cash.  Poor to mediocre service.

IFlzMwxkyukGE73Yjo6FjA.text: This is one of my favorite shush places to eat in Vegas! I eat here every time I come to Vegas!! Favorite sushi roll is their popping spicy crab roll! Their rock shrimp hand roll is very good as well! It is on the pricey side, but totally worth it! For a party of 2 we our bill averages 100, without any cocktails!

cJrzo_KVF8rAZw8NhIPMrg.text: My seven friends and I went out to dinner for our friends best friends birthday and bachelorette party and we received the worst service. We arrived and did not get a menu to review the items nor the prices. Our server told us, "I will take care of you." He did not relay the message that it would be $50 per person for fried rice. I'm sorry, but rice should not be that expensive. When we received our bill we were all shocked of how expensive our experience and fried rice was. Without receiving a menu or disclosure of how much the food would be was so ridiculous. Once we talked to a "manager" we did NOT receive the service we thought we came for. For half the table, which whom to be servers are outraged. This was a horrible restaurant and will not be attending ever again.

uInEwIk4j4-9_x26wTS_yA.text: Going to give it 4 stars only because it is on the VeGas strip. I know it's a little unfair but the competition is so strong at 5 star properties on the boulevard. Pop rocks roll is note worthy as well as the protein roll as I have never had anything like it anywhere before. Nice view of the fountains with a hip soundtrack! Very lively space with a great waiter.

y-JQsxqneINdOEiNopABiQ.text: Their rolls are good but not worth the price. Their specialty rolls weren't really that special either. The wait for our food also took too long. All in all I wasn't impressed with their food or their service.

5TYtlaXZZTis8xm7d_UFHA.text: What a wonderful place to eat and have a good time. Great service and great food. Go yellowtail!!!!

CUkUe2D00LSLS9qjvnqLHA.text: The decor is nice but not quite up to Bellagio standards.  Overall the food was so-so, but when you consider the high prices, very disappointing.  The rolls were horrible and the sashimi although tasty and fresh disappointed because the portion size was so small.  We did not overindulge and the cost per person was $150.  Unfortunately there was nothing memorable about the dining experience.

f21lVhIs_Ps97xPowua5YQ.text: Great food Great service  Great location Great cucumber martini - prob best drink I had in Vegas!!  True mixology at work here!

wJIwH715UVnmF_38GiO5MQ.text: Great restaurant for great atmosphere. If you're looking for something special and unique restaurant, this is a great choice of restaurant. Very friendly staffs and lots of seating and foods were phonomonal. The best part that I like was the outside seating where I could see water show. I highly recommend for everyone to try out. You won't be disappointed.

09IHV7PT18jGNfVMTPmUDg.text: I seem to keep rating these higher end restaurants in Vegas with a 4 star review and all I can say is that I thoroughly enjoy my experience there but am waiting for the best meal ever to hand out a 5 star in Vegas.    Yellowtail was not a contender for a 5 star but do no let that disuade you from hitting it up.  The food was VERY good and things like the edamame with sweet spicy chili sauce were new and very good to me.  I thought it interesting that they have a Nobu staple (popcorn shrimp in spicy sauce) on the menu.  I ordered 4 of these for the table and they were gone in 3 minutes (they should be eaten hot anyway).  I ordered more and they too were gone.   We ordered some sushi rolls that were fantastic including the first lemon zest I have ever had in a Maki Sushi.  It was a special and tasted like a perfect summer happy hour roll.  So good...  Anyway the one guy that didn't like sushi was happy with his $50 Kobi beef.  Seaweed salad was fantastic and ample/fresh.  The Ahi nachos rocked too.  You will not be dissappointed here but bring money like at every non-buffet in Vegas.  Again, this place was built for the expense account.  Cheers. T

ULJsRjDYN1y5fIp5lFCe2w.text: This place is a very upscale sushi restaurant so expect to spend some money when you come here. My fiance was taking a couple of his business partners here and I decided to come along because I'm a huge sushi fan.   Not impressed!  I guess I'm not a fan of fancy sushi.  Here is a list of what I ordered:  Spicy miso $8  Baked crab $10  California $17 Kobe beef flat iron $42   Miso was good I like the little kick it had from being spicy, the baked crab was good but not great the crispy onions they put in it were overwhelming all I tasted was onions, the California roll was good but how can you mess that up and the Kobe beef was ok. Overall the food was good but nothing special.   What I really enjoyed was the atmosphere really dark and romantic and the view was amazing since its inside the Bellagio you had a close view of the water show which was nice.  I see in a lot of people's reviews their complaining about the prices all I have to say to that is I agree the food is not worth the cost but its worth the experience. The atmosphere, view and service was well worth the  $400 something dollar bill.  Also the food presentation was very nice as well I didn't take any pics because that is very tacky to do at a place like this.   So overall it was a good experience, but I think I'll stick to my small hole in the wall sushi joints.

SfyITwkoAhNt83ubyWU9GQ.text: It's a great feeling when you're treated like a VIP. My dad and I visited Yellowtail with a nice comp and we ordered quite a bit of sushi and rolls, not to mention a nice bottle of wine.   The service was great and the environment was pleasant. I recommend trying all of the sushi dishes...it was too hard to pick and choose!   Chef Akira has a great business here and I certainly recommend stopping by here for a bite.

OIAzPRmtpe9z3q-szw5f6Q.text: The recommendation we received was that the place was pricey but worth it. And that was exactly what happened.  The server was amazing, and the sushi some of the freshest in my life. You must try the big eye tuna pizza or at least some of the sushi. Why? Because it is amazing. The sushi is so fresh there isn't a touch of "fishiness". We had the protein and angry salmon rolls. Neither disappointed. Also the mocha for dessert was full of flavor. But, the green tea mochi has Essence of Jasmine in it - so be careful if you aren't into flowery tastes.

uXT744zr90O9z9EcgIvO4w.text: Ambiance is ok.  The sushi is good. They have some amazing rolls.  Service is really good. But it is really pricy for the sushi.

9yBeDRuyrywAksVno11WnQ.text: The size of the hamachi nigiri was minuscule!  The Lobster Handroll looked like a burrito born prematurely, (three teeny, tiny bites)!  The Tuna roll pieces were the size of quarters!  Was the sushi chef on a binge?  The green tea was $8 a pot...get the picture?  The check was $75!  It's shocking the Bellagio has such an inferior sushi bar.  I don't care how much they pay for a fish.  It's not showing in the presentation of the sushi.  How do they stay in business!  Our server was excellent.  The decor lovely.  But, the alligator covered chairs were worn and in need of refurbishing.

71nwWYCaukNo9kYjKDNlRw.text: Well, we got back to Vegas and all last week I've been dreaming of the pop rock sushi at Yellowtail.  So, finally, we got our chance and headed over for dinner.  Well, the Popping Spicy Crab was great!  There is just something about the spicy flavors and the pop rock surprise as you eat it.... we ended up ordering more.  We had a few other things also, like the soft shell crab sushi roll which was good, but not special.   The Alaskan Snow Crab Tempura which was really good, the crab was tender and the tempura was crunchy, served in a bowl with a nice ponzu sauce, it was lovely.  We also tried the Big Eye Tuna Pizza, and it was good, I especially liked the truffle oil, it really worked.  The sommelier helped us pick out several different beers to go with the meal, we had fun with the Japanese beers she recommended.   All in all, a great meal.

zP0sQipRvRa3ZS03T6G2Hg.text: I've been to Yellowtail a few times, including twice in the past month.  My experience has been great every time.  Both times I recently went we sat right next to a window overlooking the Bellagio fountains and the food and service were both phenomenal.    I've had the edamame, big eye tuna pizza, the Alaskan king crab tempura, the popping spicy crab aka pop rocks roll, and the filet mignon toban.    The sweet chili that was added to the edamame made it very delicious.  The big eye tuna pizza is a dish that is an absolute must try.  It's difficult to describe the burst of flavor when you bite into it a piece, but it's excellent.  The crab tempura was fried to perfection and went really well with the sauces they served it with.  The spicy crab roll was unique because of the pop rocks they add to it.  The filet mignon melted in my mouth.  I also had a dessert that was made from nutella that was amazing.  I don't remember what it was called (dessert in a cup maybe?), but I would recommend it as well.  The overall quality of the food is good enough to justify the price you pay for it.    I would definitely call in advance and make a reservation.  Also, a lot of people dress up to eat here, but the atmosphere and vibe is laid back and relaxed enough that you can wear relatively casual attire and not feel under-dressed.

8YWo9n2HNMY4LMW5025QVw.text: Went here on a whim and can't wait to go back! mile high and pop rocks roll were great. Protein roll literally melted in your mouth. Service was great, rolls were both beautiful and delicious

gOE5OoFr254ziSEuh7gi2Q.text: I ate here 2 days ago and was extremely unimpressed, 2 people out the door was almost $300 , yet 1.5 miles away I had one of the best values for sushi ever. Pretty ambiance, very high quality sushi, but portions are minimal and not very innovative....dull. Skip this place unless you have too much $ to burn and too lazy to go anywhere else.

hCF3eInKe7P7W4pp_j5FlA.text: Want quick service with decent sushi? Yellowtail is the place for it. I loved the crispy rice. Oh and their edamame was awesome. It came in two different flavors and I absolutely loved the sweet chili one! Their miso soup was also pretty good. They had two or three different types of miso soups.   I gave four stars instead of five because I didn't find any unique sushi rolls for me to try.  Kumi is the sister restaurant of Yellowtail, and i gave that restaurant a 5 star! Definitely try Kumi

ZOzPlJ6c2YJ5IT8KPIW7jw.text: Happy Bday to me! A friend took me and the family along to indulge ourselves into this exquisite experience of...OMG delicious eats.  I really was begging them to stop because I couldn't eat any more food.    The appetizer that you must try is their Big Eye Tuna Pizza, mmm it was drizzeled with Truffle oil.  Oh my that was yummy.  I also got to sample the rock shrimp, and the Duck Prosciutto.  I love proscuitto, but the duck prosciutto was a bit on the saltier side, but again, it is duck.  Oh another that was delicious was the kobe beef tataki, man that literally melted in my mouth. Oh My, my tummy just started growling for that.  LOL, I don't think I can finish this review without re-living the experience again.  For some sushi we tried the Popping Spicy Crab roll, a favorite that my brother enjoyed.  I devoured the Toro sushi, what was in the platter, went all in my tummy.  We had a platter that had a variety of fish.  If you are eating here, I don't have to go in details of what I ate, but you won't be disappointed.  Toro, for sure, that was a must for sushi.   Okay seriously, I am not done.  We still had more food to be served.  Main courses brought on the Kobe Beef Flat Iron and Jidori Chicken.  They both were cooked to perfection, the yummy goodness that melted in your mouth had me saying MmmMm, so good, but so full, I can't even eat more of it :(.     For dessert we finished off with a ginger flan and chocolate lava cake paired with lychee sorbet.  I mananged to get at least a bite out of both of them, and they were yes, like the rest of my review, YUM.   I can't wait to return, I'm coming back with an empty stomach.  The whole staff was very pleasant.  BTW, the seating of this restaurant also overlooks the water fountain, oh you know, just icing on the cake at this place.   Thanks Yellowtail for this awesome experience in my mouth, my tummy thanks you!

6X1YpSVicaVikr1aKsf3uQ.text: Underwhelmed by the food, good but not great. Cocktails however were delicious, a little pricey but expected at an upscale restaurant. The view of the Bellagio fountains were spectacular. We were able to walk outside on balcony and actually feel the water.

bd_Ik6-MsE6iym0HQI4jAg.text: Decent Sushi restaurant inside the Bellagio.  The service was the best part.  Very friendly staff.  Prices are outrageous (20 dollars a roll) but it is Las Vegas and it is inside of a 5 diamond hotel so.....get some Yellowtail with Jalepeno and the Popping Spicy Crab Roll....

7PqfX3qCSA9tJ8yvRKM-UA.text: Amazing everything! The food was phenomenal, the service was excellent; and if you're lucky enough to sit on the patio... The view is just fantastic. Spend the money and enjoy the meal.

0aR2SPELcLJHiB59MF3OIQ.text: I came here with my boyfriend for our 2 year anniversary. Located inside Bellagio, if you reserve seats outside, you will have a nice view of the Bellagio Fountains (which performs every 15 and 30 minutes). The place is elegant for dinner, dimly lit, and loud with the sounds of other table guests. Our reservations were for 9pm, but was seated around 9:30pm, so just be cautious about time if you are on a schedule.  This is what we ate: 1. Big Eye Tuna Pizza $26 - thin crust on the bottom and tuna on the top, good to share, and definitely should try if you never had it before. 2. Grilled Eggplant Skewers $12 - sweet miso sauce with sesames, soft mushy eggplants. I would pass on it to try other things. 3. Popping Spicy Crab Roll $16 - House recommendation, actual pop rocks within the roll, very interesting, a must try!  We also ordered a bottle of sake, there are lots of selections. You can also grab a beer or glass of wine.  Service was attentive, they came back a few times to see if we needed more sake, more food, and filled up our glasses of water. I left feeling pretty good, and would come back for another nice dinner occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popping Spicy Crab Roll
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uLrYt76QQGMGLRyM8qjicw.text: While staying at Bellagio, we decided to go to yellowtail since we are sushi lovers. slow service, not very good sushi ( I mean the quality doesn't even come close to supermarket sushi) The tuna pizza that was supposed to be top notch, was not even good enough to be half finish. I still can smell the old oily smell of the crisp. Then tuna roll, protein roll, steak. none was good. very disappointing. Not to mention that the price was unreasonably high. I asked for a cucumber avocado roll. I was charged for cucumber roll plus 3 dollar for avocado and additional 3 dollar for " inside out" which means in cucumber roll the rice is inside the seaweed  ( seaweed paper is the outer layer) but now that they added avocado they had to have the rice outer layer and that cost 3 $ additional to price of cucumber and avocado!  I also asked for side of rice with steak which I was charged additional 3 dollar for bowl of rice ( which make sense ) and another 3$ to serve the rice in a bowl!! and I have to add the quality of steak was close to what you eat at fast food places and the steak was cooked completely bloody even I requested well cooked and I specifically asked the server's opinion ordering that for my kids, which he recommended! Too many people standing nice and clean doing nothing!

1PyToNN8dIp4mIk9r3UwMA.text: Well..It's was ehhh.  Great vibe in the room, service was very attentive but the food was just average.  I was expecting a lot better.   We started with the edamame which was actually quite good.  The sweet chili edamame was addicting.  Next came the Tuna Pizza.  Based on the reviews and pictures I was expecting something incredible.  It was like a thin wafer with one thin slice of tuna across the top.  Looked premade too.  We had the Rock Shrimp which was ok, too lemony though. @Andreas at Encore has better.  The Protein roll was just ok.    As a local we had been meaning to try Yellowtail...now we can say, been there, done that.  Disappointing.

3-2YRSpymfzwUffL131xTw.text: This place is outstanding. The food was amazing. For appetizer I suggest ordering tuna pizza sounds daring but is delicious it is also complemented nicely with truffle oil. Also the creamy spicy rock shrimp dosent dissatisfy. It's nice with a nice touch of spice. Also for the main rolls we ordered angry salmon which is a spicy salmon garlicky roll. Secondly we ordered rock shrimp hand roll this roll wasn't the extraordinary but it was ordinary. For tempura lovers there is a tempura roll that is amazing. Lastly we ordered an amazing roll that is a spicy tuna roll. The spicy tuna was by far the best roll on the menu and I high reccomend it. It is very spicy though so If you don't love spicy this isn't for you but my family and I love spicy so this roll was a home run. The service is ok not the best but decent in the beginning it was amazing but towards the end not so much. But either than that it's a home run.

lyjHTYUO1-e0UI03uP3ddg.text: WOW! This is one of the best meals I have had in a very long time. The tuna pizza, the yellowtail, the steak... and O yea, the dessert.   this is a must visit

MRa3q_dTZMAMQQRmP27xSQ.text: I really feel the need to review Yellowtail solely on the service of one of their hostesses on the night of Saturday, 5/17/15.  I had booked a reservation to celebrate an anniversary on their patio a week in advance.  On the taxi ride to the restaurant, I called to let them know that we were running a little bit late.  I was told that there was no reservation under my name, and when she looked up my OpenTable confirmation number, it showed that it was booked for the previous night (Friday), and that the restaurant was fully booked, especially for the coveted patio seating.  I was floored at myself for the mistake; we were so excited to try Yellowtail and experience their beautiful patio overlooking the Bellagio fountains.  I asked to just put my name down in case something opened up, and perhaps we would just dine at the bar.  We checked in, were told that it was a realistic wait of an hour and a half, and proceeded to order a few drinks and appetizers at the bar.  Maybe 20-30 minutes passed by, and the hostess that I spoke to over the phone approached me at the bar and said she was able to get me a table on the patio, saying she "knew she had to do something for me" after speaking to me on the phone.  I really appreciated the hospitality, especially since it clearly was my mistake on booking a table for the wrong night.  The patio table and view of the Bellagio water show were divine.  I have no words to describe the amazing ambiance, and truly can't compare it to any other view while dining.  If you dine here and the weather is nice, I would try to get a table out here.  The food was a bit mediocre for the pricing, though I feel like it was justified by the patio experience.  The only dish that really stuck out was my boyfriend's Surf & Turf ($115).  The sauce on the lobster was so delicious, and both the proteins were cooked to perfection.  I ordered the Hirame Ikejime ($30), which was just OK.  Hirame is one of my favorite fish eaten raw, but nothing wowed me.  I also ordered the Seared Foie Gras ($45), which was again, OK, and a very tiny portion for the price.  There was nothing special about our miso soups ($8 for a regular, and $9 for spicy).  The spicy version just tasted like they added few dashes of Tabasco.  All in all, the scenery made it all worth it (I know, I can't stop talking about it).  Service was great.  He didn't mention anything about it being our anniversary, but I was already highly appreciative of the fact that the hostess got us a table.  This is a great experience to celebrate a romantic evening!

g8Yx7HyOgK0DutsOjevdSg.text: For a 5 star hotel this sushi place is WAY OVER PRICED the yellowtail nigiri is $15 & the size of my thumb?  The uni was $19! It wasn't that fresh smdh... My bill was $87! 3 sushi, miso soup $7 lychee martini $20 I mean wow! Will not comeback

BJ_5onqEn0DVDR6E9wp2Sg.text: Yellowtail an overall amazingly artistic experience.  From the ambiance to the decor to the food presentation and well crafted cocktails.  The Spicy Tuna was spectacular and the plating and creative cocktails were beautifully made.  All the different aspects created a wonderful dining experience here.

RPzlqjlbGjezmBOPvcvzXA.text: The environment was dark but decent. We reserved seats for the patio to watch the Bellagio fountains- but didn't get them when we arrived. Drag!! We could see part of the shows from where we were seated inside. The hostess was a hot mess and not very welcoming or polite- in fact she seemed a bit unsure and uncomfortable. Our waitress was very nice and had excellent recommendations. The wait for both our drinks and food was quite a bit. Our waitress apologized and kept checking in, but you could tell the wait staff we slightly taxed. And we overheard another table complaining about being forgotten to management. We got the Alaskan king crab tempura- dear god that dish is amazing! One of the best I've ever tried! The Angry salmon roll was decent. Miso soup was good, and the red Zinfandel that was recommended was also quite good. That being said the price was too high for the small portions, slightly above average sushi, wait time, and fail on seating. Our price was $97 for 2 people- including a discount rate we got due to attending a conference in Vegas. I'd recommend it if you're going for the crab tempura- but get 1 for each person! And at $45 a plate it won't fill you up.  Lots of opportunities for this place to Improve!

KQE-omfmad6HBtDHTEaggQ.text: Horrible! The worst sushi we have had in a long time.  Made my husband sick. Paid almost $200 for sushi and I didn't even eat it. I would prefer McDonald instead Yellow Tail.

dVGCVK_dIV9HEu35IhVuqA.text: The food was pretty good, but our service was so appalling I had to take off three stars.  We go to Yellowtail on a friend's recommendation. It's myself, 7 other students, and a professor in town for a convention. After a lot of deliberation our waiter suggests letting him order, saying it'll be a good way to try the menu as well as making the price reasonable for us. He asks for our preferences so he can understand our tastes, and two of the students say they like California rolls - which should indicate to him their tastes are pretty basic.   We get one round. Four plates, all different, and share. It's kind of cool we think. Then another round comes out, two orders of two items. Then another. And another. Progressively going up the menu.   After about our 5th round the waiter tells us everything he ordered is in and now we just need to wait for the rest to come out. After this, two orders of a $60 dish come out. Then more rolls. Then two orders of a $130 dish come out. At this point, everyone is full and wondering why this waiter has ordered us so much food. Food that some people can't even enjoy because it's too eclectic for their tastes. Another order comes out. Then another, four rolls that are barely touched because everyone is so full.   We've barely touched that order before the next thing comes out. Luckily someone says "No. We're done eating." Afterwards our waiter comes over, leans into the ear of the girl who organized our dinner and somewhat snarkily says "Just so you know... Well, nevermind." And walks off. Then we get the bill.  Our bill is about $1300 and our waiter has guaranteed himself about a $200 tip because of the automatic gratuity placed on tables of 8 or more.   Our server took advantage of us. He knew we were young students. He knew we were indecisive about our tastes. He knew that amount of food was way too much. And yet, he put in at least 11 courses of food, possibly more.   Why wouldn't he place 3 courses, ask if we would like more of what we had or if he's matching our tastes, then continue? Why would he place THAT MANY orders at once?  The service here completely ruined my faith in Yellowtail. Between being shoved in the back and having to wait forever to get refills on drinks and our experience with a waiter who knew he ordered too much food that was too expensive for a group of 20-22 year olds and a professor, likely because of an automatic gratuity, I don't know if I can return. If your waiter is a tall man with glasses and closely cropped hair, do not let him order for your group.  If, despite reading how they treat their customers, you decide to est at Yellowtail anyway, give the tuna pizza a try. That and a few other dishes are slightly redeeming qualities of this restaurant, but I'll never forget the way their staff abused the trust of myself and my peers.

KatCaMqIrIIwL1hv9sqwAA.text: First time there for a light dinner before going to Hyde. They have an extensive Sake list to choose from and attentively keep your glass full.   We shared the Gyoza and tuna pizza which were both delicious. We each got our own rolls and they were good but not spectacular.   The service is awesome, very polite, professional and courteous. The prices are pretty high even for sushi. It's a good place to snack but not worth the prices for the entrees if you're hungry.

sovUSDAG-92njDbn8zEngg.text: Yellowtail used to me my fav restaurant in Vegas and I go every year. I was there this weekend and the food was not up to the usual standard and not nearly as tasty as before. The portions got smaller and Im ok with that its just that its not as good as before. Bellagio is till my fav hotel.  The staff is always helpful and nice. The cost is astronomical.... Im looking for a new sushi bar in Vegas.

ODVe6CggipkyPLJUFdkBTA.text: Best place I have EVER been! The hostesses were beautiful and polite, and very accommodating. If you go there, request a patio seat so you can watch the fountain show, it was a great view.  The server was amazing! He was very nice and professional, and yet he had so much personality! He made amazing recommendations and was attentive all night regardless of being very busy. Best waiter I've ever had.  The food was phenomenal! Everything tasted amazing, I've never had anything like it. I was astounded. I tried a lot of things and everything was perfect. We had the house sake and a few different years of the Macallan scotch, both amazing. My favorite drink was the desert sake called Banzai Bunny. It was a sweet sparkling sake, a perfect finish to the meal.  The music and atmosphere were perfect. I've never enjoyed the music in a restaurant so much, it was mostly very ambient and relaxing, yet slightly up beat remixes of popular songs played at the perfect volume. The tables were set wonderfully and the entire restaurant was beautiful.  The overall experience at this restaurant was wonderful, my boyfriend and I were both extremely impressed and will be back again! Thank you Yellowtail for the great experience!

jvq_wCMYQjN4KTFUgteBrA.text: Definitely not my usual price point for sushi... I'd rather go to a steakhouse or something for the same amount of money.  That being said, the ambiance was pretty nice.  The decor was dark and sleek, and our server was decent (he did forget to bring us tamari, but other than that, great).  We could also look out the window and see a little bit of the Bellagio fountain show, and it was neat to see it from inside the building.  I also liked the sommelier.  She was able to take two different wine preferences (dry vs. "sweet!  I like Moscato!") and recommend something in the middle that would appeal to both types of palates (still a little too sweet for my liking, personally, but a good compromise).  We shared the seared diver sea scallops ("mustard potato puree, cherry tomato").  These scallops were cooked very nicely and were garnished with a smear of the potato puree, which was too sweet, and a roasted cherry tomato.  The only thing was... there were two scallops.  They were 1.5 inches in diameter and had been cut in half so that there would be four pieces arranged delicately on the plate.  For $23, I think at least one more scallop would have been nice.  Next up was the popping spicy crab roll ("cucumber, asparagus, pop rocks").  Umm, it had pop rocks in it.  How could we not resist?  This was really fun to eat and actually worked a lot better than I expected.  We also ordered the unagi roll ("cucumber, sesame seeds, eel sauce").  Eel is always good and this was no exception.  These rolls were all a bit on the small side though.  Actually, I could have eaten the scallops and the rolls on my own, and then I would have been full.  But that would have cost me $50+.  Overall, I wouldn't choose to come here, but this was a nice place for a group of friends to chill and drink some wine (marked up from $20 to $55).  Such is my experience with Vegas... I don't gamble.  Instead, I lose a lot of money whenever I dine out, haha.

m_s9LVOx2MHqopx7X2DYdg.text: The best part about this place is sitting in the cocktail area out front and people watching. It's perfect!   Our food was pretty good (a bit pricey for the quality) and service was friendly and competent by the cute cocktail servers.   It can get really crowded in the bar area, but the cocktail tables in the front are away from the crowds and perfect for eating a full meal at.

NneI-YXO-9voBrqYMp8SJw.text: This trendy sushi place serves fresh, delicious cuisine that is unique and very Vegas. Loved it!

qI8YTEiGEltZZIpe_JaCCQ.text: First let me start by saying Tammy is a horrible server, her attitude changed from the beginning when I asked a simple question about what something cost .  But this Another example of a Restaurant that doesn't understand customer service and trying to price gauge their customers.  I have visited this restuarant on occasion when I am here for business trips ,and I order the same exact thing ,only this time they tried to up charge me and make money on the side for something as simple as yellowtail. Shame on you Yellowtail,what a horrible display of unprofessionalism . I  just over it ,what a way to ruin your customers or should I say former customers weekend .

kxWGrcEzojfPakEmG7SEZg.text: This place was a big disappointment. The menu looked fantastic and the food was good, so why the bad review? First off is portion size. I ordered an "entree," which was the Kobe Beef Flat Iron. I'm not much of a fish eater, but my wife is. Anyway, my entree come out and it looked more like an appetizer with a splat of potato puree. I'm a high metabolism carnivore and this was a huge disappointment for me, especially at $48!  My wife got two sushi rolls. She liked them, but again, they were extremely expensive. We spent about $130 and were hungry about 3 hours later.   The service was extremely slow, which is frustrating when your hungry and in vegas.

yW4agoK0VRqN4-5QWcd18Q.text: I loved this Yellowtail. Went to Las Vegas for Easter Holiday weekend and made reservations with Yellowtail.... OMG this place is delicious!!! Food, Drinks, Service, atmosphere great, great, great!

MYvx2TY3MrCsqzRn6S6qaA.text: ~High end sushi at a higher end price. Check out my full review with helpful photos here: asupr.us/ap-yellowtail Yellowtail is quite the luxurious setting which is quite fitting considering the fact that it's within the grand Bellagio casino. The decor was upscale, but trendy at the same time. In addition to the extravagant decor inside Yellowtail, you're also spoiled with an absolutely breathtaking view of the famous Fountains of Bellagio. First off, I acknowledge that eating at Yellowtail comes with a premium. And I already expected the increase in price from eating in Boston compared to eating in Vegas. With those two factors in mind, I still found the prices a little on the high side. Normally I'd be fine with paying a premium for high quality sushi, but for the price in Vegas and the sushi I got... I felt like the price I was paying was more for the surroundings and the location. I found the dishes to be on the smaller size, but it's all about quality, not quantity. Still would have liked to get a little more bang for my buck. Here are some of the rolls I tried: Big Eye Tuna Pizza - Micro Shiso, Truffle Oil Simply put, this thing is amazing and unique. It's a stark contrast from the soft delicious tuna and the crunchy pizza crust. It just all worked, very clean flavors. Kobe Beef Tataki - Spicy Daikon, Garlic, Maldon Sea Salt The Kobe Beef is cut paper thin, but it's the combination with the crunch of the garlic and the sea salt that makes this dish a sure winner. Melts in your mouth. Tai Snapper - Extra Virgin Olive Oil, Shiso, Tosazu The extra virgin olive oil makes this dish divine. The slight peppery taste gives the snapper a nice little kick. Excellent stuff. Toro Scallion Roll - Blue Fin Tuna Belly, Green Onion On the small side, but a classic combination. Fish was nice and fresh, rice was perfect. Nothing special, just very solid. Popping Spicy Crab Roll - Cucumber, Asparagus, Pop Rocks Amazing and unique roll. Yes, the description does say Pop Rocks. Most unique roll I may have ever had.

9YpHs3PfGkrocjcgZ-7E1Q.text: Was here a couple weeks ago, had a reservation at 8 but got there 30 min early, the host was great and was able to get us immediate.  The tuna pizza was recommended and was delicious, all the rolls were very fresh and beautifully prepared. We were able to get a glimpse of the fountain show which was a nice feature.  Cons: the bill was a bit pricy, but it's Bellagio so it was expected  Pros: delicious variation of fish, staff was very attentive. Our server Tammy was amazing and made the everything even better. Definitely will be back!

fjTEJMIXPWC8UswRIqx-UA.text: Didn't get a window or patio seat, but can still see the window from my seat... and its pretty amazing to see the famous Bellagio fountains while enjoying dinner. I was a bit anxious about trying this restaurant because I LOVE Japanese food and didn't know how I'd feel about paying loads of money for it when I have plenty of fave restaurants. Between my other half and I, we ordered a couple of small plates and rolls and one entree to share. I'd say some were unique and delicious. The pop rock roll, oyster shooter, and big eye tuna pizza are a must. But otherwise I wouldn't spend so much money on Japanese food. Definitely overpriced.

e_TSDxXkFRV7cxQ3q2tU7w.text: Yellowtail was definitely a great experience for Japanese food. usually at Japanese restaurants i only order sushi BUT here i tried everything! The big eye tuna pizza was a great start with the truffle  oil.  Even the duck procuitto was delicious. At first i was a bit hesistant but when i took that bite i was in heaven! I have posted up some pictures of the food we had.  Even the executive chef Akira (who was also on Iron Chef) came out to greet us. He was very nice and funny. We had a great table on the patio that has the best view of the Fountain show of Bellagio. We were very lucky.  Definitely would recommend this restaurant!

7xhdIDNxgdqb-34rWGrEaw.text: The ambiance is great, especially if you're seated on the patio, with the Fountains going right in front of you.  However, considering the tapas size of the entrees, and the prices, ouch, really expensive!  I had the black cod, delicious, but where's the beef?  The portion is so small it must have been meant for an elf.  My friend had the Chilean sea bass, and she was not happy with it.  She said the fish tasted like it was spoiled.  The portion was also elf-size, but definitely not the price.  We shared the chocolate chocolate dessert, but did not mind the wee size because of the calories, otherwise, yes, they were teeny tiny little pieces.  We're locals having fun on a Friday night, should we tell our friends?

3ClNGupQbu4sMwvu7I1Ldw.text: I'm aware that it's Vegas, but this is one of the more overpriced places I've been here. I won't say that the tuna sushi "pizza" wasn't good, because it really was delicious (as is anything with truffles, but I digress). But the only menu items less than $15 are salads, which are small. The $15-20 items are the sushi rolls, which really are better described as "rice rolls" with the faintest essence of fish in them. And everything else (sushi pizza included) are $30+, including appetizers. Save your money...

IpvkUg0IUNsmQZqrVyg3lA.text: We were going to see a show last night and were running short of time. The staff got our meals out very quickly. We ordered four plates between two people and that was more than enough. Good is of exceptional quality

bO-9pSqoz0B4XKrZH-pVHw.text: Been to many sushi places in Vegas and all over the United States and when someone mentions the word "sushi" this is the very first place that comes to mind. The food is simply outstanding, just not much more to say about it than that.  The place is well located in the Bellagio and has a sexy and trendy feel to it. I could go on and on here, ranting and raving about this place but just take my word for it, you will never be disappointed here.

EM5aCcoNIZdcrSledf9Zcg.text: Yellowtail was everything our disastrous experience at "Carnevino" was not. The food at Yellowtail was actually good, the atmosphere was breathtaking, and the service was top notch. Yes it was expensive, but we actually ordered enough food that we were full! So I did not mind the higher price tag. And still I spent less than the horrible "Carnevino".   Biggest props goes to their service. Our waiter was so attentive and friendly I left him a slightly larger tip than usual. First class all the way.  They also accommodated us by sitting us right up against the windows so we watched the fountain show about 7 times. Beautiful!  2 appetizers, 2 entrees, wine, dessert and more for much less than we spent at "Carnevino" + a great experience watching the fountain show.  I'd definitely come back to Yellowtail!

zI3YdlZHVAvWqHpzKrd18A.text: I can't go to Vegas without eating here once or twice. Great for groups with family style portions. Make sure you get the big eye tuna pizza and hand rolled soft crab... Oh yeah, phenomenal view of the bellagio fountain!

W2J4hVPUz91n4iwGWWqHfw.text: Bumped up to a 5th star on account of a handwritten "Thank You" from our server Mithkah. Whether she knows it or not,  because of her follow up Yellowtail has now moved to the top of my sushi rotation is Vegas.  Owners listen up- those old time service gestures are THE shit! Being nice, friendly and enjoying your job are the keys to success in the service industry. I was going to wait till July to back to Vegas, but now am going next week... for more Yellowtail of course!

UgaAzZbYXTIxnFU4disIfA.text: Yellowtail had the best sashimi and a great choice of sake!!! I ate here around 5-6 times in my 10 day stay! Amazing!!!

q3DntIY8r9MifSscRBBjzA.text: The sashimi I received was so so at best, service was decent. My expectation when coming to Las Vegas is to get the best, this was average at best. I've received far better seafood/sashimi and I'm from Chicago!

yHD-in9ddE1MseWBqhCvRg.text: Theo rocked. The view over the water rocked. The company rocked. The food rocked.  Why didn't we sit outside? Next time!

HTqa7o1RFBY94WnMa9b2oQ.text: **This review is only for the bar**  So after winning (relatively) big at some $5 blackjack tables, my friends and I headed here for some classy cocktails. Kat, the friendly and knowledgeable bartender, recommended the Essence - a smooth and refreshing martini consisting of Square One cucumber vodka, cucumber puree, and white cranberry juice for sweetness. Amazing. It was artfully served in a martini glass with a swizzle stick stacked with thinly sliced cucumber and cherry tomatoes.  I was tasting cucumber on my tongue for half an hour after I had polished off the cocktail. Love it. It was worth the $20 splurge.

hKVG59yJyEOcThUpqomdIQ.text: As everyone's else commands, I hated this restaurant, the food and presentation for price of it is a NoNo No  The customer service sucked and the food, what surprised us the most is that they brought both of our order on the same plate and didn't tell us, so we are waiting for the second plate to arrive Nop that was it. Very much not to the standard of Bellogio casino this restaurant service and food  should get better to the 5 star rating or should close down.

89i4Y5eMvzPm2pvIkPspYQ.text: I've visited this place the day before yesterday. This is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas, especially for my special day. So nice situation, the window seat after sunset is the best. Please don't miss the big eye tuna pizza and broiled atlantic black cod which is my favorite. I need to add the comment about the service... was wonderful!!! We had a great time with their kind services and smiles. I would love to visit again whenever I could stop by Las Vegas!

y_Faw2qO4BK4E756gZdurg.text: Great service. Ask for patio seating and you get front row view of the spectacular fountain show every 15 min. Tuna pizza is great and pop rocks sushi (the chefs mom got him to eat sushi by putting candy inside so this was the inspiration) is also a fun surprise in every bite. Chili edamame is yummy too. It's pricey but hey that's Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E656DVrMGuWlU7Y9w7i7xA.text: Proprietor/Chef: The Light Group / Akira Back  yellowtail.. like so many restaurants in vegas has got "ostentatious" written all over it. so befits the name "restaurant & lounge".  the space is exquisite.. even if i weren't dining in, i could sit here all night, sipping on martinis with girlfriends .. or handsome prospects that probably will never meet the mark.  our friend was a friend of the friend's chef.  so in passing, he naturally consumed the table with interesting talks of his restaurant, peers, industry and of course VEGAS. he insisted we try omakase ..so we dived right into it.    we tried a varietal of food.. all consumed in petite amounts. the most memorable dishes for me include the truffle tuna pizza, baked crab roll, halibut and the sous vide chicken.  Surprisingly, yes, the chicken.  It was the last entree, and one bite was so tender & moist, we couldn't resist our stuffed silly selves.  my stomach wanted to explode like a ticking time bomb, and wait... there's more.  a ginormous dessert platter, i nearly lost my ability to breathe.  luckily i savored more than i sweet, so after a few bites, i was able to.. slowly....put...down...the....spoon....... easy there.  decadence knows no boundaries!

6WQWuS3ExSNdQ_ULjrnAJQ.text: Buyer beware, Dinner for 2 will cost you 2 HUNDRED dollars easy. If you are an average income person this place is NOT in uou r budget. Plus staff unfriendly n not knowledgeable. BEWARE shared portions , they are VERY small n cost $25 plus each n are NOT shareable. Advice, if cost is an issue, don't bother.

rNzcEDzhN2lcbgWJ2C--6Q.text: I would give non of star to this restaurant if I could.  I ordered some nigiri sushi and some maki . I understand the price if the sushi is worth but the sushi is terrible all the sushi was tasteless. I should add a alot of Wasabi and ginger maybe a lot more soy sauce. The spicy tuna roll was not spicy enough and tasteless and also the negitoro roll has a lot of muscle in it and also i bite tuna scale inside of roll. Tuna scale was sharp almost cut my tongue. So disgusting and dirty. Sushi in the buffet is even better.

accxKTocJYQ2i1hxzJNs1Q.text: Ask for Tammy, best server in Vegas!  Must eats: big eye pita, seaweed salad, red dragon and the A1 steak roll.  Plan to save room for the chocolate dessert...it is heaven in a cup!!!

PAz6dMQsI1keHOcjcDP38w.text: Nice atmosphere nice staffs  Worst sushi and food. Not worth to pay that much. Quality of sushi is little better than kaiten sushi...sushi rice was ok but the way of holding rice was not that professional. So disappointed at this restaurant and the chef. Overrated.

I4jLRo7QDOCvjJEq7NqKYA.text: love it here & ever since i started comin 2 this place, there has only been 2X that i didnt dine here while in vegas:  1 time was cuz of CES show, where it was more or less a meet & greet  ~  da other time was cuz reservations were only available @10pm, which was 2 late cuz we already had other planz 4 a birthday celebration  absolutely love da big eye tuna pizza & we usually order 2 or more + theres nothin i ordered that i didnt like  ~  da only thing is that i also love good sake, so no matter f we have 2 people or 8 people, our bill is usually pretty steep, between $700-$3000 after tax/tip

7TURicDu8Y8CQ72ImL78YQ.text: Drinks were mediocre. Food took an hour to get to us after we ordered. Our bartender was too busy talking to some douche who wouldn't shut up and stop asking her a million questions. The sushi pieces are tiny, okay flavor and overpriced. Find another place.

g98XkoFQwH2g4viEFttNDQ.text: This restaurant has to be one of the best dining experiences I've ever had! The food is absolutely incredible, esp. the big eye tuna pizza, the lobster carpaccio, and the rolls. Don't let the price color your view - it's the las vegas strip after all! Wonderful location, impeccable service, delicious unique food - in sum, a Vegas must if you like food!

5d5tJ9bi6zsDeU_JiSW5sA.text: Nice stop for a beer or cocktail. Great spot for people watching. Service was great! Did not try any food.

Ttg3xGIdRC9j4ci1ZxF9QQ.text: A big shout out to Jamie at the front desk who was really fantastic and on top of everything despite it being a busy holiday weekend.  We got a table outside right in front of the fountain and it made our night.   Food is descent. They move a lot of people through there in a night so the service is a little rushed but friendly and generally fun. We've eaten at Yellowtail 3 or 4 times and it's always a great time but this weekend it was really fabulous.  Thanks Jamie.

iHPzqhfhP97L5LeKoAFY1Q.text: 12/28/2017 was my first visit to Yellowtail and it will not be my last.  The service and food were excellent.  I started the experience with a Plymouth martini with bleu cheese hand-stuffed olives.  (The real deal!)  Not only can Casey, the bartender, make a great drink, but also give great food recommendations.  He raved on the Big Eye Tuna Pizza and it did not disappoint.  It was incredible!  I also had the Seared Diver Sea Scallops.  Next, I wanted to venture into a dish that featured the namesake of the restaurant.  Upon asking for another recommendation, James (another bartender), readily suggested the Yellowtail Jalapeno option.  Delightful!  Rounding out the evening was the succulent Scottish Salmon.  Pricey evening but . . . I'm worth it.   I will return when in Vegas next.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SP4-zFmLaqohnEXN6LXFPQ.text: Wondered if they had a new chef.  Dine here often and it was pretty poor this evening.  Several of the signature dishes were very disappointing.  Rice on the rolls was supermarket quality.  Sad to see for a Vegas staple.

zElNj-5zFoKydLnV_EFyCw.text: I normally don't "yelp", but my experience here was pretty terrible. The only person who seemed to care was the person filling our water, so I ended up handing him a $100 tip.  The service in general from our waitress was bad.  The waitress who was "waiting" on our table couldn't care less.  I used to work in the service industry.  The trick to get a good tip is to give updates to your customer regardless if it is busy or not.  Some of these people don't realize that a tip is actually based on their service and is not a requirement.  In the end, management asked us "are you sure that you didn't get your order???"  Terrible.  Someone f***ed up on their team, yet we were question.

b3zaWPCIvHDRAwFZHJ9DMw.text: Had a wonderful dinner at Yellowtail at the suggestion of the concierge at Four Seasons.  We had the crispy tofu appetizer, which was excellent, and a couple of rolls -- Unagi (eel) and Happa (cajun spiced albacore, spicy aioli) -- which were outstanding.  Also threw in salmon roe sushi, which was good.  What really made the evening, however, was the outdoor patio seating overlooking the Bellagio fountains, so that every 30 minutes we would be treated to a music choreographed fountain display.  Really a great dining experience.  Highly recommend.  I will definitely go back next time I visit Vegas.

yFdsC0aRli4EvLOvacweHQ.text: Awesome food!  Great ambiance! Loved every appetizer and entree!  Will definitely return!

A04U7ya5aYqAXfqKvLyyig.text: Absolutely delicious!   Big Eye Tuna Pizza was amazing!  Atmosphere and servers also amazing!  Highly recommend!

1R78F7BfC70Y03EPeksstw.text: Such good food, like nobu when it first started. Ask for Brad if possible he's incredible and has the best recommendation. Great service great food great experience!

ta4SzRJjBdFcaoCjx369oQ.text: I LOVE this restaurant!! One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas! It has a contemporary, trendy, and upscale atmosphere. I love that it overlooks the Bellagio Fountains. (No need to sit on the patio. You can go out any time to watch the show and take pictures). The service is fantastic and attentive.  A few must have dishes are: - Big Eye Tuna Pizza (their most popular signature dish) - Rock Shrimp  - Alaskan King Crab Tempura  - Protein Sushi Roll  - Jidori Chicken

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Eye Tuna Pizza Sooooo goood!
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura Alaskan King Crab
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Protein Sushi Roll

jU4Wc706dQZ6LdSy_ctRSQ.text: Let me start by saying how amazing the view is. It overlooks the Bellagio fountains which is pretty cool. The service was also good. The staff was friendly, helpful and made sure the food came quick. Besides the fountains and service, I was unimpressed with this restaurant. Everyone seems to rave about the tuna pizza so we decided to give it a go. It was a total disappointment. It lacked flavor and was definitely not worth the $27 dollars. We ordered two more appetizers which were only okay.  Then the rolls came out. They were good but definitely not worth the price.  Overall, I wouldn't go back. The portions were small, the food was okay, and it was way over priced.

xasBoSolUEsaneGeTx7fHA.text: Best sushi you can have it is well worth of wait as well as money. I love this sushi house I can't wait to go back again.  If you are in Las Vegas you must try their sushi.  I recommended to all friends and family.

zd_R0oJytelOFxy7IC4W-w.text: We were treated to an amazing experience at Yellowtail on our recent trip to Vegas.  Sarah, our server, was super sweet and took great care of us. Our group has a diverse and varied palate and she made lots of menu suggestions to accommodate everyone's different tastes. Some delicious highlights: Big Eye Tuna Pizza (can I eat this every day tho?), Tempura Alaska King Crab (so good!), Protein Roll, Rib Eye Steak cooked to perfection, and Chocolate in a Cup and Apple Harumaki for dessert to top it all off. She also paired some fabulous cocktails and sake with our dishes. Everything was coursed out perfectly and absolutely delicious!  I also want to thank the friendly and accommodating GM, Keith. He knew we were celebrating a very special birthday and seated us next to the balcony, so we were treated to incredible views of the Bellagio fountain during our dinner. He checked in on us multiple times throughout the evening to make sure we were enjoying ourselves.  We couldn't have asked for a better experience - from the food, to the impeccable service, and welcoming staff. Thank you Sarah and Keith for a lovely evening! We will definitely come back the next time we visit Vegas.

kyaFBHyka-yDSJOxeqTVPQ.text: Great experience all around! Food was uniquely delicious! Service was personable, attentive and caring. Emanuel was our server, so if you get him, he will take care of you!  The Big Eye Tuna Pizza is one of the most memorable food items I've ever had in terms of flavor! Delicious! The Black Miso Cod was also unexpectedly light, moist, and amazingly flavorful! The wife enjoyed the Sunset cocktail where the drink is fresh and delicious.   Overall, you cannot go wrong dining here!

NIDwObgfWD9YZUkyyVlu-Q.text: Beautiful place, great service. The quality of food was good even though it's pricey, but it's in the strip. The only thing I was disappointed with was the options. They didn't have a large selection, and very few vegan/vegetarian options.

VKJO_XUYZYPLE2YdWI1aQQ.text: I took my parents here for their anniversary when they came in to town and we loved yellowtail. Our server (I feel horrible I forgot her name) was awesome, recommended the Big Eye Tuna Pizza to start with. It was amazing, I ordered another appetizer and a few rolls for the table however the Tuna Pizza was the one thing that left an impression on us. After our delicious dinner the manager overheard it was my parents anniversary so he sent over complimentary glasses of champagne. Overall the food was spot on and the service was top notch. I would absolutely recommend this restaurant if you are looking for a nice Japanese meal.

38d5cakVOWIbavP2YHG9Iw.text: Arrived at about 9:20pm on a Monday night and was quickly seated. That was the height of my experience. The waitress promptly took my order and then I didn't see her again for 15 minutes. When I got her attention I reminded her that I was still waiting for a drink. 5 minutes later I got my drink. I waited another 20 minutes for the first of the  2 sushi rolls that I ordered.  I had the Filet Mignon Toban and Red Dragon. Both rolls were average and I was clearly paying a significant markup for location. The rolls came out about 15 minutes apart. Overall I was very disappointed with the quality of the dining experience and would not recommend for service or food.

5IJrvJTvMxFpFXwKoU3QLA.text: Only thing good at this place is the tuna pizza everything else is mediocre . Service was terrible .. Our waiter Michael was awful and would disappear who knows where . Even his fellow coworkers would have to go out and find him and he could not be found anywhere.  When he did finally show up he would forget what we ordered and forget to put it in .. Not very knowledgable either about menu . Awful experience and waste of time and money .. Go elsewhere .

bVc4YUtjOCwAryiVD1rUaw.text: yea not worth the money, not anything impressive. drinks were good. it wasn't bad but I've had better for less. the place just doesn't really feel comfortable. not a warm inviting atmosphere. and how many douche bags can a bar seat? apparently many at this location.

XtsJx2POH1JIpAJeO7rPSQ.text: We were in vegas for my sons 21st birthday.. And started our nite at YELLOWTAIL..OMG  this place was beyond any thing that i could think of..From the start Fantastic cocktails amazing appetizers Then let the sushi begin..We have had a lot of sushi all over the world, and were not sure how to start, So our server asked if we would like the chef to put our order together...We told them what we would like to try and put it in his hands..Well it was amazing..unbelievable.Each platter just got better..and yes it is not cheap eats..but what you do get is the freshest most creative mouthwatering sushi around..Far better then NOBU  and may i add some of the best looking staff in Vegas  Well worth the money ..If your looking for cheap eats they have that in vegas..But if your looking for some of the finest sushi Do yourself a favor and stop in at yellowtail for a incredable experience....love it love it love it   Chef Ivo

oNYqn_-Ctg38zv8wkjSZfg.text: Really good sushi that is fresh but the price is pretty high for what you get. My only real complaint is that you would expect the menu to be a little bit more creative and original for the price.

AIydaF4FRo9_POkz7oJOxA.text: Very very good! The restaurant is very new and very modern and fancy and you have a great view of the bellagio fountains. Our waiter was great and super helpful. He asked if we had a show to see before hand so he knew of any time constraints which is thoughtful. He recommended the big eye tuna pizza and the tempera fried king crab. Both were amazing. They were actually on the food network for their crab. The sushi is very fresh and all the other food I had (rock shrimp tempura, Chilean sea bass, and ankimo) were all delicious. The restaurant is expensive, but the location is why. Food is great too. Would recommend going.

iis2N7u4j8L18wNCz8GGJg.text: While my girlfriend and I were in the Bellagio waiting for the performance of "O", we decided we would stop and eat at one of the many restaurants in the Bellagio floor. We had already eaten the Buffet, so we narrowed it down to the four or five remaining restaurants. Yellowtail had the shortest line, and I had been in the mood for sushi for a few days, so we stopped in. The setting is very intimate, very cool. There's a small section inside next to the bar, a few tables spread throughout the restaurant, and a few tables on a deck looking out over the casino floor. We were seated immediately, and the service was outstanding. Very, very beautiful hostesses and servers took care of us all night long. Had a few different rolls and a few orders of sashimi. The pace of the meal was pretty good, as we got our drinks and soup immediately, then slowly started receiving the rolls and sushi as the meal went on. It was at a good enough pace where you could eat and enjoy the meal, yet not have huge plates covering the table, spread out every which way. Overall, the quality of the sushi was very good, and the taste was great also.  For the restaurant, I was going to go with three stars. The food was good, but I've had better sushi at many local restaurants throughout the country, and it was WAY cheaper. The price of this restaurant certainly doesn't reflect the taste, although it was good, just not for the price. The service definitely knocked it up to four stars, however. Our waitress was exceptional, and the entire meal was very relaxing and enjoyable. Overall, I would recommend this place to anyone looking for sushi on the strip, as it probably won't get any cheaper unless you go somewhere else in Vegas. Definitely enjoyed the experience, and I would probably stop here again.

nSz0BoSMM_tRMTO6EsMSvQ.text: Excellent restaurant, good service, great food expensive. Yesterday I spend 180 just for one person, but it was worth it, great carpaccios, delish sushi tuna belly is yummy

6LQTCPBeLZSlzlADwbQbsg.text: Food is delicious!! We had the spicy miso soup to start with. We also had the tuna pizza, yellowtail serrano, oysters, ribeye, kobe flat iron steak and few other small plates to share. Portions are small but that is expected for fine dinning.  We ordered pomegranate martinis, glasses of riesling & sauvingonm blanc, also some sake. Mixed drinks r much better than the wine. Their wine selection used to be much better n they used to have a sommelier. Overall delicious quality fine food.

tuFqLaPNLXVR2oXtKxWJqw.text: Kobe beef sashimi and uni (sea urchin) sashimi - 2 foods I've always wanted to try.  It's all about the taste of fat - fatty buttery beef and fatty buttery caviar.  Truly one of the greatest culinary experiences I've ever had in my life.
