erLQ-E_Zzh2_YgwSYGhVtg.text: Rating from 1 to 10, 10 being the best or extremely over priced.  The place: 7.75 (hip, romantic, relaxing) The cleanliness: 8.5 (no stains, spots, or smells) The music: 9 (great music to go with the ambience) The service: 8 (very friendly with lots of smiles) The food: 8 (fresh and tasty, like it a lot, but not love it) The drink: didn't order drinks they made, just water and wine. The price: 8 (portion is too small, need to order a lot to get full)  The result: definitely going back when I have craving for sushi.

2BGUTgtSVPTpzrpcs_iB-Q.text: I am giving this restaurant more stars for having ambiance and great service. When we were there it was packed with high profile celebrities. The service was fantastic and everything came quick. I thought the food was good, a B, but extremely expensive for what it was. We had a few roles and light drinks and the tab came up to $300+. If I had not sat next to the black eyed pees singer (aple.de.ap) I would have given it three stars.... but I love that guy so I have fond memories of that night :.0

_XJFi7a0Jw9UN3gd3GM10w.text: The sushi here is good but not for sushi purists. The draw to Yellowtail is their creative soon on sushi. If you like roils and interesting takes on the japanese classic then try it out. If you're looking for authenticity in japanese cuisine or are more of a nigiri or sashimi type of person there are places more fitting.

yqYu_WUPudxn-QDyIJ4szA.text: Service was top-notch, no doubt.    Price-wise, I guess it's Vegas so when you go to a place like Social House or Yellowtail, you're going to pay way more than anywhere else.  Two glasses of wine, three rolls and an edamame = $100  I tried all the unique sounding rolls like the unagi & banana roll (not too banana-y, surprisingly good!), strawberry roll with spicy tuna (strawberry on top, great aftertaste), etc.  The portions were as small as a regular sushi roll and not the size of larger special rolls.  How do they not have a sushi bar?  Hmm that always seems fishy to me.

-nSmuSot4Fgrjq3hjmvV8g.text: In a word: awesome.  This was easily one of the top sushi places I have gone to. Quiet, elegant atmosphere, fresh food and great service. The rolls were well executed and not overly prepared or slathered in sauces. The fish was very fresh and presentation wasn't over the top - which I like.  Personal favs: - the edamame, I really like the sweet & spicy version (they bring two types, traditional and sweet & spicy) - Strawberry roll, hadn't had a roll with fruit in/on it before and this was a nice treat, plus the strawberries still had bite to them - Popping Crab Roll, a new take on the traditional crab roll with Pop Rocks in it, odd but addictive  Overall, my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. It is something we will definitely remember from our trip to Vegas and can't wait to get back to visit Yellowtail again.

95zIRx3aKdKbVa3r7ccBeg.text: My wife and our friends went here for my wife's birthday.  It was a pretty cool experience. 1.  Atmosphere - wow, it was really nice.  The restaurant is pretty intimate and cozy (kinda dark with light music in the background).  If I had to do it over again, I would recommend making reservations to sit outside on the balcony.  On the balcony, you would have a full view of the Bellagio Fountains playing while you eat.  We learned of this AFTER we sat down.  Next time! 2.  Service - so so, they were quite busy and a lot of the waiters took their time.  However, I must admit that the hostesses are incredibly attractive...LOL... my wife gave me a few angry looks..lol.. oh well. 3.  We all ordered the set menu.  It is a 7 course fish.  By the way, quality is key here.  Funny thing, after our 4th dish, we jokingly mentioned that we may have to swing by the In and Out Burger joint to get a filling.  However, the 5th to 7th course is a bit heavier and actually made us full. As for the food, I would highly recommend the sliced Halibut , the yellowtail/salmon/tuna salad, and the Kobe Medallion beef.  Wow.  We capped it off with green tea ice-cream... very good. Drinks are kinda cool.  They have their own variations of mixed drinks. 4.  Price -- extremely pricey.  Usually reserve for special occassions. 5.  Dress code - we were a bit surprised that it was not more of a dressy crowd.  We saw a few jeans and several in shorts.  For an upscale restaurant, we thought it was a bit odd... I guess you are on the strip.  My wife and I planned to return again.  It was a great experience.

yVKZ_zgtrUaU3WhjudlPUg.text: best part of our trip to vegas!  this place served me the best thing i've ever tasted:  A sushi roll with: Lobster on the inside, topped with tuna, cilantro and truffle oil.  Sweet Baby Geezus...amazing!!!!!  Great music, great atmosphere.

JmNllDFGZiQ_jgBdKpr9bQ.text: Very nice elegant dining experience. Service was excellent. If you visit here you MUST try the popping spicy crab it was excellent. I also ordered the California roll but it was average and not worth the price. Sticking to traditional cuisine I ordered Sake as a drink, it came in a cool looking possibly bamboo cylinder and was good and smooth, but at around $45 it was only worth the price to share among the table.

KeDStbyzhrtu1qeGrJQyrw.text: I went here for my one year anniversary with my boyfriend, and it was great, as long as you know what to expect. The bill came out to $175 including tip.   If you've ever been to Nobu, the menu is very similar. The food was really good, and you're not supposed to go and order just one entree and be done. I definitely recommend the rock shrimp, kobe beef tataki, and the yellowtail serrano. The spicy tuna specialty roll was really disappointing, and I didn't really like it. Also, the edamame comes in two different ways: the regular plain way with sea salt and then with thai chili or something which was just okay. I was also not impressed with the dessert menu, so we didn't get any. I also got hot tea, which was $8..!!   The ambience was fantastic. The restaurant was beautiful, but a little smaller then I expected. It was rainy and windy that day, so the balcony was closed, but we got a seat right next to the window so we could see the Bellagio fountain show very easily.   As for the service... I didn't really like our server. I felt like he was ignoring us and rushing to get away when we were trying to talk or ask for something.   All in all, I would definitely go here again when I have some extra money to splurge on dinner.

9-cMiNk9VDE5VPXxxUTYiA.text: We went there for our anniversary we got a table by the window which you can see the dancing water outside very nice. We ordered the Yellowtail Serrano and king crab dynamite for the appetizer not really like the Yellowtail but the crab is amazing very big portion too. Must try the popping crab roll I love the pop rocks in it and we also got the unagi and toro rolls it's was good but nothing special. We spend $175 for our food and 2 glasses of wine not too bad for a fancy sushi place in Vegas we enjoyed it!!

9VYEKkuhdpfW3ek9ThraXg.text: maybe I was just really really really hungry but everything we ordered was good. They offer a shared plate type of menu so its perfect for a medium sized to large group. Somehow even though everyone seems to complain about the price when we got the bill and figured out the price per person it wasnt bad at all. Dont expect to stuff yourself like your at Duffs buffet and you will do well. ...... Sushi pizza

-UE1wU1IUOOpzshWB18B4w.text: Don't know if off night but of four items we ordered only one was ok.  Nothing like I expected for $155 and all the hype after iron chef.  One thing that really upset me was we don't drink alcohol, just soft drinks and when they ask if you would like a refill or another drink you get charged full price for your drink again.  Seems so old school to charge for refills .  AND If you do charge for refills TELL THE PEOPLE they are being charged.   Bad experience.

atnGy9VPu_7ICg5xY1qOcw.text: My sister and I lucked out on all accounts when dining at this wonderful restaurant.  We ordered a wide variety of sushi and specialities to include the hamachi that melted in our mouths, the tuna pizza (someone else posted a pic) with truffle oil that was interesting and every bite delightful, and the baked crab hand roll that was a party in the mouth.  Everything we ordered was exceptional.  The waitstaff and service was exactly what one would expect from this place,--prompt, helpful, attentive, exact.  The various choices are expensive, but considering we had pretty close to a perfect experience, one doesn't mind forking (or chopsticking in this case) out the dough.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

6kdvtBCUWRl34JIwW_21tg.text: Overpriced & small portions!!  I've had better sushi.  We also ordered the Kobe steak and the beef ribs, both over $40.  They give you 5 very small pieces of meat for the ribs.  Both dishes tasted good but not THAT good.  Our bill was over $200 because we kept ordering food so we could feel like we actually ate something. My suggestions: Eat before you go, or drink lots of alcohol while you are dining so you won't notice the child-like portions with the adult price tag.

XpMaAf-bHZxMrOCFHwQ2DA.text: I honestly can't think of a sushi experience that wasn't better than Yellowtail.  We walked in without reservations and had almost no wait.  The atmosphere is like a nightclub, the music was loud and terrible, and it was extremely dark.  Putting all of that aside, the food was mediocre at best.  The sauce that the tofu came with tasted exactly like Oriental Ramen broth.  The rolls were extremely small and had minimal flavor, the edemame was adequate although half of it was overcooked.  I think their slogan on the business card said it all:  "Yellowtail - Barely Adequate"

CYQonte31_RIxKImF_Jh0w.text: The only imaginable reason to eat at "Yellowtail" in the Bellagio is if you can sit outside and enjoy the amazing Bellagio fountain show.  The menu, sushi, specialty rolls, and drink options are really not very good (and that's understating the quality of the food.)  The rolls were very small and totally overpriced ($17 for a California Roll which was nothing special).  We had four rolls, one beer and some edamame and spent over $120.  The service was pleasant, but the order took too long to get to us.  With all the options for sushi in Vegas, we will Not be returning to Yellowtail.

QThFrgqObkuyuDYQZXw3uQ.text: You can see the fountains from here so that's cool. The staff is really friendly and my water cup was never empty. The three of us ordered a bunch of stuff and it only came out to $160 (without alcohol). The stand-outs were the tuna pizza, shrimp cigars, and the chocolate cup dessert. As for the rolls, their signature roll is a strawberry roll...its just strawberry on top of a spicy tuna roll...maybe I'm just conservative, but I would eat the roll without the strawberry. I would go back if I wanted a cheap place to eat at Bellagio.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x2PT6YwQ9_imlRq3L2SGFg.text: Ok the food here was seriously BOMB.com...would've been 5 stars except for: ~Portions were very (I mean VERY) small ~It was my 21st birthday..we spent 400$+ on a b-day dinner..and no free little song and dance?!?!?! WTF But I mean I ordered the sweet ginger cigar shrimp, the lobster roll, and the seaweed salad. All were amazing. Excellent selection of Sake..avoid the 14$ "cocktails" that were 99% juice. I also tried my friends Unagi and Banana roll..sooo good. Kobe Beef is incredible. Pretty much everything I tried was the best I've tasted, and I would DEF reccomend. Beautiful venue and incredible staff.

3_fxGXmugxxpDJ95PfmhPQ.text: I'm a bit of a sushi snob, so when I heard that the Bellagio was finally getting into the game, I was definitely intrigued. Didn't get a chance to try it until now, and the results aren't impressive...  The wait wasn't too bad; around 10 minutes for 5 on a Saturday night so a few members of our party decided to go play some blackjack while they waited. While they were gone, we were seated and placed our drink orders. A few moments after our entire party returned, yet neither the waitress nor the sake attendant could be bothered to acknowledge their arrival or take their drink orders. Pretty tacky...  The service didn't get much better from there. Sake came quickly, but anything from the bar took way too long without any explanation. When we finally ordered our food, our waitress missed two of the items, most of our 2nd round of drinks and then checked in on us very infrequently. I suppose to her credit, she admitted her shortcomings and offered us a free dessert, but it would have been nicer had she just been on her game from the beginning.   The food wasn't much better. Sushi was an embarrassment. Ordered a lobster roll; the lobster was alright, but the mango was nowhere to be found and the roll was simply too small to justify the price. The toro was nowhere near as delicious as toro should be and I'm not sure there was actually any wasabi on the nigiri.   The hot food does deserve a little praise. The rock shrimp in a korean chili sauce was very tasty, although the sauce made the shrimp on the bottom of the bowl a bit soggy.  The kobe tartar and kobe filet were the highlights of the meal, but again...way too small for nearly $40 a plate.  I'm aware it's the Bellagio, so obviously things are going to be a bit higher then an off-strip place, but that's not an excuse to rip people off and you better have your execution down. This wasn't the case at all, so it deserves no more then two stars. If you're on this part of the strip looking for good sushi, I'd recommend Sushi Roku across the street at Caesars.

CPkfiupFdYJV3Bm8StqaCA.text: Sleek contempary room with good people viewing seats within the Forum shops rotunda.  Very good sushi, very good service, reasonable prices by Vegas standards.  Worth a visit if you are in a sushi mood.

F3Zw8-rPV4YqSpbSex6S-g.text: Overpriced for the quality and quantity.  It simply does not live up to Vegas standards.  I was very disappointed.  I do not mind paying for good sushi, but this one was below average.

DyZ3b4ya12s5-ohKdaIzWw.text: We were in Vegas a couple of weeks ago to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary.  We had tickets to go see "O" at the Bellagio so we decided to have dinner nearby.  My wife made reservations online for Yellowtail and I was at first skeptical about high-priced sushi but after eating there, we were both pleasantly surprised.  The ambiance, service and food were nothing short of excellent.  We were seated next to the big windows and had a great view of the fountains.  Our waiters were very helpful in suggesting "what's good to eat" there and they did not disappoint.  Among our favorite dishes, we enjoyed the Kobe Beef Tataki, the Tempura Alaskan King Crab and the Unagi & Banana Roll.  While we spent about $200 on our meal we enjoyed every penny of it!  We definitely will visit Yellowtail again the next time we are in Vegas.

Ke42-tGxvhitbbXXpBLyTg.text: Great view of the Bellagio fountains. Food and service was a total missed.

Ojy6PMtmkFadCPFoNDJecQ.text: As soon as I touched down in Vegas, all I kept thinking about was getting my fix and having some Vegas sushi from one of the highly rated places I had read about. Thank goodness it was my birthday dinner so I got my wish! We ended up at Yellowtail in the Bellaggio. The staff is completely friendly and fun and I love that more than anything. Friendly staff can make okay tasting food into a great food experience and you might not even realize it. The ambiance really seemed to match the whole cocktail dress look, I honestly felt like I was in an episode of the Hills, I don't know if it was the martinis or what, but I really felt like Heidi would walk by with Spencer or something. I loved how the windows looked right out to the Belaggio fountains. The sushi here is really amazing, taste was extremely well balanced, fresh and just left you wanting more and more. I loved the two different kinds of Edamame, the one with the sweet chili sauce on the pods was a hit at the table. I was a little disappointed by how simple the menu was, I like lots of specialty rolls with lots of ingredients in them as opposed to the more simple rolls but the simple rolls were to die for so I am not complaining at all. The entire table seemed to really be enjoying their experience the signature cocktails were well received as well as the food. The birthday dessert brought out was similar take on a chocolate lava cake with a liquor and mint infused foam on top. Perfect to share with a table. I would highly suggest taking a few moments out of your trip and give Yellowtail a try, great place for several occasions and you might see Brody or something!

Es_y-K0LzFbs0sA0_qiBaw.text: reservations: pointless. we were seated a half hour after our reservation time and got stuck at a bar table because we couldn't wait any longer for a "real" table to open up, we had somewhere to be after dinner. since we were pretty much on the casino floor, ambiance was not impressive.  menu: not much of a selection, so that was a bummer.  food: good miso soup and edamame (the ONE plus). the popping roll and strawberry something roll were recommended to us- plain, small, not impressive. my friend got the scallop dinner plate, which i laughed loudly at when it arrived. it was one of those things where you say, "that's it??" the fried ice cream and chocolate desserts were also recommended to us- extra sad! it's hard to believe that i didn't enjoy eating dessert...  service: great. our waitress and the management felt really bad for making us wait, so they got everything to us quickly. the manager bought our drinks. however, my hot sake was luke warm sake- yuck.  in the end, it's really about the food. when you're starving, are made to wait, and then leave hungry, it's not a good night. we will never go back.

aAI7R4gdfsVCcenFZXUtEw.text: Very good food, though portions are a bit on the small side and expensive (even for the quality).  Rock shrimp appetizer is sort of standard now, but was good.  Protein roll is very good.  Waiter recommended the baked crab hand roll and he was right -- they were impressive.  The salmon serrano roll was less impressive.  Halibut sushi was soft and delicious, although it didn't come with ponzu (which I prefer with halibut).

A82HH7GbhuqB5-42tcfHyA.text: Very loud, spotty service and very pricey - the wine appears to be marked up 400%.  The Tuna pizza appetizer was good, my main dish( Kobe pork ribs) arrived after the waiter and other staff came by SIX TIMES to assure me that my meal was on the way. My dinner companion basically ate alone.   When the dish did finally arrive, it was an astonishingly small portion for the $35 and the meat lacked flavour.  To the Yellowtail's credit, they did not charge me for the dish. At that point in the evening, it was too little too late.

CDUdT6iOKhp6MiXQgPSJ4g.text: This was a very good sushi place located in the Bellagio. The sushi was fresh and the menu had unique items on it. I had the rock shrimp appetizer (delicious), the soft shell crab roll (ok) and a baked crab hand roll (very good). I recommend going here but beware that it is pricey ($50-60 per person) and you need reservations to sit in the actual restaurant otherwise they will seat you in the bar.

sOLBOmZ7X9PfA4XnD2enEA.text: I would give the food 3 stars but the atmosphere 5 stars.  We stopped in for cocktails and sushi.  The cocktails were delicious!  Although all of our sushi rolls kind of tasted the same and there wasn't much selection to choose from, the sushi was still pretty decent.  I much prefer Okada at the Wynn.  The atmosphere was great- lots of low lighting and dark woods with a fabulous view of the Bellagio fountain show.  I would come back again but probably just for cocktails and to enjoy the atmosphere.

1VeswOUg9EE_KR9rT-3JDw.text: Decent fresh sushi at the Bellagio.  Kobe steak was good, but the size of a half dollar!  Ambiance was excellent and the super model waitresses were actually quite pleasant and helpful.  Overall a good dining experience.

MjqyOk_4wysjSFJm_8AIgA.text: Had dinner here Sunday night. Sushi is always top quality and great to pair with a good sake. Service was excellent.

qRz7DNdmxqSLqdzqqG0Djw.text: Well I have been wanting to eat here since I heard it mentioned on Food Network's Best I ever ate with Chopsitcks by chef Beau Macmillan. The item mentioned was the Tempura fried king crab with ponzu sauce on top. Usually hype does not live up to things I have learned but, this surely did! The dish itself is a little small and pricey ($23) but worth it, My friend and I also got the edamame, Spicy tuna roll and the poppin spicy crab roll. The edamame was served 2 ways salted and sweet chili sauce very good! Spicy tuna was good but nothing exciting  The poppin spicy crab roll though was awesome!! Crab, Cucumber, Asparagus and oh how about some pop rocks!!! So good and fun with that popping in mouth. Overall it was very good! I had a beer and my friend had a glass of wine and the whole meal was $86..Pricey I know but for the Bellagio and the strip I felt it was ok. The service was also very sharp too.

AxOzy5P_SeTb_3RlAzkVAA.text: My favorite part of experiencing Yellowtail was the bartender Kat.  She was really cool, friendly, and welcoming.  I'm a huge foodie so I was really looking forward to the eats.  The food in my opinion was a tad overpriced but it was what I expected coming to a fancy Bellagio restaurant.  But everything Was beautifully presented, GREAT plate presentation.  The sushi was fresh and tasted great so no complaints there.  Just be ready to spend a few bucks more for the same thing you'd get somewhere off the strip.  It was a really busy night because of some convention next door so the other staff members were a bit brash and rude.  Might go back for a cocktail but not in a hurry for the food or grumpy staff members.

FECKdaTRs73q2u7sdQ2RSw.text: Lovely environment for conversation and for savouring the cuisine. Which was delightful. The service was excellent. Not someplace I could afford to go all the time but it was a respite from the mundane. A wonderful evening.

iZIjbG2ovvXCwyn9vKXkpg.text: I am not a sushi fan, the only place I eat sushi is at Takami in LA, but I tried. Ahh it wasn't that good and most importantly the prices are to high. Not worth at  all will never ever ever eat here again. If you have extra I mean extra extra money to trow away, then this place is for you.

nfGgU8_x1lZ9Q-Ey9757-g.text: Had an awful meal there a few nights ago.  Started with maguro and hamachi sushi.  It was not even close to fresh. Then had Alaska king crab tempura.  It was completely tasteless Finished with a soft shell crab roll.  I don't know what the wrap was; it wasn't seaweed, but whatever it was it was mushy and the whole thing was just awful.  I obviously don't recommend.  Perhaps sushi and Las Vegas aren't a good match.

jwdP07upS3IlOnRllTsahg.text: Meh. Don't like this place so much. If I'm ever in the Bellagio and hungry, I will do one of 2 things. Grab a taxi back to the Wynn to eat or if my friends/bf are/is playing, go to the high stakes baccarat table to get my Asian food fix.   Anyway, I've been here twice. Both times, I've had indigestion afterward. And I eat a lot of sushi, a lot of fish, so it's not just my stomach, it's definitely something here that makes me sick!   Last time I went was for my 21st birthday. It was still a fun experience and I still had a great time, but there are just better places to eat in Vegas. I really do love their butterfish appetizer, it is perfectly cooked, melts in your mouth, and you just talk about how good it tastes for 10 minutes. They also have an Alaskan King Crab tempura app which is pretty good. It was featured on "The Best Thing I Ever Ate," but I think I like the Nobu version better. Anyway, everything else is just all right. Their handrolls aren't really handrolls... They should call them "tiny stick rolls" with one smalllll piece of fish in them. They taste good but it just doesn't quite cut it for me.   I wouldn't choose to come here again, not when I can go to Okada or Nobu in LV.

0Pq6qdkqllGwaGzt1HHYhw.text: I can't decided, 3 or 4 stars? We had heard lots of good things about the restaurant and even their amazing sushi, however we left feeling less than wowed.  The good:  the decor is nice and trendy (you can even get a table that faces the Bellagio fountains), service is awesome (which is making me want to give the place a 4), and I probably could have had three servings of the Tuna Pizza - LOVED IT.  The so-so:  the sushi.  For what we were paying, I had higher expectations for the sushi and felt like I could have gotten those rolls anywhere.    If you do plan to dine here, definitely make reservations and I am pretty sure you can make a special request for the tables near the fountain.

XWG_7O69HjjWx79lKC9zwQ.text: 2 stars for great ambience and good service - would give a 1/2 star for food if Yelp allowed, but not good enough to round up to 3.  Let me qualify this review by saying we were motivated by a good experience at Noodles and the in room bio about the Korean executive chef who broke down the making of his signature tuna pizza.  Decor / ambience: excellent.  In fact, probably one of the best places on the strip for views of the fountain show and quiet atmosphere for a business dinner or dinner date.  Minimalist decor with candles on each table.  Drink menu presented via a customized iPad app, which was a little over the top, but fine.  Service: fine, exactly what one would expect from a restaurant trying to market itself more on the fine dining spectrum.  Drink glasses always full and empty plates taken away quickly.  Food: herein lies the great and tragic downfall.  We began with the tuna pizza and soft shell crab roll.  The roll was small for our tastes about a 4 inch cut roll, wrapped in nori and soy.  The crab was crisp and fresh though so okay all around.  The pizza however left much to be desired.  The tortilla on which the tuna lay was burnt and overpowered anything that the chefs could have placed on top.  The tuna itself was cut delicately, but tasteless.  The order was followed up with ankimo, Saba roll(Holy Mackerel), hamachi roll (Yellowtail Scallion).  Ankimo was not True pate, but the tube sort, cut into round circles and lacking in any flavor.  The rolls resembled convenient store sushi in appearance - although the rice was soft, there was such an insignificant amount of fish that we really could not taste anything.  I really am not trying to be overly dramatic here - looking at some of the photos I post, you will get a feel for what the plates are like.  The price for the disappointing food was the final nail.  I understand that when going to a place like Yellowtail, you will be overpaying to a certain extent for the ambience and experience.  However to not even receive food I could get from places in LA, I.E., Go's Mart, Katsuya, Sugarfish, or Got Sushi for what Yellowtail charges is ridiculous.  Normally, if I do not like a restaurant, I would not return.  However, I was so dissatisfied with my experience at Yellowtail, that I felt compelled to review.  I do not plan on returning.

mx_UP1BiylB3lGS_YqpqqQ.text: One star for the atmosphere. 0 for the food. 0 for being overly priced. We ordered the yellowtail with scallions and the "special", a sashimi albacore dish. The albacore arrived, it was overly bland and fishy. We're both big albacore fans, and this was this worst we've ever had by far. We sent it back and ordered the bluefin tuna belly. The Bluefin arrived and we both just looked at each other. 6 TINY pieces of sushi with an even smaller amount of fish inside. We waited an additional 20 minutes after the finishing the bluefin for the yellowtail. It was hard to distinguish from the last dish, as this was equal in size. This is not an understatement people, TINY MINUSCULE sushi.  I don't mind paying if the food is good, but in this case, you don't get the quality, or the portions for the price.

2FKgEvUrfGLV2SHqmJ7SLQ.text: We didnt have a reservation on a busy Saturday night. They found a high top for us with no problem. Within minutes we had drinks and our order was taken. Service and support staff was A +++! sushi came out fast! Top sushi experience of mine. Thanks Yellowtail!  The tuna pizza was to die for. The protein roll amazing.

FjvqnLqw2EvKZV_jSeKtDA.text: The best sushi on the Strip, period. Seriously worth every penny! The tuna pizza is to die for... The service was great and the ambience only enhanced our experience. This isn't a spot you go to often, but when entertaining people at a nice hotel on the Strip, this is my new go-to Japanese restaurant.

jT4I3T7_7GuvofiVatb_Lg.text: Terrible experience at this Sushi restaurant We attempted to eat here Friday night. We had a group of 6. We sat for 45mins with no food. The waiter did not even stop by to apologize for the delay and offer more drinks  and appetizers to tide us over. When we asked to speak with the manger he was not remorseful at all for the poor service. I would never eat here again. I would expect MUCH more for a Vegas establishment in Ceasars that serves $25 rolls and a robata grill.

r7GAIsOZU0fMt4VKkduaZw.text: Warning - I'm a sushi snob! Ok, if you love Yellowtail you need to try this place. Best Yellowtail dishes I've had. The Yellowtail Serrano is a must! I also really enjoyed the Kobe beef sushimi and the big eye tuna pizza. All other items were eh..not worth the exuberant price tag.  Next time I will just hit up the bar for some yelowtail snacks and cocktails...

vVuu3_h_b-0JgaPmWUGRlw.text: Delicious and hip.  I was amazed at the quality of the service - a well-tuned machine that never missed a beat. You cannot go wrong here, but be aware of the $20 specialty drinks.

ULAz-U3JTSbYKpSPXj7fLw.text: Had a great time here!  Listen to Tatiana G and get the crab handroll.  It is a little more pricey but is worth it for a fun night out.  Music was fun and the atmosphere and view are very nice.

9Y0OUWJxKLB4-QSqSrkfXg.text: I've had almost everything on the menu and most of it is awesome.  The ambiance is poppin and if you're able to get a table for 2 at the window next to the Bellagio fountain show, that's a plus.  Pop rock roll is one of my favorites.

a4U_dq5luhZ6LALbl6Y-uw.text: When you dine at a restaurant in a nice hotel such as the Bellagio, expect to pay a lot just for the location and ambiance. So yes, it is expensive but it is also very good. Portions are small which I actually like because I'm not looking to get stuffed ordering a la carte. This is not AYCE. Small portions translate into perfect little bites with a lot of fresh flavor here at Yellowtail.   The King Crab Tempura was outstanding. So delicious. Crispy outside, tender juicy king crab chunks on the inside.  Popping rock spicy crab was amazing! I'm gonna try to get my local sushi chef to add that to their menu.   Toro was priced a little high for even a fancy place but it was fresh and of course, melt-in-your-mouth divinity.  I'll come back to Yellowtail when I'm back in Vegas.

bzQCF-B6TlNdkHxPlwI3WQ.text: Always a great place for cocktails and apps before going to club or just meeting with friends. Love Chef Akira Back and his management team (Yoshi makes it happen). His culinary creations caters to everyone's palate. Highly recommend the braised short rib and tempura king crab.

ZBDckGJiC6fuWdcHhFcEKQ.text: "Sushi with my girls" - came here for a dinner during this epic 48 hour bachelorette party and among us, we split a few dishes:  -big eye tuna pizza (AMAZING) -alaskan king crab (DELICIOUS) -popping spicy crab (WOW-ed) -edamame (LIKE NONE OTHER) -spicy tuna roll (typical but with everything else, still delicious, this was per the bachelorette's request) -angry salmon roll (despite the name, very flavorful)  Split between 5 girls it was about $25/person. Highly recommend ...   ...and then go get McDonald's afterwards.

bRmFCPWjiuHtBOJXzwdrsg.text: Overcooked rice in the rolls, incompetent service and lame drinks. Terrible vegetarian options. Take a cab to the Wynn/Encore if you are veg. It's worth it.   To say this place is overrated is truly stating the obvious. Don't fall into the shitty, overpriced Vegas food trap.

Gk66rKXSsAZ_2e-tNP6ypA.text: Leave it to their manager David to turn our experience in there from one star to five star, food was really good but the service and again by their manger was impacable, highly recommended

2Nm26_OiQH5XQTOI0tSUmA.text: I have had better sushi at a $10 Chinese buffet. This place is pricey and the food is simply not that fresh or well made. Skip this place unless everything else is closed, including the snack bar. Terrible meal and fairly expensive.

JnPDZLuhMoW32L8OqhoYUQ.text: I'm going to make this short and simple. It took 20-25 just to order our food. Looked like all the waiters were catering to the larger parties. They seated us right next to the stairs which was an awkward place to put a table. We were literally 2 steps from the stairs. Food was okay. Super small portion for a pricy price tag.

HjH8W-n9Z7AtSFNKW50tWw.text: Overall a very nice evening.  Food a bit pricey and some small portions, although mostly very tasty. But if you ask for a table on the small outdoor patio, it blows away any shortcomings.   If you want to eat a lot of regularly priced sushi go elsewhere.  If you want a romantic and enjoyable evening, this is the place.

sWPtabwTAtp8jLIB6ztiFQ.text: Outstanding Japanese restaurant in the heart of Vegas inside the Bellagio.  Was looking for a nice place to eat while in Vegas on a business trip and wandered over to the Bellagio thinking I'd find something good, and boy was I right!  Beautiful setting...elegant decor, dim lighting, and the famous Bellagio fountain outside the window with the Strip behind it.  But wow...the food here...absolutely out of this world!  Ordered the Mile high Roll, Yellowtail Jalapeno, and Lobster carpaccio...every morsel was absolutely magnificent.  Molten chocolate dessert with Nutella was also sooo delicious.   Should also mention that the service was outstanding.  Mithka (sp?) was very attentive and a real pleasure.  I don't often say that about servers.  She was a delight!  Will definitely come back!

4KYw9cFCkPUUBawJwquuMw.text: Host & waitress were attentive the entire time, food was delivered rather quickly & was very good. Don't forget to pair it with one of their specialty cocktails as this restaurant does deserve 5 stars for food, service & drinks in our own experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y_nTNzm0PCHshBAYj6n6jw.text: Incredible sushi and experience. Went here with customers and had a fantastic time. House sake carafes were plentiful and plenty good enough for our purposes (although they have an amazing sake list if you like higher end sake). The tuna pizza and tuna jalapeno apps were to die for, as was the seaweed salad. Can't wait to go back. Be sure to ask for a seat near fountain if possible.

9M5ZTJ3e1sDVshGzKNovUg.text: Corking fee of $50 wasn't great. For the price I've had much better Sushi. They charge $180 for a $20 bottle of wine. Be ready to spend a lot of money for something you can get other places for a lot lot less.

pc0VE5XvCSgp78YvcU_XWA.text: I have to give one star because I was very disappointed with the food here. It is a little pricey looking at the menu, as one piece of uni is about 8 dollars. But it is understandable given the restaurant has fountain view and is a in a hotel. However, given the price here, I got very disappointed because the sashimi was not even fresh. The uni is a little bitter and tasted like it was from three days ago. The oyster was not even fresh. I ordered half dozen and they tasted as the quality and freshness one would expect from a buffet place. I was here two years ago and the food has totally go downhill, like a lot of other restaurants on MGM properties, including Joel Robuchon.

P_mUi6MTRahSOLvhH6e6bA.text: What a disappointing experience I had this past weekend at this place. We had three people in our party. Each one of us ordered a salad and a sushi roll. All 3 salads came at different times and all 3 rolls came at different times. It's rude to start eating when a member of your party is still waiting for their food. You would think a restaurant inside a premium hotel, such as the Bellagio, would understand that.  The 3rd sushi roll came out 10 minutes after the first two. While we were waiting, we asked the waitress about the missing item and she became very defensive. Literally said "I put in all 3 orders at the same time and you will get it when it is ready." It was just a salmon roll. Not like it should have taken extra time to prepare it. We asked our busboy to look into it and he said he would. Then he never came to our table again. We got there right at 5:00 PM and were the 4th table seated; so they should not have been too busy when our order was placed. Food was just OK. I have had much better in San Diego. I don't usually write negative reviews, but since they don't seem to care about customer service, I am posting this as a warning to others. For the price they charge, I expected better. Will not visit again.

rjU4jVU_T8qhmD-hgsIPcw.text: Yellowtail is AMAZING!!!, we were there last nite.  We started off with the tuna pizza, i've had this many different ways and theirs was superb!  Next we had the grilled halibut warm appetizer, i think i died and went to heaven.  This dish was so OUSTANDING, I wanted to take a bath in the sauce, its a MUST HAVE.  NEXT THE Hapa roll, yummmmmmm.  Our server Chanez was excellent!  I mentioned that we loved Japanese scallops and they are hard to find in sushi restaurants, but I wanted to know if it could be made into a spicy roll, instead of just a piece of sushi, when it was served to us the chef created a special roll for us using the Japanese scallops, it was to die for!  It's pricey but was so worth every delicious bite.

dVyNYYBAOmIN_Fkf-iGBKg.text: I rate this 3.5 stars. On all my visits here, I tend to stick to the hot and cold apps, and main course choices. The dining room is dark, modern and creates an intimate space. There are a few tables that are situated next to the French doors with a view of the Bellagio water show. You can also request, in advance to be seated on terrace outside, which a few brave couples did, in 40 degree temps! I love the rock shrimp, the tempura crab, the filet and also the black cod. What I have found in the past as well as this visit is that the sushi here just doesn't cut it for me. They have a good variety and it seems fresh and the choices are pretty much on par with other locations. However, if I were to close my eyes, pick a piece, I would not be able to distinguish the rolls. They all seem to taste the same to me here. Nothing in the sushi selection stands out for me. The winners are the starters and the main entree's here, and are quite good. Also very shareable.

rtcLjAjvN_1-o8bYHknH6g.text: We ended up at Yellowtail because wait at other restaurants was so long. Had sushi last night so looking for something different.  Beef short ribs were out of this world. Sauce was so yummy.  Yes price is expensive and portions small.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Yci9dl08ucLvWwe_19pMww.text: I will never get sick of coming here! I use to come here almost once a week when I lived in Vegas. Mostly on Sunday's (local's night). Almost everything on the menu are good and each dish and sushi roll are very unique! The sushi are also very fresh. My favorite dishes are the crab hand roll in soy paper, popping spicy crab sushi, big eye tuna pizza, & lobster carpaccio. The big eye tuna pizza is a must! It has truffle oil on it & very addicting. My friends & I always came back for this. I also love their signature cocktails, especially the cucumber one. It gets really busy in there, you might have to wait awhile, even if you have a reservation. The atmosphere is very trendy and cool. There's also an out door seating area where you could watch the Bellagio Water Fountain Show. The service is sometimes slow, but the servers have always been accommodating and friendly. This is probably one of my favorite Japanese restaurant in Vegas.

47OBqve4-m9OtPr8XDbXKQ.text: We absolutely loved the food! We had the big eye pizza which was delicious. We also had the yellow tail jalapenoand the albacore. One of the best sashimi we ever had!

jY5HWsX1Bk0BzpHV-8ilOA.text: While on vacation and eating at a lot of restaurants Yellowtail was the worst. Smallest sushi and dishes I have ever seen. The service was ok but that did not make up for the horrible food and after paying OVER $200 myself and my family were still hungry. Can I give this place a lower rating?

b14VbwaIUQMWAgBioS6VuQ.text: This used to be a favourite of mine, when visiting Last Vegas, but I'm tired of the attitude and done with this place.   The good: The pop rocks (yes, like the candy) sushi roll and the rock shrimp are fantastic. The high steaks roll is good too.   The bad: The second-to-last time we went there, we made a reservation on Open Table. Their airheaded hostesses couldn't even be bothered pressing the button on the screen that said that we had shown up. We spent over $1,000 that night and yet got a nasty note from Open Table saying we were cut off from making reservations, because we had "No Show"ed at Yellow Tail. Are you kidding me??   More bad: This last time, we got a call to confirm our reservation, with a warning saying, because they are so full tonight, all dinners are limited to two hours. Basically, we will kick you out. Are you kidding me?   I've had enough of the attitude. There are plenty of great sushi restaurants in Vegas and we'll happily spend our money there.

xYPDtG4Q0FTFmn7_r7LPqA.text: Not that great! Service was good but food was just ok. You can leave a hand roll waiting for s food runner for 10 minutes. It gets soggy!  Lost the crunch.  The waiter was ambivalent.

a21oZFBvUqmekPtc6pt5ig.text: I've eaten here 3 times and all 3 times I was very happy with the meal.   The first two visits were just normal dinners, a little pricey but I felt like it was worth it for the food/ambiance/experience.   My most recent visit was a little ridiculous because my friend is a pretty big gambler so our group of 5 had an extremely extravagant meal thanks to him. The best part was that we literally tried just about everything on the menu.   Our flight got to Vegas at 9, we were at our villa by 915 and we called and asked for 36 oysters to be ready for us because we were starving. When we arrived they sat us right away and had the oysters ready in minutes! They were so delicious we ordered a second batch.   All the sushi was fresh and delicious (you can see in the pictures I posted), the lobster was really amazing (I actually don't even like lobster to begin with so I was pleasantly surprised when I was going back for seconds) Even the lobster tempura was good, it literally melts in your mouth.   We also had the most AMAZING bottle of wine. It was $1700, so normally we would never but since it was on the casino's dime, why not? I think it was called the Montrachet (I posted a picture of the bottle incase you wanted to try it) but it was the most expensive white wine they had.   We also tried one of everything on the desert menu, I'm not too crazy about sweets but the ice cream was pretty bomb.   It was a fun experience, honestly it is overpriced and pricey but you're in Vegas at the Bellagio so what do you expect? It's got a killer view if you're seated near the balcony so go let loose and have some FUN!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing wine! So smooth~~
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creepy lookin but delicious!

wlAm8nAOeRE38p5OBQusog.text: Yellowtail is an exceptional restaurant with excellent food and incredible service. Some of the best sushi in the city. It has 1 of the best terrace views to watch the fountains at bellagio. The atmosphere was stellar and there were gorgeous people everywhere in the restaurant. A must try is the Kobe beef tataki, the big eye tuna pizza, and the Kumamoto oysters. The food was exceptional all around. I will def be going back sometime soon.

l1dBCThXm3XY7OisHRv89A.text: The Tuna Pizza our server recommended was amazing!  Easily one of the top 20 things I've ever eaten.  Our drinks were okay and the rest of the food was tasty too.  My cocktail was average and overall the food was rather expensive, but that's what you get in Vegas, I suppose!  Service was good though for the most part and besides the slight lag time between when we received our food, the experience was pleasant and a great way to start out the night.  I would dine here again when in Vegas.

u64_75JEJsYcbdLsSULn9g.text: I think this is my new favorite place to eat in Vegas. Definitely the best place to eat in Bellagio. The seafood is top quality and the service at the bar was on par with the food. Like any restaurant there will be things you will like and not like. I have a feeling that there will be few things at Yellow Tail that I would not like. The view of the dancing fountain out front is the "cherry on top" of high class ambience.  Don't expect large portions. The food served here is carefully and delicately crafted. Take your time and enjoy every bite and you will be satisfied. If you are looking to hobble out of yellowtail with your belt loosened, then you have the wrong idea. While the prices were high (all Bellagio restaurants are high priced) this was one of the few places that earned their high price. Some have said that this is overrated, my experience did not disappoint and I look forward to going back every time I come to Vegas.

uXuIreRun7RwiM47YgIw-w.text: Wether the customer is a high roller VIP spending almost 1k on dinner alone (which we were) or just an average Joe, you can NEVER EVER ask him to leave because you need the table for your next party. Bad form.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi platter

-0pcIO90X8bcoRzQziAn8w.text: service was terrible.  our food started coming out before our drinks.  that's pretty basic and our waitress should have paid more attention.  the food is way over-priced.  the best things are the yellowtail, oysters & kobe beef.

rxIBFvq_IKjRf6zG8ttK-Q.text: Impressive but expensive!  The good was really great! We tried a variety of apps but no sushi rolls: tuna pizza, beef tataki, Walu (AMAZING), short ribs, rock shrimp, chicken, and few more things. Loved it all. The place is cute and the service was good.  I AM a fan!

6D1_rP_ZHalyjlMByDmKow.text: Dined here with some friends the other night. We sat out on the patio and had a great view of the fountains during dinner. Appetizers and rolls were phenomenal. Had the big eye tuna pizza, dragon roll, pop rock roll, braised short rib, and a lobster carpaccio. We also tried a few of the sake they had on the menu, all of which were terrific and the waitress seemed pretty educated about each bottle. For my entree I had a flatiron with asparagus that was topped with an amazing teriyaki-like steak sauce. Couldn't have been happier with the service and food, check this place out next time in Bellagio!!

zpk8r2CSODtWydi-opsbPg.text: We were hanging out at the Bellagio, waiting for "O" to start and decided to get some dinner. After much contemplation we finally decided to get some sushi at Yellowtail.  The decor inside the restaurant was amazing! However, the sushi was just ok, and considering the fact that it was waaaaaaay to expensive, I'm not likely to come back.  I did think the pop-rock crab roll was very cool, although it didn't taste all that good.

e15Gv1L5uAFNRB8bTYgiaw.text: This is a luxurious looking restaurnat with a view of the Bellagio fountains to boot. We had a beautiful corner table that was cozy and romantic.   This is our 6th time visiting . Best meal so far!

3FVpAwdw8s4up3ucmf0Dtw.text: I didn't eat any sushi but I stopped by for a drink with friends.   Firstly, the bartender had a pleasant demeanor and actually knew how to make vodka gimlet martinis. This happens to be my "signature" drink and whenever I visit a new bar/lounge, I order one.  Prior to Thursday, the only place I could find one I liked was at the Sidebar down town.  The decor was cool and for it's location (in the middle of the casino) it wasn't too loud.

7yvkNIYIQtvR_8RsHUpk-w.text: Food and Service were awesome.  The Hamachi/Yellowtail sashimi melted in our mouths.  But the best part was the dessert.  Sooooo gooooood.   A great way to finish a great meal.    Oh, I should mention these are semi-small plates.  So if you're hungry you'll need to order sides.  For us though, the portions were perfect

T87LHMEv65hlfgU_kkrsIQ.text: I really enjoyed the ribs and the pop rock sushi. I also love the Edamame and the tuna pizza. Not to mention its the best place too watch the Bellagio fountains.

CYWtXONlPBM_R85nS4weSw.text: My girlfriend and I visited Yellowtail this past weekend. This was my second visit and her first. We both LOVE this place! Chef Akira and his team have created an incredible menu that is pretty unique and you would be hard pressed to find anything else like it. The portions may be a little small, but they are packed with flavor and make you want more!  The Thai snapper was amazing along with some Hawaiian fish we had. Well worth the price. Can't wait to go back again! I love the view of the fountains as well. Great ambience!

WB03vZxbSmWbdyhM5lxXog.text: Yellowtail is to impress.  Yourself, your date or your mama.  The decor, atmosphere and service are all up to upscale balla diner snuff.  You are here because you have fat bankroll, a generous sponsor and/or you're very very beautiful.  Unlike some of the more hip upscale places, there weren't any goofy spikey haired mtv types, which is a good thing.  Although I normally evaluate the value of a place, it is difficult to do since I did not see the bill and probably if you are worried about getting your money's worth, you might as well just get a $14 cocktail and enjoy the atmosphere before grabbing a cab and having a giant feast on Spring Mountain for the same price as your cocktail.  We had spicy tuna rolls, flat iron kobe beef, beef tataki, seaweed salad, miso soup, halibut sashima (I think), potstickers, big eye tuna pizza (a surprising dish!), lobster bowl and some weird roll with pop rocks in them.  I made sure that I got full by adding a bowl of rice to my order.  Portions were generally tiny, though aside from the pop rocks, every dish was excellent.  Even the miso soup was done right.  Normally, I am a little bit more aware of the food, but I was a little buzzed and didn't have my inner yelp critic active.  Since they don't publish the menu nor do I have a receipt, I can't remember the exact dish names.  As a practical matter, if you are on a date here, try your best not to get whiplash.  The ladies are out in force here.  If you are here with the guys, then get a table in the waiting area instead of the inner restaurant.  It's the best view in the house.  Finally, a shout out to our generous sponsor.  I doubt that I would have tried this place without 'em.

RHGnHv9jj5mti2SvyNtteA.text: Ya this place is cool because its at the bellagio but its way expensive.. we had 7 people and $500 later and several dishes later.. everyone was still hungry but we did not want to spend any more $ on food the portion size for an aunt.

GQVV5mS3tm3HqMEJ3DFCvA.text: CAUTION: Be very careful about choosing to come here even if  you do have a reservation.   The front of the house is staffed by a 20-something, ADD-challenged, Barbie-wanna be who has no clue on how to organize, let alone honor, those people conscientious enough to call ahead for a table.   We (and two other couples who were not with our group) had reservations for 8pm on a Wednesday night. All of us showed up either 5 minutes early or on time, and were asked to wait for a few minutes. No problem, we understand this is usually the case while tables are cleared out.   By 8:20pm, we were all still standing around.   However, during the 25 minute wait for our tables, two Japanese business groups (containing 4-6 people each) showed up without reservations and were rushed through to open seats. When we asked Barbie about this, she just prattled, "Oh, it'll just be a few more minutes."   We left shortly afterward.   I'm not sure what happened to the other 4 schmucks patiently waiting for a table. But as far as I'm concerned, front of house represents the restaurant and if you cannot manage your customers, how do I know whether you can manage the food?  Two thumbs down for this restuarant.

JKxu30r8lT-EVEY-2Vsq-A.text: I visited Yellowtail with colleagues. The service was outstanding and the food was superb. Don't miss the tuna pizza and fried Alaskan king crab. If you're wanting sushi, definitely go with the shrimp tempura specialty roll!

rzW_Xq1Kij8GaYiYj3OVLQ.text: 8pm reservation on a Friday night and we were seated promptly. Our party of 4 started with the big eye tuna pizza which was different but very tasty. Had a variety of rolls (all of which tasted very fresh) but smaller portions than your typical sushi places. Rolls vary from your basic spicy tuna, shrimp tempura roll, and unagi rolls.  Yellowtail Tataki was very good (we ordered 3 of them after the first tasting). The pop rock candy roll was ok and something we would pass on the next time. 2 desserts (chocolate in a cup and green tea mousse) were very good (and our waiter picked them out). The dessert actually came with some type of mocha shot and was a nice way to wash down the dessert. 4 bottles of beer and the total was about $340.  Being in Vegas, this is not as authentic as R-23, but the ambiance and service make it a very enjoyable dining experience. We were fortunate enough to have a table next to the window and saw several Bellagio fountain shows and added that much more to the ambiance (music was great too). Our waiter was exceptional and not pushy at all about what to order. He took the time to explain items (I think his name was Roberto). Bonus that he picked out desserts that the wives loved. Would definitely go back to this place.

vWS18bL71XzXFIaTbdJyXQ.text: If this place had pictures on the menu they would be out of business! The portions are super tiny and super expensive. I could understand if there weren't any other sushi restaurants around, but c'mon, this is Vegas and there are all sorts of sushi restaurants opened by world renowned chefs.   The food was alright. My friends and I had three rolls and the yellowtail carpaccio. All of the rolls tasted like $5 supermarket rolls and were super small. The yellowtail carpaccio is what you would expect, sashimi was cut a bit thicker than I normally like. The only plus side to this place was that it was inside bellagio - a great place to gamble (i've had lots of luck at their craps tables there) and that our waitress was super friendly.  My two cents? Pay a cab to take you to Osaka off the strip.

pM3UdgWgnuU1ai6x_kacxg.text: Don't let the online menu prices fool you, its definitely very small portions, so you have to order 3x as much to get full. Our bill, with just 2 beers and 2 plum wines, came out to $460 for 4 of us.  The food was ok, we stuck to rolls and appetizers, and the service left a lot to be desired.  The kobe beef appetizer is at least worth trying.

aXLHJNcpCwH8_Whoerrh0A.text: So I cannot speak for the food, but the mixed drinks are DELICIOUS!  My coworker and I liked it so much that we came here two nights before they closed.  I loved their Lychee cocktail, and my coworker liked their Blood Orange cocktail (sorry, I forget the official name). We each loved our drink enough the first night to re-order it on our second visit. We also tried their cucumber cocktail, which was great as well.  The trade off was the cost - our drinks cost $20 each.   But better one expensive cocktail than 2 or 3 horrible cheap ones!  The service here was great too.  The waitress we had on the first night was great - kind and quick to help us. The bartender on the second visit was also friendly and nice to chat with.  If you are walking through the Bellagio and looking for a drink, stop here.  You won't regret it!

7MLRujjIWPmVNPeZRsxxhQ.text: Yellowtail is consistently a wonderful dining experience!  My husband and I dined here with friends and were impressed again with the quality of food and drinks from this restaurant.  The service was a bit off, with it taking almost 20 minutes to receive our cocktails once we sat down.  I gave it four stars because of this oversight, seeing as how it was after 10:30 pm and the restaurant was not busy.  Our server did an excellent job when it came time for sushi recommendations, and even though it's not listed on the menu - always get the sushi pizza - it's delicious!!!  We recommend also trying the sashimi platter (so fresh!!!), the pop rocks roll, and the spicy tuna.  All are excellent and are a good way to judge the difference between this restaurant and the run-of-the-mill sushi experience.  The view also cannot be beat!!  The Fountains at Bellagio show is not to be missed - it's awesome!!!  :)  Cheers!

_dQ0tL9BaHuhPimRdEmf-Q.text: Great food and ambiance. Our server was great, the shared plates were all awesome, and we sat on the balcony to see the fountains. What a rad place, I definitely recommend it!

-gRwsddVGFXuPOiqNATQDQ.text: "Roberto the waiter is first ballot hall  of famer"  My mother and 85 year old uncle have dined here at leadt 6 times over the last 3 years and always  have bedn blown away by the food and service. Yesterday we drove from San zfiego to the Bellagio and the first thing we did when we got to our rooms was not only make a reservation at Yellowtail  but also made a request for Roberto to be our our waiter. On our 6 hour drive from San Diego wd mentioned Robertos name at least 2 times. What a compliment. Aside from the food being great we Always appreciate Roberto for not only his great service but his genuine kindness. Well done. - William- San Diego-92101

_p-7p6iU-0txBsUH87oKzg.text: First time here. Food was so good! Sushi was really fresh and delicious. Atmosphere was fun. Great place to go w friends. Or a date.  View of Bellagio watershow.  Foods to definitely order... Yellowtail Serrano. Rock shrimp. Toro scallion roll. Tuna pizza. All were amazing.

l25VNcJUbkYZpjcz4xD1Yg.text: For the price, the food wasn't great. There are so many better options elsewhere. Spent over $400 and all seven of us left feeling hungry. We eventually went to the cafe to eat. Won't be coming back here.

32wVEk7_NVaGw8Kqm8ohOg.text: Excellent service and delicious food. My husband and I both got sushi and enjoyed it very much! Our drinks were excellent. We are from NC so the prices were a good bit higher than home but very comparable in the area. Our server Theo was excellent and helpful with our selection of food without being pushy or overbearing as sometimes servers can seem. He truly seemed to guide us towards what we wanted verses what was best to sell.

cvl1Kf1IjcdoscF5Zg8KQQ.text: Had dinner here last night around 730pm. We didnt make reservations but we got seated right away right infront of the balcony that over looks the Bellagio water show. View was amazing.   Food: we had the tunna pizza, the tempura crab bites, and the popstickers and 2 waters. With tip the bill for 2 people was $102.   Taste of the food was amazing. Size of plates are small. Service was excellent .   Overall we enjoyed this place very much anf had a pleasant experice.

Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna pizza

jzWd_sXVDxw4WmLDkvTiqg.text: We dined two nights in a row at our stay in Bellagio. Prices are on the high end and portions are on the modest side, but everything we ordered was delicious. I recommend the scallop tiradito, yellowtail jalapeno, salmon new style sashimi, and my favorite, the toro Bluefin tuna belly (fresh)! I loved the kick in the spicy Miso soup and the crab was a great compliment to it- the rock shrimp were yummy also. Ask for some sriracha to use as dipping sauce. Service was impeccable...we had a rotation of servers taking care of us and checking on us both visits. Ambiance is dark lit, intimate, swanky on the inside. Thanks yellowtail

DGAxBhCFTJC7YXOoFvfpyw.text: This place is VERY loud and expensive. It was difficult to even hear the waiter let alone have a conversation.  The food is top notch however.  Great view of the Bellagio fountain.  This place has a lot of nice things to offer, but the experience was just average.

l1y_ONNGblEMDKRxQ89ZQA.text: One of the best dinners we had while staying in Vegas! You have to try the tuna pizza it's amazing! Will definitely be back when we are in town!

Rpuf8psUavR4UO8_wMhy9Q.text: Did the greatest hits okamase. Each course was spectacular! My all time favorite was the tuna truffle pizza and the chocolate on the cup dessert. I will definitely keep coming back for more!

l0-4uocnCCx0S0yIw4ygQw.text: My friends and I came here for a nice dinner last Friday and did not get the experience we were expecting. We ordered the edamame, gyoza, foie gras, and sushi rolls I don't remember which as it was not worth the price we paid.  I was so excited when I saw the foie gras because I absolutely love it and being from California, I do not get it often unless I travel out of the state. I was extremely disappointed as they covered the delicious natural taste of it with too much of the other stuff to make it look pretty. Honestly you can't go wrong with edamame and gyoza as they are staples in sushi restaurants so I was glad we had that to fill up on.  I would like to mention the lack of friendly service as well. The worst service yet the most expensive place we ate at this weekend. Not okay at all. I did get a glance of the dancing Bellagio fountains which was a nice touch though.

j5sCb0zHwi19iIEyj2GLaQ.text: After a humongo brunch, we wanted a lighter dinner, it was time to descend upon YT again.    Perfect choice.  Seriously one of the best Japanese restaurants on the Strip.  Top 3.  Eats: -Lobster carpaccio -Big eye tuna pizza -Sawara sashimi -Spicy salmon roll -Rock shrimp -Soft shell crab  By the glass sakes are only the sparkling variety, if you're going by the carafe, I would go straight to the junmai daiginjo, even the junmai ginjo didn't cut it.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soft shell crab
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rock shrimp
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy salmon

KtBvt4654VqOBmVE29jpzA.text: Very disappointing especially at the price point. Bellagio should do better....the low stars are value for the money. You can get much better at a slighter lower price point in Vegas! Service wasn't great either ...  Try Shibuya at MGM, Kumi or Mizuya at Mandalay Bay, or Masa at Aria before you go here...

_N1YdgmGvEy5WMFdagBikA.text: Great dishes. Portions are a bit smaller than expected, but each dish really wow'ed me! Optimal location on strip!

R89Rd7m1RVLMMXgUr8Q6QQ.text: Located in the Bellagio, sitting by the windows at night affords you gorgeous views of the fountains and the "Eiffel Tower" across the street. We had dinner at Yellowtail prior to the O show at the Bellagio (magnificent show, highly recommend). We decided to order a few small plates instead of entrees and settled on the tuna pizza with truffle oil (my favorite dish), the new salmon (second favorite dish, quite delicate and fresh), crab handrolls (too saucy), and a crispy rice dish (also too saucy). Overall the food was quite good, though the freshness of the fish seemed to be lost in the sauce. We also ordered a bottle of unfiltered sake which was fine, though definitely overpriced for the quality. If you want a nice meal in Vegas with good ambience and service and dont have a budget, Yellowtail is worth a try. Otherwise, there's better Japanese food off strip.

yO8KlFeE-wPwYx30rUAQNA.text: Wait for 1hr on sushi roll! You can get it anywhere not worth it. Too noisey dor sushi place also. You can get me just once

bvxzo8H9ZlfXGpEdnfejtw.text: First Yelp review, fittingly. @TaylorSwift13 once tweeted "The best meal of my life. Yellowtail in Las Vegas, NV." I live in Las Vegas so I decided to visit Bellagio and try it. Accurate statement t-swizzle!   I've been here at least 4 times; the most recent visit on 6/28. Attractive hostesses/waitresses, waitstaff team service is top notch, super friendly, and attentive. Every single time. Nice, classy atmosphere and clientele. Everything you should expect in a high-end restaurant business. Phenomenal food. All reasons why I keep coming back for more!   TIP: Ask for a patio view table outside so you can watch the fountain show. One should be available if it's not too busy. It will enhance your dining experience even more!  From what I remember, I've tried:  -Big Eye Tuna Pizza -Kobe Beef Tataki -Popping Spicy Crab Roll (pop rocks and sushi..unique combo..i didn't come here for rolls, but this is a must try..i love it!)  -Braised Kobe Beef Short Ribs -Kobe Beef Flat Iron -16oz Vintage Ribeye -Potato Puree  Every choice was amazing. I can't put into words how awesome each food item was. I could randomly choose any item on the menu and be confident that it would be of superb quality. Thanks Yellowtail @Bellagio, I am glad to be a return customer and will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16oz vintage ribeye
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. patio view

om4K4J96moSvfXIT-DilnQ.text: Food was excellent. Rolls were creative and delicious. Host didn't offer us seating in the dinning room so maybe we were not dressed appropriately but we had collar shirts on. Other dinning room guest had sports wear on and there were tables available. Service was excellent. It's not cheap of course but nothing in Vegas is on the strip.

XU0tFwKcdbw_aF3K_ieFnw.text: I been here last night with friends and we got table outside that very nice. But about service is very bad We order 2 roll and he say wait for 20 min that's ok for ur but he forgot 1 and we have to wait more. And when you check in with Yelp you will got some drink for free and I show him. He say yes and I never get that until I ask him again. If he not happy to service us just change not do something like that. It not good. But all food and everything very good just that guy service outside!!

QmRIJN6HxP4Dgg0OlVkDBw.text: One of the best meals we had in Vegas this time around. We made an early reservation in order to catch a show so the restaurant was mostly empty. You can imagine how trendy and fun this place is towards later on in the evening.   We ordered a good mix of dishes and they were all delicious. Some of the dishes we liked the best were the atlantic black cod, softshell crab, japanese yellowtail and the best was the crispy kalbi.   There's lots of buffet choices in Vegas, but we were glad we had a really nice restaurant to enjoy a delicious dinner.

ycIQJ73-IbLPKXTHEfQ_Bw.text: Amazing. The best sushi I have ever, ever, had.   When I saw that Yellowtail looked right out onto the casino floor, I was disappointed. However, my husband and I arrived 15 minutes before our  scheduled reservation and were promptly seated in the rear spacious dining room, with a view of the Bellagio fountains from behind. There are floor to ceiling windows and a beautiful terrace that we were told to use at any time.  The service was a bit slow, but it was a busy Thursday night and we didn't mind. We ended up ordering 4 rolls altogether. Again, best sushi either of us had ever had. Average price for a roll was probably 19.00.  The ambience is great as well - very dimly lit with nice music in the background.   10/10!!

x26oa0XqvRT42nWoXOvZFQ.text: I'm was one of those guys who didn't eat sushi. After going to Yellow tail I now eat sushi both raw and cooked. The Tuna pizza is fantastic along with most of their dishes. The problem is I am so spoiled by this restaurant that when I go back home to Chicago I can't eat sushi because nothing lives up to Yellow Tail. I'm excited to be back in Vegas in 2 days and I look forward to eating, once again, at Yellow Tail.

y2l0odgE7UGNZ3_QRS6FWA.text: Sorry but not in the sushi top list for Vegas.  The service was unorganized and there was no order to my meal. I received the salad and pickles at the end of the meal. The fish was cut so small and it didn't match the price I was paying. I liked the Gyoza but not the tomato sauce it came with.

lFI-duPervrg2jVTVRBoxw.text: Sushi restaurants on the strip are a dime a dozen, so when one sticks out it's really special. The food is brilliant. The ahi tuna pizza is to die for. The view of the fountain is a beautiful addition and the service was brilliant. Great experience, I'll definitely be going back!

pXJvFwQDfYSrDOlV7PZP7A.text: Overrated restaurant and food. Received attitude from the staff who weren't friendly at all. I felt discriminated against. Spend your money elsewhere.

rzzdpwBysIy8JMLgrnd4KA.text: Came here for dinner with some clients. Great atmosphere and service. The sushi was good with unique flavor. Priced fair to be in Bellagio.

GkPTmCqxMGaDaukTKt_2Aw.text: The taste is extremely high quality but the portion is very small ( except the entree.. the rib eye had quite an amount)

txjwzLsVmLeaNdqwWG8CHQ.text: I came here because I read that this was Taylor swifts favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.  Our party was 3 people and our bill was $710.55 without tip included yet:(  I got the ribeye and the Wagyu beef. I would pass on the ribeye. It was too tough and chewy. It also came out almost raw so I had to send it back to get it cooked some more.  The best thing here is the Kobe wagyu beef! It's served on a hot stone so u can cook it more if you'd like! Medium rare is good for Wagyu because it's so soft and tender.   My fam got the sushi rolls. I don't eat sushi myself, but they said it was okay. My mom liked the uni roll

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye.. Too raw and tough to eat

rqlu9iw7ogEmGz3OB3yUog.text: Was there with a group and did quite a large tasting menu. Most everything was very good, the sashimi platter being the best, along with some of the sashimi appetizers. The wacky rolls with everything from pop rocks to cooked meat were not at all interesting and just over the top.

eijDqWH3pMi2G5LRikPqXA.text: Hands down- the best sushi in Vegas. We sat at the bar where Luciano was our server/ bartender. He provided great service and I loved his recommendations. Everything we ordered was fresh and delicious. The miso soup was lovely and the tuna pizza will blow your mind.  The yellowtail jalapeno was superb and the mile high roll is mouthwateringly delightful. This restaurant is located in the Bellagio and their prices reflect that great location, but we are still talking about how great the food was, so I think it's worth it .

9V2aKQIv13PUIN_QRn9WCg.text: Sigh...I really wanted this to be a phenomenal experience but alas, this was not to be. Very expensive!!! And you don't get much at all. I ordered a martini to start, $20. Then me and the hubby ordered sushi. I had a California roll. The hubby chose a shrimp tempura roll. I chose the yellowtail sushi and the hubby got tuna. The rolls were average size. The sushi, two itsy bitsy pieces per fish type. The fish quality was Fantastic however after $140 and still being hungry we cut our losses and went elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The infusion
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big eye tuna pizza
Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna sushi

FhsN0XT6avTXd99P2k73Ow.text: We come to Vegas and stayed in Bellagio Hotel and we was look for the best sushi restaurant because its my favorite food and we find Yellowtail This sushi chef restaurant was amazing! I will recommend to have the pizza sashimi its really good.. I love this place everything we eat is delicious but when we finish we order desert. We had hot chocolate in a cup its my favorite! It was just perfect. I will be coming back to this restaurant for sure.

tAhwo1Z4D1dlGXIQFKsqtA.text: This place is so beautiful and the service is out of this world. The food was amazing and such a work of art.

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This place is beautiful

XhkMah0riRw9V0O8DMKt-g.text: The best restaurant in Vegas.   I've been here a million times and just love it.  The view is gorgeous, service impeccable and the food....well its awesome.  Omakase is the way to go....everything just wow'd us!  It's not cheap, but it's well worth it.

CaewZHxLpJYguocbVwVXOg.text: Fun environment. Killer food.   My experience was more than pleasant. The sushi was very fresh and succulent.   Coming here was a fantastic choice for the evening.

j2j91JJ3EOQ3cc93u_g9nQ.text: They were welcoming and the drinks were superb!  We were seeking an adult beverage before a reservation at another location.  It was a logistical issue b/c we had a 20 year old with us.  They found a nice table and were wonderful.

ZRdIFLzVmCbBeIDzLTVMEQ.text: Upscale setting with a great view of the fountains, but you pay for the setting and the view.  The sushi was good, but nothing amazing.  For the prices, I'd expect better.  I did enjoy the food, but wouldn't say it was fine dining.  Service was great.  Our waiter was on point, prompt, friendly and polite.  Nice experience if you're on a company card.  If you're personally paying, I'd suggest looking elsewhere, honestly.  4 stars!

bTn9A1AumAdT2iFmFFLtfQ.text: My partner and I decided to come here to try out their famous tuna pizza. The ambiance, decor, and food was delicious. We were initially sitting inside but we asked the hostess if it's possible to sit outside instead so we can outlook the beautiful scenery of the bellagio fountains. The request was made and everyone who accomadated and catered to us were very kind. The bellagio fountains and the music were the best part of our night and also the dessert was a cherry on top, literally! Thanks Yellowtail for the wonderful evening, we will be back!

f2nje3iNo6d765UiaHfN1Q.text: We had such an amazing experience dining here, food came out quick and was beyond delicious, highly recommended. Also get the shiso sparkler amazing cocktail and the baked corn!!!

yM5OcVo8cY9c-JTn8KXTMQ.text: Be warned: if you are a red-blooded American who likes decent sized portions that will actually fill you up, this is NOT the place for you. The dinners are the size of appetizers. The $32 chicken was literally five tiny pieces that wouldn't fill up an infant.   Also, their $6 sodas and iced teas don't even come with free refills. The ripoff factor here is astounding -- maybe even the worst on the strip. Don't be duped by the coolness factor.   We actually hit up a burger place after dinner because not a single one of us was full. Sad!!

ViRmwqdLdfedR7Olijt_Ng.text: The service here is probably some of the best in Vegas. The bartenders and wait staff are exceedingly polite and knowledgeable. The spare rib roll was of special note. Amazing quality and freshness! Must visit if you can.

FcYnBbM30IePBljUjEVadQ.text: Went there during Christmas vacation. Me and my friend were meeting up with our aunt who already at the restaurant. The hostesses were really nice and even offered to put our carry on somewhere safe so we didn't have to drag them around. I wasn't especially hungry that night so I got the uni sushi. Uni is one of my favorite things to eat. The sushi were pretty good. Not the best ever but pretty decent. If I was more hungry I would have definitely ordered the uni pasta!  I wasn't that hungry but there is always room for dessert right? Haha. I had the yuzu citrus. It was not only really good it was also so pretty! I could stare at it forever with the flowers and all. See attached pic. The yuzu flavor came through really nicely and the strawberry gelato was good without being overpowering.  So next time, same dessert and some uni pasta!

photos.caption: Photo of Yellowtail by Chef Akira Back - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yuzu citrus. Look how pretty!

pornHSgLgkMCLkBnYL-WLA.text: This is my top favorite resturant in Las Vegas, everything from the views to the server is truly amazing.  The food is absolutely perfect every single time. My top favs dishes are he Tuna Pizza, protein roll, kimchi edamame, toben filet, and crispy rock shrimp. My top drink would be the essence or the lychee specialty drinks.  This is such a unique spot especially when seated on the patio. It's like no other. Truly breathe taking to be able to watch the fountain show from such an intimate and sexy venue.   The staff is always on point and the managers are the best in the city. I would recommend everyone to try Yellowtail, you will not regret it.   Thanks Yellowtail for always making my dinner there special.

aswTTH252kSQoqCx5ClaCQ.text: My second time here was much better all around! I got the same lychee cocktail as I always get but this time I switched up the entree and stuck with the sushi side of the menu. It was a much better choice. The ambience here looks fancy, and it's priced fancy, but one of my friends was let in with a bro tank and swim trunks which is much appreciated.   Do not pass on the sushi roll with the pop rocks and crab! It was the funkiest, coolest roll ever! We had to order another one for the table because we liked it so much.
